On many occasions over the past 10 years, my wifi network has caused me to seriously contemplate liquidating all of my assets and spending my remaining years tracking down the evil geniuses who created them.  I'm not particularly computer savvy, but I've always been able to follow online instructions to do port forwarding or create static ip's and the like.  This however has always been a trap, one that leads me to believe I can manage my wifi network and make it......actually work (imagine that).  After several different routers, a couple of range extenders and countless hours I would have rather been doing anything else, I finally gave up!  Following much research, I took the plunge and paid full price (gulp) for a 3 pack of the Eero's.  This has all been done with Time Warner Cable (if that matters).The Pros:1. It took me about 20 minutes to setup the network w/3 Eero's....easily the simplest setup I've ever done!2. My 2,000 sq. ft. 2 story house and my attached 1,000 sq. ft garage all have very strong wifi.3. I can nickname my devices so it's easy for me to see what's on the network.4. I easily grouped devices together that my kids use and set times they can't access wifi.5. I can access my network to pause/un-pause wifi for specific devices or for everything, even when I'm not home (using the iphone app).6. I've had it setup for about a week and it's been flawless!  All my speed tests in every area of the house are at my providers max capacity!7. I had a question about setting up the app for me and my wife.  I called in and was told they were experiencing high call volumes, but someone answered about 10 seconds later and quickly helped me get things done.8. The iPhone app interface is very easy to use....and it all makes sense.  They've simplified it to be used by actual human beings....ones that don't work on computers for a living.  An example:  I wanted to do some port forwarding....all I had to do was forward the port AND the app actually suggested that I make a static IP so I don't lose the port forwarding if the device doesn't connect to that ip in the future!  I always had to learn that the hard way.  Eero's then took me right to the screen to set the static ip!9. It actually works...everywhere...all the time...imagine that!Cons:1. Somewhat spendy.  However, it's much cheaper than a kidney, or my firstborn....which is what I was contemplating trading to anyone who could solve my wifi dilemmas.I'll update this review in the future if my Eero's turns on me, betrays my trust, or does anything else you should be warned about.

Title: You might have some kinks, but customer service will always try to fix it with you.
Review Comment: Hands down the best customer service ever. Installed them and the first few days were great. Super fast internet. Then Sonos ran into some problems. Then Macbook ran into some problems. I got frustrated and wondered if I should return my eeros. Called customer service and they looked at my system diagnostics and helped me fix the problem. Customer service was extremely knowledgeable, clear, and patient. Now my network is even better. Thanks eero! Would recommend to anyone.

Title: Great Wi-Fi system
Review Comment: Great Wi-Fi system. Has much better coverage than a single router. Setting up all three was easy, and the app is simple and intuitive.

Title: Worth the cost.
Review Comment: Very easy to install. Performance has been stellar. Thus far, this has been the best router I've worked with. The only thing that would make it better is a lower price.

Title: I'm never building another router
Review Comment: I'm not going to detail my geek cred, but suffice it to say for these purposes that I usually build my own Linux-based routers. I'm not allergic to solder or compiling kernels. But I bought a 3-unit eero system over Thanksgiving and it's been a godsend.These networks aren't so much hubs as layer 2 switches. Know how your phone jumps from one station to another as you move through the house? How it's automatic and quick, but sometimes totally breaks the connection and makes Netflix stutter or VOIP calls drop? eero totally ends that. Connections are rock solid even as they bounce from one router to another. And they do bounce. If my kid and I are sitting on the couch using our phones, and both of us start streaming videos, eero is smart enough to push one of us off onto a different router so we're not interfering with each other's connection.I would not willingly go back to a handbuilt network now. I've only had a mesh network for a month and a half, but it's so much better than anything I'd pieced together myself that I'm retiring from the practice.

Title: Best WiFi System available.
Review Comment: This is the best WiFI system I have ever owned. I replaced two Airport Extremes with three Eeros and now have consistent speed throughout my house. I would recommend this product to anyone. There support and website are phenomenal!

Title: Best "router" For Your Money
Review Comment: I have had a lot of routers over the years. Most of them I would replace within a year because I got sick of rebooting them. I finally had a stable one with the Apple routers. However mine was the express and is meant to handle 5 connections. Apple is stopping production on their routers so what was I to do? Read reviews and hit twitter. I found Eero currently I live in a 2 bedroom apartment so just 1 Eero will do for now. It is great to know that when I upgrade I can add to the system. It has worked very well, I love the feature that it will restart the device if it notices bad connection. If you are looking for a new WiFi system you should do an Eero system. Best money I have spent.

Title: BEST. period
Review Comment: THIS. IS. THE. VERY. BEST. period.I could just stop there. We've had trouble with internet FOREVER. I can't remember a time when we didn't have to literally restart our modem multiple times a day. (Old house - plaster walls, multiple levels etc.)  I had tried everything.  Multiple power lines.  Multiple routers and wifi and extenders, etc.  Then I read about mesh networks.  And did my research.  Wow.  My life has changed !! Eero is amazing.  Easy to set up.  Easy to use.  Easy to monitor when set up.  AND THE BEST PART ... I HAVE NOT RESTARTED MY MODEM SINCE WE GOT IT OVER A MONTH AGO.  And the signal strength is POWERFUL...and reaches all of our trouble spots without any trouble.  LOVE IT. THANK YOU EERO. THANK YOU THANK YOU !!!

Title: Easiest install ever!
Review Comment: Dead zones gone! Easiest install ever!

Title: The eero Home WIFI System as truly changed my family's internet download experience for the better!
Review Comment: I am over joyed by the reliability and performance of the product.  The eero Home WIFI System as truly changed my family's internet download experience for the better!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: installed easily and works GREAT!

Title: Works as expected
Review Comment: Have had the system in my 2100 sf home (3 floors) for a couple of months.  Has been working flawlessly since.  I tested the system using speedtest on my laptop and was shocked to see the same upload and download speeds throughout my home.Super easy set up and I love the fact that I can check my system on my phone app.

Title: Eero works great for internet on computers and iPhones but absolute disaster ...
Review Comment: Just Installed Eero as my Apple Airport and Extreme were'nt providing uniform wireless signal.  Eero works great for internet on computers and iPhones but absolute disaster when trying to stream Netflix and Amazon on TV. I'm glad I kept my Airport/Express routers.

Title: Yesssssss
Review Comment: Amazing, speed and coverage, one network, no repeaters, mesh.  A network blanket for the entire house. Cannot think of how they could possibly make it easier to set up!

Title: Four Stars
Review Comment: It works!

Title: Dad proof
Review Comment: Easy set up. Fast and reliable thus far.

Title: Extremely satisfied with the eero system
Review Comment: Works perfectly, easy set up, small sleek unobtrusive devices....large 3 story home

Title: Returned. Connection dropouts and inability to determine connection status of units.
Review Comment: I bought five of these for our home (which was suggested in the eero square foot calculations) which were replacing a 3 and 6 year old airport extremes. Network speeds were about the same, and we started getting connection problems which were not present with the much older gear.I was attempting to connect them all together on the back end with Ethernet in order to not diminish performance with having so many eero, but it was impossible to tell whether the units were connecting with Ethernet or wireless from the eero UI. I was able to call eero to check on them (they all were not using ethernet) and they could initially tell me, but upon subsequent callbacks something changed on their end and they could not.I spent about $900 on a system that I thought would be pretty rock solid, but it ended up being a real disappointment and I decided to return them all.

Title: Wifi devices dropped connections randomly, hardwire had no issues.
Review Comment: Wifi started to drop devices randomly. The hardwire connections had no issues. We have a fiber connection and have never had issues. Wifi devices said they were connected but nothing worked. Tried rebuilding network, resetting numerous ipads and iphones network settings. I could stream a video on the hardwire tv connection while my phone and ipads couldnt get a wifi signal in the same room ??

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works great, easy setup.

Title: It's amazing. Eero feels a bit too expensive
Review Comment: Despite buying hundreds of things on Amazon, I don't think I've ever reviewed anything. That said, I am seriously impressed with eero so far and it was immediately evident after setup (which was very simple) that our wifi connection had drastically improved throughout our house. It's amazing. Eero feels a bit too expensive, but I'm extremely happy with the results.

Title: Best of the best...worth the money
Review Comment: This saved our internet!!! We live in an old New England house, aka every wall stops the internet. We had more dead zones than a cemetery. We bought the 3 pack. Our den went from 16 Mbps, now we have well over 100mbps!

Title: It just works
Review Comment: I gotta admit I was a bit skeptical but the Eero is everything it's hyped to be and more. We have an older home with robust construction and a cable-modem router in a closet surrounded by thick walls, so the wifi coverage has always been a bit spotty. A four-Eero mesh definitively fixed that. And the Eero management app on the iPhone is a work of art. Best network software I've ever used. Bam! Oh yeah, it's expensive. But worth it.

Title: Could not be happier with this system
Review Comment: Could not be happier with this system.  Super easy setup, great signal strength throughout the house, and fast connection speed.

Title: Highly recommended.
Review Comment: Performed as advertised. Simple to install. Highly recommended.

Title: It just doesn't work
Review Comment: I have had a horrible experience with eero. The network simply disappears several times per day, and other times has slow periods where each access point gets 5 to 6 Mbps of throughput (wired devices are getting 110 Mbps, so it is not an issue with my cable modem). I added eeros to try and improve performance to no avail. Support thinks something in my house is interfering with the eeros, so I asked if I can change the channel -- you cannot as they are hard-coded to Channel 1, which is rather annoying.I took a chance on these an invested big, but I really regret it. I am returning the units to Amazon and going back to my Apple AirPort router with extenders: It might be slow, but at least it's reliable.

Title: I know others claim it was easy. But in the end I am really enjoying ...
Review Comment: I had some setup issues, Yes, I know others claim it was easy.  But in the end I am really enjoying them.  I would like more control and info in the app, maybe a web client too.. Over all I would buy again.

Title: Outstanding wifi with capabilities my old network never had.
Review Comment: I am not tech savy, and have always been dependent on a local IT guy to set up and maintain my wifi network. All those router settings are like a foreign language to me. Our house is old, 4,000-plus square feet, single level, and made of brick with many interior brick walls. Our old wifi system required 4 routers, and we still had a few areas in the house with very poor signal. Each of the routers was connected to our main ATT Uverse router by ethernet cables.Eero setup is simplicity in itself. The eero app walks you right through it. I did encounter a glitch during setup, however, and this was related to my main router. Our internet service is through ATT Uverse. The ATT Uverse router must be put in bridge mode, or the eero system will not function properly. I spent a frustrating hour or so until I found this bit of information in the online help section. I wish eero had presented this information more prominently in the set up guide; this is why I took one star off my rating. Anyway, after a simple phone call to ATT (go directly to a service operator; don't try to use their automated menu system), I requested that they put my router in bridge mode, which they did remotely while I was speaking with the operator. After that, the eero system has worked flawlessly.I still needed 4 eero units to cover the house, the same number of routers as I had before; and all of the eeros are connected to the main router by ethernet cables as before. But now download speeds are better than I ever had, and every square inch of the house receives great signal, whereas before, there were parts of the house that had very low signal. Before, I was constantly having to reset my routers; I have had my eero system now for 2 months, and I have not had to reset any of the routers once. On my old network, I often had to manually change the wifi address settings on my device as I moved from one router zone to another; with the eero mesh network I no longer have that problem; and for the first time if my iPhone is in the bedroom, for instance, my Apple watch stays connected to it from anywhere in the house. Being able to monitor the status of my eero network through the app, which you can do from anywhere that you have access to the internet, is very cool. And I really love the independence I now have--I, a guy who never had any understanding of setting up a wifi network--of being able to set up and maintain my own wifi network.I cannot vouch for how well eero works using wireless connectivity between the routers, since all of mine are wired directly to my main ATT Uverse router via ethernet cables. I hope this review helps in the decision making process for any of you who are in a situation similar to mine.

Title: Easy, simple, fixed!
Review Comment: Easy to install and it solved the problem of dead space at the far end of our home. Simple...easy...fixed. Good product.

Title: ... very large size house and the 3 pack is excellent WiFi connection to the many devices family members have ...
Review Comment: I have a very large size house and the 3 pack is excellent WiFi connection to the many devices family members have running at the same time!

Title: Great product!
Review Comment: No issues with internet connection since purchasing and installing eero wifi system. I highly recommend this product to anyone interested in quality uninterrupted wifi.

Title: Strong WiFi everywhere.
Review Comment: Consistent coverage of WiFi through out the house.

Title: Easy setup and great execution that results in a product ...
Review Comment: Easy setup and great execution that results in a product that actually maximizes our internet service - not an easy feat given how hard it often is to get the speeds promised by providers.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent reception all over the house!

Title: Excellent product that is really simple to setup and use!
Review Comment: Having worked with various networking equipment for over 20 years, Eero has made the tech savy requirement obsolete. Very simple, clear and quick setup instructions made configuring 3 hubs extremely boring - which is a great thing!! About as close to 'plug and play' as you can get. My hubs are over the recommended 40 feet apart, going thru floors and walls, including a fire rated garage wall, and all have excellent signal strength.I balked a little at the price, but the little extra was well worth the performance and stability of the equipment. The hardest part of the entire installation was figuring out a name for the network. :-)

Title: As Advertised
Review Comment: 3 pack fully covers 3000 sq foot home and surrounding outdoor space.  Easy set up had me up and running in under 30 min.

Title: Super easy to set up, regular software updates from company
Review Comment: Super easy to set up, and I like that the Eero team regularly releases updates to their routers and iPhone app. The latest update shows you which devices are connected to each Eero node, and their signal strength which is incredibly helpful. I think the main thing I'd like to see added is support for connecting a printer or hard drive to the USB port. Right now, Eero says it's only used for "diagnostic purposes"

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It was easy an has worked  as advertised

Title: Finally great wifi coverage in my house
Review Comment: Finally solved the problem in my house of patchwork, weak wifi. Easy, no nonsense tech support.

Title: Fast and easy solution!
Review Comment: Wow! So I needed an internet solution for our home and this truly was the answer! We have 4700 sq feet on 2 levels. We had dead and slow spots. Not to mention we are always early adopters of things and have 2 teenage sons - we have lots of devices! I was nervous after reading some reviews, but installation was easy. We have AT&T Uverse and I was able to set up all 3 eero's in less than 30 mins. I just did it today and it says signal strength will optimize in 24 hours, but I'm already getting stronger signals in previous dead/low spots.  I love that it's one network with one password. Plus I love I got rid of that insanely complicated password from AT&T and made it something that works for us. So far, this seems to have been the answer to all our internet troubles!

Title: Big proponent for this system
Review Comment: I work for an ISP and we recently began selling these systems at our retail locations. We have a 1G pipeline at these locations and over wifi we'd generally pull between 20-35m on mobile devices. Before the launch we set up Eeros at all the stores and began pulling 125m (I haven't been to one of the locations to check since last patch.) I'm paying for 25m Internet service at my apartment. Less than 20 feet from my modem, in my kitchen, I was lucky to get 5m, so after seeing what it did for our coverage in our stores, I decided to buy one for myself.  Since purchasing the Eero system, I get a solid 35m everywhere in my apartment, and have even maintained a signal up to 35 feet behind my building.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: completely solving wifi coverage in a building

Title: Blazing, secure, and simple to configure
Review Comment: I'm now getting incredible speeds over WiFi.  I just clocked 134 Mb/s to my laptop while attached via WiFi to one of the secondary Eero units (one of the eeros that is not plugged directly into the Ethernet).  Incredible!

Title: WIFI works great, routing leaves a LOT to be desired and support is "there" but not helpful.
Review Comment: UPnP does not work correctly with Tivo (using the Netflix APP).  Still waiting on support to resolve the issues.  Initially they were very responsive but after a few instructed reboots it appears they quickly gave up on trying to help me.  Hopefully someone will get the information I provided to their engineering team (since the APP/Configuration has absolutely NO way for me to help myself).

Title: Wifi that "Just Works"
Review Comment: This really is a great little product. I can now get 400+ Mbit/s all over my home, whereas before I'd be lucky to break 100. Pros:* Ethernet jack on every device. Unlike some of the competitors, this means  you can choose to hard wire some of the eeros for even better speeds (I used a MoCA bridge for this, which runs Ethernet over the existing cable connections in my house). Some of the competitors only have an Ethernet jack on a "main" device.* Simple setup.* Reliable network that Just Works. My phone automatically connects to the best network to maximize speed.* Can be used in "bridge" mode where the Eero's just acts as access points to my existing router. There are  a few downsides:* Need to make an account to set up the Eero in the app.* Needs an app at all. I have an iPhone right now, but I've previously used windows phone and might go back to it in the future and the fact that you need either an Android or iOS phone to do the setup is a bit worrying. I'd prefer if the "app" was just a web page served by the devices, so it could be accessed on any device, including a laptop.* No full IPv6 support. Not super critical right now I suppose, but a bit risky that it may not support this for the future (no problem if you use the Eero's in bridge mode though - as long as your existing router handles IPv6). This is the one and only reason I kept my existing router rather than just use Eero's for everything.For me personally it would be a 5 star review if the IPv6 thing gets addressed in a future update because it would mean I could just get rid of my traditional router altogether. The other cons are an annoyance but not enough to dock a star.

Title: Excellent and highly recommended for all
Review Comment: Easy setup, great coverage, adapts and updates as you go along. Highly recommended no matter what your technical knowledge (none needed) may be.

Title: ok router but to much money
Review Comment: The routers are ok this is my third one but the price is too high.

Title: I have highly recommend this to my family and friends
Review Comment: Have had spotty coverage in my house for years.  I have tried multiple routers and also different extenders to no avail.  Eero is the only option that gives me whole house coverage at speed.  Well worth the money.  I have highly recommend this to my family and friends.

Title: Very pleased with the signal
Review Comment: Very pleased with the signal. Easy to install. I ended up getting the 2 pack to cover over first floor and it works great. No black holes like we had in the past.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy to install and very user friendly.  It is simple and inconspicuous.  I love it.

Title: I've had all kinds of routers this one just works ...
Review Comment: I've had all kinds of routers this one just works! Plug it in and forget it. The way tech should be.

Title: Easy to set up and fast
Review Comment: Wow! Our house is large and old and has lots of dead zones. It is 3 floors and have never had consistent wifi or streaming. Knowing Amazon's reputation we ordered the 3 system. Easy to set up and fast. Excellent wifi and streaming from the start. Best present for ourselves we ever bought.

Title: Outstanding!
Review Comment: Eero is the first wifi router and signal extender that works effectively throughout our very large home.  It was extremely easy to install.  And the company regularly updates the system's software without any apparent service disruption or effort on my part.  I highly recommend Eero.  It's worth the investment!

Title: incredible!
Review Comment: This product is absolutely amazing. I will never go back to a traditional router. This is truly a game changing product. Installation is as easy as it gets. Wifi strength stays steady throughout the entire house. I would recommend this to anyone and everyone!

Title: Finally have a full signal in all rooms of house!
Review Comment: Purchased 4 eero's to cover 3600sq ft home that covers two floors that sits on a hill.  Replaced 2 wireless modems and one wireless extender.  It was the easiest install and we are now able to use Sonos in entire house on the same network.  System in place for a month,  not one reset and watching 4K Netflix with no delays.  Fantastic system.

Title: The Alpha and Omega of Difficult Home WiFi
Review Comment: This thing is the real deal. My parents live in a house that's large-iah and, due to construction materials, insanely radio opaque. I couldn't abide by the 40ft placement radius guideline, having to stretch the units to around 60-80ft away... Through solid concrete for one node.But it works. It frickin works! We've tried everything including high powered routers and multiple repeaters, and not only did this work but it was actually easy to set up and worked the first time. I rarely write Amazon reviews but I wanted to tell people that this 3 pack is absolutely worth the money if you've been struggling to get consistent wifi in your house.Also works perfectly with lots of devices like DLink Wi-Fi camera, Smart TVs, and printers. The only small downside is lack of WPS.

Title: A perfect WiFi solution!
Review Comment: Spotty WiFi? Look no farther than the Eero. It was easy to set up and solved ALL our dropout problems for a 2,700SF three story house. Nice looking too. A perfect solution.

Title: Very easy setup. Migrated from an Apple Time Capsule following ...
Review Comment: Very easy setup. Migrated from an Apple Time Capsule following the directions on the eero website so that I could keep it on the network as a time capsule. I went with eero because we have an oddly shaped floor plan and it was difficult to get a signal in some of the bedrooms. Installing the eero took care of that problem immediately.I've updated the firmware twice now with no issues. Overall I'm very happy with this as a set it and forget solution.

Title: Didn't work well for me. YMMV
Review Comment: I will admit that I'm in the minority of reviewers here, but this system just didn't work out for me and I'm rather underwhelmed at the product support.I had been running a home system with an apple extreme and a couple of airport expresses connected via LAN for extending the wifi network in my house (2-story, fairly large). Had worked very well ,with the sole exception that when moving around the house using wifi, the various base stations wouldn't hand off very efficiently, holding on to a weak signal even when a stronger one was available (had to switch wifi on a device off and back on to get the better signal). A minor inconvenience, but otherwise fairly robust setup. I run three media servers and  Sonos system in which most of the units are on the LAN but do have a couple on the Sonos wireless net. Worked pretty flawlessly with the above exception.In any event, the idea of a true mesh network sounded like the solution to my roaming issues. My concern with a system like the Eero was the cloud-based nature of the system, lack of diagnostic tools at my disposal to help solve problems, and the phone/tablet-app-only interface. So I threw the dice. Set up was fairly straight forward with the iPhone app. The problem I had from the start, however, was intermittent short drop outs of internet service and connections to my network servers. I'm talking about 5-10 second intervals where streaming would stop, Skype calls drop, loss of connection to my music library (on a NAS), about several times an hour. Worse, after the first few days, the app on my iPhone couldn't even connect with the Eero system, yet that system remained connected to the internet and continued to route signals (with the above problems). Unfortunately, this was just before Christmas and I figured tech support would be sparse so I waited 'til just after Christmas to call. Got level one support which was fairly useless ("never heard of that problem before"), was kicked up to level 2, but that entailed waiting for an email response. 24 hours later, heard back from tech support acknowledging the ticket and letting me know they would get back to me "in a few days" when they had some sort of answer.This left me high and dry so I swapped out the system for my old setup and am back up and running just great with my previous set-up.Now, I'm willing to admit that my network my be atypical with multiple media servers, a Sonos system, reserved IP addresses, etc., but the lack of ability to interface with the router in any meaningful way, and, in my experience at least, marginal customer support, to be suboptimal for a product of this nature in this price range. I'm fairly tech-savvy so usually can solve problems without the need for tech support, but with a system like this, you're kind of stuck.

Title: Highly recommend!
Review Comment: I tested my home wireless speed with the WI-Fi SweetSpot app installed on an iPhone 6 both before and after setting up my eero. I was using my cable company's wireless router with about 12-15 devices in a 1500 sq. ft. ranch home with the main unit in the basement.. After setup, the wireless speeds literally tripled! To say the least, I was quite impressed I 'm even getting 4 bars in the furthest reaches of my backyard.Even got an enthusiastic response from my two data intensive teenage daughters!  The eero will pay for itself in data overage charges!Setup could not have been easier, Less than 20 minutes total.

Title: Eero Home WiFi Mesh Network Made Simple
Review Comment: I bought the Eero WiFI mesh system primarily to boost the signal for my Smart 55" TV in the Living Room.  The Eero WiFi System is simple to install, I think I was up and running within 20-30 minutes.  The most amazing thing is my speed test for the Smart TV increased 5 times (Download Speed) which means I no longer have annoying buffering while while watching Grand Tour or, House of Cards - Can't have that.  I have recommended this product to people at work who have claimed similar increases in their WiFi performance.  I totally recommend this product!!  The price for this through Amazon is the same at Best Buy.  I much rather buy through Amazon because my purchases here benefits Omni Nano.NOTE: Eero recommends getting a twin pack for homes and apartments which are less than 2,000 square feet in area.  My 2-Story Townhome with 1,800 square feet is well covered by the this system.  The two-pack system is expandable to add an additional Eero receiver if need be.

Title: Amazingly easy to setup
Review Comment: We have large house  with three floors and lots of dead spots. Tried Powerlines, extenders, new routers, nothing ever worked well. Amazingly easy to setup, getting 80 Mbps downloads, no dead spots.Worth the cost of one router won't provide coverage.

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: Easy to set up.  Had one issue that was handled within 1 minute by calling their spectacular customer service.  I love the auto-switching from 2.4 Ghz to 5.0 or 5.2 Ghz for the fastest connection.  Speed went from about 50 Mbs to 150 Mbs (what I'm actually paying for with my cable provider). Highly recommend.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Them s***s work good AF.

Title: though very easy to setup
Review Comment: NO ACL... this product does not support ACL!  this is literally entry level home system. so it will not work for most businesses. though very easy to setup. signal does fluctuate, (measuring showing signal drops. also it create stumbles if one device transfer data. other devices may "wait" ... ) bridge mode is much better than NAT mode. in NAT mode issues with routing are very common.entry level amateur equipment. so if your network is simple, it will work (but so is any other router)sorry to rain on other triumphant reviews.

Title: Easy setup and they are FAST
Review Comment: If you have WIFI issues, these are what you want to buy. No more issues. Put one for every 1000SQ Feet in your house. Easy setup and they are FAST. Mesh networks are awesome technology.

Title: Finally --- complete & consistent wi-fi coverage
Review Comment: Works as advertised: easy set-up; whole house covered; all our devices connected with no problems. Great solution to several years of trying to find an adequate router.

Title: Best WiFi Router Mesh System On The Market
Review Comment: If you have spotty connection in your home this is the system for you.  I have a 3800 sqft home and it works better than anything router I've ever had.  I can stream music and movies on the back patio around the pool.  You will not regret this purchase.  Set up is an absolute cinch!!!.

Title: Best thing since sliced bread!!
Review Comment: Love it!! Full Wifi signal all day everyday!!

Title: GREAT product
Review Comment: soo easy to set up and works perfect.  Eero solved many years of home wifi frustration.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy to install and works great

Title: Eero sets up very easily and works as promised
Review Comment: I've been through several iterations of wifi trying to get a strong signal throughout the house, without success till now.  There have always been pockets of weak or no signal.  Eero sets up very easily and works as promised.  I got the set of 3 for a 2 story house with finished basement.  Strong signal everywhere!

Title: Four Stars
Review Comment: What an improvement!

Title: Finally something that works.
Review Comment: Perfectly covers the dead spaces.  Finally something that really works, and I've tried all the usual suspects.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: The WiFi System was very easy to set-up and works seamlessly.

Title: What's not to like?
Review Comment: To quote another modern technocrat, "it just works." Setup: next to none; adding nodes: practically automatic; updates & maintenance: so far, self-healing. I wanted a 100% reliable system for a materials-dense house that I could plug in and forget, and that is what I got.

Title: but very easy to set up and works flawlessly
Review Comment: Somewhat pricey, but very easy to set up and works flawlessly.  I have three eeros in my home replacing three access points.  Wi-fi is faster and much more reliable.  The system behaves exactly as advertised.Pros: ease of setup and use, flawless performance, rock solid reliabilityCons: price (but worth it, in my opinion)

Title: Disk Malfunction
Review Comment: I was excited to receive the Eero system, which worked well until one of the disks malfunctioned, causing significant disruption in service at great cost. We will see how they respond and rectify the situation! David

Title: Awesome!!!
Review Comment: The only thing that needs to be said about this product: awesome.  Set-up was awesome...took 15 minutes and worked flawlessly.  Performance has been awesome...no dead zones, excellent speeds.  App is awesome...so simple yet provides all the information you could want or need.This is a well thought out solution.  Simple yet powerful.  Would recommend this product to everyone.

Title: Eero is a lifesaver!
Review Comment: I absolutely love EERO!!  We have a 3 story home that I thought I could blanket with just using a router and then an extender.  Immediately the extender broke and we lost wifi all the time.  So then I came across Eero, figured it was worth a try.  I couldn't be happier!  I have 3 eeros (1 on each floor) they blanket the whole house, I haven't lost wifi unless it was something with my provider!  If you want amazing wifi and great connection go buy this right now!

Title: Great product but be aware of some SERIOUS PRIVACY ISSUES WITH USING EERO...
Review Comment: First let me say that this product works well and have solved a very difficult wifi coverage issue for my business.  I am getting my full 50MB download speed at the Eero connected to my router and about 30 - 40MB on average around the office, sometimes in places where I got literally ZERO connection before Eero, so I'm pleased with it's performance. What I'm NOT pleased about is the invasion of privacy that Eero products seem to come bundled with. In essence, because you MUST use the Eero app to set up the network, and that software ONLY comes as an Android phone or Iphone app (IOS on Ipad is NOT supported!), you are basically FORCED to give Eero a working cellular phone number linked to your account. Also, because Google enforces cell phone authentication now when you download Android apps, if you use Eero's Android app and you've never given Google your actual cell phone number you will have to do that too just to get the Eero app loaded on your phone. Ridiculous. No doubt both Eero and Google could use your cellular number to tie every bit of your web traffic to the owner of the cellular phone if they so choose which doesn't bode well for privacy advocates. There also doesn't appear to be a way for Eero to enforce MAC authentication so if you're used to using specific MAC addresses to limit what devices can connect to your router you are out of luck. Anyone who can sniff your wifi traffic and decrypt it will have full access to your network. I frankly think it is entirely disrespectful of a company to force you into this situation and if it wasn't for the absolute necessity of having Wifi coverage using Eero I would have chosen another vendor because of these privacy concerns.

Title: Get Eero!
Review Comment: This WiFi System is legit! Strong signal thru out the household and is easy to manage. Beats the repeaters we had before hands down.

Title: Router Nirvana
Review Comment: Before eero, one of our computers would disconnect from WiFi frequently and we had occasional buffering issues with Netflix and Amazon Video on our smart televisions. I should also mention that In the last couple of years we've added two tablets, an Amazon Echo, an Echo Dot, a device that monitors our rooftop solar panels, a Joule sous vide, a Hue bridge and several WiFi-enabled LED light bulbs. Projecting that there will be more smart devices to come in the near future, we needed to act. After researching routers and router extenders, it was decided that the eero system would be our best option. A hefty price break sealed the deal and we purchased a three pack. Since the eero system was put into service to blanket the house, we've had no further connectivity issues. Installation was incredibly simple--all devices connected easily and they work as they are supposed to. As non-techies, automatic updates are a big plus; there is no wondering if our router is up-to-date (if it wasn't, we wouldn't have known how to update it anyway). Unlike our previous routers, eero's appearance is sleek and unobtrusive. We like our eero system so much that we will be ordering another one or two for our vacation home shortly.

Title: Would buy again
Review Comment: This is the first (and only) "mesh" network that I have purchased, so I cannot compare eero to its competitors in that category.  I had a traditional network set up using Apple routers and Netgear extenders and eero was a tremendous upgrade.First of all the set up was very simple using the app.  The app is easy to use and intuitive.  Setting up several units took less than 20 minutes.  When choosing eero, this was one of the factors that influenced my decision over Netgear's product in which the app appeared dated (at least at the time I'm writing this).Most importantly though is that eero just works.  I struggled with random dead spots all over my home (despite having repeaters literally 15 ft from the devices) and I am no longer having this issue.While certainly more expensive than many products, the product does what it's supposed to do and delivers coverage all over my house.

Title: Works great!
Review Comment: Works extremely well. Easy to set up. Solved my wifi problem. Highly recommend.

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: It's wifi that just works everywhere in the house.  Easy to set up, and the app is just a pleasant bonus

Title: Works Great
Review Comment: Works great. Easy to set up. I get high speed wireless throughout my house (2 floors and a finished basement) with two Eero units. Wireless download speed (82 mps) is almost as fast as the wired connection (83 mps). Throughput to all local network connections (TV, Apple TV, PCs, set top boxes, etc.) was optimized after a day or so. The iPhone app is quite helpful for monitoring the status of the Internet connection as well as internal network connections. Highly recommend Eero.

Title: Transformative home WiFi system!
Review Comment: Amazing system, so easy to blanket the whole house with coverage, works wired or wireless, one SSID for the entire system, just an excellent product.

Title: Pricey, but super easy and super fast
Review Comment: This system has worked incredibly well.  It is certainly not cheap, but it seems to be a case of getting what you pay for: excellent performance and fast set up.  Setup relies on a simple iPhone app and was super simple.  The network performance has been flawless and fast.  However, two important notes: (1) it takes a couple days for the network to optimize itself, so be patient - mine was pretty fast out of the box, but a friend's eero network (in a taller house) improved by nearly 3X over the course of about 48 hours (2) you have to do the latest software updates for the best performance. Below are the performance numbers for my old Airport Extreme, followed by the eero without a patch and then the eero with the patch.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Beware if you own Arris Surfboard SB6183, due to some bugs wireless does not work

Title: Best Christmas Gift
Review Comment: Best Christmas Gift!  I researched many options and asked for the eero wifi system for Christmas.  It is SO simple to install.  I downloaded the app to my iPhone 7 and followed the instructions to set it up.  It was fast, easy and working in 20 minutes.  Most of the time installing was due to rebooting my modem/router from my cable company.  I tested it out by watching Amazon Prime where we had spotty wifi and it it worked like a charm!  It's only been 1 day, but so far I love it!

Title: Great easy to use router
Review Comment: The system is really easy to set up and distributes the wifi signal to the entire house.  The ability to create profiles and set Internet pause times is great. I would like to be able to add a device to multiple profiles. I really like being able to check and manage the network from the app wherever I might be. I can see who is online and pause the xbox connection if they should be doing homework. I would recommend to anyone who wants a network router that you can just set up and forget for the most part but easy to configure when you do need to make a change.

Title: More my fault I think
Review Comment: It really didn't do what I was expecting. But not sure that the issue I have can be cured by this either.

Title: Works great! Order with confidence.
Review Comment: I'm not a technical guy. I either don't have the aptitude or the patience. I want to plug something in and have it work. Eero was simple to set up and works like a charm. This solved all of my home wifi coverage issues.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent, reliable, as easy as advertised.

Title: Don't even hesitate. This is a first class product with a great range.
Review Comment: Easy to set up. Fewer drops and black spots.

Title: A+
Review Comment: great, as expected -- easy to set up and now we have ripping fast wifi in the whole loft apartment

Title: Great Product - Sub Par Support
Review Comment: Two parts to this review.First part is the hardware. Hardware is beautiful looking, super easy to set up, performance is awesome for my home, and the attention to detail of the product is spectacular. You are purchasing a system of routers that will completely cover your home in reliable wifi coverage. It looks like a modern "apple designed" device and has a beautiful app that is iOS and android friendly. No support for a computer to set up and monitor the system though that's not a huge deal.Second part is the support of the purchase of the product. Support of this item lacks common sense. You might never know when to purchase this item. Buy it now. You might loose out on a promotion. Also the experience I received when asking for assistance. Here is the story about the experience with Eero and Amazon Customer Service. I bought this as a early adopter of the "mesh network" items full price 500 bucks. It went on promotion 2 days after receiving it. Called eero and was told that I needed to talk to the seller. Called Amazon and uncovered there is No Policy or support to give me the difference while keeping the product. Instead they told me to re-purchase to get the promo price, THIS IS Amazon Customer Service's solution...To have over 1k in charges until the other was returned for Realiable Wi-Fi. So I return it, and go to rebuy it.... It's off the special promotion I find. Called Amazon informed me there was/is nothing they can do is not on special. I was advised that I needed to wait to buy it again. They mentioned that if I would have bought a TV they could have helped me. So to recap. Bought the $500 3 pack. Had to return it. Lost money as I had to pay to return it. Tried to get the promotion again and it was off promo. In the mean time I am getting email from eeros marketing telling me that I can get 100 off and to purchase it today. Great customer focus Eero and Amazon.

Title: The 3 devices come well packaged and appear to be robustly built with a good quality finish
Review Comment: I have a 3 story condo and my wi fi wasn't reaching from the bottom to top floor.  I had tried a range extender and, while it allowed me to get an adequate signal where I added the extender, there were still a number of weak spots plus my devices wouldn't always change networks properly.  I read all the reviews on the eero system and finally decided to give it a try.  Most of the reviews I read have already hit the high points.  The 3 devices come well packaged and appear to be robustly built with a good quality finish.  I didn't have any issues setting up the devices using my iPhone; I was up and running in less than 30 minutes.  My signal strength/download rates were improved significantly throughout the house and now there is no need to switch networks since the mesh approach makes the devices look like one network.  After installation, I wanted to move one of the devices for improved coverage; so sent a test to eeros to make sure I knew how.  The response came shortly and it turned out you just unplug the device from its current location and plug it in in the new location; everything synchs up automatically.  I've been running for a couple of months now and everything is still working great.  I definitely would recommend this product.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Simple setup. Intuitive app. Spotless coverage. Worth every penny.

Title: My Wi-Fi connections suck. I have called my ISP and everything is ...
Review Comment: I don't need any replies or comments:  I paid over $500.00 w/service plan for the 3-pack.  My Wi-Fi connections suck.  I have called my ISP and everything is fine on their end.  I should of stuck to my NETGEAR NIGHTHAWK router that I have had for several years; it worked better.  I wish I could get my money back (Been trying to call and reach a rep).  Also, I see that I could have bought it for $127.00 cheaper now...awesome.  I hope it works for others and you are successful.  My Upload/Download speeds on average 5.3/0.2!  They go offline several times a day.  I have to reboot my system at least 2-3 daily.  Good luck people!

Title: They Just Work and Work Great
Review Comment: I purchased a three pack during the Black Friday sale ... the performance increase is awesome; back bedrooms went from under 10 MB to over 100 MB. Devices connected to the primary eero come in at over 300 MB. Total setup time including the initial software update for all three eeros took about 15 minutes.

Title: Revolutionary product!
Review Comment: OMG!  Buy Eero TODAY!  The easiest network setup I've EVER done!  Gives you a PERFECT wifi network!  Never seen anything this simple and effective!

Title: GREAT PRODUCT.  It works well.  It really delivers.  Get the 3-pack.
Review Comment: This product is GREAT.  We have a 5,000sq ft house on two levels.  For years we have had several access points in the home, and have relied on our mobile phones and tablets to lock on to the best one depending on what room we're in.  Stuttering videos, slow browsing, and sometimes just no access are problems we've had through several versions of this kind of setup.  FINALLY, I sprung for a 3-pack of these, and I can tell you, I have FULL BARS IN EVERY CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  It really does work as advertised.  If you have the problems I've mentioned, you should get a set of these and all that will be history.  I'm a licensed ham radio operator, and I was skeptical, but this actually does what you think it is supposed to do.

Title: Beyond simplicity
Review Comment: Beyond simplicity, finally, something that really work an Erro solved in the most simple (Not cheap but no expensive).I'm so glad to have been bought eero devices and it was not just for me, my wife loved it; she is not technical and not having to switch between 6 different networks around my house is fantastic for her and I don't have to provide technical support for everyone anymore and I don't have to explain why I have so many WIFI networks :).

Title: Great product!
Review Comment: Great product! Easy to set up and very reliable. Highly recommend.

Title: Great coverage in our 2 story house
Review Comment: Great coverage in our 2 story house. The only downside is the price.I like the new Family Profile feature. It lets you easily schedule off times for the kid's devises without disabling the whole internet. It also lets you disable & enable their internet on the fly if they are not doing homework.

Title: Mine are BLIND
Review Comment: two (z)-eeros 20 feet away, up on bookshelves, couldn't see each other. For the price, they should connect and make me a cuppa coffee besides. Worthless in my hands. Have the ORBI (at home), and send this back for my second ORBI.

Title: A whole new wifi!!
Review Comment: Super easy to set up! We now have no wifi dead zones in our home. Streaming is much much faster everywhere!

Title: Not fully compatible with WeMo
Review Comment: Here's the good.Considerably faster wi-if than running airport extremes as extenders.Easy to set-up.Worked great with our Wink hub and door locks.Here's the bad and why we returned them.Not fully compatible with WeMo.After spending a total of 8hrs on support and troubleshooting with WeMo and Eero our insight WeMo switches never worked.  The other WeMo products worked half the time.

Title: Not the end-all
Review Comment: Eero talks as if these are going to be the greatest thing ever. That's just simply not the case. Ultimately, these are just normal wifi access points. They didn't go through everything, like they said they would; they didn't just instantly handle themselves, like they said they would; I ended up having to hardwire all three of mine, and put them into bridge mode to work with my Fiber. Outside of that, they work fine. But, I could have done this with my old Apple WAPs.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works as expected. Just a townhouse but made a difference with multiple users and multiple devices using the Internet

Title: Simple and Effective -- it just works.
Review Comment: EERO is simple to install (requires a smartphone, either iOS or Android) and works great. This is closest system to approximating distributed wired APs performance-wise that I have found. Unlike mesh systems that use store and forward, there is no hop speed reduction or added latency. It just works! This is my go-to solution now for setting up whole-home wifi systems for clients that want to use their gadgets all over their (usually larger) homes. There's very little in the way of customization that IT geeks like myself might appreciate, but for the vast majority of folks that just want reliable wi-fi, this is the answer.

Title: After years of struggles, finally a solution that works BRILLIANTLY.
Review Comment: As the tech guy in my family, I have spent many, many years being the recipient of nonstop complaints about how bad the internet is in the apartment my parents live in. They have an account with Comcast and are signed up for the 150MB/s service. With the Motorola box provided from Comcast, even in non-peak hours, the fastest speeds I could get were about 40-60 MB/s download. Now, the real struggle begins when you take into consideration the layout of the apartment. When the apartment was designed in the 80s, the designer decided it would be a nice idea to put mirrors on almost every wall in the apartment. As many of you may know, a mirror will absolutely obliterate a Wi-Fi signal - now imagine a 4,000-square foot apartment full of mirrored walls... Needless to say I've had my hands full on every visit to them. I’ve tried EVERY solution in the books and up until now nothing has worked. It’s been a nightmare.Then comes along Eero... Let me say - what a LIFE CHANGER. First off, putting the Comcast modem / router combo device into bridged mode and setting up that first Eero box literally DOUBLED the wireless speed. My speedtest results went from the above mentioned to a consistent 110-130 MB/s. HUGE improvement. And then I proceeded to install the other 2 Eero units in a couple key locations across the apartment and the results are astonishing. In my mother's workspace, the wireless speeds were about 5-10 MB/s and the signal would quite often drop completely interrupting downloads and whatever else with the old setup. After getting the Eero system set up, she was getting a consistent 90MB/s download with not even a hint of instability. That’s over 90 linear feet from the main Eero box through 2 fully mirrored walls… I mean, what is this wizardry?I will say that this solution is expensive, and certainly not for everyone. But if you have any of the unusual issues that prevent traditional Wi-Fi setups like I have had, you literally don’t have to look elsewhere. Eero is a game changer, and has literally revolutionized my parent’s existence. My hat is off to the team behind this product. Bravo.

Title: Unbelievable router
Review Comment: Literally the best wifi router I have ever ever ever tried. In a 3 story up and down duplex I am now getting 80mbs in the basement where I used to be lucky if I ever got a signal

Title: Great, Great System!
Review Comment: Use to the ease of set up in Apple Product and this beat Apples Time capsule by a mile!Literally,  had it set up in my 3200 square foot house on 4 levels in 7 minutes!! So easy with the iPhone app, just unbelievable!!And now have much better coverage than I had with 5 apple Airport Expresses!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: We bought one for our home. It worked so well we bought another system for our office.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: awesome product, great job team. Handling tons of devices very well, easy setup, aesthetically pleasing. take the leap!

Title: NOW THAT ALL THREE ARE WORKING, LOVE IT!
Review Comment: NOW THAT ALL THREE ARE WORKING, LOVE IT!At first, only two of the three-pack worked. The third one wouldn't connect. It was VERY FRUSTRATING. The eero app also said the unit needed upgrading. Spent several hours trying to solve this. Finally, I thought of taking it off the network. Got a message saying that if I did that, it would RESET TO FACTORY DEFAULTS. AH HA!! That fixed it. It subsequently reconnected and we've been getting 60+mbps all over the house and outside as well. (A $255 Linksys WRT1900AC Dual Band Smart Wi-Fi Wireless AC Router (2.4 + 5GHz) *PLUS* a $111 Linksys AC1200 MAX Wi-Fi Range Extender (RE6500) with homemade house wiring. NOW GARBAGE. BOO HOO! But with all that Linksys stuff, we STILL had dead spots, weak/slow wifi, AND VERY COMPLEX LINKSYS-BROWSER-BASED CONFIGURATION. EERO magically eliminates all that hassle and provides extremely high-speed wifi !!)

Title: super easy to setup
Review Comment: My MBs per second went from 15mb to 85mb and a strong signal throughout the house.  The key to the Eero is that you can string them along throughout your house vs. most routers (Airport Extreme) that requires all additional routers connect to the base station.  Also, super easy to setup. No more IP addresses.  Get an Eero.

Title: Easy to set up and has worked flawlessly
Review Comment: My network has never been faster or more reliable.  Easy to set up and has worked flawlessly.  The app has shown me all devices accessing the network.  In short has made wireless in my house wonderful.  No dead zones and fast downloads.  I highly recommend Eero.

Title: Amazing!
Review Comment: I almost gave up on having stable WIFI. We hooked up the Eero and its like magic streaming all 4 roku tv's, 6 cell phones, tablets and laptops...no problem at all. Fast and stable! Love it!!

Title: Well Designed Routers
Review Comment: When Apple stopped supporting their router and extenders, I switched to the eero system.  It set up very quickly and works exceptionally well.  Please note that some of your equipment needs to be rebooted to get the new domain number using DHCP.  The routers automatically update their software very quickly and without any fuss.  Three units covered a 3800 sq ft house with no dead spots.  The guest network is also very useful because it doesn't compromise the main network.  While I still am concerned with the offsite (AWS) control, it actually appears to be better protected than a lazily updated stand alone router.

Title: I would say NOTHING exists that is perfect at this time
Review Comment: review 12/17/16Eero with three access points function at least as well as three separate access points (any brand) on the same SSID.  I wired all three of my eero units to wifi in order to handle the "backhaul".The fundamental problem with this setup:  Apple devices such as iphone 6s and the late 2016 macbook pro with touch bar (absolute latest devices available from Apple) do not handoff from one eero to another without dropping connection.  The handoff from access point to access point varies from 1 to 10 seconds depending who knows what.  You WILL DROP VOIP CALLS or IPHONE/IMUSIC/AIRPLAY streams during handoff.  It is NOT ANY different in performance compared to having multiple airport express access points.If all you want is more broad coverage of wifi, any number of solutions will be feasible. If you want SEAMLESS transition, I would say NOTHING exists that is perfect at this time.Apple has no way of knowing how many access points you have and it clearly does not scan or actively trade access points until your bandwidth drops into oblivion and you lose connection first.  Even then, the handoff is way too slow to reconnect.It is possible in addition that the foam insulation in my house is causing more radio reflections and slowing things down even further.  But that makes my point even more important:  the challenging house is where you would want an eero to work... and that's exactly where it won't.People seem to have reported poor results in other wifi discussions with apple products in terms of handoff between access points.  Unless devices are actively scanning with a second wifi antenna and pre-connecting, you won't get the desired results.  Another option might be if a device was connected to two signals at once.I am going back to me centrally placed asus router so that I can do Iphone over wifi with AT&T since my cell reception sucks in my house.  I lose some phone coverage at certain corners of my house, but this is something I am going to have to live with.  I suspect nothing important will change in my house until wifi technology moves towards a true mesh network at some point.SEAMLESS HANDOFF is what we are looking for Eero and Apple.  Eero is falsely advertising until this can be done.  Eero bears responsibility for not warning the average user that their product won't work with all clients.  I am clearly not the average user and so I was able to figure out that this is not going to work no matter how much I screw around with it.I gave this 3 stars but I should have been much more harsh for wasting half my day on this nonsense.  I am curious how many people who installed an Eero are predominantly just on one AP and therefore are reporting good results.  If someone has any further theories, I am willing to hear them...

Title: Easy setup. Stability is not rock solid as the ...
Review Comment: Potential but software quality is still not there. Easy setup. Stability is not rock solid as the units dropped several times over the corse of a few weeks of testing. Speed wise so so but not matching latest version of Time Capsule for throughout on a 1Gb fiber connection. Ended up returning them and going back to the the Time Capsule.

Title: A Very Satisfied Customer
Review Comment: Finally a system that actually lived up to its promise.  Great coverage throughout our large ranch style home and setup was super easy.

Title: Love it
Review Comment: Simple. Practical. Reliable.

Title: This was incredibly easy to install and has vastly improved wifi in my ...
Review Comment: I debated between this and the Orbi.  I decided to go with the Eero because the purchase included 3 units.  This was incredibly easy to install and has vastly improved wifi in my 5 story townhouse.

Title: easy to setup and works
Review Comment: This first time ever I have internet all over my house , easy to setup and works well

Title: Best Router System I've Ever Owned
Review Comment: This is the best router system I've ever owned. It just works. You don't have to do a bunch of complicated setup in order to get the best wifi performance. It just does any needed adjustments on its own, and the eero gurus are always improving the overall system via various automatically installed updates. I would highly recommend this router system to anyone who wants great wifi performance and doesn't want to mess with the complexity of setting up other router systems that are on the market.

Title: Bottom line - you won't be disappointed. Easiest setup
Review Comment: Bottom line - you won't be disappointed. Easiest setup, best performance, largest coverage.I have 1GB speed in a 4-story, 3700 sq ft duplex with multiple TVs, gaming systems, Apple TVs, computers, phones, tablets and other IoT devices. You name it, we have some form of it on the network. I can stream 4K content on two TVs at the same time, work on my laptop anywhere in the home, and haven't had a single connection issue in the two months it's been setup. This thing is solid. I'll never go back to a single-unit system because they simply don't make sense.

Title: Great purchase! Extremely satisfied!!
Review Comment: This has been a wonderful purchase. I was able to expand my network to another building on our property with this unit. Now we have complete coverage no matter where we sit. Office, deck, garage, etc.

Title: This was so easy to set up and it solved my WIfI problems
Review Comment: I am a 61 year old woman...not a techie by any means. This was so easy to set up and it solved my WIfI problems.  Thanks eero.

Title: Easy to setup and if you have kids it's great ...
Review Comment: Has made wifi dead spots a thing of the past in our house.  Easy to setup and if you have kids it's great to control their access.

Title: It works, old flat, lathe and plaster walls ...
Review Comment: It works, old flat, lathe and plaster walls, heavy solid doors... and it works. Shame on you all of the other routers I've had, ten year old technology in gradually prettier cases... shame.

Title: Good coverage but be prepared for minor "outages"
Review Comment: *** UPDATE ***Since I wrote this review, v2.10 came out and this seems to have fixed the disconnect issues I was having.===============================So far I love the reach this WiFi has.  The setup is extremely easy and can be done via an app.  Speeds are good. The router actually runs tests every now and then on its own (I think upon first boot up and once every 3-5 days or so).  I am using it in bridge mode to my Cisco 325RV so l can't try out the family management features or address assignment.  It is very tempting so that I can cut my tween off to get her attention. :)Now for the bad part.  It often seems I am getting disconnected.  My unprofessional guess is this is when the router is trying to push you over to the 5ghz band and it disconnects the device from 2.4ghz to try to achieve this.  If you are looking to be able to select what radio channel you are out of luck (for now at least.. Maybe that will change).  There is also no way to reboot the router (which almost seems mandatory after an internet outage).  I have submitted this as a feature request for the app.

Title: No more dead spots, performance through the house
Review Comment: I went with eero after living with daily frustrations of an Apple Airport setup (an AirPort Extreme + 3 Airport Express setup as range extenders). Results are exceptional. No dead spots, no one in the house getting anything but great performance no matter what they're doing. Not expensive if it delivers. And eero excels, delivering throughout a 4500, 2-story house.

Title: Excellent Units
Review Comment: They work very well and have made our home very wonderful for the internet. We had major issues prior to these units.

Title: Problem Solved!
Review Comment: I've had perpetual problems with wifi coverage.  I've purchased several wifi extenders that just didn't fix my problem.  Then I bought the Eero.  This is a great product.  No more problems!!  I purchased the two-pack for a house right at 4000 sq ft and the coverage is great.

Title: Great... at first.
Review Comment: I loved this thing at first but after just 2 months of wifi bliss the network keeps shutting down for long periods of time. When I connect my old routers everything works fine. I need to contact customer support or just call Amazon and see if they will allow me to return/exchange this.Edit: After a 1 hour chat with eero customer support all problems have been resolved and internet is faster than ever.

Title: Worth It
Review Comment: I truly labored over which home wifi mesh system to buy.  I heavily researched Eero, Google Wifi, Plume, Amplifi, and Orbi.  I thoroughly changed my mind several times but never felt completely decided.  I liked Eero from the start, but was put off by the price.  Would have gone with Google Wifi but the performance didn't measure up.  Amplifi was an early pick but ultimately the unsightly style of the remote antenna turned me away.  And despite Orbi's superior speed, those things are HUGE to leave sitting out on the table.  Ultimately I was sold by Eero's amazing commitment to service, support, and features.  The latest 2.0 firmware upgrade has seen significant performance improvements.We have a central column in the middle of our townhouse with plumbing, AC, walls, etc. that notoriously blocked the central upstairs' wifi signal to much of the downstairs.  Where we did get signal it was degraded and slow.  Out of the box last night I had the first device up and connected via the app in under 10 minutes.  Same for the other two, and I have 5 bars of wifi in every corner of my townhouse.  Speed everywhere has gone from 1-5 Mb to 40-80 Mb!

Title: This is an excellent product. Has solved my wifi signal problems
Review Comment: This is an excellent product.  Has solved my wifi signal problems.  Very easy set up.  Highly recommended!

Title: Fixed my spotty WiFi for good
Review Comment: I love Eero it really fixed my WiFi connectivity problems at my house. Before Eero I tried several combinations of Router and Replicators, different locations and nothing really fixed the spotty signals I had in some parts of the house.Eero is pretty straightforward to use, the app is really great, it helps you visualize the connections and manage your devices with ease.I also chose Eero because I did not want Google managing the internet of my home (Google knows too much about me already :-), parsing everything that my family is doing. I really like that Eero has no ties to Advertising companies and businesses.

Title: Excellent product!
Review Comment: This system is a winner! It is a fast easy setup. We have what used to be called Time Warner high speed internet and it works perfectly with our modem. I love how well it handles our 20+ devices with lightning fast speed. We have a 2600+ sq ft, two story house and our coverage is complete. I highly recommend this system.

Title: great coverage
Review Comment: We had devices dropping wifi signal even though I had 3 apple extenders throughout the house.  The eero solved that problem.  Works great! easy to set up.  Just bought same system for my sisters home for Christmas after hearing her kids complain about wifi coverage in their house.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Best Home Wifi product money can buy !!!

Title: ... three pack and were able to get quick and good wifi for the first two
Review Comment: We purchased a three pack and were able to get quick and good wifi for the first two. And although we were able to connect the third unit it had to be within 15 feet of the second and not able to reach the full area we need. Here's the problem, we're talking an 1800 SF ranch home, one floor, L-shaped and should not be much of a challenge. In fact our old router covered the same square footage with same strength of signal. So I don't know who is doing the testing on the eero but it just plain doesn't work even though we spent a lot of time with tech support.

Title: This system is great. I now have 120MB speed everywhere in my ...
Review Comment: This system is great. I now have 120MB speed everywhere in my two story house and basement too. I used to get 6-10MB all over the house.I have Apple devices, an HP wireless printer and laptop, Nest, etc... and EVERYTHING works perfectly!Highly recommended!

Title: Perfection
Review Comment: Top notch Tech Support. Great product. No more dead zones in my Wifi. I really like this product, and I love Eero Customer Service!

Title: Placement Logistics Tough in Older Houses, but Ease and Performance as Promised
Review Comment: Ease of setup so highly touted is true except that for me, so far, every location I choose for a satellite eero outside the bedroom where the main eero station is located comes back with "poor connection" and refuses to add to the network.  I'm in a house from 1924, and it was built in sections, meaning some of the interior walls were once thick exterior walls.  However, my apple extreme with apple express satellites had no trouble sharing signals through them.  The reason I wanted to try eero was not poor signal strength, but erratic performance with the Apple.  The guidelines for setting up the eero stations - 40 feet maximum with line of sight and no walls between - seem absurd to me.  In one case, I had the satellite 16 feet away, within line of sight, and it still came back with "poor connection," which keeps you from moving forward in the setup process at all.To get the satellite stations on line, I've moved them close enough, and though it seems they're not far enough out to reach my target spots for better wifi, I ran speed test this morning and eero is out-performing Apple Extreme by a wide margin.

Title: So far so good. It covers the areas that I needed to ...
Review Comment: So far so good.  It covers the areas that I needed to be covered.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: great product

Title: Use this to replace my Apple AirPort Extreme Base Station
Review Comment: Since I heard the news Apple's leaving the wireless router market, I've decided to give eero a try, as my airport extreme is aging (tech-wise), and I have always want to give the viritual MESH network a try.Not disappointed at all. Have 3 eero place at different part of the home. In the past, I have had slow wireless coverage in the upstairs area, eero's able to extend the coverage in a noticeable manner.Setup is still not as easy as the AirPort Extreme but still better than the Google Onehub.The Eero iOS app is also nice -- I am able to monitor the home network while I am *not* at home and off of the wifi network.

Title: Excellent
Review Comment: I had multiple AirPort Extreme routers around the house, but they started to act up. So I decided to give this a try. The whole setup process was so easy and I ended up getting better speeds than I was with the AirPort Extreme routers. I did, however, use Ethernet for each of the eeros because I already had Ethernet in place, but the wifi blanketing the house is so nice now.

Title: Awesome product, works great
Review Comment: The performance and ease of setup are amazing.  I am supremely happy with this purchase and would certainly buy again. Sure, it costs quite a bit, but then you get the performance you pay for. I had an Airport network and was very disappointed that about slow performance in other rooms of my apartment. I just use two of the three stations right now.

Title: Excellent product.
Review Comment: I purchased this product 9 months ago and can confidently say Eero is an excellent product. Our wifi speeds increased from 40 Mbps to 120mbps with eero being the only variable. The coverage is seemless throughout the house due to the three routers. Purchase an eero for an instant upgrade for you home wifi!

Title: Improved my coverage. No more kids complaining.
Review Comment: Improved my coverage.  No more kids complaining.

Title: Excellent software, beats Apple's hardware and software.
Review Comment: Replaced network of Airport Extreme's and Expresses in four level home.  This fixed all dead spots and improved performance.  The software far exceeds Apple's and is quite powerful.  Especially like being able to use the iPhone software to check on network away from home.  I was able to set up the entire mesh with 18 devices on both regular and guest networks in about 30 minutes... (some of this was moving a ladder to update Ring camera devices).

Title: Just do it.  You'll be happy you did.  Eero is way better than Luma.
Review Comment: All I can say is amazing!  We have 4 units in our 3,800 square foot home, and not only do we have fantastic wifi in every nook and cranny of the house now, but it also extends to the boundaries of our 15,000 square foot lot!  Where we used to get no coverage, we now get 60 Mb+ speeds.  After setting the Eero up at my house, I had occasion to set up wifi at my Mom's house.  I bought the Luma system because it was on Black Friday special.  What a mistake!  The Luma was clunky and ineffective - I couldn't get the units to communicate with each other from even 20 feet away, and had to call tech support twice (to no avail in the end).  The Eero, by contrast, was super easy to set up and incredibly effective.  I had it set up and working in about 20 minutes with no hiccups at all.  Just get it.

Title: Eero didn't work for my home
Review Comment: I was excited to get the Eero to replace my Asus RT N66U router and two Netgear extenders. I have a 2500 sq ft 2 story home with all the bells and whistles for home automation: Sonos, Ring, Echos, Hue, Isy, Insteon, Nest, and the usual TVs / Laptops / Phones requiring wifi throughout the house. I placed two Eeros downstairs within 40 ft of each other (one in the office and one in the living room) and the other upstairs (this one was also approximately 40 ft of both in a straight line). No matter where I placed the 3rd Eero upstairs, the reception was too poor and setup could not be completed.Setup with the app was super easy and I was looking forward to not having to switch between extenders when moving from one floor to the next. At this point I'll probably just upgrade to the best wifi router available with better extenders and hope for the best. Let me know if you have any suggestions.

Title: Great product!
Review Comment: Kudos to the design team -- this is one of those few products that executes brilliantly, and yet is invisible behind the scenes (as a router should be).  With a little experimentation in terms of locating the units, we were easily able to get rid of all our dead zones and now enjoy fast wifi throughout the house -- and into the backyard.  Previously had a Apple extreme router with another Apple router setup as an extender -- this was frustrating at best, and never seemed to work.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Coupled this with a new modem and my home wifi speeds have about doubled. Impressive!!

Title: Total waste of money.
Review Comment: I don't do reviews unless they are really good or bad.  I bought 3 pack.  Which was north of $400.  I had an Asus large router that worked great I just thought this was cool so I bought it.  Line of sight between all of the units.  Really?  What if your first unit is attached to a modem in the middle of a room with curved walls.  Then there is the 40 ft thing.  Nope.  Had one 21 feet away and still wouldn't connect.  So after about 3 hours of resetting the routers. I got Servie to 2 units.  Showed good speed.  No I put my Apple TV on it and what do you know 20 minutes and the movie hasn't started yet.  With my asus I had service in the street which is a good 100 feet away.  These are a joke and way over priced.  I'll be returning them and going back to my old router.

Title: Painless, perfect, wi-fi
Review Comment: Full speed wi-fi all throughout my 4400 sq foot, one story house - what more can I say?  I used to fight having multiple wi-fi endpoints, and the best speed I could hope for was usually about 10 Mbps.  Coverage was non-existent in the farthest bedrooms, now a speedtest from my phone, from the furthest wifi, shows 108Mbps download, which is my full Internet throughput, at the far corner of the house where it would never connect before.  Handoff between devices as you move through the house is seamless, before, even with the same SSIDs, I'd have to disable and reenable wifi before it would grab the closer device.All configured very easily through the phone app.  We switched Internet providers while I was out of town, and had to redo the system.  I was able to reset up IP Reservations, port forwarding, etc, from my phone, in 5 minutes, from across the country.  You don't get much easier than that.

Title: Amazing Coverage and So Easy to Setup!!
Review Comment: Could not be happier with this purchase!!  I live in a 2nd floor one bedroom apartment and my boyfriend lives in another one bedroom on the first floor in the same complex.  There is a big 3 bedroom townhouse style apartment in between them.  Previously I had the newest Apple Airport Extreme in my place and we had an Apple Airport Express in his to repeat my connection.  His internet was always pretty weak and unreliable (he confessed just how bad only after we installed the eero).  After doing some research into mesh network router systems and seeing the great reviews for the eero system (and the fact that it was $100 off the usual price) I decided to give it a try.  I got the pack of 3 expecting to have the main one in my place right up against the wall and the 2nd and 3rd in his place to cover the whole apartment.Initial setup of the first unit with the eero iPhone app was a breeze.  The app also found the second but said the connection was too weak after several attempts.
