I was bummed so I told the app to stop trying at which point it said there was an update available for the main unit.  After the update I tried to connect to the 2nd again and it worked.  Then the app ran the update for the 2nd.  Those 2 alone were all we needed to COMPLETELY blanket his apartment (back to the farthest corner) and mine.  I setup the 3rd (and let run the update) just because we had it.The app provides so much great information and is super easy to use.  This is a system I fully expect to keep for many many years as it can grow and adjust to whatever living situation we find ourselves in.Only negative I can say is that the USB port on the eero can't yet be used to connect an external hard drive for file sharing so for now my Airport Extreme is continuing to do that job on my network after adjusting it's settings to be in Bridge Mode only.  It's an extra annoying piece of tech that I hope I can retire in the coming months if eero adds that functionality via an update.I highly recommend the eero Home WiFi System.  Depending on your home situation you might even want to start with only one or two and see how well they cover the area before adding more.  The flexibility, reliability, coverage, and ease of use make this the very BEST WiFi system I have ever owned (and I've had just about every router Apple released).

Title: Coverage versus speed.
Review Comment: Coverage is good but the speed suffers. It has some good features due to the last firmware update but not sure the speed decay is worth it.  I actually have 5 units and they really need to be hard wired to preserve the speed.

Title: Won't Bridge with Comcast
Review Comment: Could not get router to take a bridge connection from XFINITY modem/router. Both companies said it was the others problem. Can get bridge mode to work with Apple AirPort Extreme so seems like eero could use some tweaking. Returned product if they address bridge issues would try again.

Title: Almost a Good product. I didnt like having my information stored ...
Review Comment: Almost a Good product. I didnt like having my information stored in the cloud. If you have problems like I did with several devices not connecting but connecting different versions support doesnt believe you and tells you its your device. Funny how I switched devices and connected that same device in 1 minute.. If you have home automation devices(aka cameras, harmony hub, automation devices)  I would steer clear of this system.  They dont offer a hairpin nat solution. There developer just says thats not safe and I'm done with discussing this and thats the way this will be. This is the mentality I got for the entire system as this is the way we do it and were not going to change and our system works great but it doesnt.

Title: USB 2.0 port doesn't support printers or external disks!
Review Comment: They say there is a USB 2.0 port in you technoligy section "Dual auto-sensing Gigabit ports for WAN (cable or DSL modem) and/or LAN (networked device) connectivity, USB 2.0 port" is deceptive and needs to include the caveat I found in the help center "printers can also be connected to your eeros via Ethernet. The USB port on your eero is currently only for diagnostic".I think the technology statement leads the general public is to believe it be able to connect either a printer or external drive to and not for diagnostics. I shouldn't have had to find out after the fact when I tried to set one of these up that it is totally useless to me.  It's like a car salesman telling me I have one but oh by the way it is for our use not your's.  While it is contained in the questions section, I shouldn't have to look there.If they fix this and give me a web or app interface on my Mac I will consider raise my star rating.
Supposed to improve my home wifi experience. It didn't. Going back to my apple airport

Title: eero lives up to its discription, very nice product if you want to blanket a strong WiFi signal inside and out
Review Comment: The system does exactly what eero says it will. It is not often that products live up to their billing but this system does. I am very happy with the fairly easy set-up, relocating, changing the network from old to new. I bought the rectangle 3pack at a local electronics store. then ordered another single here from amazon for upstairs front of our house. Probably not necessary, but I like assurance of having a nice strong signal no matter where it is at home. The signal that was null outside my rear slider is now strong, we are able to use the WiFi at home carelessly now.One of the remote mesh unit -  I have connected to a stream daddy using an eithernet connnection. The performance watching live sports is amazing now, movies aren't that bad either.Happy with eero for sure , little expensive but well worth it!

Title: Solved my Nest cameras going offline problem
Review Comment: I had previously constructed a distributed Wi-Fi network throughout my 1920s house (with plaster-and-lath walls) using an Apple Airport, extended by an Airport Express (further extended using MoCA technology), but it still didn't adequately reach my pair of Nest cameras in two rooms downstairs. (My Airport Extreme was upstairs and the MoCA-fed Airport Express was downstairs but in a different room than either of the Nest cameras.)So I decided to jump to eero technology, and I'm happy I did. (I picked eero over Luma in part because eero was able to take advantage of rooms with an Ethernet feed and so could also take advantage of my MoCA.)The most-important benefit to me has been rock-solid connections for my two Nest cameras.Given that it looks like Apple might be retiring its Airport lines, this seems like a prescient transition for me (and also absolves this Apple loyalist of any guilt from moving away from Apple's Wi-Fi ecosystem). 😉

Title: Long time waiting for this device.
Review Comment: Perfect out of box. True plug n play. Would be improved if it had more user setting to configure. It does have seemless room to room transition. I have mine hardwired which i feel is the best coverage.

Title: Needs work
Review Comment: Setup had problems but I finally got it to work after an update. After using it for a a few weeks, my download speed was only 22MBPS. (I have 200mbps)

Title: Product has potential but lacking some basic configuration settings
Review Comment: I so much wanted this solution to providing a seamless Wi-Fi network to work but despite some good features it needs some improvement and updates for me to rate it more than 3 stars.  As so many reviewers have stated the set up was very quick and easy. I had 2 of the 3 units up in less than 30 minutes and that included the time for software updates that came down immediately.  Signal strength was very good and I did not have any issues with any devices (iPad, 2 laptops, 2 Galaxy S6 phones) connecting but was only on the 2.4 GHz network.  All these devices connect to my original hardware on the 5 GHz band so with eero I was connecting at half the speed.  Upon further investigation using wifi analyzer I found I was on a busy channel from overlapping neighbors.  I could not find any settings in the phone app interface to alter the configuration so called tech support.  I was told unfortunately there is no option at this time to manually set or change the channel selection. Tech support told me this might be future update as many other callers have asked for it.  Also you cannot configure the units to only use the 5 GHz band nor can you turn off the SSID broadcast.  For me these are some basic settings present in most Wi-Fi routers so I was very disappointed by lacking in this current release of the product.In summary this product might be fine solution for many users in most environments, but the following shortcomings are why I am returning the product.• Product needs to be able to view/edit via a web interface, not just using a phone app.• Need to be able to configure to turn on/off 2.4 GHz or 5GHz network speed• Set channel frequency band• Use MAC authentication• Turn off SSID broadcast

Title: works great. I have a large bomb shelter of a ...
Review Comment: Huge fan, works great.  I have a large bomb shelter of a house.  Miles of cat 5 and coax, finally Wi-Fi that works everywhere.  It took 6 of them, but no complaints.  Also very easy to set up.  My only issue was out changed the IP address and I had a little problem changing other things already on my network.  I would really like option to set address. If you can do that already, then I couldn't figure it out.  Never the less, everything, including Sonos, my media server all finally work.

Title: Simply Fantastic. Have better coverage all through my sprawling ranch home than I've had through years of different "solutions"
Review Comment: I am 1 week into having eero set up at home and four days in at my small business. My home is a good size, sprawling ranch. I've had trouble for the whole time I have lived here getting consistent wifi coverage all over the house. Two particular problems were the master bedroom (which is on the other side of the house from where the internet signal comes in on DSL) and the basement. I've used two (and sometimes three) apple wifi routers (two extremes sometimes with one airport) along with trying various other supplemental wifi options (those powerline type devices, or even setting up a separate WIFI coming off one of the extremes to try to push signal into the basement), etc etc etc.  I'm vey technical and have been chronically frustrated.I literally set up the whole eero system in less about 15 minutes. It was ridiculously easy. I was compelled by their two way radios (one set for the eero devices to communicate with each other about which was doing what) and one for pushing signal around the house (most wifi systems with extenders of any sort are doing everything on one set of radios, even if many antennas).Okay, 1 week in, Totally amazed. This has fixed EVERYTHING I had struggled with for at least a decade in this house. It's amazing. The signal on my wifi now is strong everywhere in the house, like amazing conveyance of speed I have to work with, strong. It's even made my Ring Doorbell work much better (and that was quite a frustration in itself due to wifi issues). Best part of all: Master bedroom how have huge bandwidth and strong connection to wifi.  And, I've never had as good of connection as I do now in my basement office. My Apple computer in basement is seeing speeds it has never enjoyed before. I am a fan.Adding to this the regular updates and patches (which is not done on most other routers), I am supremely happy. So happy, got another system for the real office away from my home. I have an issue still to work through there to get my Macs to see the server through the eero (PCs all see it perfectly), but that will resolve once I meet with my tech quy and adjust some things. But the perfection of this solution at my house.  Wow. I was hesitant to spend THIS much money but now I'm so glad this option exists and I'd have paid even more to have it.

Title: Solved issue and was super EASY!
Review Comment: Easy, easy, EASY! Literally took minutes to set up and immediately solved an issue with two upstairs bedrooms that were previously inaccessible to my WiFi.

Title: I'm fortunately to have 300 MB service from Comcast and saw ...
Review Comment: BEWARE OF DRAMATICALLY SLOW INTERNET SPEEDS!!!  Purchased the three-pack and installed without any problems. Unfortunately, the speed at each eero after the 1st one connected to my cable modem cuts the available speeds in half! I'm fortunately to have 300 MB service from Comcast and saw this speed on eero #1, at eero #2 the speed dropped down to 45 MB and at #3 was about 40 MB.  In both cases, the eero app indicated that connection between devices was excellent with all bars lit. Also, the performance after upgrading to version 2.0 of the firmware was WORSE than before the upgrade! After a fair amount of research, I learned that this bandwidth drop-off is a design flaw in that bandwidth is being used for backhaul and connecting the three eero devices. I decided to give ORBI a try (as their approach utilizes a proprietary third wireless band for backhaul and connectivity, thereby preserving the 2.4 and 5 ghz bands for use solely by connected devices). I currently have two ORBIs installed (router and satellite) and achieve 295 MB to 65 MB throughout a 6,300 sf two-story home. I plan to add a second ORBI satellite when they become available and expect I'll be well about 150 MB in every room of the house. If you have a smaller home and can place your eero devices fairly close together (20 feet) with NO obstructions, then you might be happy enough.  For me, eero dramatically underperformed the ORBI in a high-bandwidth environment and seemed much more like a kickstarter beta product. Netgear has been making routers and wireless gear for decades and that experience clearly showed in the Orbi product. It's not as simple to setup as eero, but that shortfall is more than made up for by the high bandwidth capability and advanced router functionality.

Title: Disappointing for the $$$
Review Comment: Qualification: I successfully manage a Cisco wireless network with ~300 WAPs and ~3,500 daily clients.I purchased the the EERO 3-pack to better cover my two story house with wifi. I have an ASUS RT-N66U with Merlin firmware that doesn't quite reach the expanse of my (not that big) house that I just moved into several months ago. It's two stories with 1300 square feet on each story. I can get signal with my iPhone from every location in my house with the ASUS router but it's flaky at the far reaches from the router, as expected.I followed all the steps and did my best to not try anything a normal home user wouldn't do. I can get the base unit working, plugged into my cable modem. However, I cannot get another EERO device to mesh connect from a _reasonable_ location. I respected the "within 40 feet, preferably line-of-sight" guideline and placed an EERO at about 32 feet away with line of sight. I don't understand what good this system is if I have to place devices even closer together.The solo EERO that I connected worked well enough which I why I chose 2 stars. The configuration software is very bare bones. You can't change your IPv4 space to something other than 192.168.7.0/24.For $400 (Cyber Monday deal), this thing was supposed to at least work without headaches. If you're going to charge Apple prices for something, you better well make sure the thing works for normal people. I honestly don't understand how the EERO is so well rated.I have put my trusty ASUS RT-N66U back into service.

Title: Couldn't be happier!
Review Comment: I am shocked at how much faster and more reliable our WiFi has been throughout our 3-story house with eero.We've tried so many old-school routers and none of them have done the trick, even after calling out a tech to help "optimize" our settings in the admin.Now, that's all a thing of the past because with eero in my office upstairs we're getting almost 20% faster speeds than the top speeds we ever clocked before, consistently, even in our basement. I can finally play high-end PS4 games online and stream movies with no glitches or waiting. Yeah, eero is expensive, but it's worth every penny.

Title: Eero is GREAT!
Review Comment: I'm not a techie at all, but I was able to install all three units in about 15 min and was up and running with all my devices within 30 minutes total. My network has always been a little flaky and would drop out periodically and in odd locations around my house. Now I have great Internet connectivity and speed everywhere!!!  I'm very pleased.

Title: Just order and be happy. I ordered them...sent them back...ordered Google Wifi...but those were worse...so I'm reordering Eero.
Review Comment: ****update after ordering Google Wifi****I'm beginning to feel like Goldilocks, but here goes....The Google Wifi was easy to setup, but it would not allow me to set them in bridge mode. When I called tech support, it took 25 minutes to get someone (the app has a callback feature...which called me within seconds of requesting a phone call...but then kept me waiting) versus Eero which answered in seconds. Both tech support folks were friendly, but the Google person felt more bound to a script and punted on some basic questions. For example "How secure is the firewall on the Google wifi?" question led to this answer "Google wifi has WEP2 passwords.") The Eero person felt like they were actually providing tech support.Google: I found out in the set up that bridge mode doesn't allow for guest ssid (?!?!). I know many wont need bridge mode, but I don't understand that design. Also, the tech support told me that bridge mode essentially reduces Google wifi to 3 separate access points with different names, which is basically what I have with the Apple Airports I have now. So the Google is going back, and I'm ordering Eero again if I can somehow get the same black friday deal I originally ordered under.Eero: I sent them back on an annoyance with the app,but I hope that has been fixed. The product is good, the support is great. Just order them and be happy. Don't do like me and tear down your setup multiple times. Eero has also continued to follow up with me, even after I returned the devices. So, I feel like there may be bumps, but they will work through them.

Title: Fantastic Product
Review Comment: I have to say that adding eero to my wifi has made my signal in my new home so much more reliable, what a difference. You have a very good product and would and have recommended to all  of my friends.

Title: Worth every penny!
Review Comment: Let me make it very simple, I have been in the tech industry since the invention of the Apple and have installed and used every type of wireless router and extender. Eero was the easiest to install of any I have used and solved the problem I had of getting consisted strong signal through every corner of my house and basement, where I have my office, even with the modem located two floors above. I purchased the 3 unit solution. Finally, my signal strengths and speeds allow me to do everything I want at any location on the 7 devices (including an Echo) I use. I also love the ability to add guests to my system without giving them my main password.

Title: Thanks EERO! What we've all been waiting for; simple, clean, and it really WORKS
Review Comment: simple quick review since they deserve it;  Finally a whole house wifi system that works well, looks good, SUPER easy to set up and configure (on the first try!), easy to expand, easily handles multiple devices and streaming. it loves our xfinity broadband. it has run flawlessly for a couple weeks now, under heavy load.

Title: This product requires a smart phone and each unit must be able to see ...
Review Comment: This product requires a smart phone and each unit must be able to see another unit.  If you don't have open concept this may not be a good pick for your home.

Title: WiFi calling doesn't work
Review Comment: While a great idea and great technology, the current firmware is incompatible with WiFi calling on the iPhones. Once your device moves between nodes in the mesh network, the calling is dropped and WiFi calling is disabled. Eero is looking into it, but our Eeros are sitting in the box right now, since we're in a mobile dead zone.c.f., on going reedit thread about this issue - [...]

Title: Changed my life!
Review Comment: I had endless home wireless problems. Poor reception, dead zones, dropped service. I suspect my provider was bad, I changed modems, I bought "state of the art" routers....nothing helped. Until now. Eero has changed all of that. It is fast, reliable, easy to set up and no dead zones. Honestly, I wish I had bought it sooner.

Title: PS4 and Arris SB6183 (older Firmware) Modem Users Beware
Review Comment: Just to help other fellow gamers that may be looking at this product. If you have a PS4 and an Arris SB6183 modem you may find the two dont play well together at the moment. In my case I found that I was unable to search the Playstation Store, download updates, or even download games digitally from their store front. If I plugged my PS4 back into my existing Airport Extreme setup no problems, same goes for hardwired directly from PS4 to Modem. Eero support was amazing as you will read about in these reviews and I spent hours trying to find out what was causing the problems. And in the end it turned out that Eero's software has issues with older firmware on the Arris SB6183 modem and they still have to work out the kinks ($500 for beta like software is not ok!). I'm also unlucky in that my ISP will not push a newer firmware so I had to return the Eero units in the end.

Title: Four Stars
Review Comment: Really works great, easy set-up and no issues using it.

Title: AT&T UVerse issues
Review Comment: Having picked it up with $100+ discount, I was initially excited about the Eero given the underwhelming wi-fi performance of our existing UVerse router / modem combo unit. Initial set up was easy, with an app providing step by step instructions. However, when complete, I was left with both the new Eero network and heritage AT&T network in tandem; not what I was ideally looking for. Cue internet searches for support on both Eero and AT&T's websites, both of which failed to find a solution. An email to Eero support was promptly responded to, however they pointed me back to AT&T as it's supposedly a known issue that their routers don't come with a bridge mode. To cut a long, boring story short; while I'm sure I'll find a solution at some point, if you're looking for a simple solution to internet coverage / speed issues, while it will improve both (as it has for me), it's far from the easy solution it claims to be.

Title: Works better than anything previously used
Review Comment: Light years ahead of having a home router and extenders. I have tried many different solutions and this solution is hands down the best I have found for my home. No dead spots, great service in all parts of all three floors.  Yes I had to have five units to cover everywhere but it was well worth it and much better than using range extenders.It's like crack, I can't get enough of it!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: great product; finally have whole house wifi!

Title: Too much money for too much initial pain.
Review Comment: One of the three bricked after the initial update. The placement tool on the Android app did nothing as far as I could tell to recommend placement other than me physically placing the two units and seeing if they could connect. When all three were working the signal strengths were not any better than my Existing Airport Extreme. For reference it is a 113 year old farm house. After the bricking and superficial useless app in this case I sent it back. Right, I cycled it and did the paperclip reset on the bricked unit, which was ironic after their promotional video. Disappointed. Too much money for too much initial pain.

Title: Wifi Heaven
Review Comment: Probably have programmed 10 routers over the years, all frustrating, all requiring talking to someone in a foreign country multiple times. DNS this, change that, it's your ISP, yada, yada. Finally after hours and hours it works.This was heaven.Open the box. Download the app. Follow the directions in the app. Ten minutes later your wife in the basement has wifi for the first time @ 50mbps, your son on the 2nd floor is happy at the same rate, and I'm happy in the office.What a difference.Truly a product designed for the consumer. The box, the units themselves, the API, the software all works. If this product works well for at least a year without a hardware failure, clearly a 10!

Title: My entire house has excellent download speeds
Review Comment: Easiest set-up of a wireless network I've ever experienced. My entire house has excellent download speeds. I would recommend this product to anyone wishing to expand wifi coverage in their home or office.

Title: but that is not what I love the most
Review Comment: Easiest wireless network I have ever setup, but that is not what I love the most. The two extenders (I assume that is what they are) are downright amazing. I have the base unit in the basement, another on the main level in the kitchen, and the final in my bedroom up on the second level. The coverage and speeds are fantastic. I read the review of this product on CNET and was a little skeptical as I had tried other brands to try and get coverage and predictable download speeds throughout the house with little success. eero is the real deal.

Title: Still in Beta
Review Comment: So far, I'm pretty excited about the possibilities, and the mesh experience is working (in that its providing full house coverage).  For most devices, WiFi is fast with low latency.  They were fairly easy to setup and get going. Took about 20min for all 3.  However, this leads to my subject line.  I have a couple of devices which randomly drop to lower speeds with high latency. I had issues with 2 of the nodes staying connected together wirelessly, have all 3 connected over the wire right now.Another issue, which might be fine for most, is the lack of some kind of desktop management support. This is huge for me, even if through a browser  Right now, it can only be managed via an iOS or Android app.  Then there's the fact that management features are highly lacking. You can setup basics like DHCP, get basic health stats for each mode and overall bandwidth, setup guest access, basic useage profiles, etc.  To be fair, they have plans to release a lot more features and functions, at which time I'd definitely raise my rating.  Right now though, there are still essential bugs to squash and core features to add.

Title: No more restrictions on speed
Review Comment: Had a few connection issues but was my fault. Had to customer service and they were very helpful and knowledgeable. Seemed to really like their job which was event by how enthusiastically they were willing to help and stay on the line until set up was complete.  So far so good, no longer restricted by the slow speed of a extender

Title: Really is as good as it says, love it!
Review Comment: OK, check my past reviews and see no raving about anything. This was phenomenal!  Best product ever!  No instructions, uses a IOS app (I'm sure there is an android equivalent).If I had a normal situation, I would have been up and running in 5 minutes. My situation was challenging, because I get a very bad/no service signal on my cell phone without my ATT microcell which comes over the wifi network. So when I tried to do the install which begins with the router off, I would constantly loses cell service which halted the install. I was halted hundreds of times but eero kept remembering where I was and eventually completed the install. Now I have faster wifi then ever before and the same throughout my 2200 sq ft house. I have 3 eeros and I might have been OK with just 2 units. Love this thing!  I have watched this product for a year wondering if it was worth the price, and it is- and more so with the $100 price reduction. I am a FAN!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent product and signal is very strong!!!!

Title: Works great and easy set up
Review Comment: Works great and easy setup - consistent wireless speeds throughout the house.  I used the two pack to cover a little over 2,000 square feet two level home.

Title: It works as designed.
Review Comment: I Comcast as internet provider. I have a 3-level house and modem is in basement.The struggle has been to get WiFi to the rest of the house. The modem by itself was not effective at all. Like many, I tried to extend to the rest of the house using WiFi extenders (plug in to wall type). These worked ok but I still could only get between 18 and 46 Mbps. I was thinking this was as good as it was going to get until I saw the eero product.I purchased the 3-pack and was impressed with how easy it was to setup (via iPhone app). Connected the first to the basement modem which created a new WiFi network and then connected the others throughout the house. I placed one on the first floor and one on the second floor. The eero app you download helps to get everything setup and could not believe how easy it was. I am now consistently running between 112-125 Mbps regardless of where I am at in the house. I also run multiple Xbox one consoles and Netflix, YouTube, etc. are no longer dropping connections.I was able to get the $100 discount so my price for the 3 pack was $399. For me it was well worth because frustration with dropped or slow connections has stopped.One quirk is that after setting up one of the eero, I had to move it but could not get it to reconnect. My solution was to remove it from the network with the iPhone app, reset the device (on the back of the eero using a needle/safety pin), and then adding back to the network using the app. Worked great after that.Would definitely recommend this although the price is a little steep.

Title: Does what it claims!
Review Comment: Eero  is amazing. It works exactly as marketed, which is very rare with technology oriented products. Ever since installing the eero system we have not had a single dropped Internet connection, whereas before and it happen 3 to 4 times a day. The added features that come With the continual upgrades such as family filters are wonderful.  It's always fun to find a new product from a small company that solves the problem and does it better than those from the biggest people out there.

Title: FIRST CLASS & what a pleasure! No more screwing around with crappy & expensive devices & sorry tech svc; eeros just work. Period
Review Comment: Outstanding customer service. My second unit wasn't finding the internet. I chose to 'chat' online, "Steve" took over and within 20 seconds of his knowing I had an issue, it was fixed. Now I have fast and secure WiFi throughout my home and garage. As in entrepreneur I know what these guys went through to get where they got and I appreciate not only their effort to be first class but their success in being so. What a pleasure!!

Title: Finally a strong, simple WiFi Network
Review Comment: After two previous failed attempts to resolve the issue of poor WiFi signal in many rooms of our 2000+ square foot home with other products, I was delighted to find that the eero system was quick and easy to set up, and has definitively solved our problem.  Instead of having multiple different logins/passwords as was the case with other products, the eero gave me a single, simple login/password combination throughout the house.  The range from just 3 eero devices is remarkably good and the signal strength has never wavered.

Title: Simple for a Non Tech girl
Review Comment: First of all I have zero technical aptitude. I was prepared to spend an hour+ setting this up. It took 15 minutes. I have been living with a very frustrating situation for 5 years in that my Netgear Nighthawk router and Motorola modem could not reach 200 feet into my living room. I have purchased expensive modems, wifi routers and had tech guys out here, to no avail. There is a wall between the office and living room stopping the connection. I set this up and it feels like a miracle as it finally works. So simple for a non tech girl!

Title: Best wifi solution - especially great for a larger home!
Review Comment: Without question, eero is the easiest, most reliable wifi system I have ever installed. I live in a 4,500+ sf mid-century modern house with lots of obstacles in the way of seamless wifi. ATT Uverse is our internet provider.  After trying several solutions including the Netgear Nighthawk, I finally found the winner when I switched to eero about a month ago. We demand a lot out of our wifi and we finally have zero complaints with this system. I wish I had purchase eero sooner. FYI I am using 4 eero'/s in my home.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: My fault! It does not work outside US/Canada

Title: Just. Plain. Awesome.
Review Comment: Probably one of the best purchases I've made this year.  My house suffered from dead zones and slow connectivity just a floor away from my airhawk router. I don't live in a mansion, but streaming video on my fire sticks was a constant buffering issue. Enter the 3 router mesh system with Eero and all problems are solved!  I was hesitant with the $500 price tag (should have waited a week when it went on sale at $100 off) but my router and extender were not cutting the mustard and this was worth it. I've wasted $500 on far less. Don't waste any more time and fix your wifi!

Title: Problem Solved
Review Comment: Finally good wireless signals through the entire house that handles multiple devices!

Title: Updated - Works great but is not flawless - Support lets it down
Review Comment: Update 12/3/16 (removed 2 stars): I have a strange problem with eero where virtual machines running on Hyper-V on my laptop struggle to get IP settings from the network's DHCP server. It works about 40% of the time but the other 60% of the time it will either not get any settings or the DHCP server will give it the same IP address as the host machine, causing a network clash.Their technical support seems to be unable to diagnose the problem and not knowledgeable enough (one person asked me what are virtual machines). Diagnostic tools are unavailable to the client so I can't do any investigation myself and after 3 weeks trying to resolve this I'm starting to think that it ain't going to happen. I'm getting ready to return this item as soon as I can locate someone that has Google Wifi in stock.Original review:This is a step into the future of home networks.When we moved into our house, an average two-storey family house, I put a Comcast Xfinity Gateway router in the front room next to the cable outlet and the wireless connection to it was shockingly bad. It was really only usable within the same room. I tried other solutions to extend the network but always ended up with two SSIDs that we had to switch over and dark spots where there was no signal.The eero fixed it. 3 boxes spread around my house and now I have strong, fast WIFI everywhere. No dark spots.The setup was super easy, all done via the phone app. Within minutes I had the first box set up with the network created and adding the extra boxes was super quick. No hitches or issues.And now I have the peace of mind that if I move to a bigger house or get a dark spot anywhere I can just buy an extra box and throw it in the system and boom, problem solved. I have only one SSID and can seamlessly use the internet walking from room to room.

Title: Test all your products in less than 30 days
Review Comment: If you have wireless devices they may not stay connected to the system.  Notably printers.  While Eero customer service is helpful and responsive their fix to the problem is to hard wire non working devices by moving them close to an Eero device or to buy a new printer.  None of which were tenable solutions.  For $530 my expectation is that I'll have wifi and not have to hard wire anything - or purchase additional equipment particularly if those same devices worked seamlessly with my $100 router.  In any event after working with Eero for quite some time I decided that it wasn't worth the expense or hassle.  I was told I couldn't return it because now it was past 30 days.On black Friday they offered $100 off a system.  I again wrote the company suggesting they provide the credit and I would apply it to a additional single Eero - cost $150 - so I could hardwire my printer.  I'd still be out of.pocket $50 but I thought it to be a fair compromise.  I was told no they can't do that.So now I a writing this review to ensure that this does not happen to anyone else.  BTW this is a relatively new HP printer - pretty mainstream.

Title: Very Satisfied
Review Comment: For me, the Eero has worked exactly as promised. After I got my modem to bypass its interior router, the second station paired perfectly. Speed has quadrupled. Very happy!

Title: Nice! Be careful with "bridged" mode at least until the next software update (after 2.0.0).
Review Comment: I bought this for myself after having successfully deployed 2 other eero 3 pack systems. For those installations I used a powerline adapter to attach the main eero and the most remote eero with the thinking that a "wired backhaul" was more stable/reliable than the wireless mesh backhaul and could provide better communication to the non-wired eero. I also let the main eeros in those setups "be in charge" and handle routing etc (the default/preferred setup).For my setup which a little more complex as I have a dedicated firewall computer and several subnets. I initially tried to use the main eero in "bridge" mode. This proved to be somewhat unreliable. Was getting dropoffs and network lags. Support reported that there is currently a bug with bridging for some people and that it would be addressed in an upcoming patch. I did not want to wait so switched over the main eero to "automatic" instead of bridged and put it "in front of" my home subnet - a double NAT configuration. For the other two eeros - one was connected via powerline to the home subnet and the other was via the mesh (wireless backhaul).Things seem to be working a lot better so far. I did have to do some tricky port routing etc for things like my slingboxes thanks to the double NAT setup but really it wasn't that bad. As a bonus I have a bit more wireless and network control features available to me - profiles etc and that's nice.I'm happy so far - support has been great, product seems to work as expected but still a little early in the game. An old nexus 7 device did initially have some connection issues with the new setup but that seems to have gone away as of this morning.I am looking at adding another eero to round out my setup - primary one in the basement, 2 on the main floor (either side of the house one wired other powerline wired) and 1 upstairs (wireless mesh).

Title: Cute and adorable but ultimately useless.
Review Comment: I bought this item for the same reason than everyone else and for me it did not solve any problems. If as the instructions say the units have to be able to see each other than it's the wrong product for me, my house is not an empty warehouse.

Title: Do not buy this product unless you want to spend HOURS on the phone with their IT dept.
Review Comment: my husband  has worked in IT for over 20 years and has an applied math degree. It took him over three hours to get this product working correctly. That time included 2.5 hours with their IT dept.Not impressed.

Title: Wifi drops constantly
Review Comment: I bought an Eero to replace my trusty-but-old Airport Base Station which was showing signs of flakiness after 5 or so years.  I wanted something similar to the Airport in ease of configuration, but without having to be configured from software running on a Mac OS machine (which is really heavy handed when I just want to tweak something).  A few friends recommended the Eero, and I'd seen good reviews online, so I decided to give it a try.On the positive side, the Eero is incredibly simple to set up, and the phone app works well.  However I could just never get consistent wireless performance out of it.  One moment it would appear to be working fine; the next moment multiple machines would lose their wifi connections, and I'd have to sit there and unplug / plug in the device and reboot phones until finally things would work again.  A desktop that literally sits about 2 feet from the device would constantly lose its wifi connection.  I eventually had to just wire as many things as possible directly using wired Ethernet, and that seems more reliable.Some cursory Internet research seems to indicate that the problem might be because the Eero doesn't support configuring the wifi channel it uses [...].  If so that would explain why my wifi is so bad with the device; I live in a dense city with 10+ wifi networks visible from my apartment, so there is lots of interference.  It's possible if I lived in a less dense area the Eero would work better, but given how poorly it performs for me I can't recommend it.

Title: simple, effective, successful -- I'll try to forget the price.
Review Comment: I have a four story town house with Verizon Fios coming in at the lowest level.  With an Apple router of the latest design I got very good speed on the first level, but already on the second with my smartphone I sometimes lost a bar, and despite a signal extender the signal was slow and weak on higher floors.A three pack from Eero fixed us up, and the setup took only a few minutes.  The setup is guided by the smartphone app, which worked flawlessly.  First, you unplug your router and disconnect whatever you've been using for wi-fi.  Then you run an ethernet cable from your router to the first Eero, turn on the power, and follow the very simple directions in the app.  Very soon you are registered, you name the network and the password, and Eero no. 1 is pumping out signal.  Then I went up to the kitchen, on the second level, and powered up No. 2 there.  You then bring it to life with the app, again following VERY simple instructions.  Then I went up to the fourth level and plugged in the final one, again following the app's instructions.  Result -- a good, strong signal everywhere in the house, 35 megabits/second everywhere above the first floor.  Exactly as advertised and with just a few minutes of setup.  Pricey, but entirely satisfactory.

Title: Super easy installation and strong signal with great customer support!
Review Comment: I have tried many extender router, different brands from cheap to the most expensive ones, somehow all of them always gave problems such as disconnected many times, signal lost, super difficult to do the setting etc. Eero was my one last attempt, and it worked like magic. Very easy to install even for people who knows nothing about router setting, just install the app, tap tap tap. Signal strong, no disconnection, simply work. I had a problem before and tried to contact the customer support, their response was super, I got personal help one on one who patiently helped me find the problem. One downside though: it's expensive, but compare to what I have spent with many brands that now just stay in my drawer, I say Eero is definitely the best investment!

Title: Definitely impressed!
Review Comment: I finally have no dead spots throughout my house. Love the mesh networking technology of EERO. With the latest update speeds have increased dramatically. Call me impressed. Setup was quick and easy. I recommend EERO for all my non-techie and techie friends alike.

Title: Awesomw
Review Comment: Awesome

Title: BUY THIS and NO more worry!
Review Comment: LOVE this system! We have no connectivity issues anymore and SO easy to install!

Title: Fast. Simple. It works great.
Review Comment: I'm very impressed. Worked exactly as described, with very simple set up and zero troubleshooting, with very fast WiFi throughout my home, including areas that I'd never had any success reaching before.

Title: Great idea.  Problems still exist.
Review Comment: These are great for the individual that does not want to fuss with their internet setup.  If you are like me and already invested hundreds into a Sonos system then you are out of luck.  It just does not work with Sonos out of the box.  Even after writing and then speaking with the Eero support team I was not able to resolve the issue.The eero team suggests it is an issue with Sonos.  I consider that a strike against eero.  As a product Sonos has worked with every wifi network I have ever setup.  Until I setup eero that is.  I consider that a fairly causal relationship.I returned the Eero and instead went with a traditional Asus router which I installed AdvancedTomato on and employed WDS to create a Mesh network.

Title: Easiest piece of tech I've ever setup
Review Comment: Sleek and attractive design; very Apple-esque. Our upstairs is 1660sq/ft and downstairs ~ 900sq/ft and the two pack was sufficient for our setup.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product easy to set up and works like it states.

Title: Solid performance, but you'll pay top dollar for it
Review Comment: Pricy, but works very well.1600 sqft ranch-style home. One eero in the basement, one at one end of the house in the living room, one in the middle of the house.WiFi coverage is phenomenal, anywhere in the house, and even works well in both front/back yards, driveway, and garage. iOS app is very intuitive, and provides ability to change all required settings (including what I'll call 'parental controls' for device-specific access), to more obscure settings like port forwarding and DNS.I'm personally wary of server-side software that has access to, or controls electronics in my life that previously were without (thermostats, smoke detectors, routers, etc.), but feel better that even if eero goes under, the routers will still continue to function.Recommended purchase if you can manage the price. Let's hope that cash keeps the company chugging along.

Title: Awesome
Review Comment: I work in IT and live in a 2500 sqft 2 story home.  I have always had trouble with wireless.  I've tried everything.  Repeaters, routers converted into gateways, different routers, seriously, all kinds of tests, configurations, products and... this solved my problem.  Now I have fast wireless in the house and outside.  I used to do test in my office as an acid test and I always got an unstable 5Mbps or less.  Now I get 85 to 100 Mbps in the same location.  The same location I have used for testing for years.  Never has anything ever come close.  And I can now go all over the house and I get really nice, fast connections.  This is a great product.

Title: Brilliant product.
Review Comment: Finally my large, brick house is bathed in glorious high speed stable wifi! Well worth the price. Tried everything else before and this was so simple to set up and just awesome.

Title: This is a great little product for a solid WiFi connection throughout your home, best I've worked with..
Review Comment: I have purchased two sets of the EERO Home WiFi System (3 Pack). This is a great little product for a solid WiFi connection throughout your home. Say goodbye to any dead spots and with EERO's mesh coverage I can reach room(s) without a hard wire connection. If you're uptight or uneasy about a self install work with a EERO PRO installer, they can assist you with special configurations, port forwarding ect. BTW: Tech support is great too very helpful.I love my EERO systems.

Title: By far the best WiFi System I have ever used
Review Comment: By far the best WiFi System I have ever used.  Tried the Netgear Orbi and returned it to try the Eero.  Part of my system is hardwired with Cat 5, but the Orbi doesn't allow that configuration, nor could it "reach" the base station.  When I installed the Eero, it picked up the base station before I could even plug in the Ethernet cable.  How they got the signal so strong is such a little box is beyond me.  But kudos on them for being able to combine the technology with good looks and a great user interface.

Title: Worth it
Review Comment: I get my full internet bandwidth (about 60 Mbps) over wifi now, from anywhere in my house or yard. It's very easy to set up (least network trouble I've had in my 20 years of being in the tech industry).

Title: Great product
Review Comment: Great product especially if you get bad internet-based. Worth every dime.  Also very user friendly when it comes to setup

Title: Must have
Review Comment: It works great.  Easy to setup and use.  A must have for any modern smart household.

Title: Easy set up
Review Comment: Easy set up. It def increased my wifi speed and reach throughout my house. Good to have control over individual (children) devices; like setting a time, when kids come home from school, to do homework and to sty offline. This was worth every penny.

Title: Disappointing experience - I recommend waiting until future versions
Review Comment: I really like the mesh concept for a large area (which we have) and being able to print from any part of the network to the same printer, but other than that, I would not say this has been worth the price and I'm likely to return the product in the next week. From the start, I experienced consistent drop offs in coverage (much more than my prior equipment) and the most recent software update (11/17) has completely incapacitated one of the four units I'm using. The app has no troubleshooting instructions for this situation and simply directs me to a generic support webpage for contact options, as if I want to spend an hour helping them debug a standard installation like this. It's particularly disappointing to have a software update actually degrade my service, sigh.Maybe the moral of the story is never buy first-version products like this for a crucial function like networking. They still have a lot of work to do.

Title: Highly recommended.
Review Comment: Replaced my AirPort system with eero. Never had a more stable, faster network. Highly recommended.

Title: Problems solved
Review Comment: It's single handily solved our wifi problems. Our house is long with thick walls and our old signal and repeater just wasn't enough.

Title: Initial set up was great and easy
Review Comment: I've been using the Eero system for about 6 months now and unfortunately I just can't put up with it anymore.  Initial set up was great and easy, then the software bugs started.  I spoke to Eero many times in the first month regarding issues that to their credit they resolved very quickly with updates to their code.  Most of the issues arose from having a slightly more advance network in place than I think they expect the average buyer to have.  But as I said their customer service was quick and friendly (all knew me by name) and fixed everything they could on their end.  Then the hardware problems started.  Within the first week one of the units died.  Since then four more have died.  The replacements are always sent promptly and the last one they identified as dead before I did.  I realized it was dead when I got an RMA email to send it back.  Now I'm back to software and connection issues.  This evening, for the 3rd time in the past month the ethernet connection on one of the units has stopped working and the only thing that will fix it is removing it from the network, hard resetting, and then readding it back in which now isn't nearly as reliable as it used to be.I will say that when the devices are up and running the experience in nice and throughput is decent so long as you don't keep sustained demand on them.  Unfortunately for me that hasn't been something I've been able to keep consistently.  I'm retiring these and starting the search for another alternative.  Like I mentioned earlier they're a great company and have great support, unfortunately their product hasn't lived up to the rest of the experience for me.

Title: This works great!
Review Comment: My mind is blown on how great it works. In the basement, my new Apple TV went from 35 Mb down to 90 Mb down. I expected improvements, but it's so much better than I ever expected. And it's just so easy to set up. I'm telling all my friends to give this a shot if you have the slightest or serious WiFi problems.

Title: ... help at our house as much as we would like. We need to buy more apparently
Review Comment: Did not help at our house as much as we would like. We need to buy more apparently...we have a rather large house and these are only good for up to 30 feet apart so plan accordingly.

Title: Best WIFI service ever.  eero works for me, so I can concentrate in the things that matter.
Review Comment: First I'm in the IT business.  And as a Tech savy person I can say that eero does not come with many configuration options.  That's why I used to have a bunch other routers that support many other options.  But did I need them at home?  Turn out that I don't.  And supporting all of them was a day to day.  Ending on mutiple trips back home or calls from my sons and wife to get back online.  And explain then what to do was not simple.  The old turn off and back on became not just a funny request.So, I got eero, and it took me 5 minutes to install it.  I was able to use my CAT5E backbone that I already had at home.  Results?  100% WIFI coverage and I have a concrete home with lots of steel and concrete walls.  eero was able to provide full coverage in all floors.  Even the basement.Now I know who's at home, who is using it.  Whats speed I'm getting directly from the cable modem router, carrier test was only valid directly from the modem. I can do that remotely now and still have a test directly from the modem.  I can pause my kids internet access.I am extremely happy that I gave up a bunch of things that I could use from traditional routers that I don't need and get an eero to work for me, so I can concentrate in what really matters.

Title: Totally worth it!
Review Comment: We love our eero system! We have had it for about a month now, with good strong wifi throughout our whole house! We have fought with many different routers, extenders etc and have never been able to get wifi to work. We have a difficult house - it is older with plaster walls on the main floor and a concrete basement. No matter what we tried, the wifi would never extend to the basement bedrooms (where my teenage boys' bedrooms are). We also constantly dealt with the wifi being spotty or inconsistent on the main floor. Not any more! Eero has been a game changer and was worth every penny for our family!

Title: Easy set-up and terrific performance
Review Comment: Finally a system that works! I've gone thru combinations of 5 routers in 10 years, various combinations, including power line extenders, and nothing was stable or reliable in our large home until the eero. Easy set-up and terrific performance!

Title: Useless after automatic system update
Review Comment: They worked beautifully for the first month or two and then went to s*** after an automatic system update .  I can't remember the last time they worked a full day . I find myself having to restart (unplug) the eeros up to five times a day.  I wish I could return them but  they won't accept  returns after a month  and I'm unable to back down to the firmware version that actually worked.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: A game changer. We will never go back.

Title: They walked me through everything that was going on and it turns out the Eero units were not at fault - they even had tips for h
Review Comment: Purchased two 3-packs October 2016 and installed throughout my house and detached garage - I was up and running in about 20 minutes.  Easiest wifi install ever and blazingly fast speeds with no dead spots - 100% works as advertised.  I use Sonos for music and was having trouble with them - I thought it was the Eero so on Sunday morning I emailed Eero, expecting a reply in a few days - got a reply right away and was on the phone with support within an hour.  They walked me through everything that was going on and it turns out the Eero units were not at fault - they even had tips for how to make the Sonos system perform better.  Best support experience I've ever had - these Eero guys know what they are doing and are crazy responsive - at least Dallas and Jared are.

Title: EERO Rocks!  Best home network ever.
Review Comment: I work as a management consultant in technology so I came into this with tempered expectations.  I took the EERO out of the box, plugged into the Fios router (which I pay for 75/75 speeds) in the basement and then got all three units green lighted in under 5 minutes.  First test was to try up on the 2nd floor two stories above the router and best I could do before was 10-12 MB speeds.  First test ran over 70/50 MB.Have now had the system up for over a month...life changing.  Latest test showing 85/85 while 9 devices on the network, setup guest network for friends and family in under 60 seconds, no resets or restarts, getting crazy fast speeds 40 feet from my back door around the pool/patio.  Smart TVs now do not buffer on Amazon Video or Netflix.The reality is that if you do not have other issues related to internet connectivity or substandard cable wi-fi router that you have to deal with this system should work seamlessly for you.  In full disclosure I have previously purchased an advanced (not Quantum) router directly from Verizon.  Not sure if that's why everything just plugged in and worked great.  I do envision that if you are plugging into older routers you may only be as good as your last "hop" in internet terminology.

Title: Solved my wireless issues
Review Comment: I purchased the 3 pack eero for my 3500 sq ft colonial home, to replace a 2-yr old top-end Linksys AC2400 Dual-Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router. I had been having issues with poor and dropping wireless upstairs, on the deck behind my home, in the basement, and in the 1st floor areas furthest from my office with that router.  The eero solved all those issues and I have reliable wireless everywhere. I've had it for about 2 months, and never had to restart it or touch it - it's just worked. Setup was simple with the IOS app and took me about 20 mins from opening the box.  My experience has been first rate.

Title: Terrible. Does not work at all with Uverse modem
Review Comment: Terrible. Does not work at all with Uverse modem!  Has every problem that their commercials claim to solve!  I am unplugging and restarting my modem and eero on a daily basis!  Eero customer service refuses to solve this!

Title: Four Stars
Review Comment: this has helped my internet so much at my house

Title: Solved all my Wifi headaches.
Review Comment: Solved all my Wifi headaches. Now I have Wifi ecen in places I didn't have before. Handover is seamless. I don't rhink about Wifi anymore LOL just relaxing. UI and app are crazy good. This is the Apple of Wifi routers.

Title: Eero sucks. Did an update via their app when I ...
Review Comment: Eero sucks. Did an update via their app when I was out of state, and now my entire network including my security system is down. Nothing I can do until I go home! Unreliable!

Title: Works great, cost could be better.
Review Comment: It definetly fixed my dead zones and weak whole home wi if signals. If the cost were better, it'd warrant 5 stars.

Title: Thank you
Review Comment: I now have WiFi through out my house...

Title: Love my new eero system!!
Review Comment: The product is great and the service was great.  We have now used eero for about a month and it is a huge improvement over our previous system.  We have some wireless TV cable boxes that complicated the installation.  When I contacted eero for help they did a fantastic job of walking me through everything and stayed on the line until they were sure everything was working.

Title: These were fantastic! Plugged into modem
Review Comment: Tried to use other wifi extenders and routers without success. These were fantastic! Plugged into modem, easy setup, used three and whole house was covered with speeds that matched my computer with wired Ethernet into the modem. 45mbps in the room furthest from the modem! Don't waste time with other brands and well worth the money.

Title: Works like a charm!
Review Comment: I have a setup with three eero devices. The main one (connected to the cable modem) in the main living room. A second one upstairs in the bedroom connected through an ethernet cable. A third one downstairs near the back of the house, connected wirelessly. Works perfectly, no more issues with switching between wireless access points. Great wireless speeds everywhere in the house. Previous setup has Apple airport extremes (one downstairs & second one upstairs; connected through an ethernet cable). Switching between access points never worked flawlessly in the previous setup & there was bad coverage at the back of the house. This all seems to be solved after switching to three eero devices.

Title: Great product. Like many others I had gone through ...
Review Comment: Great product.  Like many others I had gone through three routers and many extenders.  This solved my problem.  I should have started with this one.

Title: Worked great for a few months
Review Comment: Worked great for a few months, now it crashes several times a day, and apparently they wont take it back because I bought it from Amazon...

Title: Solution for my wifi issues!
Review Comment: I feel myself with the obligation to write a review. I bought mine about a week ago and I am very impressed what it can do. I live in a large apartment (300m2) and Eero eliminates all dead spots, which is incredible! In the past, I had to install multiples routers and keep changing network as I walk from bedroom to the living room (I used to have 4 differents networks at my home). Now, it in only one and with a incredible wifi coverage. It is a bit expensive, but for now I don't know any other system that works that well. There is some points that should be updated as the speed test (which is not accurate) and the possibility to manage the network when you are away (specially for manage my kids connections). I am aware that I can make multiples profiles, but still it would be something good in my opinion.I really recommended this product for people like me, who was always fighting for a good internet signal through the house.

Title: ​I hoped this product will help but did not. ...
Review Comment: ​I hoped this product will help but did not.Unfortunately, the time I realised to return the product my return date was expired.Its extremely disappointing to buy something this expensive and shot cut off date to return

Title: Transition from highly customizable system to an out of box system.
Review Comment: I was not expecting much going from a highly customizable system to an out of box system for my home wireless needs.  It was easy to setup using the smartphone app and the process took only a few minutes before going online.  No settings to tweak or changes to make by reading user forums, manufacturer suggestions etc.  This system simply works and it works well!Excellent coverage that covers home of ~1390sq.ft.  Currently using one eero device and don't see a need for more at this time.  Able to fully utilize ISP's 150mbps downstream limit and maintain a consistent and reliable connection.  My setup is ARRIS SURFboard SB6190 cable modem->Mikrotik Routerboard RB2011UiAS-2HnD-IN router->eero Home WiFi System.  Mikrotik was previously used as an Access Point as well, but now just a firewall & router.I've used several network devices in the IT field for work and at home, but this one stands out and would recommend it to friends and family.

Title: Satisfied eero customer
Review Comment: I found setup to be very quick and easy, and the wifi coverage is complete for this 3 story home.

Title: Finally have full WiFi coverage!
Review Comment: From a setup perspective, the eero system has been the easiest, stress-free setup I have ever dealt with.  From opening the box, to the straight forward instructions via the mobile application, the struggle of getting the WiFi network up and running was non-existent.  To top it off, the performance has been exceptional so far.  My eero system is providing full WiFi coverage in my 2 story house and device connectivity has been flawless so far.  Thank you for creating such a fantastic product and look forward to having first hand experience with any new innovative ideas.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Wi-fi works great, coverage is also good

Title: Improvement needed
Review Comment: Erro sets up nicely, but it does not have the push button typically found on routers to sync a device to your wifi.  As a result, you have to plug your other devices to your computer in order to detect erro.  This was very annoying.  Also, erro only has two ports for an Ethernet cable - which is wholly insufficient for a home office.  All of this coupled with the price means There are better options.

Title: Stellar Product
Review Comment: I rarely write reviews...but I am SO IMPRESSED with this product that I had to!  I'm quite tech savvy...have 30-40 computers/iPads etc.  Macs and Windows machines.  Wifi networks at business, home, and condo.  Our condo Time Capsule died...and it's two stories, reception was always spotty in our upstairs bedroom.  I've heard good things about Eero so decided to give it a try.Jeez...I'm still blown away by how easy it was to set up.  Took like five minutes, anybody could do it.  And I thought Apple wireless routers were easy to set up...this was even better.  We have phenomenal signal strength everywhere now, and a full 30 Mbps up and down (exactly what we pay for).  My only possible complaint would be cost...but just like many Apple products, that's what the best costs (oh, packaging and quality is comparable to Apple too).

Title: Very Easy to Setup
Review Comment: Very Easy to Setup!!! I had all three setup and running within a few minutes. The app is easy to use and clearly walks you through the setup. I have Nest products too, but this was even simpler. I walked through our 2300 sq ft ranch home and had a very strong signal throughout each room. It's so nice not switching between the main router and the extender. I am really impressed!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great system

Title: Pricy but worth it
Review Comment: easy to install because the instructions are crystal clear in plain English which those technically challenged or over 73 years old like me need. Very attractive and unobtrusive relay devices

Title: Great wifi
Review Comment: Good wifi, good support but a little expensive

Title: SImple and good coverage. Worth it
Review Comment: As advertised.  SImple and good coverage.  Worth it.

Title: I have 4 eero's set up in 4 part of the house and I absolutely love it Set up is a breeze with the app ...
Review Comment: I'm am geek without all the knowledge so keep that in mind when you read this review.  I have tried everything to get wifi to reach all part of my house.  My office is in the back so the router would not put off enough signal at 50 feet away to work my iPhone.. randomly came across this product thanks to the geek squad installing my new microwave.. free advice I'll take it.Do not let the price scare you! The upstairs portion of my house is almost 2000sq feet with a fireplace and wall in the middle. I have 4 eero's set up in 4 part of the house and I absolutely love itSet up is a breeze with the app and it even tells you if the location you picked will not work. Just to give you an idea on my wifi speed, I was getting 49mb in my car. About 50 feet from the box in the kitchen.  79mbs in certain parts of the house and 30 mb in the basement.I run kodi on hd, Apple TV, the wife finally loves me again now that she can use her laptop in the living room.There are cheaper options but I've learned my lesson. Definitely worth the buy

Title: Works nicely! Can get reception throughout the house (2200 sq ...
Review Comment: Works nicely! Can get reception throughout the house (2200 sq ft) and really easy to set up...which is always a plus for me!

Title: It just works
Review Comment: I live in a tri split level old brick home that has a basement. This gives me 4 floors of  unevenly spread out space. Prior to Eero my Verizon Fios router could not reach the top floor or basement effectively. Even when it did the bandwidth was poor. Even my Nighthawk router could not provide decent download speeds for my PS4.I purchased a set of 3 devices and in minutes I was up and running. I can now easily hit base max speed on my fios connection and have tripled my downloading of games.I will note that one device offered the most impressive speed increase but was not enough to cover the entire house. With all 3 the speed drops slightly but the range is fantastic.Software updates have been smooth and I look forward to more features being released.

Title: Great...but beware if you prefer 5 ghz over 2.4 ghz for speed.
Review Comment: I live in a brownstone condo in downtown Boston.  A crowded area with a lot of competition for bandwidth, channels and frequencies.  My Apple Router worked ok when in range but couldn't reach the 2nd floor.  An additional Apple Airport Extreme as an extender worked ok not great.  Hence my search for the Eero.  Given the overcrowded competition for 2.4 ghz in my neighborhood I configured a 2.4 ghz and 5 ghz wireless network on the Apple router and was able to choose which of the two networks I could join in my condo based on signal strength.  The 5 ghz network FAR outperformed the 2.4 ghz at speeds over 100 mps download for the 5 vs 10 mps or less on the 2.4 ghz network.While the setup of the Eero was easy, there is NO option to configure both a 2.4 and 5 ghz network  The router simultaneously broadcasts both and chooses for you which network, based on signal strength it connects to.  I want the ability to override the automatic connection and force a connection to the 5 ghz Eero network given the speed advantages.  Unfortunately you can't do that. I called Eero tech support and they are aware of the limitation with no commitment to fix.While I love the improved signal strength of the Eero mesh throughout my condo, my inability to choose connection to a 5 ghz network (and therefore suffer much slower speeds) is a major drawback.Net, if you depend or strongly prefer 5 ghz wireless networks - you will not be able to choose this as default option on Eero.

Title: Huge time-saver
Review Comment: Trying to get a signal into all corners of our three-level house was never easy. I had to use two routers but even then there were dead spots, not to mention the necessity of running cable to the second router. I never found a wireless booster that would work as advertised and always had to revert to cabling the second router. eero changed all that. I unpacked the three eero routers and within 15 minutes, they were working perfectly without any need to fiddle with complex settings.The app that accompanies the routers is very useful. Among other things, it lets you see each device that is on the network, its name, IP address, etc. This makes it much easier to get wireless printers, etc., working and troubleshoot them when they get cranky.

Title: Very easy to set up and control
Review Comment: Very easy to set up and control. I connected the first eero by cable, to the dsl modem and disabled wifi on the modem. This allowed me to jump between two floors. I am in a very old building, with very thick walls. While two of the eeros have line of sight to each other, the third is inside another room, out of sight. I haven't seen any dead zones since installation.

Title: Great product!
Review Comment: If your skeptical about the price don't be! Bought the 3 pack what a difference! Speed works very well & overall coverage is tremendous! Now I can get wifi in my garage full tree & wander half way out drive with coverage! Great product!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Excellent very satisfied product you can add as many eeros to get a wider coverage .Thumbs up !!!

Title: ... between the routers and the speed and coverage is amazing inside and outside my home
Review Comment: I am using it wirelessly between the routers and the speed and coverage is amazing inside and outside my home. A great product! Enough said.

Title: Fantastic?? Nonsense!!!
Review Comment: I bought 1 GB service and spent $500 on these pieces of crap to utilize that bandwidth.Generally, I realize about 1/2 of 1% of that bandwidth using these pieces of garbage.Using three of these in my 2800 second foot home results in frequent drops ftp My smart TV, limited access -poor connected - from 30 feet away, and nothing but trouble.I disabled wifi and used my Verizon LTE link to write this review from my iPhone.Overrated trash. That's why they sell used for 30% of purchase price.DO NOT BUY THIS TRASH!!!

Title: Excellent as advertised with one drawback
Review Comment: Excellent as advertised with one drawback... it still wanted/needed my older personal router to pipe through (with wireless disabled) in order to work with Verizon Fios,

Title: Coverage in my house (two story plus finished basement) is fantastic, and speed is every bit as good as ...
Review Comment: Thrilled with my results so far.  Coverage in my house (two story plus finished basement) is fantastic, and speed is every bit as good as promised.

Title: Excellent product
Review Comment: After several other tries and a lot of $$, this was the solution to complete coverage in an adobe house.  Excellent coverage.  Simple to set up.  A bit pricey.

Title: Finally solved all our wifi issues!!
Review Comment: We've struggled for years with our wifi. I thought we'd tried everything - upgraded to top-of-the-line routers, extenders, and even hired a local company to install a switch and wired access points. None of these solutions worked, so when I heard the initial positive reviews of eero I figured we'd give it a try, and if it didn't work just return it.Six months later, and we haven't looked back. We went from multiple complaints a day, to never having to worry about router problems or bad signals. And if there ever is a problem with internet, it is always problem with the signal coming into the house.For a 4300 sq ft house, I had expected to need 4 units, so bought a 3-pack plus 1 extra, but actually the 3-pack more than covers every corner of the house and most of the front and backyard, so we returned the extra.I can't recommend this system enough. It's really worth every penny, and we're much happier with it than with the custom setup that we'd spent way more on...

Title: Appealing on the surface but seriously lacking in performance
Review Comment: Like some things about the product - looks nice, easy setup, good Wifi signal.However, as some other reviews have noted, the overall throughput on the device is flat out horrible.Tried bridge mode and have the 2 eeros hardwired together but didn't help.

Title: If you need it now, don't wait for Google Wifi
Review Comment: Forget routers with range extenders and go for eero. The only other potential option may be Google Wifi, which looks similar and will be $100 cheaper, once launched.

Title: Eero is like wifi on steroids!!!
Review Comment: Eero has made a great product! Like wifi on steroids.  I have tried many other wifi routers, even used wi-fi extenders, yet would always run into limitations with multi-level environments- dead spots, weakening signals. Mesh networking has transformed our wifi experience - faster, more robust, and an easy app to do all the config'ing. Get this now!!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Eero works as advertised-

Title: Big improvement
Review Comment: Very happy with Eero

Title: Works great, no buffering or dead spots any longer.
Review Comment: Very easy to install.  Works fantastic.  We had two dead spots in our home.  Now everywhere in home is great internet speeds.  Our TV on main floor would buffer or have streaming issues.  Since we installed not one issue anywhere.  We love it!!  Thanks.

Title: Poor setup procedure
Review Comment: The detectors are great. They work as advertised and are easily monitored and controlloed from my cell phone.The setup is where they could have done better. I bought 5 of these and wanted them all to be interconected. They are and it works great. However, they fail to tell you that you have to activate each detector in the chain when seting up a new one. Even the scond and third from the original three pack. When setting these up, after activating it it tells you to go ahead and install it. If you do you will have to get it and activate it for the setup of the new detector to complete. I had to have all four in the chain going when I set up the fifth.So, If you're installing more than one of these. Sit at a table and do all the setup at once while your comfortable. I would have rate these five stars, but I think this is a VERY MAJOR flaw in the set up. I don't believe they're unaware of the problem, so there doing this on purpose. Not what I'm looking for in a tech company.

Title: Absolutely a great product to address your home's wifi needs
Review Comment: Absolutely a great product to address your home's wifi needs. I have tried several other products in the past but eero is by far the best out there.

Title: Simple, sleek and it works
Review Comment: I gotta say I am impressed with this system.  Crazy easy to set up and no more large router with antenna sticking out everywhere in my living room.  Like most, I was concerned about the cost of the product for a company/brand that I have never heard of.  But I've been tired of my existing Wifi network so I knew I was going to go with a full system rather than a standalone router.My setup: 17 wireless devices and 5 wired over a house that is 2-story/3200 sq ft with 200 mbps service.  Modem and router is in the back of the house on the main floor.  So upstairs toward the front of the house really struggled with speeds.  Range was fine but speeds weren't good enough because those are the bedrooms.  My house is newly built in 2015 so the materials in the wall aren't an issue.  Just the distance and plus its much better to have a router upstairs so the signal can filter down rather than downstairs trying to send the signal up.  However, I don't have a choice because of where my only cable line comes in the house (satellite everywhere else).  Over the last year, I've used Airport Extreme, Netgear Nighthawk (all of them) and Onhub.  I've been using the Nighthawk X6 the past few months.  Powerful, but overkill especially when you still have weak spots in the house.  So over the past couple weeks started looking again when I had to start rebooting the router a couple times a week for it to give me my proper speeds.  I had 3 choices: Amplifi, Eero and Google Wifi (when it comes out).  I didn't consider Orbi or Luma.  So I went with Eero.  I was up and running in 10 mins.  Unplug modem, hook up eero.  Power up everything and setup on app.  Done.  I made my SSID and password the same as my other router and all of the other devices immediately connected without issue.So far my speeds have been great all over the house.  Everything loads fast.  As I get further away from the router connected to the modem the speeds drop a little but not by much.  And that is what makes it better than a regular range extender.  You get range AND speed.  They're not hardwired to each other so the speeds I get are excellent considered.  App is great and simple.  Light years ahead of Netgear's Genie app in terms of UI.  Almost everything that's out is ahead of that ;)Couple things I wish it had:1. Additional Ethernet port2. Ability to create different SSIDs for 5GHZ and 2.4GHZ bandsFor someone who wants a lot of advanced options that you would find in a Nighthawk router then you probably won't be pleased with this.  But I really just wanted something I set up, add a guest network and be done.  I don't care about QoS functionality and stuff like that.  So I'll see how this continues to work over the next few weeks and update my review accordingly.  Really with this, price is the major deal breaker for most.  If you can get by that, you should be fine with your purchase.  My review is more like 4.5/5.

Title: Works exactly as advertised. 3 units completely cover my ...
