As you can see, the test was 20x faster with the direct connection to the modem.  I'll be doing some troubleshooting on this, but for a solution that should be getting faster through automatic updates, this hasn't been the case for me.

Title: Does it's job great, but overheats and becomes super not to touch
Review Comment: This item works great for what it's supposed to do, however, it gets really hot and even makes the surface underneath really hot, so I'm afraid to use it any longer for safety reasons. I have a toddler who is just shy of 2 years old, and I wouldn't want him to get hurt if he touches it; or even worse--have my house burn down.

Title: Excellent product
Review Comment: Excellent product - couldn't be happier!!

Title: Love it.
Review Comment: Seamless wifi all over my 4,000 sq ft house. I cut the cord and this system facilitates smooth streaming. Simply, it just works.  Love it.

Title: Fixed my network. I have a very large/long house ...
Review Comment: Fixed my network.  I have a very large/long house and it works perfectly.

Title: We are all on line.
Review Comment: Everyone's Connected

Title: The only home wi-fi solution that has provided high speed ...
Review Comment: The only home wi-fi solution that has provided high speed coverage through my entire house (and I have tried many extender solutions).  Works as advertised - simple to setup and just works.

Title: Eero is the new Hero in the Household!
Review Comment: Eero is unquestionably the most reliable piece of networking equipment (if you can even call those 'fancy little white boxes' that!) I have ever bought. It is easy to set up (yes, your dad can set this up without your help!), works like magic, and most importantly, I don't hear complaints from the family of "slow internet" or dropped signals, ever since. It is night and day from the age of all that Linksys/Netgear we have been buying for a couple of decades! The app is minimalistic and yet fully functional. Having the same "SSID" throughout the home and devices makes like very easy... I am most proud of this impulsive purchase of mine - better than any other!

Title: legit wifi extension
Review Comment: awesome.  before Eero, my wifi didn't reach my bedroom... I tried wifi extenders (both cheap and expensive), and nothing worked.  With Eero, there is no problem!  Highly recommend Eero to anyone who needs legit wifi extension in their home.

Title: I followed recommended setting and unplugged my Netgear router and tested again
Review Comment: I bought a total of 6 eeros to install in my home based on their claim to provide hyper fast internet and the use of just one wireless network. I work from home so I VPN all the time, dedicated connection. Because of my work, I chose to keep my Netgear equipment, which is made of X8 and a R7000 extender plus AC outlet extender, too. I installed both, eeros and left my original Netgear install to see how it worked. As usual, my Netgear continued to deliver, I run 105 Mbps which translates into 70-90 Mbps wireless but with the eeros was a constant 20 Mbps at the most, except standing next to the eero plugged to the modem. I followed recommended setting and unplugged my Netgear router and tested again, without success, eero speed remained 20 Mbps. Let me be clear, eero is a good solution for someone who has not a minimal idea how to plug a router and needs a wifi setup, which most ISP companies will help you install anyways; but to claim hyper speeds, I think it's not the right claim at least not in my home. I kept my Netgear and now I'm learning how to set different Access points throughout my home so I can use the same SSID.

Title: Life Changing!!
Review Comment: I don't usually write reviews, but felt compelled in this case. I had been struggling with our home wifi for years. We have a 2-story home and my wife has her office in our detached garage. Getting good wifi coverage has been impossible. To try to improve things, I originally purchased a typical range extender. That helped... but it was inconsistent - would sometimes provide a great signal on our second floor and in the garage, but often not - which might have been more frustrating than not having it at all. I was always rebooting it to try to get it to work.I bought the Eero system out of desperation. Didn't want to have to go to a wired system, but didn't have much hope that it would actually do the job. I figured with my Prime membership and Amazon's return policy, I didn't have much to lose. I ordered 4 just to make sure I'd have adequate coverage in our home.From the moment I plugged them in, things just worked. It was like magic. I didn't want to believe it at first - I kept our other router pumping out it's signal thinking that the Eero network would fail at any moment. It didn't. Ever. Still to this day, it is providing fantastic coverage and blazing speeds for a wireless network. Can't recommend it highly enough!

Title: Works
Review Comment: Works as advertised

Title: Excellent product. I have a big house and am ...
Review Comment: Excellent product. I have a big house and am getting excellent speeds all over the house. Set up is simple & accompanying App is well designed & very functional. Goodbye Linksys.

Title: Eero has made our wifi so much better. It reaches every inch of our house
Review Comment: Eero has made our wifi so much better. It reaches every inch of our house. No more going over our data. I was a bit hesitant at spending so much money on this system but it was worth every penny!

Title: Fake promise!
Review Comment: The performance is really poor. Incredibly expensive devices that performed worse than regular WIFI provided by Comcast. I which I hadn't throw that much money away. Did a comparison on performance using both at my home and the Comcast router outperformed EERO by ten times.

Title: Great product
Review Comment: I installed the three pack in a very large house which, due to infloor heating, has concrete floors top and bottom.  Every other product I tried left dead holes on the second floor (you had to sit on the right side of the bed to get a signal.  The left side could not).  I now have excellent signal everywhere in the house for the first time in years.  Setup was easy as my son did it in about 30 minutes.My problems with Eero are minor.  The painter unplugged one and I had to turn the HP printer off and on to reset it.  About once a week it will drop out and I click the wi-fi button to reconnect (30 seconds).We have four computers and a server running all the time, multiple smartphones and still stream movies. I think, for me, it is a great product and works as advertised.

Title: It just plain works.
Review Comment: Dead simple. Plug the first node into your gateway. Connect to the wireless signal with your phone. Walk away until the signal is less than optimal. Drop another node at the threshold of great to OK. Power it up. Repeat. When you're done, you're done. I've been using eeros for months now in a long, sprawling ranch-style house, and have had ZERO issues. They simply update themselves. I can check the status of the network from my phone, and trigger speed tests on it. I've set up a guest network with two clicks, and can always see what devices are on which network. I've left my ISP's wireless broadcast on, but it's never interfered. No more band hopping, channel tuning, MAC filtering, and all the other tech finagling that have been part of connected life for the past decade. At first I kinda missed the tinkering, but no more. WiFi can now be taken for granted.

Title: WOW!
Review Comment: Easy to install. Worked right out of the box. Second and third units even easier. Best thing I ever did

Title: Game Changing, Easy Peasy
Review Comment: This Thing Is Idiot Proof. It took about 30 minutes to read the instructions, download the app on my Android phone, and set up the three white boxes. I'm covering a very large home. I'm picking up good signal in places in the home that never had signal. On a good day, I'll even pick up signal outside the home in the garden. Replaced a Netgear N900 and a Netgear Wifi Extender. I set the Netgear N900 router into Wireless Access Point mode and turned off the wireless with the front panel switch, then wired the Internet port to one of the ports on the Eero, so I could continue to use the USB flash drive plugged in to one of the two USB ports on the N900. It will also function as a 4-port wired Ethernet switch. I plugged the Magic Jack phone into the 2nd ethernet port on the Eero. I named the Eero network (SSID) the same as on the N900 and used the same password. Everything immediately accessed the new Eero network. I had to rehome the devices that were using the wireless networks on the Netgear Wifi Extender. Easy peasy. Congrats to the Eero peeps for making a great invention.

Title: Excellent coverage, easy installation
Review Comment: I installed two of these in a small house and the coverage is outstanding. That's not surprising given the size of the house, but the more interesting thing is how well the devices work. With multiple access points, I used to have to occasionally mess with WiFi on my phone to get it to associate with  the device with the strongest signal. At other times, I would have to take extra steps to get things to connect with WiFi at all. After installing the eero access points, I don't even have to think about WiFi. Another feature that is a positive is how the system updates. It just happens and you get notified. No downloading firmware and rebooting. It's not that hard to update firmware on an access point, but it's much nicer to know that the system is just taking care of that and then letting you know. It really is the case that these are very easily installed and then just work. That says lots about the care and thought that went into the engineering and user experience design.

Title: Works as expected
Review Comment: Except for the discretion in the speed test, the devices work as expected. A known issue in the display of the speed test is being addressed. No eta on solution. In my case, it reports less than the actual, compared to internet site speed test.

Title: Genius
Review Comment: I had spent hours on the phone with AT&T, NetFlix and Vizio as I repeatedly had viewing issues. Further we had dead spots for WiFi and our home is about 2100 sq ft. I tried Netgear and nothing improved the situation. My son told me to check out EERO. This company, their products are game changing. It is easy to install, app works brilliantly, no more dead spots, no TV issues. We have a guesthouse and were told by AT&T we needed to add service and they said no way to  get WiFi; with eero we have super WiFi. I know this is a pricey product but it works. Their support is awesome (though I only called with questions before I purchased - haven't needed any support post purchase). The 'pods' only need and electric outlet (they come with a nice length cord). The app lets you know if they are properly placed for best results. EERO is a GREAT product! (and a great company)30-DAY UPDATE - eero still works like a champion. It has solved our dead spot or slow speed areas (only issue remains is AT&T Gigapower still goes out for a couple minutes at a time several times a week and if you are live streaming it is a pain BUT eero gives the TV very high download speed). The eero team and product are 5-STAR!

Title: the performance got worse and worse
Review Comment: every day since the purchase, the performance got worse and worse, to the point that now, a couple of months after it, we cannot watch a 720p movie! The connection is constantly breaking, Skype is impossible to use, etc.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: This has solved a wi-fi problem that we had not been able to solve previously.  it works!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Had a little trouble with setup but tech support sent a replacement without any fuss.Works as advertised.

Title: Solved our problems!
Review Comment: The configuration of our house makes a consistent WiFi signal difficult.  The modem has to be upstairs, which makes the reception in the downstairs bedrooms difficult to impossible.  I purchased a signal extender, which worked for a while, but never well or consistently.  When I read about eero, I was very interested.  True to the review, it was VERY easy to set up, with one exception.  It took me a while to figure out the best way to get my Sonos working again.  My wife is far more into Sonos than she is exceptional WiFi coverage, so she quickly declared it a bust.  However, with a little bit of research, I very quickly solved that problem and we now have spotless and fast WiFi in areas where we had no WiFi before. I also have younger kids who love to log back in when it's lights out...eero allows me to schedule their WiFi access, so I can shut them down at night.  I love this product and am considering one more unit in a far corner of our house to make sure our outdoor deck is covered as well.

Title: Worth the Money
Review Comment: My Airport Time Capsule got zapped by lighting, making a change necessary. eero has been a major improvement. I have seamless, fast, rock-solid coverage throughout my house. It was very easy to set up, and the app is understandable. eero is lightyears ahead of anything else. I was reminded of this again yesterday when I set up a Belkin wifi in my daughter's dorm room (I had to go with one of the access points "recommended" by the university).When I got home from taking my daughter back to school yesterday, the electricity went out at our house, reminding me of another advantage of the eero. In the past, with the Airport Time Capsule, the electricity would go out. When it came back, I would have to go into my office and restart components in the right order to get them to come back up. This often took 30 minutes or so. Not yesterday. When the system went down, I received an email. When it came back up, it took about 3 minutes or so, but it all reset itself so that we were back on line.I didn't like spending $500 to replace the Airport, but there is no question that this system is the best. I would have to say that it has been worth it.

Title: It is extremely easy to set up
Review Comment: It does what it is supposed to do:  improve wifi signals.  It is extremely easy to set up.

Title: Finally
Review Comment: Like everyone who has submitted a review about eero, we could never get consistent, high speed wifi throughout our house. Speeds were half what we could get by using Ethernet, and that was on a good day. At least twice a week we would have to reboot to get a signal. Finally, wifi would not extend throughout our house which meant no TV streaming in our family room (too far from our modem/router). With eero all of that is now a distant nightmare. Our internet speeds through wifi are consistent and the same as Ethernet speed; no more rebooting; and, finally, we are streaming movies with virtually no buffering. That alone gives eero 5 stars and I haven't even mentioned their fantastic support team. Once I knew I could stream I purchased a smart tv for my office in my home where there is no wiring for a satellite box. For some reason the TV could not connect with my eero network. I contacted support and Dave was immediately on it. He had me do some things but most of the techno hocus pocus was done at eero headquarters. In no time, my wifi and my tv were connected and I'm now watching sports while I work. Finally, a product that is as good if not better than advertised.

Title: I suspect it's doing updates frequently but isn't smart enough to now when I'm online or off
Review Comment: Too much downtime. I suspect it's doing updates frequently but isn't smart enough to now when I'm online or off.  I have lots of issues late at night.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: So far it is outstanding. Once I upgraded my modem eero has been rock solid and consistent.

Title: Love the eero system
Review Comment: Awesome wifi!  I was using a hug power router and range extender before and still had spotty and slow coverage in some areas.  We're in a 1200 sq ft condo, but the walls present challenges to most systems. The eero system works great!  I have one in the living room and one in the hallway (affixed to he wall with a command strip above the outlet) and have coverage everywhere and at faster speeds than before and no lagging out on video games.

Title: Great product because it worked right out of the box
Review Comment: Great product because it worked right out of the box. The mobile app is very easy to use and works without glitches. Only con would be that product for a packet of 3 is a bit over priced.

Title: Looks convenient, but quickly broke
Review Comment: The knob to push out one of the adapters broke after one use. The whole thing is fairly flimsy, and is rather too heavy and so tends to fall out of outlets as well. Nice package but the product just isn't great.

Title: Fantastic System
Review Comment: 10 minutes out of box to 3 access points installed and operating flawlessly

Title: 10 years of misery removed in 15 minutes-  Stop looking for other solutions.  -  EERO  is the real deal- buy it now.  ----
Review Comment: I do not do reviews- Highly recommend this system-  10 years of misery solved in about 15 minutes- EERO made it easy-  I have upgraded routers & signal extenders multiple times- nothing worked. I even tried moving the service in my home. It is depressing to think about the time, & money I have spent trying to get a reliable signal to all areas of my home.( Not a large house, but internet did not penetrate home well) -  Wireless printing was always a bad bet- 1/2 the time you needed to carry your laptop to the printer and plug it in.  Not any more- EERO has solved my problem and it was simple-  Can't leave the review without giving a high 5 to customer service- When installing the EERO the fumble fingered installer dropped a unit while trying to place it on top of a bookshelf-  It did not survive the landing on the tile floor.  EERO customer service overnighted a new unit with a prepaid return label-  You need to love a company that takes care of it's customers-  They apologized that their unit did not survive being dropped from 8 feet to the ceramic tile floor & they paid the shipping cost-  Stop trying to decide- buy the EERO

Title: Very glad I bought Eero (3 pack)
Review Comment: Fabulous product- it works as advertised and was a snap to install. Instant wi fi improvement! From frustrating sporadic connections to full-time full-strength. Is it worth $500? Certainly was for me.

Title: The good part is easy to setup
Review Comment: The good part is easy to setup.And the signal is not good, especially compare with Airport Extreme. I set up 3 eero as a straight line. The 1st connects to my model. The 2nd, 3rd connect wirelessly. Then I connect my old Airport Extreme with 2nd eero.I use iMac, two MacBook pro, iPhone, and iPad mini to test speed around 3rd eero. Only one of my MacBook Pro can get up to 70Mb speed around 3nd eero. All other devices can only get up to 40Mb speed. Especialy iMac, only get speed around 15Mb. But when I connect to my Airport Extreme (which connects to 2nd eero). I can get full speed (80Mb) for all my devices.One more thing, it doesn't support IPv6!!!!!!You spend $500 in 2016 to get the high-end wifi device that doesn't support IPv6 YET?If you really need an easy setup wifi devices. I highly suggest Airport Extreme. With almost same price, better signal, and support IPv6.

Title: Great
Review Comment: My access point is in the corner of the house. With this product I have consistent and reliable wifi throughout the house. Great stuff

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Perfect! Excellent customer support! After I instal 3 units, order another for extension. Thank you to Manufacture.

Title: $500 and performs worse than a $50 range extender.
Review Comment: I purchased an Eero 3 pack in hopes of improving the Wi-Fi situation of my home. I had recently bought a Ring Wi-Fi doorbell, and the signal at my front door wasn't great, resulting in problems with the video feed from the doorbell. I tried some moving my router, and buying some different extenders and experimenting with what will work best. After some playing around, at best I was still only able to get results that were "ok" at the doorbell, but nothing fantastic.I've previously heard about the Eero, but at $500 it was going to be a last resort. I bit the bullet and gave them a try, and was awfully disappointed with the results. The setup in theory was supposed to be simple, and I assume it would be simple if you have one of the few smartphones that are compatible with their App, but I didn't. I ended up buying a used Nexus tablet just for this, and spent a few hours just trying to get the Eero app installed and launched. Why couldn't I just use a browser like every other piece of consumer networking equipment ever? Once I finally got the app to launch, I couldn't even configure the Eeros as I lacked a data connection, so I needed to use my neighbor's Wi-Fi just to set things up.It was smooth sailing after the first unit, the next two pretty much configure themselves. That was about all that went well.The speeds were absolutely terrible. With my old setup of being connected via Wi-Fi AC to my router I would be able to average a 400 megabit transfer speed from my server, and when connected to my range extender it would still easily do 200 megabit, more than enough for streaming high quality videos. Doing the exact same tests on Eeros, I never saw faster than 20 megabit. Streaming video with a 30-megabit bitrate wouldn't work, as it would be constantly buffering. Countless hours troubleshooting didn't help, the only solution was to plug in my old router and switch over to that when I wanted to watch something.I also had a weird issue which I could never explain, whenever I shut down my desktop (which was connected by Ethernet directly into my modem, not connected to the Eeros at all), the entire Eero network would go down. The second I fire up the desktop, I'd have Wi-Fi again.There is next to no configuring the Eero, the options are very stripped down and over simplified. No QoS, can’t use different SSIDs for 2.4 and 5ghz, no way to monitor what device is doing what or how much bandwidth is in use or by what. It is a router for stupid people, not people that want to know what is going on in the world.The coverage the Eeros provide is fantastic, it blanketed my house. While I didn’t have any dead spots before, coverage was significantly improved upon. Unfortunately, that coverage didn’t mean much, as the performance was terrible.Back to my original issue with the doorbell, the Eero didn’t help. I had great signal near the doorbell now, but due to the performance issues of the Eeros, video quality still suffered and frequently dropped out entirely. I eventually resolved the issue by disconnecting the Eero’s, and using a Netgear power line networking based Wi-Fi extender. Now the doorbell streams high quality video without issue, at about a tenth of the price of the Eero system.There is a saying that you get what you pay for, this is one of the few times that it doesn't apply

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product. Google Router is gone and with it my dropped pockets!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Best wifi ever!

Title: Too high a cost to justify level of improvement - returned
Review Comment: Had to return this - obviously my Verizon DSL is just too poor a service on its own to be resolved by this product, no matter the cost! I did run the download test(s) available, both before and then after the eero was installed. It definitely increased my available speed - the biggest difference was it shortened the 'delay' from 167 to 9! But then I started getting 10 sec rewinds during streaming and the player still hung on occasion, etc...On the one hand, if you can spare the cash this definitely has the potential to improve your wifi. If you have poor service at the source, like I do apparently, while this does improve the wifi signal it doesn't resolve the source issues and I just couldn't justify paying out the money. Low return for high cost of investment - sent it back.

Title: Literally the easiest thing ever.
Review Comment: Amazing!  3400 sq feet (plus deck and patio) all have perfect reception.  I didn't think it was possible.Setup took 3 minutes.  Our cable guy asked for info because he loved it so much!

Title: Works well with existing ethernet network
Review Comment: When we remodeled our 1944 two-story house with basement, we ran Ethernet cable from the cable modem in the basement to every room in the house.  This is great for wired devices like a desktop computer, printer, TiVo, Roku or Xbox, but so many things are wireless now.  The wired network let us put our wireless router in a fairly central location in the living room, but WiFi speeds dropped to half of wired speeds in my husband's basement office and the kitchen, and disappeared completely in my son's bedroom and husband's garage workshop.  Eero has been the perfect solution.  I got the three pack and placed each one on a different floor, zig-zagging horizontally across the house.  I plugged each Eero into an Ethernet jack, so they talk to each other through my existing wired network.  My son now has an Eero in his room which also improved the signal in the kitchen, and the Eero in the basement has improved the signal for my husband in his office and also his garage workshop.  We now can get full 60 mbps WiFi speeds anywhere in the house.  Everything works, including iPhones, Apple/Windows/Linux laptops and tablets, WeeMo switch, Kindle, Aria Scale, AmbientWeather Station, as well as the wired devices I mentioned earlier.  The fact that Eero is actively updating the router software gives me hope that this router will be resistant to malware attacks.  It was expensive, but I think the price was reasonable for three routers that work seamlessly together, allowing your devices to roam between the different access points.  Three Eeros are the perfect number for our 3000 square foot house.

Title: It does what it says it will do
Review Comment: Read an article in the WSJ on July 20th by Geoffrey Fowler endorsing Eero. Checked various magazine reviews but didn't see it listed. Contact the author directly, who enthusiastically endorsed the product. Ordered Eero. Absolutely seamless installation using mobile app. Works exactly as it is advertised. Highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to improve their wireless signal throughout their residence. Worth every penny. In a world where making and meeting commitments is a rarity, this product delivers!

Title: Worked exact as expected. We didn't have cell service ...
Review Comment: Worked exact as expected. We didn't have cell service and now use wifi calling throughout the house with no issues.

Title: Put this system through the ultimate test and it passed with flying colors
Review Comment: We were getting tired of basic wifi router with several extenders around the house.  The problem is, if you want to switch to one of the extenders, you have to manually connect.  So we bought the eero system and WOW.  It was easy to set up, I can check the system from my smart phone.  No more having to log into different extenders.But the true test when my wife's friend and family spent a week with us.  The father works in the IT industry and the oldest boy is studying programing at the University of Washington and always coding.  The youngest boy is 13 and a big gamer.  Eero didn't miss a beat.  At one point there was four laptops, six smart phones using the internet and just to make it interesting, we were streaming a movie for everyone to watch.  No noticeable slowdown in any of our devices.This was a great investment.  I would highly recommend the eero wifi system

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It is really easy to set-up.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Very easy to setup. Was up and running in a matter of minutes.

Title: Old house.  Works perfectly.
Review Comment: This is the first system that can actually provide wifi coverage over my entire 110 year old house.  Over 5,500 sq feet.  Brick walls.  Horse hair plaster.  Solid construction.  This system with 3 units covers my entire house!  Happy wife and happy kids.  This is a fantastic system and extremely easy to set up.  And it looks great too!  I love it.

Title: Very happy camper, saves me data charges
Review Comment: I live in a 1200 sq foot flat in a 1930s building with my router setup at one end and my bedroom at the other end. I wasn't able to get wifi in the bedroom on my phone or laptop and my Roku connection was always buffering. I was incurring crazy data charges. I installed a high end router and tried to add an extender (complicated, I thought) to no avail. I installed two Eeros in under 10 minutes and have the same upload/download times at both ends of my flat now. Easy peasy and it's paying for itself in saved data charges. No issues in the last 6-8 weeks. I'm a typical user and run iPhone, laptop, 2 Rokus, AirPrint printer, iPad. I also love that updates are automatically pushed to you.

Title: Easy to set up and monitor
Review Comment: works as advertised.  Easy to set up and monitor.

Title: Eero and Roku issues
Review Comment: Great range however I am having issues with connecting Netflix and Amazon Via my Roku box. Unfortunately not as plug and play ready as I hoped for.

Title: Happy with this decision.
Review Comment: Easy convenient setup. Great performance. Beautiful design.

Title: As advertised
Review Comment: Very easy setup process.  Completed configuration, established the network, and connected all devices in under 30 minutes.  Does not require line-of-sight between the access points, but does seem to require no more than one wall between each node to establish the connection.  Expensive, but huge improvement in wi-fi coverage and performance throughout the entire house.

Title: Eero vs Luma
Review Comment: On paper, these two companies are similar. They are startups that are well funded, and have recently launched devices that are about the size of an Apple TV or an Apple Airport Express. You typically buy a pack of 3, plugging one into your modem and the others to ethernet or leave alone and they will create a wireless mesh network. eero has been the market longer than luma.If you have Sonos, then you are already familiar with mesh networks. Like Sonos, these devices can talk to each other via wireless, as long as each one can "see" the other. From there they re-distribute the wifi signal creating a constant amount of coverage.These devices are also incredibly easy to setup and manage (in theory). You do everything from your phone app. And you can manage your network from anywhere. They are cloud powered routers. eero has written a lot about their cloud operations. Impressive.However, that is where the comparisons end. I have used both devices now and can weigh in on which one is better. I got an eero for my father and set that up in May. I also got a Luma for myself, and waited a few months longer to get that. Then I also got an eero for myself after some disappointing results with the luma.Below is my experience with both.UnboxingThe clear winner here is eero. The simple explanation is that the eero is like unboxing an Apple Product. The box is easy to open, the materials are top notch (glossy white plastic and soft touch rubber). The charger and finishes are exactly what you would get from an Apple Product.The Luma on the other hand feels cheap. The power plug is gray, but exactly like any other electronic product. The device box is cheap plastic feeling. For many people this device will be visible in their home (like it is for my parents) and so I think this matters.Oh, almost forgot. It was comical hard to actually open the luma box. No product should be hard to get out.Winner: eeroSetupTo set up each device, you install their iOS app, then plug in the first device and go through the setup process.The eero device completed setup in under 10 seconds. It was what I expected, so I didn't think much of it.The luma device took a very long time to setup and failed multiple times. This repeated with each device I set up. It was a bit baffling to be honest.Once the devices are set up, you are now ready to add more devices.Winner: eeroSoftware updatesBoth devices manage software updates automatically. With the eero you can see what version you have. The software updates automatically overnight, and in the latest app update they added a mode where you can force an update. You can even see release notes here.The luma does not show you any information about what version of the software it's running and there is no way to update, or see release notes or anything.It's worth noting, that when I was setting up my father's eero devices, the software updates never came down. I called eero and talked to a live person and he was pretty amazing at getting it resolved. It took a few calls and emails and they determined that one of the devices was faulty and they overnight shipped a replacement the next day. I didn't have a chance to work with luma on anything like that, but the experience with eero was very impressive.Winner: eeroPhone AppAs I mentioned you do everything from the phone app. In the case of the eero I can manage my network and my Dad's from the same app. When I next visit my sister, I plan to get her setup with eero as well and I'm guessing she will need at least 5 devices.In each phone app you can do things like manage your wifi setup and password, choose a guest network (and share the network name and password), see all the connected devices and also create profiles for each person in the house and do some basic parental controls.Right now, I think the luma app has the edge because it has a visual map of your wifi coverage which I find handy. Winner: lumaParental ControlsBoth apps offer basic parental controls. The reason I wanted to get the luma was that they had said they would offer very deep parental controls. In that time eero added parental controls and luma still hasn't delivered on what they said they would offer.Here is the deal. They are both limited at this right now. The best parental control device (and generally useful network management device) is the Circle with Disney. I will review this soon, but I can tell you right now that it's 5 star.Circle, the most advanced parental control deviceWinner: tieReliability and PerformanceThese are highly complex devices making your life simple and easy. The first few months for eero were bumpy and that's also true for luma. Amazon Reviewers rate the eero far higher than luma (4.4 star for eero vs 2.9 stars for luma). There are some very troubling issues with luma that will be resolved with time. For one thing, the Amazon rating trajectory for them is rather bad. They will need to fix this.The biggest issue I immediately ran into with luma was that every few hours, my iPhone, PC, iPad would spin for a few seconds before completing a task such as loading a web page.I though maybe that was just me.... but no, my wife and kids noticed it to. I did some light trouble shooting turning parental controls off and so on (this is before we had the Circle). I also did a lot of speed tests. I have 120 Mbps service from Comcast and with the Luma not once did I ever see sustained performance hard wired. The eero however has constantly been clocking in at my full bandwidth.In the end, my tolerance for this stuff is super low. Internet needs to work always and work well. I returned the luma after 2 days and my life with the eero has been glorious.Winner: eeroCostThe luma is cheaper. This is by design as eero was the first to market and has a lot of mindshare. To get people to pay attention, I believe luma undercut them (the 3 pack is $100 cheaper from luma).However, this is an important investment for your house. I would not recommend getting the luma due to its lower cost. That $100 could be a big deal in the long run.When purchasing I'd recommend getting the 3 pack as each device is priced at $166 vs $199 individuals. There is also a 2 pack. I got one 3 and one 2 pack.Winner: lumaFinal ThoughtsIt's really exciting to  me that wifi is entering a new era. Surround wifi will solve dead spot and coverage issues for so many families.I fully expect the luma to resolve a number of the problems I identified. However, at this time the eero has been in the market longer, and is the clear leader.I am super happy with my setup. I now have 5 eero devices in my house, they are all hard wired except for the one. I have replaced everything else powering wifi in the house and it's glorious. I highly recommend getting eeros.Winner: eero

Title: Perfect WiFi
Review Comment: The system is incredible.  My old Apple Airport extreme lost connectivity several times per day, it wouldn't reach the back parts of my house, the password needed to be a jumble of text with punctuation and numbers, it wouldn't work with my work VPN, and I never saw speeds faster than 100mbps. With eero, I get 40mbps in the back yard and 130mbps near the main access point.  The VPN works perfectly, I haven't seen a moment of downtime and the password rules are way friendlier so I can actually remember them.

Title: Great!
Review Comment: So far these are awesome.  Parts of my hose we totally dead and with 3 they now LIVE!!!  Super easy to set up and a welcome addition.

Title: Expensive but worth every penny
Review Comment: My home is split over 3 levels. I have a 300 mbps connection which I could never receive reliably or at any significant speed down in the basement. After trying out numerous alternatives (routers, access points, extenders, and power line adapters), I stumbled on eero. I now have 4 of them spread over the house and get the expected 300 mbps from anywhere the house. An expensive proposition at $600 for 4 units -- but boy -- has it been worth it !!The installation process is super slick and I can see that this will be how setup applications will be in the future -- with a fancy app that guides you at every step and knows what you are doing. A couple of weeks or so after I had installed the eero units, I decided to turn off the WIFI on the router provided by the cable company. This actually improved the performance and reliability of the entire eero system and I suggest everyone do this.One odd thing that I have noticed is that if the internet connection goes down, the eero that is connected to the router gets very hot. I mean really HOT -- and it may be something the eero folks need to worry about -- perhaps some venting slits in the side or the top of the unit may be required to prevent damage to the unit if the internet connection goes down for extended periods of time.Apart from this observation regarding an edge condition -- I think the eero is a game changer and a truly amazing product.

Title: Best network money spent ever
Review Comment: It's been a month. No more resetting out Internet. No more stalling. No more movies buffering. I can't believe I wasted so long to get it. This is amazing

Title: Great system with super simple setup
Review Comment: The easiest setup of any router that I've used so far; better than Apple Time Capsule and Linksys.  The nice aesthetics is a plus: you can place the eero stations in plain sight without your wife complaining about some ugly piece of technology being out in the open like the Linksys line of devices.  I did run into a problem where my cable modem (Arris SB6183) firmware caused conflicts with the eero (which is documented on their web site).  My ISP was unable/unwilling to update the firmware, so I had to upgrade my modem (SB6190) and now all is well.  It is a pricey system, but well worth it when considering the setup ease and reliability of the system.  I haven't had to restart my eeros like I had to with other routers.  You'll be happy with them.

Title: Set up was very quick and simple. My old ...
Review Comment: Set up was very quick and simple. My old wifi setup was problematic but since installing the eero system wifi has been rock solid. As a bonus, I now get a solid connection on our patio that where I'd only gotten intermittent service previously.

Title: I highly recommend Eero!
Review Comment: I have an old 3 story brick house and Eero solved my problems. The installation was very simple and the App guided you every step of the way. I highly recommend Eero!

Title: These are slow.
Review Comment: I was having network roaming issues, so I thought for sure with all the high ratings this product would be great. I found a series of issues which resulted in a return.– While it did create a mesh network, each 'hop' cuts the download speed in half. If you pay for 150 Mb down, and you are at the end opposite side of the house, expect to get at most 1/2 your speed, possibly 1/4 or less.– Intermittent speeds, even when standing directly in front of the main unit– These units also got very hot– My three year old Apple Airport Extreme (Gen 6 / A1521, current version) outperform eeros in all respects. In fact, after fiddling with placement and tech support calls and finally returning the eeros, I revisited my Extremes and named the four SSIDs the same name – it roams seamlessly now.– It's odd that you need to provide both your cell phone and email address to set these units up– I added a star, because out of the box, if you get this for grandma, they do seem to blanket a house with coverage, it's just slow.

Title: Best Router Ever !!!
Review Comment: After buying every single router on the planet to get my coverage right , this one hit the sweet spot , i was skeptical about what this would do , thought it was a glorified doo hicki , but honestly , these people delivered on what they promised , took me an hour to setup all the routers and everything was good to go , i would recommend this to anyone wanting more coverage in there house with stable speeds ,

Title: Excellent solution, easy setup, great coverage
Review Comment: Extremely easy setup!! It queue far better than any extender, booster, etc.  With the purchase price. It covers my 3600 sq ft house without issues, even the deck.

Title: Goldilocks purchase: eero was 'just right'!
Review Comment: These just work!  So simple out of the box and yet manageable.  I love that I have the option to control the DNS settings.I waited months for and tried the LUMA wifi system.  It installed fine but I was very disappointed with their lack of features on launch and their promises to deliver their features must have been talking about later generations of software.  A call to support was pleasant however their roadmap to include the features (like DNS customization) wasn't on their roadmap yet.  Performance was very painful and since they don't string / daisy chain to each other (each device has to connect back to the main hub device) I was limited in my reach.Then I tried Uniquiti wifi.  I used them in a corporate settings and they are simple screaming APs however I wasn't able to run a hardwire eathernet cable to each one so I had to return them.I finally spent the extra $ to go with Eero and I was so impressed.  Simpler set up than Luma and just enough configuration control for my semi technically capable mind to handle.  Been running for 3 days and am so happy with the purchase.  I will buy two more when the shop is finished so I can have wifi in the shop without running any more wires!

Title: Believe the hype
Review Comment: Flawless. Simple.  Actually does what it promises to do.  I have a U-shaped house, I'd have needed a router outside in the middle of the deck.  With eeros at both tips of the U and bottom, I have full bars throughout the house and out back by the pool as well. Could not be more impressed.  I took a gamble and it was well worth it. Highly recommend.UPDATE: December 2016I've added a fourth unit to extend full coverage to the pool and beyond.  As we've settled into the house we've had issues with our broadband from our ISP, but not once has eero been the source of an interruption or outage.  We wound up upgrading to AT&T's gigabit internet -- and eero is pushing all the bandwidth our various devices can handle.  Love it.Don't hesitate, buy it -- this REALLY IS the revolution in wi-fi access you've been waiting for.

Title: Easy to setup and great coverage on a 2 story ...
Review Comment: Easy to setup and great coverage on a 2 story 4000 foot home. 10 times better coverage than my previous router! I also love that I can easily control everything with my Android smartphone. I probably only needed to buy 2 though rather than 3.Update: Coverage is still excellent, however I experience frequent network disconnects for large file downloads and occasional web surfing (signal strength shows 5 bars). Interestingly, one of my computers is on a Cisco SSL VPN and does not experience these problems.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Did not work on multiple floors

Title: It seemed like we lived in a Faraday cage at times
Review Comment: We live in a two story house with a basement and we have aluminum siding on the house.  It seemed like we lived in a Faraday cage at times. No matter how strong of wifi router we bought we still had dead spots around the house, and forget about getting wifi outside. Before I went out and bought a new router and repeater I decided to try eero.  eero has changed everything.  We have one eero in the basement, two on the main floor, and on the second floor. Results? No dead spots and wifi in the back yard. Can not recommend eero more. Enthusiastic two thumbs up.

Title: Simple! And it WORKS!
Review Comment: Wow! Eero is amazing!! It was incredibly easy to set up. And it works great. I have full wifi coverage across a 2,000 sq ft area despite multiple walls. This is an elegant product - so simple and it works. Yes, it's not cheap, but well worth it to solve wifi coverage problems.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Simply the best. Never have to worry about spotty wifi again

Title: WiFi Like Oxygen
Review Comment: That's the promise eero make for their home WiFi system, and they totally deliver.  I've struggled for years with the hostile admin control panels, set-up and firmware upgrade hassles of modems, wireless access point and routers/switches over the years.  We live in a 3-story. 3,500 sq/ft home and have always had to live with WiFi dead zones. the eero 3-pack has finally given us the affordance of WiFi everywhere.Incredibly simple set-up, tutorials to guide you where needed, super simple app, it just all worked!  Small/unobtrusive form-factor almost disappears into the background.  Nice touch in the finish/color-matched AC adapters (most companies throw in the cheapest black wall worts they can find).  The one supplied Ethernet cable for modem connection is ridiculously stiff, but other than that, it is a truly 5-star product for those of us who just want connectivity.  One somewhat humorous problem (and it has nothing to do with the eero system), the only device that had any problems reconnecting after a password reset was . . . my Amazon Echo.  Simply resting the Echo did not solve the problem, I suspect it may have something to do with my enabling Amazon cloud storage of my password, but I finally figured out a work-around.

Title: Awesome. Awesome. Awesome.
Review Comment: It has 100% changed the wifi in our house!  For years we had terrible wireless service, and now it's a dream. Every room in the house has awesome coverage.  And even though the cost may seem high, it has eliminated our cell phone overage charges, and with 4 kids and 2 parents all on phones, it saves us money!

Title: Total WiFi for the house
Review Comment: This system has made our 4,000 SF house totally accessible via WiFi.  This is something the Netgear Nighthawk R8500 and a few other wireless routers could not accomplish.  Be on the lookout this goes on sale for $100 off or they will price match some of the other comparable systems on Amazon.  I will say we do have one issue with the phone app you use to manage this.  The download speed is constantly reported at less than 90 Mbps (we have 600 Mbps service) and this is wired direct to the router.  My laptop is also plugged into the router and it reports 300-600 Mbps all the time from speedtest, other speed test sites, ftp, etc.

Title: Excellent in every way
Review Comment: Eero set up was a snap.  Pushed firmware updates are a great idea.  Full coverage of my 2-story house with a 3-unit system

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Perfect

Title: Awesome.
Review Comment: Before Eero my daughter was chewing through our cell data plan because she didn't have wifi coverage in her room.  Now with Eero our 3 floor house is literally bathed in wifi, not to mention the deck and even the driveway.  Awesome.

Title: We just moved to a house that needed more coverage and a mesh network seemed perfect. The promised ease of use was even better
Review Comment: UPDATE:  I reached out to the CEO to let him know about the experience and he said that a new cable/modem would solve the problem.  He offered to send one for free.  I installed it and, lo and behold, it worked!  Would have been nice to get there faster but they had a nice save at the end and did the right thing.-----------------------------------I was so excited about this product when I read about it.  We just moved to a house that needed more coverage and a mesh network seemed perfect.  The promised ease of use was even better.I have had this for two months.  First I set it up as a node off the main network, and I had a lot of problems with speed when the Eero wasn't the router.  I then switched it to be the router for my entire network, at which point the wireless nodes started interfering with the Sonos system.  This was discovered after weeks of interactions with customer service.  The result was that download times would drop to 1-2 mbs on the wireless network (I get 300mbs normally).  When I disabled all my Sonos units, this solved the problem.  Then the two Roku units started having issues.  Again, after more weeks with customer service, I'm at a point where Netflix won't work on any device (including a TV without a Roku), none of the Rokus will work wirelessly, and I have continuous problems with sites in a wired format.I switched back to my Airport Extreme for my router and all problems solved.  But now am having speed issues again using the Eeros just as wireless access points.  So I will switch back to my older airport expresses.I have literally spent months interacting with customer service.  Changing my DNS settings.  Resetting every possible setting on the Eeros.  Dedicating ports.  Disabling everything else on my network.  I asked to send the product back because as far as I'm concerned, it's defective.  They then told me that since I bought it on Amazon, and it is past 30 days, nothing they can do.In the future...don't try to fix it...just send it back.  Before 30 days are up!  And let me know if you want to buy a (slightly used) 4 Eero system :-)

Title: This gives me great coverage all over my house
Review Comment: This gives me great coverage all over my house, and the wireless devices seem to move from AP to AP easily, not trying to stick to an AP upstairs when you've moved to the other side of the house, like I experienced when setting two standalone APs to use the same SSID.  Great community on Reddit.  Speed test results in the App are usually way off, compared to Ookla.  I had been waiting on a Luma system but with their delays, then I read that Eero has an update with Parental controls, so I ordered.  When I think parental control for an Internet related system, I think of content filtering.  Eero's parental controls are about schedules for individual devices, not content filtering.  If it did content filtering, I'd probably give it 5 stars, assuming it was as good as the quality they have put into everything else.

Title: 4 stars for ease of use and functionality.
Review Comment: 4 stars for ease of use and functionality.Minus one star because you have no way of designating specific ports to use and there is no way to hang the units on the walls

Title: Best thing since the internet
Review Comment: Set up was incredibly easy and while Eero is a bit pricey, for me it is worth being able to get wifi anywhere on my property

Title: Needed one more than the three pack, but...
Review Comment: It was worth it.  Love the ease of setting up the eero system.  I am technologically savvy, but far from expert.  I am writing this review from the once wi-fi challenged deck of my home.  Four eero units later and there are no dead spots in a 7000 sq ft house.  Very pleased.

Title: This product is fantastic and requires very little knowledge of networking as it ...
Review Comment: As a network engineer and private network consultant I am occasionally asked to set up or upgrade home networks for employees at the executive level of the companies I support. This purchase was for a very large home in Westchester, New York. A castle actually which is primarily made of solid stone and very irregularly shaped.  Multiple floors and upwards of 20K + square feet.  The system they had, consisted of several apple airport extremes and expresses and they were constantly having issues with the in-home wifi.  Signal drop outs, dead spots etc..  I had recently purchased an eero kit for a much smaller home and had been impressed with the simplicity of the setup and the performance so I decided to implement it in this castle.  It took three kits of which we used 8 out of the 9 eeros.  We removed every apple product from the network and replaced them with an eero.  In some spots, we actually didn't need to place an eero unit where there had been an apple product because the signal coming from the other erros was covering the area more than sufficiently.  By the time it was over, my client was thrilled not only with the throughput speeds in all areas of the castle, but also the setup process.  He installed the app on his phone and tablet and was loving the process of adding the erros to the network.  This product is fantastic and requires very little knowledge of networking as it pretty much configures itself.  From an IT perspective, I like the ability to dive in a little to the configuration and advanced settings options where you can manage each erro with specific settings to accommodate each rooms specifications.  About 5 of the erros we installed were hard wired to the master switch and the other 3 were picking up the wifi signal and extending it.  All without issues, errors or signal irregularity.  If you have a home or small business, look no further.  Buy this, install it, have fun while doing it, and kiss your wifi issues goodbye.  Bravo Eero!

Title: Vast Improvement
Review Comment: Worked fabulously. Suggest turning off the broadcast if you are hooking up to a router instead of modem..  Otherwise it was so simple to set this up that anybody should be able to do it. It actually made my computer is faster!

Title: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Review Comment: Makes the wifi so much faster!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: So far as good as I thought

Title: Finally a Solution to Router and Range Extenders
Review Comment: After struggling to get good wifi coverage on all three levels of the house I finally found the solution with Eero.  Setup through the app was very easy and the customer service was great.  When I first setup the network I had terrible upload speeds and reached out to customer service within minutes I had a response and an upgrade was sent to my Eero units that solved the problem.  Eero support then followed up twice to confirm everything was going well.  I may purchase another unit to improve my outdoor coverage and love that I can add on if I decide I want to.One thing I would improve upon is the design of the case so that these could more easily be wall mounted.

Title: ... from an Apple router to the eero system - best decision and best choice
Review Comment: I went from an Apple router to the eero system - best decision and best choice!  It took 10 minutes at the very most to set-up and I have incredible service throughout my home.  Areas that were slow or useless on one side of the house now have full coverage. Extremely happy.

Title: Awesome system, easy to setup and works as advertised!
Review Comment: After much debate due to the higher cost of this system, I ordered the Home Wifi system and set it up yesterday in my home.  First step though was to replace my current Xfinitiy cable modem/router with just a cable modem so as to remove any potential conflict with operating the new system behind the old router. (I had read that Arris modem / wifi routers don't work well with the router portion turned off).  I installed the new modem, called Xfinity (Comcast), registered the new modem and plugged the first Eero in.  Step 1: download the software onto my iphone.  Step 2, followed the prompts.  Step 3, I installed 3 eeros into my home in a matter of 10 minutes and instantly the wifi in the house was improved.  All the dead zones I had (even with access points setup) were gone, and my upload/download speeds are what they've been advertised.  This is the simplest wifi router system i've ever setup and their claims of no more buffering, no more dead zones...absolutely true.  This system is worth every penny.

Title: Finally a system you can trust to boost your download speed several times
Review Comment: Extremely easy to setup via the app. Ensures the same wi-fi name can be extended through out the home (unlike some other products).  The app can test download speeds and upload speeds at various points in home. My download speed of iPhone increased 4 times from 24 bps to close to 100 bps consistently (after 24 hrs, the effect is even more prominent). My corner bedroom which used a slow PC got a 3 times boost in download speed. I have tried two other systems before (Azeus and extenders), but this system is the only one you will ever need. My house about 4000 sq feet and since I installed this, there is a huge difference. We have over 15 devices connected and lot of streaming content being watched parallel on multiple t.v.'s with fire tv on each of them, and iPads and iPhones.

Title: Finally a wireless product which works
Review Comment: I have been through multiple wireless routers and access points. The list includes linksys 1900, 3200, asus ac5300, netgear nighthawk x6 all with access points from various manufactures. None of these product worked for my 5000 sq ft home. I bought eeros thinking of it did not work I would return. After installing the product I can say it is the best wireless solution I have ever owned. The installation and setupWas simple and quick. I am getting near 100mps speeds in most parts of my home with the worst speed I tested was 40mps. I was even able to control my music from my Apple TV outside my home in my backyard. Great solution, I highly recommend purchasing if you have a large home.

Title: If you have home automation devices that require stable, ...
Review Comment: If you have home automation devices that require stable, consistent and basic wifi connectivity, AVOID THIS AT ALL COSTS!  My Eero devices cannot provide basic and reliable connectivity to products such as home thermostats, robotic vacuums, home control devices etc. This is a known issue at Eero and after spending months working with Eero support, with broken promises for resolution that are never delivered upon and have pushed beyond the Amazon return window I am stuck with devices that do not provide advertised and stated functionality. Will be seeking Legal remedy as Eero will not stand behind their product nor will provide firmware fixes in a timely fashion in order to correct issues. Avoid this at all costs.

Title: Yes it's a little pricey but it just flat out works
Review Comment: This is a game changer in terms of wifi. I know it's expensive and seems excessive but damn it the product just works.Gone are the days of endless configurations and tweaks to get things right during setup. Also gone are the days of turning off my wifi in certain areas of the house or in the backyard because the signal is weak and it's better to just hop on a cell network.You open the box and the equipment is laid out in steps - install this piece first and then the second and so forth. The app is clean and simple and will walk you through the entire process.Coverage in our house has improved greatly since installing eero units on each floor. Now all I need to do it double down and purchase a few more; that's the only downside, cost. I believe you get what you pay for and you will pay for great home network coverage.

Title: Best Wifi To Date
Review Comment: Have had Eero for about 6 months now and have great coverage in all corners of each of the three levels of my home and also get coverage in my front yard and back porch.  Crazy easy to setup and use.  Easy to share access to guests and the accompanying mobile app is simple and straight forward.

Title: We have a fairly large home and property where we ...
Review Comment: We have a fairly large home and property where we need wifi in almost every section of the property for everything from Apple TV's to security cameras.  We have literally spent thousands of dollars attempting to make the wifi signal be reliable within our home, on the grounds of the property, and within other structures on the property. Some of the solutions worked (albeit usually temporarily), but the solutions that did work required the services of our computer technician to install and/or fix. That being said, that has grown increasingly expensive as a simple reboot of the system if anything did go hay wire generated a bill from the IT company. In a last ditch effort before hard wiring the entire property, we tried eero.  In less than 30 minutes, we had the entire property up and running on eero WITHOUT THE NEED FOR THE IT COMPANY!!!  We hardly ever write a review, but I felt compelled to do so for this product.  I can't say enough about the quality and SIMPLICITY of the product!!!  Buy it.  You won't regret the decision!!!!!

Title: Simple and reliable
Review Comment: I can make this review very simple. The Eero system works. Well.  We have a sprawling house, and attempts to use either a single router, or a router with extenders, never worked well.  Setting up the Eero was easy, and over six months of use, we've never had to even think about the wifi routers.  What could be better?  It even reaches a gazebo we have in the back yard.  Highly recommended if simplicity and consistent utility are the primary goals.  I can't speak to whether I could find a faster router system, but several rounds of expensive routers before the Eero did not work as well in covering the entire house.

Title: Works as advertised
Review Comment: I moved to a large condo on the beach last year.  The floors and ceiling are reinforced concrete, and a the wall studs are metal.  I would love to hardwire every room, but that would have been crazy expensive, so I had to go with WIFI.  Getting a reasonable signal from where the UVerse Service was installed to the other end of the condo was only possible with repeaters that created new wifi networks.  My wife and guests hated changing networks depending on where you were in the condo.  Eero not only solved this, but the throughput is much higher than the repeaters I tried.  I don't use this as a router, but as a distributed set of access points this does exactly what I wanted.

Title: Phased Install Yields Immediate Results
Review Comment: So I live in a relatively small split level and we couldn't get better than 1/3 the bandwidth in any room but the basement where our Verizon router was. So we decided to try Eero.  Excellent decision.Install was a breeze, though I realized our three locations didn't work perfectly at first. The second Eero I attempted to install in the mid-level wouldn't connect.  Proceeding to the third box, in the top level just above our basement Eero, it connected fine.  Then I attempted the second box again and no problems.Basically, you have to be prepared to let Eero build your network over again.But now we have full bandwidth everywhere in our house. We went from 50/50 in the basement and 12ish elsewhere to 58/52 everywhere. Just a couple weeks later and now our only problem is our ISP.Units are also simple, clean looking and stay out of the way.

Title: Setup super easy, device looks great and all feels like ...
Review Comment: Where  were you all this time? Finally a mesh Wi-Fi network that works everywhere in the house! Setup super easy, device looks great and all feels like magic! THANK YOU!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Fixed our internet.

Title: Excellent product. If you have a big house, just do it.
Review Comment: My 3 eeros replaced a custom setup using DD-WRT flashed into a Buffalo router and a bridged Apple router in a large house.  Eero was easiest setup ever. The first day it was somewhat slow, as measured by a couple of test apps running in an iPad Pro. But eeros updated their firmware overnight and the system became progressively faster. Since 3rd day, by far the fastest and most complete coverage I've ever had in the house. So far we've experienced no problems, even with as many as 15 devices connected and 3 streaming simultaneously. Both my iPad Pro and wired PCs regularly report 80 - 90 megabit/sec downloads over a Comcast cable in a somewhat rural location. It's actually a little hard to believe. We have had one extended power failure, and the eero network brought itself back online normally when power was restored.Eeros do not yet support IPv6, although it is promised as "coming soon". I'd like to add one more eero to improve coverage in one corner of the lower level of the house (although the existing setup does reach there). However, the per-unit cost of a single additional eero is much higher than the per-unit cost of my set of three.  The manufacturer should offer a better add-on price for existing customers.

Title: Must have easy set up.
Review Comment: A must have.  I will buy another set of these for our second home!!!

Title: These are great
Review Comment: Theses are GREAT!!! I received them fast from Amazon and I got them on sale. Setup was a breeze and I was up and running in less then 5 minutes with the first eero. The remaining 2 were strategically placed in my house for the best coverage in less than 10 minutes. These offer better more reliable coverage inside and outside of my house than I've ever gotten with any other combination of router with range extenders. These are easy to set up with the instructions and there has not been a single dropped signal like i would get with my router. I haven't had to unplug or restart anything. I have an Iphone and the app you need to set the eero up is easy to use and intuitive. It also has a speed test in the app so you can see what you current upload and download speeds are. I haven't tested this against anything so I can't speak to it's accuracy. I use a switch in my office to connect my computers and peripherals to the network. People complain about the cost and I agree they are pricey but after you spend money on a good router and research the numerous other options for extending coverage you could get to the same cost very easy. You don't have the multitude of options you get with a router for setting up your network but I feel most of those are overkill for the average user. These are easy to use,work well, offer good reliable coverage for a wireless network and that's what most people are asking for.

Title: Finally!
Review Comment: I finally have strong stable wifi everywhere in my home. Setup was easy and I haven't had a single issue in over a month. Highly recommended.

Title: Was hoping for a winner.. Was not the case
Review Comment: Really wanted to love this product. Did a ton of debating over which router type to cover my three story home and decided to go for the Eero. This being also the top price point I had extremely high expectations. When it arrived I admit I was very impressed with the presentation, very stylish design almost looks it came right out of Cupertino. Followed directions and got the main router set up in minutes. After that point it was all downhill. Could not get any of the other Eero's to connect to the main hub. Literally got to the point that one was less than 10 feet away in plain sight... Nothing! Sorry for $499 it's going right back where it came from.

Title: At last!
Review Comment: Finally found a solution to an almost impossible building with thick concrete and steel walls, where nothing else had covered our whole condo unit (or anyone else's).  No extender and fancy router had worked well. Now have coverage in all rooms, and iPhone gets wifi all over too, a boon since the cellular coverage was spotty at best.  And quite simple to install.  Only challenge was trying to figure out a way to get units to be roughly in sight of each other, which I did.

Title: Highly recommend Eero!
Review Comment: Great product!  I was skeptical at first if this system would solve our never-ending network frustrations.  The system was super easy to install and has worked perfectly from day one.  We have a large, three story home with a structure outside of the home and getting an internet connection to all area was very frustrating no matter what we tried.  I contacted Customer Support yesterday for a brief question and the rep was very courteous and extremely helpful.  Eero is wonderful!

Title: Easy easy set up and has been working perfectly since ...
Review Comment: Easy easy set up and has been working perfectly since day 1. Family no longer complains about dropped WiFi signal. 3 units cover my entire 3400 sq ft home and it has been maintenance free. Would recommend to any one who has had problems with their WiFi signal. Works exceedingly well with my apple systems

Title: Excellent product, a little pricey, and customer support is AWOL but excellent nonetheless
Review Comment: Ok, I've had these in place for a few months now. Long enough to have an opinion.First of all, they are very "Appleish" in the design and appearance. Even the packaging. It is quite nice. Assuming you have an iphone or ipad to run the app on, the setup is very simple and nearly foolproof. To be fair, I didn't try the Android app but based on other reviews, it appears that the ios app is more refined. They have simplified the product setup (perhaps too much?) and made it a breeze for anyone, even without technical knowledge, to get these up and running quickly and painlessly.Once the 3 APs are up and connected to each other, "it just works". Bravo! I can attest that these absolutely fixed WiFi dead spots and weak signals throughout my house. I replaced an Asus 802.11ac router/AP with these and the difference has been fantastic. Yes, yes... I know, some of you are screaming about "if you know how to configure.. blah blah blah". I know how to configure it - I've got many many years and all the silly certificates and whatnot. That isn't the issue.The app has a really nice indicator with status and how many devices are connected. One very nice addition is the speed test. You "pull down" the screen and it runs a speed test and displays the results right in the app. Nice touch. I also like that I can create and share a guest network in seconds with the app. Very nice. The lack of physical ports on the devices isn't that big a deal. A cheap switch plugged into one of those solves that problem forever.Now for the not so great...Because this is simplified for anyone to get it up and running and even manage it, it lacks some advanced features or tweaks. I have some wireless devices that are a little bit finicky. A thermostat for example works like a champ on 2.4 GHz but has erratic connectivity on 5. Don't know why, it just does. The app would benefit from an "expert mode" or something like that where I could define those things. I also would like to have the option to define the channel being used. If that is some kind of magical "we pick the best one for you" type of thing, I'd like the option to see that data. Finally, lets talk about the price shall we? This is a pretty expensive product. You could get the same "mesh" functionality from Ubiquiti's UniFi or use some power-line devices if you just need to connect a couple of devices away from your modem. WiFi range extenders are a cheaper option although they aren't nearly as slick or reliable.Then we have this awful moment;  The 2 devices that aren't wired directly into my modem would randomly disconnect and show a red status light. They'd come back after 30-60 seconds but this constant up/down cycle went on for days. Instead of fussing with it, I fired up the app, navigated through the help section and emailed support with the information requested. Then --- crickets. No acknowledgement, no reply, no help. searching some internet forums, I'm not the only one to have this issue. I basically had to remove everything and go through the setup routine all over again while moving the 2 wireless APs around a little bit to get  a better signal. Not exactly sure why it ran fine for so long then suddenly became unstable, but it did.I thought the lack of any response from support may have just been an oversight so I followed up the original ticket with a second request. Nothing again. Unfortunately, it appears that email support is non-existent. I didn't call the phone number but, I don't think I should have to. These are not cheap by any measure. Maybe the time, money, and effort put into the pretty packaging would have been better spent ensuring that customer support was top notch. I'd rather the product came in a brown paper bag and get stellar customer support than pretty packaging but nobody to answer my email.Overall, if you care about aesthetics and you want to cover a large area with seamless WiFi, this is a great product. If you are more price sensitive, take a look at some of the alternatives. And finally, if you are not comfortable with suspect customer service, you may want to wait while, what I assume are growing pains, are resolved before you purchase.

Title: Exactly as Advertised. Worth the initial investment
Review Comment: Awesome Product. Exactly as Advertised. I was very skeptical about this product; of course, every router company claims that they have the router that will solve all your internet problems, yet all of them fail to do so. This one is different. I have had it for about three months now, and Wi-fi has not disconnected nor had any problems even once.This is perfect.

Title: Thumbs Up!
Review Comment: The coverage was greatly increased from my original system that had included extenders. Would definitely recommend this set up!

Title: the future of home wifi
Review Comment: best wifi setup i've ever experienced. signal strength is amazing throughout my 3000+ square foot home even outside. switched from amped wireless due to spotty signal strength in certain areas of my home. it's nice not having to deal with multiple wifi networks and having to hop from one network to the other depending on where you are within your home. I couldn't be happier with my investment in eero. this is the future of home wifi.

Title: Eero might be the best thing I've ever bought for our home
Review Comment: For the first time since a full renovation of our home in 1997, we have a strong wireless signal throughout our home and the porch. Eero might be the best thing I've ever bought for our home. Set up was very easy and fast. It has worked perfectly since it arrived.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works great--easy to set up!

Title: Very unreliable
Review Comment: I really wanted to like the eero.  Unfortunately, it does exactly what it says it does and that is the problem for me.  When the eero is up and running, it is a delight to use.  I get great coverage, fast speeds, and updates when I’m not using it.  The problem is that when something goes wrong, there is no way to tell why.  Is it because of updates?  Did my cable modem drop?  Did one of the units crash?  All I get is “offline”.Also, the system is smart about when updates occur, but if you change your schedule, it doesn’t seem to adjust.  For the last week, I’ve needed to get up an hour earlier than normal.  Each day, I’ve woken up to all of the eeros “offline”.  The first day, I figured it was updating, let it go and used my phone instead.  If it was an update, it took over an hour and left two of the units (I have four) offline afterwards until I rebooted them much later in the day.  The second day, same thing, but I rebooted the units.  This is day three and to say I’m frustrated is an understatement.  I ended up plugging in my old router, found the network was there, the eero just went “offline” for some reason.Here are the problems for me:• Cannot schedule updates – days where I change my schedule leave me hanging high and dry for network access• No way to tell why the units go offline – the units seem to go offline frequently (couple of times a week).  No way to tell why or how to fix it other than walking around and rebooting them• Updates take a long time – I’ve seen the network go down for as much as an hour and then come back up.  Assuming that was for an update as the cable modem was still connected to the internetThe bottom line is that when it works, it’s great.  When it doesn’t you’re left guessing and going around rebooting units – just like any other router (except with those, I can at least figure out what’s going on).  So, I see these as faster, less reliable versions of the routers I replaced them with.  Personally, I’ll take the speed hit in order to have better reliability.  After a month and a half, I’m already regretting the purchase and looking to replace eero with something else.Update:It's been one week since my 2 star review.  Lowering to 1 star.  Every single day, the network is out in the morning.  Just this week, it has gone out at night before I go to bed twice.  Why is it out?  Who knows?  Who cares?  Bottom line is I'm spending more time without network access on the eero network for no reason that I can figure out (old router still gives access - had to plug it back in to deal with the eero outages).  These routers are complete garbage.  They worked great for the first month, but now instead of having to reboot two routers a couple of times a month, I'm having to reboot four routers... every... single... day!  Sometimes more than once a day.  I'm done with these.  I'm going back to my old network config.

Title: Best I've found
Review Comment: Live in a ranch style home.  Improved connectivity dramatically throughout house.  Tried other routers. Best I've found.

Title: Best system for home
Review Comment: It works as promised. Best system for home. Easy to set up

Title: The wireless hubs need to be within 40 feet of ...
Review Comment: The wireless hubs need to be within 40 feet of each other, I ended up getting sub-par speeds in my old 1950 house. Ended up going back to my old setup to get faster speeds.

Title: Wow, is all I can say!
Review Comment: In reading other reviews, I was undecided whether to give Eero a shot. I finally made the costly plunge, but let me say, it's worth every dollar!!!
