Don't let its small size fool you, there's serious horsepower in each Eero. After installing the 3 pack, which was a breeze, I know have full wifi all over my house.  No more signal degradation!!! And most importantly I getting the speed I pay for. Couldn't ask for more.

Title: Eero rocks!
Review Comment: Eero solved my connection problems completely.  Setup was very easy.

Title: I really like this system
Review Comment: I really like this system.  On the eero's site review I gave it a 9 out of 10 because I had to reboot the system 2x due to no wifi signal even though each units indicator lights showed everything was ok.  This system has done a fantastic job when streaming movies, streaming music, and game playing all at the same time.  Customer service helped me out with a brain fart I had on didn't mock me. One of the features I like is that I can change the things I need to on the go with the iOS app (I wish the had one specific for the iPad) - it was nice to enable guest mode with out having to run back into the office and login to the router.  Setup really is as simple as the video.

Title: Works as advertised!
Review Comment: I recently purchased my eero system, and we love it! We almost always record dl speeds of 110 mbps. I have a 4000 sf house and it works everywhere. I highly recommend!

Title: The other devices are placed to give good connections in an old home with steel lathe (an ...
Review Comment: I have AT&T U-Verse, which has slow (< 5 Mbs) wireless and requires frequent lease renewal (or re-connection). I installed three Eero devices, including one at the AT&T wireless router in bridge mode. The other devices are placed to give good connections in an old home with steel lathe (an effective Faraday Cage). The installation was straight forward and worked perfectly from the get-go. My wireless speed is now equal to hard-wired connections, 25-28 Mbs.

Title: Eero delivers
Review Comment: Eero is easy to install and operate. It does what it says it will do. I am very happy with this purchase.

Title: perfect out of box
Review Comment: Prayers answered!  Have been looking for an easy to use, out of the box muti point mesh network system and this one works great.  There is a critical review that mentions lack of hard wiring, but these babies can be hardwired.  I have only set up two out of the three in a 2-level 3500 SF home and the system worked perfectly with just 10-15 minutes of setup time.  As far as I can tell, handoff occurs seamlessly between access points.  No more fumbling through terrible control panels manually switching nodes all the time.  Highly recommend this product.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Worked as advertised!!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works well

Title: The Elegance of Simplicity
Review Comment: You won't find a lot of my reviews but this product is exceptional.Installation as APs on my existing wired Ethernet, was trivially simple.  Put the system into "bridge" mode and no more dead zones.  The construction of my teeny house required 4 units but no blaming eero for that.  Superb performance, no double-NATing and seamless roaming -- all I ask for.I can't comment on their tech support as I, and I suspect most customers, don't need it.  This product is simple and elegant.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: It was incredibly easy to set up and connectivity has been great since installation

Title: I arranged special delivery through myUS. com to France ...
Review Comment: I arranged special delivery through myUS.com to France. eero installation was straightforward and performance is superb. eero provides the solution that I required.

Title: Works perfect!
Review Comment: Finally no more problems with my wifi !

Title: Absolutely love this thing
Review Comment: Absolutely love this thing. Great speed and so easy to set up. Think I am going to order a second one to extend my network out to my garage.

Title: Easy with some not so Guaranteed plug and Play
Review Comment: Mostly met expectations. Not quiet as easy setup. Have a decent size 2400 sq ft home though line of site from room to open space poses challenges when setting up the mesh. Not as easy as just putting the access points to spread across the whole house. Though overall mak s it easier for hose less savvy with technology.For those of us more savvy, a bit limited with what I like to setup for port forwarding or access restrictions. We are having a hallenge with Fios and eliminating the Fios router completely. Won't let us use eero as the direct connection. Either a lot mutation or some issue with the Ethernet jack from the street.Will need further testing to see this Fios compatibility.  Otherwise working well and keeps a significantly fast connection.

Title: Happy Home
Review Comment: I have a large home with 2 gaming systems upstairs and a movie streamer downstairs.  With the nighhawk router, I just couldn't find the best location in my house to make everyone happy.  No matter what I tried, someone was complaining.  The eero was incredibly easy to set up and now everyone is happy!

Title: Very easy and it works well
Review Comment: Very easy to setup and works great!  No more spotty and dropping wifi!

Title: Easy. Fast. Great coverage.
Review Comment: It does what it advertises.  It was incredibly easy to set up.  So much so, that I'd recommend it to any of my non-technical friends as a way to replace their ISP provided hardware and feel confident that they could install it on their own because I know from personal experience that their support staff is a great group of people.Prior to eroo, I had 2 different APs broadcasting 2 different networks that I had to switch between as I moved around the house.  The coverage was still spotty and getting anything out by the pool was asking for a miracle.  After eroo was installed, there was zero configuration and I was up and running with one network and coverage in places I didn't know internet could even exist.For those that like more customization, maybe in the future they'll send down an update in the middle of the night that lets you do subnets, but for now this product is geared towards people that don't want to mess with the technology and just want it to work, and work well.  That doesn't make the product any less than 5 stars (again, it does exactly what it advertises) but you might want to hang back if you need a custom network.

Title: Boomer-Friendly!!
Review Comment: Thanks to eero's Home WiFI System my transition to Smart Home technologies is now HIGHLY responsive.  Starting with my AMAZON Echo, I began adding WeMo devices throughout my two story home.  All worked fine, albeit occasionally with a slight "lag".  Then after installing a Nexia WiFi Thermostat with my new Heat-pump, connectivity became more of a challenge.  So, I got the Three Pack.  And, WOW!!  All of my WiFi devices reported FOUR (or if the device showed 5) BAR full connectivity.  Responsive - I merely mention to Alexa that I want to turn something on or off; or to raise or lower thermostat temperature and it's accomplished in an instant; when connecting to my WiFi notebook out on the back deck my download speed "pegs the meter".  WOW!Now to set up:  It's so easy it is almost embarrassing.  It took all of 5 minutes to connect the entire 3 Pack System providing total home coverage just by following the directions on the erro app.  As a Boomer I frequently rely on my 13 Year Old Nephew for "Tech Support".  Not this time!  The erro is clearly "Boomer-Friendly".

Title: Works perfect when every unit is hard wired to the Internet
Review Comment: Works perfect when every unit is hard wired to the Internet. We have three units on our 1/2 acre property and we have strong wi fi everywhere, even outside in the backyard. Would not have same coverage if doing this all wireless. Five stars if hard wired.

Title: Eero is really as good as it claims
Review Comment: Eero is really as good as it claims.Easy set up and provide stable connection everywhere in my old house instantly

Title: Which basically disables all the smart functions like being able to monitor connections
Review Comment: Is not compatible with my DSL service (Earthlink through AT&T.)  Was able to make it work after talking with tech support (nice guy and very helpful) but only by bridging the Eero through my old router.  Which basically disables all the smart functions like being able to monitor connections, etc.  I kept it for a month to see how it did. It did make connectivity much broader in my home--extending the range considerably.  But with a slow DSL service that just meant more people and more equipment were using an already crappy slow connection.  I also found the connection to be slower with Google Hangouts with video connections very iffy.  So returned it--cost me about a hundred dollars since I waited a bit beyond the 30 day window.  Disappointing but there it is.  Seems to be a nice setup if you have a good fast internet connection and a large area to cover.  Was not noticeably faster with my setup (Netgear Nighthawk AC1900) and the cost is high.

Title: Great product, great customer service
Review Comment: Eero has been great so far. We have a four story townhouse and placed one on each floor. Our signal is strong everywhere in the house.The system is simple to set up with a smart phone. It took about 10 minutes total. I had one issue when I reconfigured the system, but their customer service was exceptional. I highly recommend this product to anyone that wants to extend the range of their WiFi.

Title: Solved a long standing problem, works like a charm
Review Comment: We own an old house with plaster walls and a small cottage close to the house that we rent out. My son who is in the computer technology business set up commercial extenders  that never extended the wireless consistently up in the cottage. Albeit it was older technology but still should have worked. Finally after so many complaints from renters I asked him to please figure this out. So he bought the 3 pack and replaced all the old extenders with the eero's.  It worked like a charm and even extended it into the patio area. Our renters were so excited that they didn't have to sit scrounged by the window trying to pick up a signal. We have had it now 6 weeks without any complaints. I like the fact that you can tell on your phone which eero is down. All I had to do was u plug it and replug. Came right  back up online. So far  so good . Love it. Definitely would recommend it to anyone who needs extenders or who have plaster walls.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works wonderfully.  Easy to set up.  Much better than my old wifi system.

Title: using my old crappy wireless router (wireless off) as the router
Review Comment: SO when I called to figure out why it wasn't working, I was informed, "yeah, they usually don't work with DSL - it's a real problem and we need to change the website".  Ya' think?!?This is what it says on the website:  Dual auto-sensing Gigabit ports for WAN (cable or DSL modem) and/or LAN (networked device)Note - DSL.  But now I have really fancy repeaters in the bridged mode, using my old crappy wireless router (wireless off) as the router, and most of the 'extra features' don't work.Wish I could get real internet up here in the woods, but in the meantime, eero = fail...

Title: I spent 45 minutes on the phone with a very nice tech guy who had absolutely no clue and had ...
Review Comment: It's not compatible with all wireless printers.  I spent 45 minutes on the phone with a very nice tech guy who had absolutely no clue and had to keep searching through manuals that he kept "waiting for them to upload."  Also note that there are are only two ethernet ports on this thing. One for your modem and one for your printer. If you have more than one printer, forget.  On the plus side, as long as you have a smart phone, it's really easy to set up.

Title: A tech product that works exactly as promised
Review Comment: After upgrading our modem, and trying two different types of network extenders, I finally bit the bullet and splurged for an eero 3 pack.  SOOOOO glad I did.  Easiest out-of-box set up of a tech product that I've ever experienced, and has provided flawless WiFi in every corner of our house (which is old, and sports an addition, so has to deal with some very thick load bearing walls in certain spots).  Absolutely love it.  Highly recommend.

Title: Very happy customer here!
Review Comment: Very happy customer here!  I first heard of the eero system from the Cult of Mac podcast (if you're an Apple fan and haven't heard it yet, I highly suggest you give it a go).  One of the podcasters was raving about how the eero had massively improved the wifi coverage in his home, and I was instantly intrigued.  My house is about 1,300 square feet and the modem sits in one corner while the Apple TV sits in the diagonally opposite corner.  Before eero, shows on Netflix, Amazon, etc. would constantly pause to buffer, which of course can be quite frustrating.  The price tag for the three-pack eero system is a hefty one, no denying that, but I justified the purchase because I had some Amazon gift cards that covered half of the cost...and I'm very glad I made that purchase!  Setup was so easy: download the app to your phone and it walks you through in a matter of minutes.  It's suggested that you place your eero devices within sight of each other, but the physical structure of my house makes that impossible.  I have one in each opposite corner, plus one in the hallway in the middle of the house.  It works perfectly!  I will note that the first day I used the system, I noticed a couple of times the blinking light on the devices that indicated loss of connectivity.  However, during that first night the system did its initial software update (so cool that it does it on its own!), and ever since then it's been running flawlessly.  Strong wifi signal throughout the house, zero loss of connectivity, zero spontaneous Netflix bufferings.  If you can swallow the cost of the device, stop thinking about it and just buy it!

Title: Fast setup, access, and seamless integration
Review Comment: They work great for my 3 level house (including basement).  I can move around the house no problem and the speeds really are as expected relative to my distance from the nearest AP.  Configuration was easy

Title: this is the best system of its type I have seen
Review Comment: Without question, this is the best system of its type I have seen. Installation was very easy and I now have strong high bandwidth service everywhere in my home. Far better than any of the many routers and so called extenders I have used. Well worth the price, no issues or concerns.

Title: Easy setup, fast and reliable
Review Comment: Replaced my old cable modem/router with Eero plus a Netgear DOCSIS 3.0 modem and am getting amazing speed and no more periods of sluggishness like I was having before. The setup was very easy. I only have one unit for my small apt but will be moving, so bought with an eye for future expansion. Highly recommend.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Super easy to set up.  Great WiFi coverage.  Excellent value.

Title: Absolutely love it
Review Comment: Without a doubt, the coolest piece of technology I've ever purchased. I was a little skeptical about this working so well due to the fact I was trying to setup in a 3 story older house and had previously 0 luck getting a TP-LINKAV500 powerline network running, however after so many good reviews, I figured I'd give Eero a shot.Within 20 minutes, I had everything completely setup. All 3 floors had fully working wifi, getting anywhere between 95-99% of the bandwidth I'm paying for from our ISP. The app breaks every part of the install down step-by-step makes everything extremely easy to start and monitor on an on-going basis. Honestly, the price seems a little steep at first, but after getting everything running so smoothly, I have no buyer's remorse whatsoever.

Title: Highly Recommend
Review Comment: This is a great system. It was very easy to set up and get functional. I had a small issue setting up one of the units but it performs as it says it will.

Title: It is shockingly and easy to set up
Review Comment: This simply works.  It is shockingly and easy to set up.  I have clear wifi signal everywhere in the apartment with no issues so far.  The app is useful in showing the wifi signal strength and speed.  It's much better than the Apple Airport that we used to have.

Title: This WiFi System Delivers
Review Comment: This product has done exactly what it says it will.  All other Wifi routers or access points or extenders I've tried have far more complicated set up and tend to stop working reliable a month or two in the future.  They've all required the dreaded periodic reboot to get them to functioning again.  Not so with my eero system.  It all installed easily (I had one failure during install, but trying it again succeeded.)  It has been working perfectly since install.  Very happy with the install.

Title: Beware 3 or 4 months later: Eero wifi network is unstable
Review Comment: If I would've written a review within the first month or two it would've been five stars, hands down. Unboxing and setup are a breeze and the iPhone app is a nice touch. I'm glad I waited because after 3 or 4 months, something has happened and I'm worse off than I was before with a single point wifi router. I don't think the product deserves 5 stars. I agree with all the 5 star reviews for the first 3 months of owning the product.Out of the blue, for no apparent reason, with no changes to my home, the Eero node placement, or number of devices connecting, I am suddenly getting random network outages, dropped wifi and reconnecting, I have to forget the network and re-join it, my printer 100% refuses to connect, I had to forcibly put in the MAC address with a DHCP reservation to get my Macbook Pro to connect. It is really disappointing. When it works, it's great, but it's becoming very inconsistent and I am having a 3 week long conversation with support to try to remedy the situation. They told me to try swapping one of the nodes with the one attached to the physical router. I tried that and it had no effect.This product is definitely not worth $500 and tech support has been slow to respond.

Title: It's easy to set up and coverage is great from the ...
Review Comment: It's easy to set up and coverage is great from the basement to the second floor.  I like products that just plain work.

Title: kcamdenesq
Review Comment: Excellent!  It just works. I have an older home and connectivity from the downstairs to the upstairs was always difficult.  I used to run a three base station system with Apple.  For whatever reason, after switching to Comcast and hours of tech support, the Apple system no longer worked.  EERO was awesome.  Plugged it in, fired it up and boom, fastest download speeds I have had and no connectivity issues.I do not enjoy the greatly extended range outside the home that some seem to get, but I am still impressed with it.

Title: the Eero system is an easy install, a delight to the eye
Review Comment: After struggling to install a Netgear N750 Dual Band 4 Port Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (VERY Mac unfriendly) and sending it back (thank you, Amazon), the Eero system is an easy install, a delight to the eye, and works flawlessly.  Worth every penny.

Title: The best invention for the internet, since the internet of the internet
Review Comment: I have tried everything to get a better wifi signal, strength and consistency of both in my house for years. I live in a single story that is a decent size, almost 3,000, so there's a lot of ground to cover (wifi wise). I also have a smart TV in the back yard, so it is actually even bigger ground to cover. At first I tried to improve my wifi changing ISP from AT&T to Time Warner's 300mbps download speed. That didn't improve the wifi-strength to the other side of the house from where the modem was located. Then I tried TP Links along with Netgear range extenders. They helped, but weren't consistent. Some days decent, some days terrible, but never exceptionally good performance, even on their best days. Didn't know what to do, then was recommended Eero. I was skeptical, as nothing had really worked in the past, but I figured I could return it if I was in no better shape. Well, no need for returning. First, the set up was idiot proof. Literally as simple as 1, 2, 3. As close to plug and play as you can get. Now, on to the important part - performance. I was blown away with how strong and how far the signal carried. I was able to stream Netflix on the family room TV and the backyard smart TV, which are located on the other side of the house to the modem, with no buffer, crystal clear picture, and immediate downloading. I was able to use multiple devices simultaneously throughout the house with no loss of strength, and I run a lot of equipment from security cameras, video door bell, multiple TVs, computers, iPads, laptop, iPhones, solar panel monitoring, etc.This is hands down, the best product for the internet since the invention of the internet. Couldn't be more satisfied! From set up to performance, you will not be disappointed

Title: Love the Eero!!!
Review Comment: Bought this to help my crappy home wifi. Actually ended up being a problem from my ISP but I don't regret buying these. I bought 2 to cover my 2 story around 2,000 sq. ft. home. Have not had any issues since installing several months ago. I did have trouble getting these set up for some reason but I called the support line and they (Haley in support) were terrific at helping. Haley answered EVERY question I had and was wonderful in helping me. This was all over a weekend and when it came time for her to have a few days off she even told me who would be helping me while she was gone (and she had informed them of all the issues).  We did get everything working and have had no problems since.

Title: WOW. simply WOW
Review Comment: Just moved into a very large home. Fiona router in the basement. Got three pack eevo. One in basement. One on first floor. One on second floor. All three basically above each other. I'm hitting 30-58mbps up and down EVERYWHERE in the house. One ssid too. It's seamless and FAST.

Title: Grateful dad.
Review Comment: Pricey, but worth it. I'm a fairly tech savvy, frustrated dad, who was fed up with horrible parental controls in traditional routers and was tired of trying to manage a bridge/extender to get coverage. Still took a long time on the phone with xfinity for the first time setup, but it's been great ever since. That's was xfinity's fault, not eero  (after putting modem/router into bridge mode, modem wouldn't connect to the Internet.) And another plug for the app - I love that my wife can use it.

Title: I needed something better and I windowshopped a lot
Review Comment: Absolutely the easiest setup I've ever done on a home network. It costs a little more but it was worth it. I've struggled with range extenders in the past and constantly was having to reset them. There were dead spots in my house where wifi was unavailable (and my teenage daughters would always remind me of that). I needed something better and I windowshopped a lot. I finally bit the bullet and decided to give the eero a try.This eero system was set up in 10-15 minutes and I have a STRONG signal in all rooms of my house. I cannot recommend this enough.  After 1.5 months of use, I have oh had to reset once and it turns out it was a problem with my cable provider, not the eero.Great product.

Title: JUST WHAT I WANTED
Review Comment: Just what I wanted to stream videos on my Smart TV. Changed my viewing. No more failures in the WiFi signal. Set up was easy. I called their support twice for rather simple questions and the calls were answered quickly and by competent english speaking techies who quickly answered my questions and were patient with my ignorance.An exceptional company.

Title: THE solution to wifi problems!
Review Comment: For years I've struggled with consistent wifi coverage throughout all areas of my home. I've tried airports and range extenders without success. The eero is the answer! Set up was a breeze. Coverage is complete and worry free. I haven't given it a second thought since o hooked it up over a month ago. I love the speed and consistency. Best thing is I can stay on one network throughout my house!

Title: Superfluous for small apartments, but simple setup and works well.
Review Comment: Eero worked well enough, but in my 750 sq. ft. apartment my centrally located router is faster, so I returned it. Will buy again if I'm ever living in a larger space.

Title: It works throughout my house (three levels). No more ...
Review Comment: It works throughout my house (three levels). No more buffering. No more dead spots. It just works. Eero is well worth the investment to eliminate my frustration with WiFi. I'm very happy.

Title: Fast easy set up
Review Comment: Fast easy set up .  Needed help connecting an old printer. Their help was easy to get and fixed the problem.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works great

Title: Awesome and gorgeous product
Review Comment: I read about this company and its product on the Wall Street Journal.  I have 8 smart TVs, 3 Echos not to mention a variety of tablets, smart phones and computers. And a good sized house.  My WiFi is heavily used and did not reach where it needed to, not to mention was very unstable, even with a variety of WiFi repeaters or extenders.  This product was so easy to install and works very well.  Strong and stable signal everywhere now!  I bought five of the gorgeous EERO discs and could not be happier.

Username: Heaven Bound Thanks to Jesus Christ
Title: Excellent product
Review Comment: Very easy to set up and it seems to work great. So far so good.

Title: The eero's are amazing. Placement is key but having a stable network ...
Review Comment: For years I have been trying various powerline carrier range extenders. I bet I've spent $800 trying to have a stable network in my home without having to hardware my entire home. It's been a constant problem, resetting modems, resetting routers, resetting extenders, powering on/off printers, etc. The eero's are amazing. Placement is key but having a stable network with high speed Wifi is finally working for me. I currently experience 44-48Mbs down and 10-15Mbs up. I've never seen it this good. And since installing this week, my network hasn't skipped a beat. Yes, they are expensive but so is my time. Money well spent!!Pros:Lightning fastStable networkNice phone appSimple setupCons:Had to relocate unit out of bedroom b/c the light is too bright at bedtime. No biggie.

Title: The easiest network setup I have ever seen, set ...
Review Comment: The easiest network setup I have ever seen, set up the first one, then add the others.The fastest network setup ever, with the fastest dowloads ever.

Title: Does what it claims and I love it
Review Comment: This system works exactly the way they described, and does exactly what I wanted. I have one unit plugged into the feed from my cable modem at one end of the house, with the second unit at the other end of the house. The second is only plugged into power and relays over the wireless - I get plenty of speed to stream HD video / audio / voice calls to my devices at that far end of the house, no problems or hiccups. The third unit is in my shop, beyond the far end of the house. There's definitely a little bit of speed loss out there, but it works just fine to stream howto videos on youtube or music. It's way less effort than trying to run cat6 everywhere, and better throughput than powerline, especially going out to the shop.I do run in bridge mode, so I'm not using Eero to do do routing/firewall - I really got it to do mesh wifi, and it does that brilliantly. The automatic firmware updates happen overnight during low/no usage periods, quickly, and I've never actually noticed it happening.

Title: Simple solution for a traditionally complex problem
Review Comment: Delivers seamless and continuous wifi coverage throughout the whole house.  Previously, we had been using multiple wireless routers which each created a separate SSID/Network which apps and connected devices couldn't communicate with each other if they were on different SSID's.  This caused many problems and hassles, let alone managing and resetting various routers.  Especially when I started adding smart home devices this became a bigger issue.Setup was simple and quick.  I like that they are constantly improving the device and apps, and I can create profiles for different family members and associate their devices to their profile, then create schedules for when their wifi on their device will or will not work, or if someone looses wifi privileges, i can disable them not the rest of the house.Best of all, their support is phenomenal!!  Quick, detailed responses, and they follow up to make sure the issue are resolved.  I plan to get one for my parent house, which will make their setup simpler, and I will have the ability to remotely login without having to drive to their house.

Title: Fantastic!
Review Comment: Completely happy with my eero system. Coverage in perfect in my three story home. Probably one of the best technology purchases I've made.

Title: Great product; tutorial on bridge mode could be a huge help for a house with lots of wireless devices
Review Comment: Having installed two of these systems, I can tell you they are extraordinarily easy to setup, and monitor through the iphone app. The setup is easy, intuitive, and the troubleshooting if the device is not in a good location was very helpful.My only suggestion (and it may already be corrected) is as follows. My network sits behind a firewall that is doing the DHCP. In order to get the device setup, and routing correctly for all the fun devices on my network (4 Sonos boxes, Ring doorbell, couple others), you must first setup EERO in front of the firewall. Next step was to then change the IP address to a range within the private network. And lastly, switch into bridge mode. It then takes 15-30 minutes as each EERO needs to restart, and pass along the info.This was critical in order for all the wireless devices to be able to talk to one another. I think a youtube video showing exactly how this works would be helpful. Again, it may be up there by the time someone reads this.

Title: Good but not great. Returned for Amplifi HD
Review Comment: good but not great. Returned for the Ubiquiti Amplifi HD. Better and less expensive from a real company, not a startup.

Title: End your WiFi woes. Wish I had purchased the Eero much earlier.
Review Comment: I was extremely skeptical of this solution as I consider myself (and take pride in) as being someone who is sophisticated in the ways of home networking. My wife and I moved to a new home and for the past 2 years have been struggling with trying to find a way to get predictable and reliable WiFi around the house.Our home has two levels and most of the time we saw extreme degradation in bandwidth once we were about 25-30 feet away from the router (Netgear AC1750). There must be some kind of building material that hampers the signal and I was hopeful that the AC1750, with it's 3 large antennas, would help solve this, but it was no good.  We resorted to using the AC1750, two Airport Extremes (Gen 2) using powerline ethernet to get full coverage of the house.  However, I consistently noted that my devices had a hard time switching to the strongest access point.Enter the Eero. A friend swore by it and reluctantly I plunked down $500 and thought that this solution would be going back to the manufacturer as yet another wifi solution that would fail to deliver. I was totally wrong. Installation was a breeze with the iPhone app and within 10 min, the system was up and running. I ran a few speed tests in the dead spots of the home and my wife was asking me why I was screaming. Performance at the edges of the house was the same as it was with direct line of sight to the primary router.  I also tested watching video as I passed from one end of the house to the other and you can see the Eero system intelligently and seamlessly switching access points once WiFi signal degrades.My only regret here is that I had waited so long to buy the product. Websites all have a faster load time and I was able to downgrade our service plan from Comcast from 100Mbps to 25Mbps since we primarily surf the web and watch Netflix. In an unexpected way, the Eero will actually pay for itself over time as we don't have to pay for higher bandwidth coming into our pipe.  Looks like my parents are getting a network upgrade with all of my old gear and I am also relieved to have cleared the house of a lot of peripherals. What a relief.One small feature request: please let us turn off the white status light so we can sleep at night.

Title: Problem solved!
Review Comment: We have a large and rambling house and always suffered from poor wi-fi coverage throughout. With eero, problem solved! Very easy to set up, I had a technical question that was answered promptly and fully. I would highly recommend this system, it completely solved what was a frustrating lack of coverage, well worth the dollars.

Title: High expectation, sad realitiy. Hope remains!
Review Comment: I was very excited for the potential but the reality fell short. The concept is amazing and on a simple setup this may work. In my home we have two separate WAN modems (from two separate ISPs) feeding into a TP-Link load balancing router to aggregate/route network bandwidth. That router handles DNS/NAT configurations and the EERO doesn't play well - so while we were able to eliminate dead zones (yes, it completely eliminated them!!) we weren't able to fully utilize the advantages of the load balancing router and with two PS4s, 7 iPads, 5 iPhones, 5 MacBooks, two desktops, and 68 HomeKit accessories we needed the bandwidth more than we needed to eliminate dead zones :-/

Title: What a relief!
Review Comment: It's so nice actually having the ability to use wifi without any problems. I haven't had to reset or reboot the router like I had to do at least every few days with all my previous routers. The speed does slow down the further I am from the original eero connected to the modem, but the consistency and reliability of a good signal throughout he house is amazing! Also, the customer service is great!

Title: Excellent coverage
Review Comment: Very pleased with the speed and coverage.

Title: Poor quality product.
Review Comment: This product is highly disappointing. The network in unstable. The range is low, and the speed is dismal. I bought $1,500 worth of units and had to yank them all out

Title: Solved the challenges of setting up wifi in older home
Review Comment: Eero solved our wifi challenge.  We live in a 1938 house with metal lath in all of the interior walls, so we could not find a way to run one network in the house without a bunch of repeaters.  Enter Eero and in 15 minutes it was 'problem solved'.  One network with full signal across the house.

Title: which I easily can tune even when not at home
Review Comment: This is the first wi-fi system that provides full coverage for any of my two homes.Also the family controls, which I easily can tune even when not at home.I've gone through various different configurations during the last 5 years and ended up with decent coverage in 90% of one of my homes using two wi-fi routers and one repeater. In my other home there are two houses about 100 ft apart, which where connected using a wi-fi extender that gave a very weak connection in the second home.I bought 3 eero for each of my homes and got great coverage everywhere!The biggest advantage is that the setup was a breeze!Just getting the simple setup and remote management, makes me recommend eero even for smaller homes where only one is needed.The two downsides I've found are that a US phone is currently needed (one of my homes is in Europe) and the dependency on the Eero cloud.

Title: Kinda worked
Review Comment: It did improve my wifi coverage but wasn't compatible with my WEMO or Nest video camera.

Title: That was a good move on my part considering the issues with delivery ...
Review Comment: PROS: I bought it because I didn't want to wait for Luma. That was a good move on my part considering the issues with delivery that they are having. eero does deliver on all fronts, just as advertised. The setup was extremely easy, the performance is solid, and the devices are aesthetically pleasing.CONS: The one drawback that I find, and I just can't seem to get over is the obvious lack of ANY sort of reporting. The app is literally a single page that tells you your devices are online, and what the results of the last speed test were (which is normally wrong). Other then that, you can only set up a rudimentary schedule for the kids that 'pauses' the internet. There is nothing that shows you total bandwidth used, types of sites (streaming media, social media, etc) or which device is using all of your bandwidth. This device would be horrible for someone with metered bandwidth, or data caps.All in all, I am happy with the product. It does what is says it will, and doesn't over-promise anything. It has potential to be a market leader, but they just need to improve the feature set or others will surely will.

Title: Worth every penny, astonishing speed, simple setup, yet highly capable
Review Comment: Im an electrical engineer and computer enthusiast.  I don't generally write a lot of reviews, however in this case the product is so outstanding I thought I would add my voice to the thousand others.I have a 1300 square foot single floor condominium with high speed internet.  It would seem Eero would not be targeting me; with only drywall, a single wifi router should work.After trying multiple types of wifi routers, including twice getting the latest generation AirPort Extreme router, I was frustrated with dropouts, start stops, timeouts, and interrupted streaming.I'm not entirely sure, but I do think there were issues with the AirPort and my ISP around DNS, where some of the stuttering was due to IP address resolution potentially due to the IPv6 neighbor discovery protocol.  Or, perhaps it was crowding on the frequency due to 15 in range networks.Regardless, by plugging in two Eeros (in 5 minutes), all those problems VANISHED and my internet speeds from my wifi devices increased by an order of magnitude.  I now have a third Eero for redundancy. They work like a charm.Simple, fast, perhaps not inexpensive - nonetheless I recommend without reservation.

Title: The units come nicely package and the installation is very simple
Review Comment: Bought this a few weeks ago for my parents home which is large. Thought I would set this up in once section of the house and see if I could get it work first and then buy an additional three units if the three worked ok. I have set up numerous Wi-Fi hotspots in my home without problems so I have some experience in this area.The units come nicely package and the installation is very simple. The reason for the three stars? Poor reception. Even keeping the three units to one section of the house there was poor connection between the units. Only line of sight would work. Anything between the units including one wall or around a corner and it would not work. Not ideal for what I was trying accomplish.Returned to Amazon without any fuss about 10 days after I had purchased.

Title: It was hard trying to place the modem in a room where all the media in the house would get good wifi. The eero fixed that
Review Comment: The product does what it says it will do.  We "cut the cord" so to speak and went away from cable and dish and started streaming everything.  It was hard trying to place the modem in a room where all the media  in the house would get good wifi.  The eero fixed that.  The app is easy to use as well.  I would highly recommend.

Title: I'm in love with Eero
Review Comment: I was nervous spending this kind of money on something I wasn't sure was gonna work for me, but I am so happy with eero, I did a side by side speed comparison with my wifi router and eero, bottom line from my  router I was getting 30mbps and from the eero 90mbps, never have I had wireless speed so high

Title: problematic and frustrating
Review Comment: speeds never lived up to specs, the app is too limited and leaves power users frustrated and wanting more, worse part is that the system go offline randomly the last time corrupting my timecapsule backup.

Title: Wonderful setup experience, but our internet speeds took a huge hit...
Review Comment: We were really looking forward to having a mesh network 'cover' our home. This Eero network was the 'big present to myself' after having been tortured by years of slow internet AT&T (max 18mps.. no, that is not missing a zero). This was to be the one-time big ticket purchase that was going to be the cherry-on-the-top of making a big investment in having an internet that just works. Sadly, it didn't work and the gear is going back.details:We recently took the plunge and set up fast internet in the house (averages 120mps download speed UPSTAIRS, a long way from the existing router); however, the Netgear router signal was a little sketchy in the back of the house (it would drop to 25-65mps) where we have a home office. So, I convinced my family that we should test this new and highly rated mesh-network system.set upWe loved unboxing and setting up the Eero 3-pack: it was a great experience. Well, done Eero team! I wish you guys were in charge of everything internet-connected we have to set up in our home.installationSet-up was a breeze and we followed the instructions carefully to place the three Eero boxes were they would perform best.performanceHowever, the mood then turned somewhat discouraging, when we discovered that while we were sitting IN the actual room with the modem and the 'mothership' Eero device, the top speeds immediately dropped from 128mps to 50-58mps while we were only 2 feet away and (of course) had perfect line-of-sight.In the office in the back of the house, the speed dropped from 65mps we were getting from the Netgear router to only 12mps, even while the second satellite Eero was plugged in line-of-sight with the Mothership, but just around a single corner from the office laptop (new construction; wood frame house). Upstairs in my office was even worse: speeds that had been 120mps/downlaod with Netgear plummeted to so slow that I couldn't even run Ookla Speedtest; the Ping test wouldn't even load! Good god. We tried moving the device to right next to the iMac, to the top of the file cabinet. but, essentially, I'd lost all 'workable' connection.the endI can't tell you how much I hate the ugly Netgear box (and all other boxes like this) but I guess you can guess how much: $499.00 worth of 'get this thing out of my house'. And I really like the look and user-experience of the Eero system. But, sadly, by the end of the day, after spending nearly the whole Friday afternoon  and most of dinner time with my technical son, and two other smarties-pants family members, trying to troubleshoot this system, we gave up. It was too late to call Customer Support and now: the weekend. After testing ~15 different positions around the house for the Eero devices, my family just wanted to watch Netflix and put the Eero system away. My son gave me a big hug, and said: 'I know you really wanted this, mom. It is cool, but it just doesn't work with our house.' Then he walked around, unplugged everything, boxed up the gear, and put everything back how it was. I know that I am unusual in having a system that already was working fine; but that's how much I hate the look of Netgear with all the are-you-insane-product-designers-or-what and their ridiculously brilliant flashing lights (as if we want those in our house; let me guess: oh, hmm, did engineers run the design team?).But, this is one time that beautiful design and a wonderful concept failed in execution. So back it goes. Maybe: it's a Comcast thing? Who knows. Well, whatever it is (and this is aimed at you, Eero team) the Netgear guys with their dumb design somehow figured out how to make the high speed connection work.Comcast - Motorola SB6141 'Surfboard' Modem - Netgear (tested: Eero, but reset to Netgear).22 internet connected devices: Nest, multiple computers, Roku, Chromecast, Apple TV, DVD, Smart TV, four phones, 6 iOS tablets.

Title: Pleased to say
Review Comment: FINALLY, a router system that reaches all corners of our home... and beyond, WITHOUT COMPRISING SIGNAL STRENGTH or SPEED (those who've experienced similar woes should comprehend the need for Caps in that statement). Considering our home and numerous other devices are run via wifi, and, anticipating more to come, this unit is well worth the investment!Set-up was simple and straightforward; finding placement for the three units was key, but not difficult. NOTE: Only challenge:  all but one of our Roku devices/TVs failed to connect to wifi after install. I waited 48+ hours for Eero auto updates before calling their customer Service.  Pleased to say, C/S was excellent.  Time Warner is our internet provider. Their Arris Surfboard 6183 Modem didn't seem to play well with the Eero system. I purchased my own Asus Surfboard 6190 (benefit: no longer paying rental fee) and Bingo!, all connected. No issues since, which is saying alot for the number of devices connected (Tablets, laptops, thermostadefs, printers).  C/S Follow-up is outstanding.

Title: I absolutely would recommend it to anyone who asked
Review Comment: Simple setup and reliable operation. I have never had to reboot it in 2 months I have owned it. I absolutely would recommend it to anyone who asked!

Title: This Is A Game Changer
Review Comment: I have had trouble covering my entire house for years and have tried EVERYTHING.  Nothing worked. Watching Netflixs, Amazon, etc. was a nightmare as each app would "buffer" periodically.  What a hassle!  I had pretty much given up and considered rewiring my house with ethernet so that I could place routers in each area of the house.  When I read the reviews about eero, I was skeptical but desperate.  Knowing that Amazon has a good return policy, I took the risk.  eero arrived and was incredibly easy to set up.  I have been watching Netflixs, Amazon, etc. while having Sonos playing in another room and EVERYTHING WORKS.  It has now been a couple of weeks and NO BUFFERING.  We are extremely happy and look forward to eeros continuing to make their product even better.  This is a game changer!

Title: BLUF: download speed increased 3x, upload increased 2x
Review Comment: Installed my eero yesterday. BLUF: download speed increased 3x, upload increased 2x.My average download speed with my old ASUS1200gr was 6.4mps. (I did 3 speed tests in each corner of my house as well as my family room and too the average.).Once I installed the eero, the average jumped to 19.09mps.I pay for 25mps.Of note, my family room reading (I do streaming tv) went from 16.8mps to 24.94mps.My daughter's bedroom (had the slowest speed in the house) went from a download speed of 0.86mps to 15.65mps!Admittedly, I did have one hiccup and that's that I have fiber optic so instead of a modum, I have a switch so that caused an initial failure of the install routine. I called the support number and the lady on the other end troubleshot the install (took two more attempts before the nature of the problem was found. The solution was to leave my ASUS router in place as a bridge and connect the eero to it. Not the most elegant solution but I didn't have another use for the ASUS anyway.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Highly recommend buying this product

Title: Not great for our business
Review Comment: Not great for our business, had to return. After successfully setting Eeros at our home, i decided to try for our 40 person business that solely does internet surfing (no video). Our business bandwith usages are less per month than a home with multiple kids that play online games and stream video. We used the eero in its recommended configuration where it was the main router not just a Access Point and while it worked with light traffic it failed when everyone connected, i was told by Eero support that each node can support up to 100 clients so we were far below that. Each eero had a hardwire ethernet connection to it to provide the best quality speed to them as their source, the main eero unit box just kept going online and offline and within an hour had to put our old Netgear R7300 back online and we were fine for the remainder of the day. We ended up using instead the Netgear Nighthawk X8 and all staff is happy and speeds from the one unit were similar as with 6 of the eeros, that was NOT the case with our old R7300 so from this test and particular use we will be keeping a single box vs 6 boxes. I find it very confusing that some of the reviews here on amazon state that tech support tells them that a user can have TOO MANY eeros in a space, Eero needs to work that out, we had our 6 spaced 30 to 40 feet apart and each was connected using their app. They are going to get a lot of returns until they tighten up that supposed problem with some firmware or hardware modifications. IT guy for thousands.

Title: VERY easy setup and works as well as claimed
Review Comment: VERY easy setup and works as well as claimed.  I have a max 50Mps download from my ISP and that's about what I have now all over my 4,000 sq.ft. home; an incredible improvement.  Customer service was terrific.  I went down a rabbit hole when setting the 3 units up and later trying to rename each of them.  I called customer service and they answered immediately and took care of everything within 2 minutes.

Title: Looks great, with nice footprint
Review Comment: I bought the euro system last month. I have an Apple Airport Extreme Base Station and a Scientific Atlanta modem with TDS as the cable provider.Pros:Came impressively packaged.Looks great, with nice footprint.Customer support is easy to get in touch with and wants to be helpful.Controlled by a smartphone.Con:It didn’t work.I was unable to set it up. I called Customer Support  (CS). We chatted for 45 minutes, but they were unable to get it set up. We tried about everything. They said they’d escalate it and get back to me.We talked again several days later and tried a bunch of things. Nothing worked.We exchanged several emails. I suggested it must be the modem, and offered to go out and buy a different modem. They weren’t interested.I returned it and got my $500 back. I then bought a $90 Netgear Extender and now wifi works in all the areas of my house.

Title: We got Eero due to its glowing reviews and we figured if we weren't happy, we'd spring for the second modem
Review Comment: Can't say enough about Eero. We were on our last leg with our wi-fi. We live in a big home and our wi-fi signal was very weak in many rooms, including our family room. Most of the time our apple tv wouldn't work. We got Eero due to its glowing reviews and we figured if we weren't happy, we'd spring for the second modem. Eero was so easy to set up. We have three units and they are more than enough for our house, yard, garage to have full signal. So happy, I love this start up, they make a great product.

Title: Won't work for wifi calling
Review Comment: Don't count on this system if you plan on using wifi calling.  Eero team was contacted about this issue and said the system won't support wifi calling if you need more than one eero.  Just ok for everything else.  Sending it all back.

Title: Nice!
Review Comment: Really works. Very much worth it. Solves coverage around the house. No more noticing slow response then manually having to select the closest wifi or extender. Seemless just what I needed for whole home wifi. It's also simple set up and the app is nice to use as a sort of dashboard (e.g. how many devices connected, speed test, and if each unit us up or down).

Title: Follow instructions carefully and test best locations for installation
Review Comment: Have a ranch style cottage Maui, Hawaii and was struggling to get coverage in all rooms, presto, eero came to the rescue. Follow instructions carefully and test best locations for installation. Solved my problems 100% !

Title: Pricy but worth it
Review Comment: I purchased this for my parents. Their house has many dead zones and I have tried many different routers and router plus extenders and nothing ever fixed the problem. I have had the eero system for a month and it has worked wonderfully. They are now able to get a strong signal everywhere. The one downside is that the system is pretty pricy.

Title: This is the first time I have had a Wi-Fi signal to every corner of my house EVER!
Review Comment: This router is AWSOME! After buying 4 different range extenders and 3 new "powerful" Wi-Fi routers I was not able to get a signal in the areas I need to.  I was at my wits end.  A two story brick house  of less than 4,000 sq. ft. shouldn't be this hard to get a signal in all the 4 bedrooms.  The eero looks beautiful in design, easy to setup, and it works like a champ.  I had my security system set up connect to it and had a small issue with connecting over a "Home Wire" device.  I called them and had an answer in less than 5 minuets.I have never had an easier time getting this to work and solve all my Wi-Fi signal at the same time.  Forget all the "NEW & IMPROVED"routers and get an eero IT WORKS!

Title: Might work for some but not for me- very disappointed.
Review Comment: This sounded great.  It did not work for me.  I wanted to extend wi fi to my basement and to my pool area.  Neither of these locations could get a signal.  I was told that the units had to be within 40 feet and that having sight access between the base and ancillary units was best.  Gee whiz- if you are within forty feet and have sight access the existing router works fine.  My pool area get a pretty good signal with an extender but eero was a no go.  Might work for some but caveat emptor..

Title: Get the eero, you won't regret it.
Review Comment: I switched over from managing our home network myself (I felt like I had a pretty good setup going) over to the eero mostly because I was curious to see how well it worked. After letting it run things for a couple months I can say I won't be going back. We have had not had to reset or tweak anything since we set it up. It has been fast, much faster than our prior setup, and extremely reliable. I love the guest wifi setup allowing me to quickly test a one-time use password to friends who are over. UX is simple and easy I imagine even for people with little to no understanding of networks. One side note, make sure you get a good cable​ modem instead of the crummy one provided by your ISP, do a little research and it will save you money and give you better internet.

Title: Very pleased.
Review Comment: Easy to set up and has worked without any issues since installed. The only challenge is that the units need to be within sight of one another more than what I understood when I purchased them. Thankfully my home is and open floor plan which helped them recognize one another. I'm not sure how well an upstairs unit would work without an open floor plan. But I love the system and it works great.

Title: Good but not great
Review Comment: 3 star review because the price doesn't justify the value. If it was cheaper I would probably give it 5 stars but I expect top hardware when paying $500 (3 pack, comes to $166 per router which can buy a premium router with better range).  It uses 2x2 MIMO when 3x3 (communicate on 3 streams) is the standard for top routers (and laptops). It sacrifices some hardware power in order to look good and be relatively small.Eero is the best looking router, comes in a package like an Apple Product. A lot of attention to detail, simplicity, and aesthetics. Just like an Apple product it costs more than it's competition. It is very easy to set up however the app could have more features. It's perfect for a novice or clueless tech person with a good paying job. Nothing to think about and can easily add/manage a guest network.I have no problems with the network dropping off and I am a heavy user. The bottom of my Eero is very hot. No visible vents, I am hope no over-heating issues occur because I am cheap when it comes to air conditioning my home.My house has ethernet in most rooms, my Eero's are connected together via ethernet (through a gigabit switch). So they talk to each other through ethernet with my set up so I get fast speeds on each floor of my house.  I thought Eero's software would just make my life simple and I liked the idea of being able to control and monitor my network on an app but the app just focuses on simplicity and not features like showing how much data each device uses and other advanced stuff.If a new version came out that was 3x3 and perhaps physically bigger to allow for better internal antennas (improve range) then I would truly be excited about this product. For me it was just a waste of money.  I could have bought a router and additional wireless access point to solve the problem in my home and saved $300.

Title: Completely happy with the EERO system!
Review Comment: I was impatiently waiting for EERO to become available in advance of purchasing a larger home, and for my relatives with large homes and spotty Wi-Fi.  The day has come for me to purchase the three-pack and give them a try. We are staying with our in-laws until our home is built, and their house was using three separate wireless routers to cover the home, with each one connecting to the modem via an Ethernet cable.  I replaced all the routers with the EERO units.  What a difference!!!  We have super coverage over the entire home and even outside by the pool!!  Though I am a power user, and slightly frustrated with the lack of "under the hood" access, the simplicity is satisfying (as long as it works).  I know that when I try to take the EERO units with me when the house is ready, my father-in-law won't let me remove them!!!  I am very happy and will update if necessary later.

Title: Works as advertised Easy setup great coverage through out my home
Review Comment: Works as advertised  Easy setup great coverage through out my home.  Worth the price!

Title: Singularly the best WiFi solution on the market.
Review Comment: Singularly the best WiFi solution on the market.Had trouble on the first day and after the firmware update, I have forgotten I have WifFi because it just functions perfectly on all three floors of my home.  EVERYTHING in my fully automated home works perfectly and simultaneously without issue. Echo, Streaming TV's, iPads, Mac, PC Workstations, Sonos, Nest, Streaming Security Video, and carries a separate guest network.

Title: Worth Every Penny
Review Comment: I live in an old ranch home, and in order to get High-Speed DSL - the router had to be placed at the complete back of our house in the master bedroom.  Nightmare scenario for getting wifi to our living room (where our DVR sits) as well as to our study.  We were using all sorts of WIFI extenders, even creating a second network using our electrical outlets to get wifi to the front of our house.  Unless you were using wifi in our bedrooom the signal was always dropping - we couldn't use on-demand options through our Satellite provider because our dvr kept losing the signal.I had been looking at eero for a while, but the price seemed prohibitive.  Finally, after yet another night of using airplay to broadcast a buffered signal we were streaming online to our TV to watch a show ( which we should easily be able to download in HD to our DVR), I gave in.  I ordered eero, it arrived under 48 hour hours and in less than 10 minutes I was downloading entire seasons to my dvr.  I am getting more than double the speeds out of our wifi, and our entire home has wifi on the same network.Could not be happier.

Title: With my previous wireless system, several times per week ...
Review Comment: With my previous wireless system, several times per week part or all of my house stopped getting Wifi signal and I thought it had something to do with my ISP, until someone in another city told me they had the same issue and solved it by switching to eero. I did not want to throw out my previous system (which I'm selling now) but after getting fed up with the problem I decided to buy 3 eero's and have been using it for more than a month and the problem of loosing signal in all or part of the house has disappeared.

Title: Delighted with Eero
Review Comment: I started with two, but it turned out I needed three to get from the far end of the main house through the garage and upstairs to my studio. Once I had all three, the speed and reliability were fantastic. So easy to set up and so trouble free. I just put everybody on the guest network so the main network would remain free of viruses and lurkers. There are two teenagers in the house with multitudes of friend who all use wifi for their phones, notebooks, and laptops. They have not affected the speed at all. I'm impressed! Oh, and this was after replacing the modem twice, and utilizing three different routers just to get the house up to speed. Obviously none of them worked as well as I wanted them to. I'm very happy with my Eeros.

Title: Sucks, just like other wifi.  Only this time I spent a lot more to get.
Review Comment: Ugh, I spent $1,000 to set up my house with EERO.  7 units to cover 5,000 sq foot house.  They go offline the time. 5 of the seven were not working yesterday.  Tech told me I have too many units. But they don't/can't give guidance on what to take offline.  He said to just experiment, which is a dopey suggestion.  I have to take hours to make your product work?  That sounds like a bad business model (especially if paid too much).I asked them to find me someone locally to pay to address.  They don't have that network.I offered to fly their tech guy in to deal with (I dont't time my self) and they won't do that.Feels like its malfunctioning units problem, which they don't know or aren't saying.  Beau was nice in tech support though.If you are busy, and want stuff to be as easy as Eero ads promise (its a lie) then you need to try someone else.

Title: Absolutely Love It!
Review Comment: This product works as advertised! I had very poor reception at certain parts of my house and now the signal is strong and fast.  Very happy with this purchase, it's a little expensive but well worth it!

Title: Its just okay, not worth the price tag.
Review Comment: Its not as great as I was expecting it to be. I got the 3 pack and set them up as directed in the app which was pretty easy to do. It also does provide whole house coverage and we don't have problems with loosing connection to the wifi like we use to. Setup and whole house coverage are two features it does very well.Here is where I am disappointed, the wifi signal is not as strong the further away you get from the main one like they advertise. I have a 150mbps plan with Comcast. The main hub that is connected to the modem, when I am near that one I have no problem getting the 150+. As I get to the furtherest one upstairs, my speed tests go down to anywhere from 50mbps to maybe 80mbps at most.Second thing is the app is very lacking in features. First off, I previously had the Google Onhub and that app had great features such as telling me how much data a specific connected device used and you could even change the timeframe to see different lengths of times. Eero app does not have this feature. Second thing is the speed test feature inside the Eero app is worthless. I will use speedtest.net app and get 150mbps result, go straight to the Eero app and get 80mp if I'm lucky. Sometimes the Eero app will do a speed test and tell me 15mbps.I am most likely returning these as the price tag is just way to high for something with less features than other routers and doesn't provide reliable speeds throughout the house.

Title: Changed my life!!  Excellent in all ways!
Review Comment: I have an old three level house.  I'm very tech savvy and wifi has been a total hassle in this house. I've bought top of the line routers, range extenders, and its all just been a total pain in the rear for one reason or another.I read about eero in a science magazine, and it sounded too good to be true.  So I bought the 3pack.WOW!  Works exactly as advertised.  Setup was so easy with the app.  ZERO HASSLE.  no complicated advanced settings to hassle with. No more dead spots. Excellent speed throughout my entire house - and outside too!The ethernet ports on the back are great for the smart TV.  Did I mention NO HASSLE.  everyone in the family isvhappy. Visitors are happy.  I'm happy.  No more wasting hours of my life on ugly overpriced wifi routers!Eero rules!!!  I'm so stoked.  Their marketing materials are spot on!  Home Wi-Fi is a huge part of enjoying the modern home.  Eero nailed it.  Literally changed my life!Buy it!!!!  Ignore the negative reviews.  This is a 5-star product, I promise you!!

Title: Does not worked in a mixed wired/wireless environment
Review Comment: Good solution, if you are all wireless, but it cannot handle a mix between wired and wireless.When setting it up initially, while the second unit was in line of sight (had an unobstructed view) of the first unit, where my old equipment was installed, and even although it was plugged into Ethernet, it could not connect.  I had to move it closer to the first unit, then it could connect.  Upstairs, it could not connect at all, since there was no line of sight, even although it was connected via Ethernet. I measured the downstairs connectivity of the 2 units and the network seemed slightly stronger than my Apple-based router/extender (hence the second star), but i will have to return the package, since I cannot get the third unit to work.  Based on the schematics on eero's site, I assume I would need 5-6 units to get my two-story 2,000 sqft home to work, and it's just not worth the investment.Waiting for v2 of the eero - might give it another try once it works with wired and not just wireless

Title: Excellent router for our large home
Review Comment: We have a 3 story Dutch colonial home built in 1913.  It is a barn of a home.  Over the years we have tried getting wifi coverage with a variety of routers.  Most recently we used a Motorola (now Arris) cable modem router combo device which provided us with spotty performance.  A few months ago we bought and installed the 3 unit eero system-one unit on each of our 3 floors and our wifi performance has been much improved.  The eero system so far has worked well with our old Motorola cable modem,

Title: Previously used Apple router and Eero works better. I only give 4 stars instead of 5 ...
Review Comment: Works very well. Previously used Apple router and Eero works better. I only give 4 stars instead of 5 because our internet provider is so crummy.

Title: Works great for our two story house.
Review Comment: It works great. It was simple to setup. Just put a little thought about where you place the base units. They are supposed to be in line of sight from one another, but just not being too far apart (15 feet?) is sufficient. The three I have downstairs blanket the upstairs with WiFi now, where most of the rooms would fall short in the past. If I had a problem, I'd move a base unit upstairs.I have tried all manner of routers like the Nighthawk and other high powered single routers. I am done buying more routers. I'm sticking with this Eero.If your house is really big,  you may want to buy extra base stations. It's not magic, but it's definitely a better setup than any single router solution I've experienced.

Title: Ridiculously easy to setup
Review Comment: Ridiculously easy to setup.  Seems to work great.  I get overwhelmingly faster wifi speeds then ever before. Great device.  I would love to see more features for the app like analytics on users consumption and time and destinations.  Reports, graphs and exports of those activity logs.  Overall, a great producing.  Great work.  Hope it truly gets better and better.

Title: I did have trouble with it early than I called ...
Review Comment: I did have trouble with it early than I called customer service, they help me answer all the questions I have, now is working fine

Title: Had doubts, 3 weeks in, doubts gone
Review Comment: I had huge doubts when I began to set these up because the second one I tried to setup was struggling to connect to the first. I did a little reading and they suggest keeping them within line-of-sight of one another. This isn't really possible in my apartment unless I owned maybe 8 or 9 of them and then it would just be an apartment covered in eeros and plugs, not something I want. Fortunately, I was able to position it just outside of line-of-sight and was able to get them to connect. The following morning, however, they had disconnected from one another again which got me insanely worried but they did reconnect without me doing anything other than restarting the first one.However, since that initial hiccup, it has been unbelievably good. I was previously running a Netgear Nighthawk C7000 and an R7000 (separately across months) and both failed miserably. Neither of these routers are particularly cheap either which made it all the more annoying. My best speed with the R7000, which was the router I was using before switching to eeros, was maxing out at about 190 Mbps in the room where it was located. The speed instantly rocketed up to 290 Mbps which is faster than I'm actually paying for, no one tell Comcast.I purposefully get a WiFi spot check in various rooms before making the switch so I could get an accurate read out on whether or not the eeros actually improved my network reliability or speed. Here's some of the changes averaged out across 3 tests lasting 10 seconds each (rooms with an eero in them have been marked as such):Living room (eero): 190 Mbps to 290 MbpsKitchen: 110 Mbps to 200 MbpsBathroom: 75 Mbps to 145 MbpsMaster bedroom (eero): 15 Mbps to 120 Mbps (the original speed was actually a major reason I looked into eeros)Second bedroom: 45 Mbps to 150 Mbps(The remaining eero is located in my hallway, which I never tested before hand)On top of the speed improvements, it also allowed me to wire in certain devices which have rather poor connections regardless of WiFi speed such as a PS4, Roku, and Apple TV. A major improvement was the reliability of my Philips Hue box. Since I could now put it in a more reasonable location than my living room (which had no bulbs in it), I'm now able to use my Hue bulbs very consistently without bulbs disconnecting from the box.I've been raving about these to friends and family like crazy and I plan to purchase another three to really create a ridiculous home network with an eero in my second bedroom, kitchen, and maybe at the opposite end of my hallway (I have an T shaped hallway). You should buy!

Title: Eero does not support PPPoe, otherwise would be perfect.
Review Comment: I bought this set to use in Hong Kong where flats are tiny and have many concrete walls which normally block wifi signal. One thing I missed was that Eero does not support PPPoe while my ISP is using such setting, the only way to solve this issue is router on router.I went straight to Apple Store to buy an Airport Extreme and an Airport Express (thanks to the return policy) to try. I plugged in the Airport Extreme and tried the wifi signal, hoping it can cover my tiny flat. In the living room the speed was 90mbs out of 100mbs, while in the study it dropped to 20mbs which is unacceptable.Desperately, I used the router on router option for Eero and placed one in living room and another one in study room. I did the speed test again and WOW! 90mbs in both the living room and study room! It dropped to 70mbs in master bedroom and kitchen which is acceptable, but I can always add another Eero if needed in the future.Satisfied with the result, I took away the Airport Extreme and tried the setting with Airport Express, same testing result. So Airport Extreme is going back to Apple.

Title: It Works
Review Comment: Love this thing. House is about 3700 sq ft and has some dead spots in corners and on back porch around pool. I have used the Netgear Plug-In Wi-Fi Range Extenders over the past year and yes they do work....problem with these is every time you move into another area that is covered by one you have to login into that extender so there is no smooth transition throughout the house. Someone recommended the eero system and after researching it I decided to take the leap and purchase it. It's amazingly simple to set up and speeds are improved, doubled in my situation compared to range extenders. I think it's a lot of money to drop down but after using it for a couple months I am very pleased and would do it again. NO switching to the closest extender anymore, just works wherever you go using the mesh network within your home. I have coverage in the dead spots and out by the pool. I have a Pentair pool wifi controller, WD My Cloud network drive and Sonos bridge all connected through a switch that is connected through the wired eero box. This was the only tricky part using the ATT gateway that is located in a not so ideal laundry room. You must have one of the eero boxes hardwired so I hooked mine up in the office (not the laundry room with the gateway directly) and it worked thankfully. Took a little work to reconnect devices to the new eero network (most people won't have this problem I'm guessing) and then everything was accessible.

Title: It's worth every penny
Review Comment: Hand down easiest router setup ever.  I'm a technology guy and this blew my mind. The speeds and ease you get with this is worth the investment.  I went from 30mbps to 95mbps.  My range increased as well.

Title: Confirmed - just as good as advertised!
Review Comment: Perfect solution to cover a large two-story house.  We have heavy users (streaming video, game systems, multiple phones, tablets, laptops, DVRs, etc.) at every corner of the house and the three pack covers everything very nicely.  It did take 24 hours and a firmware update to get to full speed, but it took care of itself.  Running the microwave used to make every wifi device pause, but not anymore!A setup tip:  The quality of the system is sensitive to the placement of each unit.  If a unit is not getting a good signal, try moving it 6 inches in any direction. One unit had a very poor connection when placed behind a speaker, but moving to the side on the speaker allowed a full strength signal and full speed.A bonus - the most recent update added the ability for family control.  The kids' devices can be set to Pause each night - no more sneaking videos after bedtime.

Title: Awesome!
Review Comment: Easy to set-up and works great!

Title: Easiest router I ever had to install. Also works ...
Review Comment: Easiest router I ever had to install. Also works perfectly, fast wifi with only one eero that covers my whole apartment.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Great product

Title: Setup was easy. IT JUST WORKS
Review Comment: It. Just. Works.In a big house with a lot of metal in the walls, I've suffered through many models of Wi-Fi routers, trying to get coverage in this or that remote wins and usually failing, even with repeaters (that rarely worked). So, the Eero system seemed very promising and IT WORKS. I do occasionally have issues where a device will "stick" with a farther-away Eero and refuse to switch to the closer one but this event is unusual, not the norm. I suspect it has more to do with the device's firmware and no Eero. Setup was easy. IT JUST WORKS.

Title: Honest review from an Xbox One gamer
Review Comment: I really don't understand what other people are doing wrong in their setup.  I purchased the 3 unit system, since even though I had fast wifi with a Verizon router (their top of the line router as of 2016), with two separate modem spots at opposite ends of the house, I still had dead spots that made no sense to me whatsoever.  My office is above my kitchen, and my wifi would be dropped by every device there, not more than 20 ft from the router.  I understand that this is through the floor... But should at least have decent connectivity.  Furthermore, my xbox was less than 10 feet from my 2nd router, and it would only show 2 or 3 out of 4 bars.  I would also get tons of lag while playing the division.  And to top it off, my TV would drop its connection when streaming movies from my computer.Needless to say, Verizon was not helpful.  They offered to sell an extender for $99, which didn't make much sense to me since again, the router was only 10 feet away.  So, I turned to eero.  From opening the box to surfing the net, it took roughly 20 minutes.  At first I was worried, since my 100/100 speed was showing up as 40/37.  But after maybe an hour (the instructions say it could take up to 24 hours to optimize) I was at full blast.  Please view the pic as a reference.The last test was playing on the Xbox.  I hard wired the Xbox to one of my eeros since there were many complaints about signal swapping with them.  the gaming had no lag at all, and I did not notice any sort of drop in connectivity.  Played for about an hour.This system is super fast, amazingly easy to set up, user friendly and has a decent app to go with it.  i highly recommend this to anyone with dead spot problems in their house.

Title: Brilliant
Review Comment: This is incredibly easy to set up and is blazing fast, even in parts of my house that didn't use to be able to access the internet. Brilliant product and brilliant of me to purchase it

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Also excellent technical support team if you need to speak to them

Title: Set it and forget it
Review Comment: Extremely easy to use and install.  My house is about 3,200 sq feet, I have two eeros on the main floor on opposite sides of the house, and the third on the lower living floor.  I get full coverage across all three living levels of the house, in tiled bathrooms, in the backyard, etc.  I have not found a real  'dead zone' yet.  It's expensive, but it works as promised and you'll never have to think about your wifi again.

Title: Easy setup, fantastic speed, great coverage
Review Comment: I replaced a few Apple Airport (Express and Extreme) routers with these 3 devices and haven't looked back.  The speed is much better as is the reliability.  Setup was easy and Eero keeps adding new features that make it better over time.

Title: clear instructions and easy installation. Very significant improvement in WiFi accessibility and ...
Review Comment: An impressive product that works exactly as advertised. Well designed, clear instructions and easy installation. Very significant improvement in WiFi accessibility and speeds throughout the house. One small warning: installation is a bit more difficult if you have a Sonos system. As I understand it, both Sonos and eero create their own private networks, and to be able to operate Sonos from, say, your iPad, you have to configure Sonos to use the eero network. Not a huge issue, but adds a little complexity to the initial installation. Once installed, you don't ever have to think about it again! I don't write reviews very often, but this product is a winner!
