Title: For once, full house coverage at full speed!
Review Comment: I looked at a lot of products, range extenders, and had tried some cheap ones with terrible results.  My house is not tiny and has a lot of stone, so I had gaps in my signal, especially in my main office.  I had two of three signal bars, but I was only getting around 9MB/sec download.I installed the Eero, which was a LOT easier than I expected (it took me 15 minutes to install three), and after placing them and only wiring one of them to the internet, I went from spotty coverage all over the house with occasional disconnects to a solid 125MB/sec all over the house.So a solid 5-stars from me.

Title: EERO 3-pack is great for a 5,000 s.f. home -- dead zones completely eliminated
Review Comment: The eero has changed everything in our household.  We have a 5,000 square foot home with 3 floors to cover.  The house is long and the cable modem and old router were in the office at the furthest end of the house.  We used high-quality updated routers with after-market antennas yet we still could not keep a decent enough signal at the opposite end of the main floor to run a webcam in the dining room (furthest point from router in office).  In addition we couldn't get adequate signal upstairs or in the basement.  With 10 ft. ceilings it made the distance to upstairs even further.  In the basement only one room directly under the router could get a decent signal.  eero has changed everything for us with respect to multiple dead zones and signal strength.  We used a 3-pack of EERO on the main floor only.  One where the old router was located at one end of the house, another in near the middle of the main floor and the third at the other end (dining room) of the main floor.  The signal strength is so good now we can use any wireless device, including phones, cameras, Hue lights and computers consistently on the main floor.  But.... what we didn't necessarily expect is that with these 3 units spread across the main floor the signal strength is good enough to cover the entire second floor as well as the entire basement.  I checked all areas using the WiFi Analyzer app on my android phone.  We even have signal strength in the garage to install a wifi security camera there as well.  Now we can use an iPad in the basement living room.  We can use any device in the bedrooms upstairs.  This product is extremely easy to set-up.  All you do is plug the first one in and do what your phone app tells you to do to set up the other two units.  It helps you place them appropriately.  We aren't using all features yet, but we plan to give priority to our OOMA voip telephone (also connected via wifi) so voice traffic gets priority over other traffic.  The units look nice on top of furniture or a desk.  I highly recommend an eero 3-pack for large homes!

Title: Just go buy the thing...
Review Comment: Just go buy this thing if you want flawless wifi all over your house and yard.  I bought this product with the hopes of having good wifi around my pool and that I could put Sonos speakers (that run on wifi) in my gazebo by my pool.  It works better than I could've ever imagined.  My previous setup had spotty reception at the back door.  Now I have full bars consistently on the other side of my pool (probably 50 ft from the back door). I was able to setup Sonos speakers out there and it works like a charm.The setup for this is about as easy as it gets. You might have to play with it a little bit once you get it setup with the placement of each Eero for maximum performance, but you could probably put them anywhere and it would work great. I tried them in a couple of different rooms, they worked great everywhere, but some configuration seemed to work a little better than others.Yes, it's expensive.  Like some reviews will tell you, if your a smart guy, you could probably rig up your own custom open mesh network that would the same for a fraction of the cost.  But I don't know how to do that, nor do I want to learn...I just want my wifi to work.  I recently cut the cable cord and we watch everything over streaming internet now, so I was able to justify this to my self.  This cost is just a few months of savings from not having a cable bill.There's a lot of cool little features the app has too.  I probably don't know them all, but it has a built in way to run a speed test.  It somehow makes my wifi faster.  My plan is "up to 25mbps" and before, I would get a wide range of results from 2-18mbps.  Rarely ever 20+.  Now with Eero, 28mbps is the norm.  It has an option where you can just text your network name and password to others you want to allow on your network.  There's also a way to create a guest network, which i haven't done yet, but seems like it would be ideal for maybe a Fantasy Football draft where you could grant a bunch of people temporary access to your network and then remove it afterwards.I've had trouble with wifi for years and this was my solution...man I wish I had this 5 years ago!

Title: Install was so easy that a caveman could do it
Review Comment: We've been dealing with spotty internet for years, and we often stream movies and TV shows in our basement on our smart TV, as well as on our computer. Since our router is upstairs, it would often disconnect and not want to even load Netflix, or any other site for that matter. Once I heard about Eero, I knew we had to try it, and boy was it a good choice. We haven't even had it a week, and I can already tell a big difference in connectivity. There hasn't been a single connectivity issue, and it was almost a daily occurrence before. The app is very easy to use to install and edit stuff otherwise, especially for people who don't know a whole lot in this field. I have recommended it to other people, and I would definitely recommend it to all of you who read this. It is definitely worth the money.

Title: EERO WORK GREAT!
Review Comment: I setup these up in 30 minutes. For the first time ever I have full bars on my Wifi throughout my entire house. I have lots of connected home devices I have had issues with in the past and so far they are working great. My network has 50 devices on it and is working good, speeds are great, I was able to do a speed test and got 163m down from my Comcast internet over the Eero Wifi network. Totally happy with this product, worth the money. I have tried LinkSys, Dlink, and Apple products for my home network in the past and they all failed. Pay the extra for this product you will be happy.

Title: Eero simple to install. Did not require advanced IT degrees.
Review Comment: Setup was straightforward following the instructions. Our house, built late 1920's, has iron sheet as reinforcement and fire containment. This limits the range of the repeaters (I think) at the extremes of the house. When I have some extra cash I'm considering adding some more units.I was pleased to note that software updates are automatically pushed to my network.

Title: I read a review In an article about the best technology of 2016 which included the EERO
Review Comment: My current router and range extender barely supported downloading email in the upstairs bedroom of my old Florida concrete wall home.  I read a review In an article about the best technology of 2016 which included the EERO.  Even though the only con was the price I decided to give it a chance.  I had it installed in less than 30 minutes and am blown away at the improvement in coverage.  Best purchase ever.

Title: I am absolutely amazed at how well this works
Review Comment: This is the wifi I have been waiting for! I am absolutely amazed at how well this works. I will admit, I was skeptical especially after trying everything else. I have tried moving my wireless router out in the open, trying multiple extenders in multiple locations, changing ISP companies, and nothing has helped. The eero system simply works and works very well. I never write reviews, but I feel like this product warranted one. The price is right at the amount where you can't just impulse buy something like this. It took me several weeks to pull the trigger, but knowing what I know now, I would have bought eero a long time ago. My internet speeds in areas that were previous dead zones are faster now than what I was getting standing right next to my previous router. If it keeps working this well, I will be a customer for life.

Title: It is worth all the hype and the price tag too!
Review Comment: It's truely worth the hype! I have had my eero for a few days now and I am super impressed. My home is over 2400 sq feet and I was constantly restarting my previous router. I always had dead spots and could never run more than 3 devices at once. Now with eero I have 9 devices on wifi with no lags, no buffering, and no slowness at all. I am truely amazed. I would curse my modem, router, and ISP everday because I was constantly power cycling my modem and router multiple times a day.  NOT ANY MORE since I have eero! It's worth $500 but I got it for $100 less on Prime Day. If you are experiencing the same issues then get past the $500 price tag. It is worth it.

Title: Simple-this works
Review Comment: We have two homes and both have terrible WIFi issues.  I've tried multiple solutions over the years with very little stable success.  Just got this yesterday and already have 25MBs throughout the house which is twice as good as the old wifi standing right next to it.  I'm blown away.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: did like were i had to unplug and disconnect everything, returned the item

Title: EERO...a product that performs well!
Review Comment: After two years of struggling and frankly giving up to improve the WIFI signal throughout my condo I spotted this product on Fox and Friends.  One of the anchors mentioned the new technology and how well it performed. Of course with any new technology there is some scepticism. I knew what I was dealing with currently and know I had to do something so I decided to give it a try. I purchased one to start and that didn't help, however when I added the second to place in another location to project the signal further it worked perfectly.  Testing speeds in various rooms at the end of the condo the speed was excellent.  So bottom line EERO does what is say it does.  My only regret was not buying the 2-Pack initially, it would have saved me $50.  So do your homework ahead of time laying out the system.  Customer support is fantastic so don't hesitate to call them ahead of time.

Title: Finally solved my wifi coverage issues.
Review Comment: Amazing. Finally solved my wifi issues after years of no luck in a fairly small home. I had even tried "enterprise" level APs like Unifi.. I decided to take the plunge for what is a fairly expensive AP system, but now I'm glad I did. Great experience so far.

Title: Must buy if you want seamless wifi
Review Comment: Awesome so far. As promised, extremely easy to set up, full strength signal inside and outside the house and fantastic speeds so far. It's expensive but so is the Internet service I purchase from Verizon and always had horrible wifi. So glad to be done with those stupid and useless wireless repeaters throughout the house. At least it finally makes it all worth it.The main hub runs a little hot so I'll keep an eye on that over the coming weeks but I'm certainly a proud owner and happy to be an early adopter!

Title: Great Concept - Would be Awesome if it worked!
Review Comment: The whole idea of this sounds great. Unfortunately it doesn't work.Setup is very easy but three of these units, all hard wired, had slower speeds and way less range than two Airport Extremes similarly hard wired.I have 200 Mbps down speed & was getting between 10 & 25 using Eero wired and had quite a few dead spots at the periphery.Will return these & go back to my old setup.

Title: Terrific Product
Review Comment: This system really works.  It gives me great wifi signal strength throughout my house, where two previous extended-range failed.  Very happy that I made this purchase.  Easy to install, and bullet-proof functionality.

Title: ... never written a review but this has been the best $500 we have spent
Review Comment: Have never written a review but this has been the best $500 we have spent. Getting onto the Internet had become such a frustrating experience. I had read the reviews calling it "life changing" and figured they were exaggerations. It is truly life changing, no frustration, no turning on and off the modem - can now watch and stream from all over the house with modem in the basement. Has been more than I reasonably expected and all that I had hoped.

Title: Sets up quickly and easily. Attractive design
Review Comment: Sets up quickly and easily. Attractive design. Phone app is fantastic and easy to use. Getting max speed in all corners of house, even those that were previously deadspots. Tried extenders, hi gain wifi router, even network through electric wiring. Nothing worked. Eero solved problem instantly. Very pleased, great product. Just wish I didn't have to take a second mortgage to buy the 3 eero package.

Title: A great router!
Review Comment: I replaced my 2 year old Apple Time Capsule with eero.  I improved my signal strength by 70% in the two other locations that I needed to get a solid Wi-Fi signal.  I used the WiFi signal app from the Mac app store to measure the improvement.  I now have a solid signal everywhere in the house.  I was also able to turn off Wi-Fi on the Time Capsule and now just use it as a Time Machine.eero is super simple to setup.  Just follow along with the app that you need to download to your phone and it walks you through each step.  I had 3 devices installed and connected in less that 15 minutes.  A trick you may want to try if this eero is replacing an existing router. Name the eero network with exactly the name as your old network and use your old password.  That way any device connecting to your network does not need to be reconfigured.  I have 3 Wemo devices, 2 iPads, 2 iPhones, Alexa, Dot, 2 Apple TVs, 1 Wireless Laser printer and two TiVo units and none of them needed any configuration changes.  Saved a lot of time and hassle.Overall I am really happy with erro!

Title: Great, but...
Review Comment: The system works extremely wellHowever, more units are needed for complete coverage than I expected and they are not cheap

Title: I never seen anything like this, I wish I had brought this before ...
Review Comment: Eero, I never seen anything like this, I wish I had brought this before I wasted lots of money on others entenders. I recommend for each bedroomthere should be one eero. Costly but well worth it.

Title: Don't Fight It, Join The Revolution
Review Comment: Took some moving around and adjusting.  Very well done.

Title: Best router I've had yet.
Review Comment: This was my SECOND system - for my second home. Perfect. Easy. Strong.Do it!

Title: I had very high expectations of the Eero system, ...
Review Comment: I had very high expectations of the Eero system, but have to return as none of the units have enough wired Ethernet (RJ45) ports to adequately replace my existing Wi-Fi router.  At least one needs to have 4 available LAN ports in my opinion (5 even better).  Yes, I can purchase a GigE switch but my wiring closet simply doesn't have much space for replacing one well-working Wi-Fi AP with a new Wi-Fi AP and separate switch.... the goal was to streamline my setup while increasing coverage.Also, although it's 802.11ac, it's only 2x2, when most high-end home AC routers (this system is expensive) are 3x3:3.  I don't know if the smaller size of the Eero's were an issue, but this seems short-sided considering how 'future proof' the units are otherwise via software.

Title: Very easy set up
Review Comment: Works and easy!

Title: great network.
Review Comment: changed everything in our house.  Before WIFI was spotty on the far side of the house even with a repeater.  We installed 3 eero units, one by the wifi and 2 in each of the far corners of the house.  We now have full signals at all times.My only comment is that the installation of the first unit was hampered by me not knowing that a network enabled device was required.  My phone had cellular turned off and I got no indication of why I could not connect the eero base.  Once I found out why (error message when I tried to use my non-cellular Ipad to set up) it was obvious.The package comes with almost no instructions (plug in turn on).  None would be needed if a note regarding network connectivity were added.

Title: Finally, WiFi Everywhere
Review Comment: Before buying my two eero units, I tried several different extenders. One I just could not get to work ( I'm a software engineer with a master's in comp sci). The others were just weak and my phone had trouble switching between the main wifi and the extended network.With my eeros my home is awash in WiFi, and all the same network name. Setup was incredibly easy and friendly.Note, I have a four story townhouse (that includes the basement) about 2800 square ft. I purchased only two units, not the three pack. As mentioned, this was perfect for me.

Title: Awesome sauce. I've tried every solution there is (extenders
Review Comment: Awesome sauce. I've tried every solution there is (extenders, multiple extenders, ethernet over power lines, etc, etc) ... none work.Eero does.Enough said.

Title: Zero Handoff Wifi was my primary goal... and eero met the challenge
Review Comment: I had a specific reason for purchasing the eero wifi product... blanketing my home with Wifi signal so I could reliably use the Wifi Calling mode on my iPhone.  In particular, I wanted a system with zero handoff so I could move to anywhere I had Wifi coverage in my house without dropping a phone call.  And eero does this quite well.  I have absolutely zero cellular coverage at my home from any carrier.Prior to purchasing my eero system I tried many times to configure my many Wifi routers and access points distributed throughout my home.  Although it was easy enough to get less expensive routers to cooperate enough to work together, there was no way to accomplish the zero handoff.  Until eero, I consistently dropped calls as I moved from one Wifi connection to another in my home.By using a lan scanning program, you can see that eero uses the same SSID and channel number for the Wifi router and access points, and uses the same channel for all 2.4 ghz access and all 5 ghz access respectively.Setup is easy, but manual configuration is limited... although with the smooth automatic configuring to allow cooperation between access points I did not feel limited in what I needed to do.To sum up, I get very reliable Wifi coverage for my computers, smart home products, TV and video systems, and zero handoff for Wifi calling applications.  All with very good through-put, frequently maxing out the internet speed supplied by my ISP (see photo).  My only reason for not providing 5 stars is the system cost.

Title: Strong wifi signal but extremely slow speeds (check out speedtest.net, not the Eero app for true speeds)
Review Comment: I had high hopes for this but unfortunately, it didn't work out.  I purchased two 3-packs hoping that if I put them 40' or less apart that I would be able to stream HD or even SD video through my house.  Unfortunately, that is not the case.  While the wireless signal is very strong everywhere, the speed diminishes quickly.  What is the point of having a strong signal if the speed is that of a 56k modem?  Unfortunately, I'm going back to my Netgear R8000 router which had higher speeds throughout my home then the 6 Eeros.  Also, make sure you look at speedtest.net for true speeds and don't just use the Eero app.Very disappointed.

Title: Flawless WIFI coverage, Top Notch APP!
Review Comment: Mesh networks made simple and works flawless. A vacation rental dream, check in on wifi status with a phone app, guests state NO WIFI, check the APP send a screenshot and problem solved. Saved me in bogus customer complaints. I have setup these in very large properties running 12 in each and every corner providing flawless wifi throughout. Been waiting years for this elegant and simple solution. THANK YOU EERO from DC Five Star Vacation Rentals in Washington DC!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Met all the expectations I had after researching, purchasing and setting up.

Title: Wow--this system works!
Review Comment: I tried range extenders and through house power adapters in the past to enhance coverage within my home, but I could not duplicate the data rate coming into my Xfinity modem/router (180 Mbit/s).  I bought the 3-pack and now have extremely good data rates throughout the place (>90 Mbits/s).  It seems to be getting even better after an update last night.  Good job Eero!

Title: Works great and is easy to set up
Review Comment: I've used wifi extenders that were supposed to be great, never were. This system covers my house much better than 2 routers and an extender! Will be buying a fourth one to move to backyard as needed!

Title: Great Item - But Priciy
Review Comment: Great items, but you may need more than you think. Probably the house lay-out and walls, but it took me four units and really thinking about a fifth.

Title: Works better than advertised
Review Comment: These are amazing, I can actually FaceTime now and get close to 2MB/s versus the .3 we were getting

Title: BUY
Review Comment: I decided to purchase this system after reading the great reviews and needing a way to get decent wifi out to my back porch and garage. I liked my trusty old Apple AirPort base station but even using an additional Airport Express as an extender wasn't performing well. My devices often wouldn't switch over to the closer device, and speeds were pretty poor. I eventually quit using the Express and tossed it into my spare gadget box. I set the eero system up in just a few minutes, and everything just works, perfect, everywhere in the house and most of my yard. Far better than my best effort before. It's not cheap but unless you actually enjoy configuring wifi networks it's well worth the price.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: works great

Title: Really excellent product and great support!  Good-bye Airport Extremes!
Review Comment: THANKS EERO!  GREAT PRODUCT!My eero system was easy to set up and get working, but took some tweaking (with the placement of the devices - working with eero tech support) to REALLY dial up the performance.Initial setup was simple once I turned my phone's bluetooth on...the first time I tried (with bluetooth off) it failed (obvious, in hindsight).  After my setup was complete, my wifi performance was as-good (and sometimes better) than my existing wifi network, which consisted of three (3) Apple Airport Extreme base stations, which mostly adequately covered most/all of my house but which did experience the occasional (always frustrating) dropouts.  I found my initial performance was mostly better than my 3-Apple-Airport-Extreme solution, and at slightly lower cost (3 eeros are ~$500, 3 Apple Airport Extremes are (179 *3) ~$580).Once I moved the "eero base station" across the room (so that it was now adjacent to an "internal wall" instead of being next to an "external wall" as it had been initially), performance of the eero's became markedly better than the Apple Airport Extremes.I'll be getting rid of my Apple Airport Extremes now!

Title: Easy-peasy!  Why did I wait so long???
Review Comment: Originally read about this product in Forbes.  Then heard from a friend who had great experience.  I live in a steel and concrete building.  Wifi extender I was using was lame.  Before ordering, I called Eero customer support with a question.  Wow!  Human being in NorAm spoke to me, answered my question, and followed up with a relevant email.  I ordered Eero three piece set.  Installed two units at my home in a breeze.  I almost did not believe how easy it was.  Performance improvement is fabulous!  Installed the third unit in my office - while I was on a conference call.  Less than zero hassle.  Highly recommended!

Title: as many people would be more comfortable with a mouse and a full keyboard
Review Comment: It's a bit pricy for extremely limited security controls. There is no ability to manage it from any desktop\laptop computer. I strongly disagree with the App only approach to managing the devices, as many people would be more comfortable with a mouse and a full keyboard. The functionality is there, and switching from AP to AP is seamless. Overall it works as advertised, it's easy to setup due to it's lack of feature control. You really can't change anything other than the password and the SSID, so it's nearly impossible to misconfigure. The use of bluetooth for initial configuration is pretty intelligent, and made it much easier than trying to connect to the default IP address. There are no mounting brackets, so it needs to be placed on the floor or a shelf. PoE would be a nice feature, as getting the right length and hiding cat cable is much easier than dealing with a power cable.Overall I think the product is really good at it's intended purpose, which is to extend a wireless network beyond a single AP. Do it so that anyone can set it up, and have it work. They have covered those objectives. I think for the price they are charging, they could have added some additional management, and the ability to properly place\hide them in the home. Beyond WiFi that works, I really don't want to see the devices.

Title: Expensive, but COMPLETELY worth it
Review Comment: Bought the 3 pack to address poor wireless penetration in a client's apartment. Eero works SO WELL. Strong and reliable signal, no lag, just as a mesh network should be. And it's solid -- doesn't require the periodic restarts that most consumer routers do.During setup I encountered a glitch: the stations had trouble connecting to each other for the first time. I called tech support at 4 pm on a Saturday expecting to leave a message. Instead the call was answered by a tech who spent about 30 minutes on the phone with me and was able to bypass the problem in his admin interface. Couldn't have asked for a better support experience.The app is good, leaves a little to be desired if you want much technical information, but for most users it should be great -- easy to use, easy to set up, etc. The tech told me they're working on improving the app.All in all this is an expensive but EXCELLENT Wi-Fi solution.

Title: Too hot for eero?
Review Comment: Like many others I have tried a number of wifi routers with the last one before the eero being a Google Onhub. Our house is a fairly large rectangle with 2 floors each around 2,000 sq ft.. We were forced to put our cable modem in a corner of the house upstairs which has made it difficult to reach the other corners with a wifi signal. Conceptually the idea of a mesh network made a lot of sense so I took down the Google router and set up the eero. At first the network did seem to help bring a signal where it hadn't reached before but then summer arrived and real high temperatures in the attic space where the cable modem and the 1st eero device. As temperatures rose the wifi became very intermittent and unstable. Additionally while we have 300mb internet service from Time Warner Cable I couldn't get a speed above about 80mb. I tried moving the eero devices around to see if that would help but no luck. I took the eero out of service and reconnected the Google Onhub. While I still have a low signal in the extreme corners of the house I am able to get a strong signal in the main part of the house with wifi connection speeds up to 275 mb. My assumption is the extreme heat impacted the eero and degraded the performance?

Title: Buy it now.
Review Comment: Very easy set up. I've been trying for years to get my wifi to reach my back yard. Eero is the first system to actually work. Buy it now.

Title: Bad move by customer rep
Review Comment: I am extremely satisfied with my Eero WiFi System. Super easy to setup. It can easily get 5 stars. I admit it is little too expensive, but totally worth it.The reason for low stars is due a backed-out refund promised by Eero customer support. They were supposed to refund $100 due to a promotion. They backed out as soon as I mentioned I bought from Amazon. They say it had to be purchased thru their website. First thing is I even came to know about this product because of Amazon, and went for it looking at reviews. They need to honor their promotion no matter where the item is bought, as long as I have a valid receipt. Amazon customer service couldn't help, and they just forwarded me to Eero support.

Title: Fantastic product and company
Review Comment: I have never done an Amazon review before, but I wanted to share the fantastic experience I have had with eero—both the product and the company.First, the product: Not much needs to be said except that I now have blazingly fast wifi throughout my house. It could not be easier to set up. The hardware is elegant and unobtrusive, unlike the alien spacecraft that other wifi companies seem to be producing these days. Also, the eero model of constant updates and improvements is far superior to what you will get from other companies. My eeros have already updated themselves several times, with improvements in performance and new features added.As for the company, I cannot say enough about how great they are to work with. I did have some problems initially with streaming music services not working properly. I contacted eero, and they worked tirelessly to figure out what the problem was. The problem turned out to be related to another component in my network (not the eeros themselves) but they saw it through until the problem was solved. I now have no problems whatsoever with my network and in fact everything works much better than before. Also, unlike with other companies, I did not receive generic emails with general suggestions and links to online help documents. Instead, I exchanged emails with a single customer service representative who actually took the time to respond to my specific questions and worked with me until my problem was solved. For me, this kind of service and attention to detail makes the eero system worth every penny. This is a company that truly cares about its customers and about getting it right.Conclusion: Buy it, you won’t be disappointed!

Title: Like most people
Review Comment: Like most people, I grumbled about the price but was willing to bite the bullet if it actually meant wifi coverage for our entire home.  Initially there were just download issues and problems with specific devices (Amazon Echo being one of them) that depend on wifi having wifi issues but when I went through the trouble shooting steps and even purchased a new modem the issues persisted and in one sense (the eeros not connecting even at a distance of just 20 unobstructed feet from one another) worsened.  eero looks nice and their site/promo videos are slickly produced but unfortunately the system does not work as promised.

Title: FINALLY reliable wifi!
Review Comment: I've tried numerous wifi range extenders and repeaters without success.  Sheer frustration led me to spend $500 on a 3-pack Eero system.  It was well worth the price!  The Eero system has, so far, provided reliable and stable wifi throughout my home.  Worth every penny...I LOVE IT!

Title: Excellent
Review Comment: Very powerful. Far better than anything else I've tried.

Title: This thing is just outrageously expensive but it does what ...
Review Comment: This thing is just outrageously expensive but it does what is advertised ...Manufacturer probably is making a killing on these things

Title: Best WiFi option out there.
Review Comment: We have an ubee router from Cox Cable in a small home with plaster walls. Had no WiFi in bedrooms 30ft away from router. Bought eero after hearing about it on a podcast and wow, have full coverage everywhere in home now.Setup was beyond easy as you just follow the prompts on the smart phone app. I don't think it is possible to mess up trying to install this.We can now chromecast to bedrooms, watch YouTube on the tablets, or user WiFi in any room of the house. Thanks eero!

Title: Get it, well worth the price
Review Comment: I don't usually review amazon products, but when I do it's because they're flawless. I had the eero system for all of 15 minutes before I had it out of the box and set up. The unboxing experience can only be described as "Apple-Like," with the box design clearly able to guide the user towards which pieces to take out first without having to read any instructions. After I had downloaded the app, setting up each node took ~4 minutes, for a total of approximately 12 minutes between unplugging my old modem and connecting my devices to the new network. Once the system was set up, the app then proceeded to do a speed test on its own as if to say, "See what you've been missing?"My entire life it feels like, we have been struggling with sub-par wifi connectivity at the far ends of my house, but no more. In a spot where I would have been lucky to receive 3Mbps down this morning, I now get upwards of 30Mbps, which is actually the speed that we are paying for. Until today, I had been telling my parents it's normal to only get 10% of the bandwidth you were paying for, because it was, but no longer!So far in my <1hr using the setup, it seems pretty sweet. I'll be sure to update this if I run into any issues after a week.

Title: Best Wifi. Works great in Europe
Review Comment: Bought it for a house in Europe. I have a 3 level concrete build house w major issues w wifi signal distribution. Set up was super easy. Works great everywhere.

Title: Best WiFi you have EVER experienced !!
Review Comment: I purchased the 3 pack. Extremely easy to setup. Very beautiful packaging and modern elegant design to the units. Covers my entire ranch style house and yard. I am getting faster speeds and better coverage than with any access point I have ever owned. I very highly recommend the eero system.

Title: Wow, it's TOTALLY worth the money!
Review Comment: WOW! I was skeptical... I thought I could buy a 2nd Airport Extreme and create access points... Do it all cheaper than eero. Almost an entire day on the phone with Time Warner cable and Apple, and I gave up. Eero is a life saver! My hard-wired iMac gets 230 mbs, and my wireless connection is now around 200. I called eero tech support and they answered immediately and were very helpful. Don't hesitate any more to buy this--the ease of setup is amazing, and the speed is incredible. It's a life saver.

Title: I bought a Mercedes and got a Fiat - Wifi speed down by 50%
Review Comment: We used an ASUS RT-AC87U router before. The speed was great in most areas of the house (usually well above 150Mbit/sec, in some areas which are closer to the device I got up to 260Mbit/sec).We used a single router setup which lead to some spotty coverage in the garden and one guestroom.The major reason why we wanted to the replace it was the some devices couldn't connect on a regular basis - which means I needed to restart the router frequently. Overall it was not a bad product at all and had lots of options/features - the price tag was $190.With eero and its $500 price tag I expected great things. I was thinking we are buying the Mercedes of the routers. I was looking for MAJOR speed and coverage improvements (means I expected speed of 150Mbit/sec everywhere in the house!).The installation of eero was simple. However, the app gave too little guidance of where to place the different devices.After the 3 device setup I saw that many features available in the app are not accessible - apparently I had to wait for a firmware update pushed to all eeros until they become available.Sorry but, every hardware device I have ever interacted with, is automatically downloading and updating itself when I first set it up.This seems very odd to me to wait until eero decides (apparently during the night) to push it to me, even though the firmware is already released and could technically be installed during the first setup.The whole setup process maybe took 5-10mins, which is great (I thought at that time).One major concern I have is that the device configuration is cloud based.This is great from a customer support standpoint, however from a user standpoint I have major concerns with that design decision.This means when your internet is down you CANNOT change your configuration. After the initial setup the only times I want to access my router configuration is when my internet connectivity is DOWN.I want to do troubleshoot the router config and decide if my internet provider or my on premise hardware is to blame.Furthermore, in case eero would be going out of business in the future this means that your $500 router is bricked.In order to configure the devices you need an up to date app and working backend server infrastructure operated by eero.If they bankrupt or a future owner after an acquisition decides to shut down the service you CANNOT use the product anymore.If no one will update the app anymore when Apple or Google make major iOS or Android changes the app is not working anymore and your device is bricked as Eero is NOT providing a HTML based configuration running locally on the device.When I started to test for speeds I was VERY surprised. My Asus router delivered pretty reliable speeds within the house of mostly >100Mbit/sec.With eero speeds dropped significantly EVERYWHERE in the house down to 30-50Mbit/sec. I rarely get more than 100Mbit/sec, even when a Macbook is sitting right next to the main eero - this is ridiculous (all test were done in 5Ghz). One thing which indeed got better is coverage and connectivity.Since my firmware was still waiting to get updated the support told me a) wait until you get a newer firmware (ok fair enough) b) wait until the mesh network is adjusting itself to your local setup.The next morning the firmware was not upgraded, but the wifi was simply completely offline. Apparently the main eero failed to upgrade itself and took down the whole wifi. After power-cycling the eero rolled back to its original firmware. I needed to call support again to push the firmware again (as I cannot to this by myself!).Support ensured me that all 3 eeros are updated right now. Later I realized that was not the case - one eero is still on an older firmware version which means I still cannot use all new features. Speeds also did not improve at all.What a mess. Its been more 24h and the setup is still not completed and I already called the support twice (by the way, the support is solid so far).So lets see what eero is claiming to do and what they deliver:1) "Your router can't do this" - yes, the mesh network is pretty neat and coverage definitely improved; however, the wifi speed is devastating.2) "Your WiFi problems, gone" - so far I had more problems than before.3) "WiFi is no longer a black box" - well since you do only have a cloud config and little to NON advanced features and options eero IS A BIGGER black box than before.4) "Security that's one step ahead" - I don't see any security related options or features - okay the firmware push is nice for the future, but that did my old router as well.5) "Never reset your router again" - so far not true at all.eero needs to significantly improve network speeds and features/options. Right now is has the feature richness of a $30 china router and is NOT worth $500.

Title: Easy, reliable and fabulous performance
Review Comment: Although Gizmodo called this a system "designed for rich, lazy people," one needs to appreciate the ease, performance and reliability of this system. $500 is pricey, but the eero improves network performance and reliability, all with no effort. Individuals with significant technical and management experience will appreciate the benefits by being able to turn their attention to things that are more important than deploying, debugging and managing a mesh wifi network.

Title: Go from turtle speeds to supersonic speeds!
Review Comment: If you are suffering with a cable system that offers high speed internet access and delivers it by turtle power, then this is the product for you. I have an Amazon TV box and was getting slow feeds. I also have MLB.TV so I can watch my favorite team from across the country. Problem was that my cable provider was so slow that I could not watch my team 9 out of 10 times. eero solved my speed problem and I would highly recommend it.

Title: No PPPOE Support
Review Comment: Simple set up but mesh routing did not positively impact my home network. Turns out eero does not support PPPOE and it doesn't seem like it's going to. Since my fiber connection uses PPPOE, I had to keep my old router (AirPort Express) as a bottleneck between the fiber modem and the eero, limiting wifi speeds to 100mb.Eero mentions this PPPOE limitation in the support section of their website, which I didn't bother reading until I was trying to set up my network. Guess I should have done more research prior to buying. I'm switching back to my old router.

Title: So much better than wifi extenders etc
Review Comment: So much better than wifi extenders etc.  if you want good high quality Internet throughout the house, mesh network is the way to go!

Title: Outstanding Customer Service
Review Comment: My home wifi now works perfectly.  I had some initial problems with performance which turned out to be caused by a bad ethernet cable I bought separately.  During the troubleshooting phase, the eero support rep was engaged, responsive and helpful.  He assisted in every way he could until the source of the problem was discovered.  Now that it is up and running the system works wonderfully.  I have strong, fast wifi coverage throughout my home.  After dealing with Comcast on other technical issues, it's great to work with a company on the other end of the customer support spectrum.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Yes it met all my needs and more

Title: Try to make it work quickly!
Review Comment: I am having trouble getting it to work.  I did not realize that there is only one month to make it work.  Hopefully the company will accept a return.

Title: Waste of Money
Review Comment: This product really has not done much to boost my wifi signals. I would not purchase this product again.

Title: eero came in a close second to Airport Extremes
Review Comment: I have solid experience in networking, and can hold my own in wireless networking technology.  I wanted to test the eero devices, namely to solve the issue of what is commonly referred to "sticky clients", or seamless roaming for my mobile devices when using multiple wireless Access Points (APs) in a home.  As my family is primarily Apple based, I tested with the following devices on my Gigabit Ethernet network, connected to U-Verse for 1GB up/down Internet::• Macbook 2015 running macOS 10.11.5 (El Capitan)• iPhone 6 running iOS 8.2.1• iPhone 6S running iOS 9.3.2• Macbook 2011 running macOS 10.6.8 (Snow Leopard)• HP laptop running Windows 10Overall, the setup and operation of the eero units works very well.  802.11AC performance is usually in excess of 200MB across my LAN or across the Internet.  The only issue I found is that my Macbook likes to hang on to the farther eero AP for sometimes over a minute plus, which would affect performance.  For now, I am going to use Apple Airport Extreme units to create a seamless 802.11AC wireless roaming network, including Airport Extreme at the head end as my router.  Although the eero units support 802.11r for Fast Transition roaming, the support of 802.11r, k, and v protocols really makes the roaming difference of my family's mobile devices "work" on the Airport Extremes.I will likely install eero units for wireless across my other house that lacks Ethernet cabling, given the efficient use of the second radios in the eero units for handling backhaul traffic as part of a true wireless mesh solution.

Title: EZ Eero setup
Review Comment: EZ setup. Works great!

Title: EERO is working great
Review Comment: Fast shipping. EERO is working great

Title: I really wanted to like this. I had high hopes considering this is ...
Review Comment: I really wanted to like this. I had high hopes considering this is a generation one product. I am quite knowledgable in networking than the average person. Before buying this I was aware that the firmware shipping was 1.0, and I needed to let it update to latest before really testing this out. I decided that when I bought this, I would give it a week and see if the high cost was worth it. (I was really unhappy that I couldn't force a firmware upgrade, a detail that really needs to be addressed or at very least you update immediately when powering on the unit...) After about 24 hours, I made sure all units got upgraded to 1.1 firmware. The second day my Apple TV upstairs somehow lost its IP from DHCP and would not let me reconnect. It was working fine and overnight AFTER the 1.1 firmware updated and the units power cycled, it just stopped working. So I power cycled the closest unit to Apple TV, and it finally could pull an IP. Since then it worked pretty good for next 4 days, I enjoyed the range it provided but I noticed that the speeds I was getting weren't exactly going in the right direction. I have a 250 mbps internet connection and upstairs I seemed to get anywhere from 100-120. Not horrible, but my Linksys router I had before eero was able to get me closer to 200. I've noticed every once awhile I would see minor dips in connection speeds to my living room (Netflix or Hulu would just stop playing or pause for a second) every once in awhile. It wasn't horrible but for the $499 price, I was expecting better since this needed to beat my $200 linksys router I had before (I never had these pauses on the linksys in the living room). The last straw was now, my connected computer directly to the eero master just stopped working. I checked and it lost its IP over DHCP and it wouldn't work until I powered cycled that. I might try on v2 or v3 of the product but I just don't think its worth the cost when I seem to be having worse issues with this over my linksys

Title: Wonderful product, requires no expertise
Review Comment: One of the best products I ever bought.  New home, we bought a wireless access point which was worthless and complicated to set up.  Then purchased Eero.  Set up in a few minutes and required no expertise.  The speeds all over the house and outside in the patio and porches are over 100 Mbps.  Highly recommend it.

Title: Easy to setup and Manage
Review Comment: 1 eero out performs most "Home routers" very easy to setup with the smartphone app. easy to manage. easy to expand coverage if needed. I have set these up individually as well as link 6 together

Title: Extremely Disappointed--Constant AP Reboots and Instability
Review Comment: Absolutely worthless. Been doing the IT thing for 20 years and this is certainly a dud. I will say the packaging and setup was very clean and worked flawlessly. Presentation was superb--functionality not so much. I purchased the 3 pack for $500 and installed all units tonight. Wireless network and LAN came up easily. Then nothing worked. Then everything worked. Then nothing worked. The Access Points kept going offline and online--all of them for more than an hour when I said enough. The firmware on all reported as v1. It's silly to me that the first thing that the units DON'T do is upgrade the firmware. And of course there is no way to manually do it--or ask the app to go do it. So, I suspect a newer version of firmware might fix this, but I'm not waiting for the magical "sometime late at night" trick. Out of the box, the product does not work. I tried removing two of the AP's--no dice. All units were plugged into my LAN as well. Sure, I could have called support, but I'm not beta testing this stuff and I've never had the need to call support for a simple wireless AP setup. I've NEVER bought a device like this and flat out had it not work as soon as it was out of the packaging. Super disappointed because I was so very excited to use the mesh technology without having to use range extenders in my house. I have over 30 devices, but doubt that's the issue. Sorry, eero, return already setup with Amazon and it goes back in the AM.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Exactly the product we wanted!

Title: Easy to set up and family profiles are a great new feature
Review Comment: We got this a few months ago and have had no issues with it.  And now that they have added Family Profiles, it's even better.  After years of incomplete Wi-Fi coverage of our 2 story home (2600 sqft), we finally have coverage everywhere - including the back yard.  It was very easy to set up, and all our devices work with it (laptops, Apple TV, Roku, iTouch, iphone, Nintendo DS, Wii U, etc).  The new family profiles let me manage our kids' devices individually, automatically cutting them off an hour before bedtime and letting me pause their access at any time.  I can also see all devices on the network and manage them individually.  The app is easy to use and I can use it anywhere.  I use the guest network for babysitters and other guests and can turn if off and/or change the password easily thru the app.  Note - Only issue we did have was the Apple TV dropping access, but we used a network cable to connect it directly into one of the Eero units and have had no more dropping.

Title: Two Stars
Review Comment: Dont believe the hype. First generation of more products to come. Meh

Title: Wifi Problem Solved
Review Comment: After having sketchy wifi in various part of the house bot the 3 pack. Fortunately the Time Warner cable guy was at the house on some other issues and help me set it up. Needed to go in bridge mode for modem router combo. Also had to accommodate alarm system. Anyway the cable guy somehow got the first base unit working and setting up the other two was easy even for me. At all locations around the house the network speed has at least doubled.A long term problem has been solved.

Title: Highly recommend this system
Review Comment: This is a truly amazing and easy to use system.  I live in a three level townhome, and now have absolutely no dead spots in my home.  We have multiple phones, computers, and televisions all drawing from this system with no lag in service at all.  Very happy with this system

Title: Genius product and concept. Very strong WiFi signal and ...
Review Comment: Genius product and concept. Very strong WiFi signal and performance all over 3000sft house. Finally mesh technology is consumer friendly.

Title: Two Stars
Review Comment: great complete home coverage and speed at the expense of reliability and manageability.

Title: Two Stars
Review Comment: I'm on DSL and the limited band width really didn't allow the speeds to improve.

Title: so eero is the perfect solution for my house
Review Comment: Finally I have full strength WiFi all over my house.Even the strongest router only has range of ~40ft radius, so eero is the perfect solution for my house. Very easy to setup, but has more advance feature if needed.Very happy, and money well spent!

Title: Recommended
Review Comment: Pricey, but easy setup and great performance.

Title: Cure your wifi problems
Review Comment: For full house coverage it is a must system! Works exactly as claimed. Highly recommended!

Title: Just connected and off to a great start!
Review Comment: We have a 3,000 sq. ft. Home with two main floora plus a finished basement.  We had dead zones in the basement and in two of our bedrooms.  We just finished installing the Eero three pack system.  Setup was a breeze as it even tests connectivity of each unit to let you try different spots to place them.  All done through a simple smartphone app.  I was able to stream, wireless print, email, from all the previous dead zones on a Saturday afternoon which is a busy tiime for internet use across our home and the neighboring competing networks.  All at much faster speeds than using the modem with Apple booster.  Out of the box we are thrilled!  We will see how it stays up and running over time, but off to an outstanding start!

Title: Super easy to set up and adjust
Review Comment: Had it about a month. Super easy to set up and adjust. One note: mine had a firmware update that prevented it from self setting up the first time. If you have issues just get on the phone with them and they'll get it going quick.

Title: THE REAL DEAL!!
Review Comment: Ok. This is the 'real deal'. You can depend on what you read in reviews and in the promotional stuff.  It really works.  It really is SUPER EASY to set up.  It's expensive.  BUT!! - after spending a lot of money on extenders in the past, it's a bargain!  Completely eliminated my dead spots - and brought ever corner to 100% speed.  The packaging will, alone, give you confidence.  Apple quality design and packaging.  But - the best part?  The mobile app you load (free of course) to do the set up with you Iphone or droid.  Amazing - why didn't somebody think of this before?

Title: Worst Access Points Ever
Review Comment: The eeros are the most underpowered wifi device that I have used in years, they are also plagued by dropped links and horrendous slow speeds. To cover my 3000sq ft one story house takes 6 devices, and I have yet to have a wireless device test out at over 10mbps, while my connection is 200mbps. I will be removing them and going back to two asus access points, I am very disappointed and out $1000, I would suspect that the amazon reviews are paid for, and not genuine reviews.

Title: Worth the High Price
Review Comment: Bought 2 Eeros for my 2100 sq. ft., one-level house. Have one next to the router and one on a high piece of furniture, out of sight, in the next room. Set-up was a breeze. My Ring doorbell now works flawlessly, where before it wasn't very reliable.  Wi-fi is strong throughout the house, where it used to be iffy, even with a couple run-of-the-mill extenders "strategically" placed in different rooms. These gizmos are kind of pricey, but they do work.

Title: Works great for a little bit of time, then will not let you see or connect wirelessly, so what is the point.
Review Comment: Bought this is addition to a new surfboard modem to increase access and speed to the internet. Was running several standard wireless devices and was seeing issues. Router and modem were due for upgrade.  Surfboard modem 32 channel is awesome and locked right in, full bandwidth, no problem.  Had a little trouble getting eero up, but once completed locked right in, again seeing full bandwidth.  Well 2 months later, the system is showing some really weird issues and it seems to have started with upgrades to the devices.  TVs will drop connectivity every once on a while and worse yet, all of the laptops in the house are having wireless connection issues.  They work in other environments (libraries, colleges, Panera, etc.) on those wireless networks, but don't work in my 3 unit home eero environment, no matter what location within the house.  Having a single device not work is one thing.  Having sporatic connection problems and 4 laptops not working is another.  Can get wired to work, but wireless is out, so what is the point.  I really had high hopes for this setup and was really excited about the technology.  Very disappointed.

Title: Easy setup. Takes a few days to "stabilize"
Review Comment: We tired many different routers, including adding access points or signal boosters and nothing worked. The router is on the 3rd floor of our home. The wi-fi was okay up there but on the second floor where the Xbox and iPads are, it was terrible.It took 10 minutes to install three eero units, and we were getting 150mbps almost immediately. Throughout the entire house.The reason I give this review only 4 stars instead of 5, is that it took about 48 hours for the speeds to remain constantly high. We'd go from 150mbps to < 5.  Support suggest constantly power cycling the eero units and my modem, which does help, but I shouldn't have to power cycle so often.It's been a week and speeds are consistently high. The eero units upgrade their firmware in about 24 hours. Most of the issues you will read on here and other forums are related to the very early release before they updated the firmware.It's expensive, but it was worth every penny.  Could we have probably found a cheaper and simpler solution, possibly but these are good looking and elegant and just work.  Reminds me of Apple in a way.I've attached an image from fast.com of our wireless speeds. We pay for 150mbps from Xfinity and as you can see our wireless is faster than what we're even paying for.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Have network of 6 Eero's not reliable, coverage varies, very over rated product.

Title: Trying to copy Apple AirPort with double price and less performance
Review Comment: (+) Pros:- Very easy to setup with mobile phone app- Good coverage in comparison to other APs with internal antenna(-) Cons:- Overpriced, Apple AirPort Express Base Station cost half the price- Has a design flaw (single point of failure), if you have more than eero device, one of them will act as a master, if this master unit is disconnect for any reason, all devices will be unavailable- It doesn't take advantage of networked home or office, this is if you have more than one eero device, I noticed that all traffic is passing through the master eero device, the result is higher delay and lower bandwidth if you are connected to other than the master deviceI think the best implementation if you want to expand he wireless coverage and your home/office is not networked, I used them for a month then I switched toL 1x Apple AirPort Extreme Base Station and 2x Apple AirPort Express Base Station

Title: So easy to use
Review Comment: Where has this been all my WiFi Life!!  Finally a Bridge / Extender that works! So easy to use! Download the app and plug it in! That simple! Up and running in less that 2 minutes!!

Title: Remarkable!
Review Comment: Installed the entire system within ten minutes, including downloading the eero app. Noticeable improvement in WiFi coverage throughout the house and significant increase in internet speed on iPhone and iPad.

Title: Excellent Product!!!
Review Comment: Best purchase ever!!!Extremely easy to install ans works like a charm.I loved Eero!!

Title: It just simply works
Review Comment: I've struggled with wifi coverage in my house for a long time.  My router is at one end of the house, and my television on the other end.  I purchased three different high end routers over the past couple of years, and each of them worked intermittently.  I would have to reboot my router every couple days as my bandwidth at the far end of my house lagged.I read the review for Eero and saw that it received high scores in two key areas for me:  First, I wanted something that was super simple to install and maintain.  I only need one feature- for the router to work.  Second, I wanted it to be super stable and not cycle between working well and not working well.  I can say now that the Eero is a perfect 10/10 on both of these requirements.  I haven't had to reboot a single time in the last month, and my family has finally stopped complaining about the bad wifi signal.  It is well worth the extra money to finally have a router system that works and continues to work.

Title: eero was the answer to my wifi dead spots
Review Comment: I bought the eero unit (individual) because my living-room and back porch were a wifi dead spot at my house. I have a ethernet cable running from my router to home theater center. I placed the eero unit in the cabinet with the ethernet cable running to it. I downloaded the app on my iphone and in minutes my eero was up and running. My living room and back porch are now totally covered in a strong wifi signal. Not only that but it reaches to the corner of my back yard. I am totally impressed with how well this unit has worked out for me. I can not recommend this unit more. I give eero an A+

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy to install and great coverage. Been installed for 3 weeks and working great.

Title: Do not purchase if you need VPN support from your home network
Review Comment: IMPORTANT: READ BEFORE PURCHASINGI was excited by the idea of a home mesh wifi network and and the positive reviews.  I missed one very important point however, officially the Eero devices do not support VPN connections.I connect from my home office to my business network by way of a simple VPN connection.  After calling technical support I learned that this is a known issue.These devices I think would still be appropriate for individuals looking for a simple extended home wifi network.

Title: Happy with eero!
Review Comment: I was skeptical when reading the reviews for eero, but so far so good!  My fear was that despite the high rating that this product would be no better than an WiFi signal extender. I've the eero WiFi router up and running for over a week now and no problems at all.  Our home is 3600 square feet and we no longer have any dead zones.  The set-up was very fast and a very simple process.  The app walks you through step-by-step.  It is pricey and I had to really think about it before I finally took the plunge and made the purchase and I am glad that I did.  Our only other option was to have wired the house with access points and that option would not have been any less expensive.

Title: The wireless is perfect and extremely fast everywhere in our house
Review Comment: We have been battling spotty wireless service in our long ranch style house for 2 years. I was skeptical Eero would be the solution and had a hard time stomaching the high price tag.  Within 15 min of it's arrival, I had all 3 stations set up via the simple user friendly app. We have been using Eero for 2 weeks now and life has drastically improved!  I cannot praise this system enough. The wireless is perfect and extremely fast everywhere in our house, even with the 10-20 devices we have running. It's even been flawless on Saturday nights and Sunday mornings which were previously the worst. I can get a crystal clear fast connection by my pool and in the basement. No more buffering and no more bouncing b/w the extender and regular network. Eero is a dream come true!

Title: Was a doubter... trust me... buy it.
Review Comment: So, I'm the typical home owner that has my router in the office downstairs and spotty wireless coverage throughout the house. I had purchased an Almond extender because it had positive reviews. It pretty much sucked. Wouldn't reconnect and was worthless. I have two young kids and watching Amazon TV upstairs was hit and miss and when a 2-year old wants to watch Paw Patrol... it better work.So, I was hesitant to buy the Eero system given the price tag. If you're looking at this review and wondering. Seriously... just buy it. It's insane. Works as well as advertised and is super easy to setup. I find myself doing speed tests just to confirm how great it is. I've had it for a month now and haven't had single issue. I'm getting the full 60MB subscriber speed throughout the house that I have coming in from my service provider. Now I can go crazy on all my other home automation ideas because I don't have to worry about spotty coverage or having multiple network names to connect to. Love love love Eero.

Title: Does what it says but still has some misses...
Review Comment: The Eero certainly delivers what it says on the box but for the hefty price of $500 it has flaws one would not expect for a premium price.Pros:If you are a person who knows very little about home networking and/or does not want to be bothered with the fiddly bits of home networking this is definitely the product for you.  It is as close as you will get to plug-and-play as you are ever likely to get.  You need an Apple or Android smartphone with Bluetooth to set it up (no Blackberry or Windows phones).  The guided tour could not be simpler.  Download the Eero app, create an account (free) and walk through the steps.  It'll even turn on your Bluetooth for you if it is off.  Start the app, plug in the Eero and follow super simple on screen instructions and within a minute or two you're done.  Rinse and repeat for additional units.  That's it. (Note: Once the system is setup no need to use Bluetooth anymore...it will work with the WiFi on your phone.)That's all there is to it and you should have seamless coverage in your home or wherever you are using it.  The units hand-off your device one to the other as you move about the place.  I think there is a learning curve for the units since when I first set them up the hand-off seemed to take a bit but a few days later I don't notice it. (I may be wrong about that...suffice it to say the hand-off works very well whatever it is doing.)Also nice is the system will auto-update its firmware.  You do nothing.  It just does it then lets you know it did it and that's all.  That may bother some people but overall it is a nice touch for most people.Cons:1) It gets hot.  Very hot.  My base unit (the one connected to the cable modem) gets uncomfortably hot on the bottom.  I set it on top of my cable modem and after a bit the plastic on top of the cable modem was borderline painful to the touch it had gotten so warm.  Heat is the bane of all electronics.  Unfortunately in Eero's zeal to make a slick looking unit (and it does look good) they compromised some engineering basics like allowing heat to escape.  There are no vent holes in the unit and the rubber "feet" it stands on barely raise it above what it is sitting on so the airflow is very poor.  As a quick solution I took to using bottle caps to put under the corners to lift it a bit to get better airflow under the unit and keep it from cooking my cable modem.  I understand they wanted sleek units but surely they could have done this better.  It is no longer "sleek" when I have bottle caps propping it up.  The other units, since they only direct traffic to the base, do not seem to get as warm so no bottle caps there.2) Each unit only has two ethernet ports.  This is not enough.  It should have four at a minimum at this price.  For instance my entertainment setup has several devices that can use the internet.  Not all are wireless and even those that are I would prefer to be wired.  The less "chatter" from multiple units in the same space the better.  With only two ports I had to buy an ethernet switch to handle all the devices.  With my base unit I have my PC and Sonos box and of course the cable modem to plug into.  Fortunately the Sonos box had two ports so I could chain it along but would have much preferred plugging into the Eero unit but I couldn't.  Three connections, two ports...won't work.3) The Eero setup a 5Ghz network which is nice but I have no idea how to access it.  I suppose 5Ghz only devices will get online but I cannot see how to use that network in lieu of 2.4Ghz.  Perhaps it uses whichever works best but it is not clear.4) With no external antenna performance is somewhat limited.  I realize this is a design choice and for me the internal antennas suffice but having setup other WiFi networks I can say that an external antenna can certainly improve overall WiFi performance.5) Their app shows a speedtest.  Pretty sure it is mostly worthless and only reporting speeds from the base unit that is connected directly into the cable modem (or whatever modem you use).  Using third party speedtests I get the same results when next to my base unit but slower (albeit still good) speeds when near the remote units.  Not exactly a lie but misleading and I really wish there was a way to test each base unit for optimal placement.6) No mounting options that I can see.  You need third party solutions if you want to mount it on a wall.  For $500 I would hope they would provide that option.All-in-all this is a very welcome entry to home WiFi.  I have been amazed it has taken this long for a manufacturer to make a simple to use home WiFi system.  My last routers were two top of the line Asus RT-AC68R units and it took me many hours (6+) to get them working right and Asus tech support was near useless.  You will not have that problem with an Eero.With some refinements this could be a perfect product.

Title: I wanted to love this product but.......
Review Comment: I too have to leave a poor review.I am also a wireless engineer with a complex setup. I was using 6 Apple Airports to create a unified network in my home (about 3000 sq Ft)I have now installed 4 EEros. The performance is great when they work. Unfortunately they don't work all the time. And this highlights the HUGE problem with the devices. There are no tools of any kind to do anything to the devices. I can not easily troubleshoot these.I am running the Apple Airport net with the Eeros. (Very diverse channels - no interference between he devices. Eeros are on channels 1 and 36 - airports on 11 and 149). I reduced the airports to 4 units rather than 6. Yet the Airports, while not providing the speed of the Eeros as consistently, they have far less problems. The routers are connected to two Separate internet connections of 130 Mbps each and both systems have different public IP addresses.Granted I have a complex network. I do wireless cameras and home automation so there are usual about 40 devices connected at any one time. I have start remigrating devices back to the Airport side since the Eero side performs so poorly.Yesterday my son was having problems connecting in his room, (12 ft from the Eero). His phone (iPhone 6) showed a speedtest speed of 1.86 Mbps on the Eero net. My 6s was at the same time registering speeds of 60+ mbps standing next to him. Rebooting the iPhones, restarting the Wifi stack, restarting the entire system changed nothing. His Xbox One? Showing speeds less than 1mbps. Sometimes.Of course, since the customer is totally locked out of the router, there is very little that can be done. I have used external tools to do a  heat map of the system and RF flux density is pretty uniform for the Eeros. But the lack of any real tools to change any parameters makes this way too expensive. I understand they want to simplify this but locking us all out negates the advantages.I really really wanted to love these devices. I am out 700$ for a system that does not function as reliably as my old one. I am now stuck with hoping that there will be some automatic software update that might solve the problem.The picture is my phone endlessly trying to get an address from the Eero system this morning. Neither mine nor my wife's phone will acquire a connection. More work with little tools, this is so frustrating...

Title: If I could give EERO 6 stars I would - they saved my marriage
Review Comment: If I could give EERO 6 stars I would.  These units have transformed our home WiFi from a spotty, erratic experience that was the source of many Friday night movie arguments to a rock solid WiFi experience...wherever we are in our three story house.  I no longer have to pretend to be the household network geek and instead can settle down and watch a great movie with the family.Simply put, I cannot stop telling people about these units - every dinner party is an opportunity to transform another family's WiFi experience.  I only wished I could have installed them years ago.  If you want to really appreciate a connected, Internet of Things household you have to get EERO.

Title: AWFUL EXPERIENCE (but customer service was great, but could only do so much!)
Review Comment: Just returned this!  Absolutely would not work.  First, the main unit into modem looked like it should have been returned.  light never went flashing blue.  Only after multiple resets with pin did it somewhat work.  the other two units blinked for a while then invariably went to red.  also, one unit was extremely hot.  Instructions recommend the units "see" each other.  What the hell good is that unless one lives in a space with no walls.  this is pretty pathetic and not yet ready for prime time.  Looked on the website at their listings for employees--a lot of spots need filling!!!!  Nick should spend a lot more time on quality control than pr.  I also really question the validity of the high ratings.  Really question them.  How I wish, for five hundred bucks this would have worked.  will take a look at the "new guys" who will  release in a month (for two hundred bucks less!  But I hope they learn their lessons, take heed, and have a really superior product before it launches.  Units that are meant to "see" each other, spaced within forty feet from main unit and meant to be spaced in a triangular pattern???  Really?  This is a miserable, costly joke.

Title: This was SO easy to connect by following the App
Review Comment: This was SO easy to connect by following the App. Now the entire family from upstairs to downstairs is complaint free when it comes to the signal strength. No more caching or lag stuttering from my huge itunes library. To go for the better part of a week and not get a complaint about the internet makes it worth every penny.

Title: Less drops, but much slower speed.
Review Comment: This sounded like a great idea for my 3,400 sq/ft home where I run into issues away from my one wireless router.  The problem was that suddenly streaming movies was really bad.  It made my apple tv unwatchable, even with the "main" unit 6 inches from my apple tv.  I will say there were less drops in remote corners of my home, but it was slower than my ASUS dual band gig router.  I think I will just end up buying a second one of those for the other end of my house and create my own "mesh".  Did not expect there to be such a difference in speed.

Title: A great mesh wifi system for the common man
Review Comment: I tried a million different solutions before finally settling on the Eero and I could not be happier with the result.I live in a 2000 square foot apartment that is two floors. The walls must be made of wifi blocking material, because I couldn't get a signal to travel further than one room over. I tried another more "advanced" mesh wifi system first, but I found that it did not deal with hand-offs very well and I would frequently remain connected to a more distant access point with a weaker signal. ThereI ultimately ended up hard wiring my Eeros to each other, but probably could have gotten away with using the wifi only. My internet is about 170mbs at the primary Eero, but I would only get about 70mbs at each of the other devices. I don't blame the Eero though, because other repeaters couldn't even connect in my apartment if I separated them by a single room. With Cat6 cable between them I get a solid 170mbs in every room now.*** Warning ***If your internet requires a captive portal you will not be able to use Eero. That means that if you see some time of login screen when you first connect a new device to your internet before you get general internet access, the Eero will not work. There needs to immediately be access to internet when the Eero is connected. My internet provider had a captive portal, so I currently have the Eero in bridge mode and use an Apple Time Capsule as my router (with wireless turned off). Hopefully this gets fixed in a future Eero update given that it seems pretty stupid that there is absolutely no functionality of the Eero when internet access is unavailable. What if Eero goes out of business??? This will just be an expensive paperweight if they stop supporting their servers. I think they should create some basic local functionality in a future update that works even if the remote management were to disappear. Overall, this is still a great product and solves an issue that many people have, but I hope they address this in the future.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Super cool

Title: Problem Solver!
Review Comment: Solved the issues in our long ranch style home after trying many other options. Totally worth the price for zero outages and headaches.I can now stream Netflix in a room that I couldn't get wifi on my phone before. Major upgrade.

Title: Excellent coverage and functionality
Review Comment: I have been super happy with these. I was covering a 2 story, 4000 sq ft home with two routers networked together. We constantly had communication and coverage issues as well is problems with the number of wireless devices trying to connect to the network. We purchased the triple pack to try and fix this and it has worked really well. There is some functionality that I believe they need to add to the app which I have communicated to the manufacturer. Since purchase I have only had one issue where one of the units kept disconnecting either from the network or disconnecting the devices associated with it. Either way, all it needed was to be unplugged for 30 seconds and it cleared whatever the issue was. Set up is actually as easy as they say and other than one isolated incident has worked flawlessly. It has fixed every issue that lead us to purchase the system. I highly recommend these for easy network setup and excellent coverage.

Title: Easy to setup and extremely powerful
Review Comment: Easy to setup and extremely powerful.  Finally a solution that kills the dead spots.  Well done!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: this product is excellent best wifi unit ever

Title: Finally!
Review Comment: Works awesome, setup was EASY.  I finally have coverage that easily spans my entire home@

Title: Sorcery
Review Comment: Quite an amazing product. I have messed with WiFi for years, powerful routers, power line, repeaters, always in pursuit of raw speed in every corner of the house. My Comcast service provides 180 Mb/s and is very reliable. My issues were a dead spot in the back office, spotty Apple remote performance, a Samsung TV with a dreadful WiFi dongle, a Lenovo with a poor USB WiFi implementation and adapters randomly picking the wrong network access point. I guess after several years, WiFi cynicism creeps in and acceptance of issues happens.Coverage is complex, but WiFi adapter settings are Pandora's Box. So many, so different, so poorly described.I set up the eero network in an hour, carefully placing the devices throughout the house. The application is simple to use. Then I wait 24 hours for the network to be optimized (not really, heavy use of speed test). My initial tests were so, so. But in the morning, presto! 60Mb/s or higher everywhere!Samsung TV - rock solid. Apple remote finds the Apple TVs, Lenovo goes from 40Mb/s to 80Mb/s, Office at 70Mb/s from a spotty 30Mb/s.Sorcery.I am delighted to hand my network management to eero and so far they are doing a great job. If you place no value on your time, this looks expensive. But the moment you realize you could be doing something else rather than learning to tame the dark art of WiFi configuration, this is a steal.

Title: No more wifi dead zones!!
Review Comment: Once set up these mesh wifi routers work great. Eero tech support has been very helpful and easy to reach by phone when I had questions or made suggestions for improvements. We have a brick home so it takes 4 eero routers but we finally have wifi everywhere and no dad zones.

Title: Definitely Recommend Eero
Review Comment: Eero is fantastic end-to-end.  From packaging to directions to set-up to performance, it is better than anything on the market.
