I've searched for better solutions over the years going from Netgear routers and extenders to Apple AirPort Extreme/Expresses (a definite improvement) to Eero.  The app makes it exceptionally easy to get going with one or ten eeros in your home.

Title: Thank you
Review Comment: For years I've dealt with connectivity issues.  Not anymore.  I used to pay for 25mbps, but once funneled through my stock centurylink router I was getting 14mbps right next to the router and 6mbps in places further from the origination point.  I was moving to a bigger home...getting faster internet, and decided to get the infrastructure I needed to truly enjoy it.  I pay for 40mbps and I get around 42mbps.  Unadulterated fun!  They were expensive in my opinion, but for what they can do and the hassles you no longer deal with, they start to make sense.  I'm happy...high price and all.  Even way in my backyard I can still get speeds up to 27mbps as opposed to just being cut off before.

Title: great router, great customer service
Review Comment: love this router! incredibly easy to set up and their help desk replies SO quickly.we live in a 1920s duplex so the wifi doesn't go very far. we tried an Extender for awhile and it was frustrating going from one wifi network to the extended version. now with 2 eeros, we have seamless and FAST internet.highly recommended.

Title: Worth the price tag!
Review Comment: These were delivered in a beautifully designed package and the set up was made INCREDIBLY easy. The app walks you through the minimal steps it takes. I have a one bedroom apartment, but because it's an old house various rooms had terrible connection to the wifi. My bedroom went from getting 9mbps, to 35mbps. Worth every penny, and I'm telling everyone I know about them!

Title: One word .. AWESOMMME
Review Comment: In one word : Awesommme life saver.Prior to purchasing this product, we had been through multiples of changes and products - including changing ISP as well as equipment like extenders, new routers etc etc but due to whatever reason, NO LUCK with trouble free Wi-Fi . Kids complaining about inability to do homework, inability to watch TV using sling etc JUST PLAIN AWFUL - then:::: chance encounter with info about EERO and in desperation but the bullet and spent the dough to buy this. With low expectations - fully expecting to return this product, what can I say ... We were floored -- awesome speed throughout the more than 5000 after with just 3 units. Flawless TV, online browsing speeds ..everything . THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Just awesome, 1800 SQ Ft home on 3 floors.  Now I have stable and fast WiFi

Title: It has been an absolutely perfect. I have had 0 issues since setup a ...
Review Comment: It has been an absolutely perfect. I have had 0 issues since setup a few weeks ago. Well worth the money if you never want to worry about wifi again.

Title: Worth every penny
Review Comment: It solved all of our wi-fi issues, no more dead spots, even out by the pool

Title: Outstanding!
Review Comment: Wow! Installation....easy. Performance....outstanding. Delivers on their promise

Title: Simple Install. Works Great.
Review Comment: I don't think I've ever had a more simple and easy network installation.  Placed two units on the ground floor and one on the second floor.  Units do have a distance limitation of 40 ft apart.  Follow the install app.  Very easy.It's been 9 months now and my Eero network has continued to work flawlessly.  One thing I would like to see is a Unit with more Ethernet ports for use in those locations  where I still have network equipment that is not wireless, e.g. TiVo, Vonage, UPS, et al.

Title: As Advertised. Does the Job.
Review Comment: After suffering with poor coverage, about 5 months ago I invested in a range extender for my wifi network.  The result was intermittent improvement.  After reading about eero I decided to give it a try.  I think I could have gotten by with 2 but the 3 pack seemed to be the better buy if 2 didn't work.  Amazon delivered in a day and, as advertised set up was virtually automatic.  The 3 eero's automatically found each other once telling them a network name and pw.  It found all 12 of our networked devices and seamlessly set them up.  Up and going in under 10 minutes.  And, no more signal dropouts; even from the far end of the house.  Not inexpensive but worth it in stable results.

Title: I called tech support and the folks were very nice, but they couldn't fix the problem
Review Comment: I switched to Comcast from ATT which had low speeds coming into house.  With ATT I was getting about the same speed wirelessly as wired (around 20 mbps average).  With Comcast, I now have 300 mbps coming into house and only get a fraction of that (around 80 mbps) wirelessly through this system.  I called tech support and the folks were very nice, but they couldn't fix the problem.  Wired I get 300+ mbps, Wireless via eero system around 80 mbps.  Not what I expected and I sure woudn't spend this kind of money had I known.I also don't have a modem / router combo in case you are thinking that I needed to setup router in bridge mode (which you do need to do if you have such a combo). I have an ARRIS sb 6190 which is a modem only so no bridge setup was needed.

Title: It just works
Review Comment: My house presents quiet a challenge for WiFi. Multiple floors of plaster & lath, steel beams, pipes for water, hot-water heat, knob-and-tube wiring. Eero presents a strong signal everywhere, without having to manually switch to another network. Setup was dead simple, one step up from setting up a toaster. Plug devices in, fire up the phone app, and you're in business after just a few, clearly-outlined taps.  Even my Sonos system, which has proved finicky in the past, accepted Eero with no problem. Highly recommended for signal quality, and ease of setup.

Title: EERO in FIOS out.
Review Comment: I have FIOS and according to their ads is the best thing since sliced bread.  I live in a 55 yr old house with real thick plaster walls held in place by wire mesh. What a struggle to get a wifi signal. I bought one from netgear and I would have needed a degree in networking to install it. It was sent back. Then it was an Apple one.  Required a computer which I no longer have and coax cable.  I been watching Eero for months but the price was up there. Remember you only get what you pay for. The installation was a bit tricky but their tech support is the best bar none.  I'm tickled pink that the wifi signal is so strong in the house and in the outdoors.  Thanks Eero

Title: Plug and play? Not.  Eero can't get it to work on my vanilla DSL network!
Review Comment: Easy to set up?  Only if you're lucky.  I have to send mine back because they can't figure it out.After 2 hours with Eero Tech Support and another hour with Linksys and $30 to restore my wireless, this system still doesn't work.  I have a vanilla AT&T router (tens of thousands of them out there) and a vanilla Linksys router.  Not only would the Eero not register, it disabled my wireless.  Eero said this was impossible.  But it happened twice.One of the engineers from Eero was awful...said there couldn't possibly be anything wrong with my Eero.  The second was more honest and spent 1.5 hours troubleshooting at the end of which my vanilla network at AT&T DSL still wouldn't interface properly with this device.Now I have a trip to Staples to buy a box (they said they wouldn't provide one) to ship back.3 hours of my time and $30 gone forever.

Title: Wifi for dummies
Review Comment: I wrote a long review for this but when I added this photo first I lost everything I had written. Not going thru that again, just let me say that if eero fits your budget, get it. Will triple or quadruple your speeds up to the amount you are subscribed for. So easy to set up my mother could do it. I went from 10-15 mps to 50-80 mps. Beautiful product, reminds me of apple products, elegant.

Title: 5x increase in speed & no more dead spots
Review Comment: Solved my problem of dead spots in my 2200sqft, 3 level house, and download speeds improved from the usual 17Mb to consistently over 80Mbps.

Title: Understand the EERO WIFI setup requirements before purchasing
Review Comment: Not enough pre sales information for me to avoid it not working in my house. It setup easily but didn't provide fast and total Internet. I bought 3 only to find out that the design for use is based on all EERO monitors being within 40 feet of each other and having a clear view to each other. Anything less causes issues with good reception between them. In addition if you leave your current WIFI in place as I initially did, it competes for both the 2.4GHZ and 5GHZ frequencies and that makes sense but they don't tell you that in the pre-sales so only when you trouble shoot your issues do they tell you to try putting your original router in bridge mode. They even tell you the process to follow so I did try that several times only to find that when my WIFI was in bridge mode to the EERO the EERO lights turned red with no signal and me no WIFI. I tried redoing this several times and even had my cable company try it with me to now avail. As a result, I have disconnected and am returning the EERO system to Amazon. I am sure that if you are in a modern home or one where all EERO's can see each other they will work as advertised but in my 1940's Georgian home it didn't.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works amazing, great customer service

Title: So far so mostly good
Review Comment: I like the concept of the mesh network. It set up pretty easily, with a hiccup, the first time it tried to register the device, it just hung there for several minutes before I gave up, backed into the previous step, and tried again at which point it finished setting up, and the next two eeros were pretty painless. All my eeros are connected to gigabit lan.I have ordered a 4th eero, two for upstairs, two for the basement, so as to truly blanket the house. The living room, which currently has no eero, "only" gets medium speed wireless-n, and with the 4th, will presumably get full wireless AC.All I ask is that you don't sell out to google, as that inevitably means that my $700 investment will be shut down within 2 years.Edit: Well, I didn't do enough testing before ordering a 4th eero, it is not really needed. I brought my Moto X down here, and it apparently transferred to a different eero than the laptop connected to, and was getting wireless AC speed. I brought the laptop back down, and it got wireless-n speed again, so I turned the radio on and off, and when it reconnected, it was getting 75% of the speed it got when in the same room as an eero, in other words, wireless AC, but through a wall or ceiling.June 5th, 2016A win for Eero. While my laptop always got full internet speed with my previous Dlink AP, my iPads and Moto X didn't. My Moto X still doesn't run at full speed, but it runs faster than it did. My iPads both get full internet speed now.EDIT 8/11/16I knew that eero lost it's wifi when it loses the internet, which is unacceptable in itself, but apparently, it loses the DHCP server or something if it loses it for an extended period of time. I lost my internet for 2 days, and at some point the wired network went wonky too. I guess I'll have to press my TPlink router back into service for DHCP  and emergency Wifi. I hope they fix this unacceptable flaw in the future, because I like it when  it's working. For the $708 I paid for 4 eeros, this is just a ridiculous flaw. If/when this is fixed, I'll restore the 5 stars.

Title: An incredible product...
Review Comment: We bought these to increase wifi coverage in the house - the three-pack drastically improved it, so much we even purchased an additional unit to add coverage throughout the backyard/garage.We decided to go with eero because of customer and professional reviews.  The ease of setup was incredible - with other network devices you need to add repeaters or extenders and usually have to change the SSID as a result, resulting in constant switching back and forth depending on where you are in the house...  With this, there is no need for any of that.  Speed improved and the absolute best part is that we have full bars EVERYWHERE.  It's not perfect coverage only next to the units or in their direct line - wherever you are, wherever you go in the house/yard, you stay connected perfectly.It was also absolutely, 100%, the easiest router we've ever set up.  It was maybe 20 minutes from the time we opened package until it was up and running. We got flawless coverage with the three pack throughout two floors and basement of a five bedroom house.  One additional unit covers the entire backyard and garage.A must-have if you are in the market for incredible connectivity...

Title: Great product and simple set-up
Review Comment: Completely solved our dead-zones within our house. Also, the consistency of not changing between various networks (1, 2, 3) makes life so much easier.Great product and simple set-up!

Title: Better than expected
Review Comment: Has completely change my wifi experience in my home.  No more dead spots, easy to manage and check speeds with app.  Expensive, but the way we are going with technology enabled devices like Nest and sprinkler systems, it is highly worth having a consistent connection.  Allows multiple users, including data hungry kids, to be online simultaneously.  No more lag on Netflix on fast screen either.  Exceeded my expectations.

Title: Wifi as it should be
Review Comment: This solved my wifi range issues. I used a Blackhawk router before and also tried an Amped Wireless Athena... Both are incapable of delivering reliable wifi to my entire house. I have about 22 wifi devices on my network including a few iPads, Android devices and 8 Nest Cams. The Nest cam kept dropping off the grid because of a weak signal. Ever since the Eero, no more issues. I put the eero's at acceptable distances and the wifi signal is solid everywhere I go in my house. The last Nest Cam I installed was on the back of my detached garage, so I was out of range. I added a 4th Eero to my setup and BINGO! Worked like a charm. The wifi signal is seamlessly available anywhere I can move inside my house or even in my yard. Not cheap, but I pay enough money for my internet bill that the least I could do is invest in technology to provide that internet service to my entire property.

Title: Excellent Product, But big bigconcern with Local Lan Issue when Internet is not working
Review Comment: Excellent Product, Excellent Customer Service, the only reason I gave it a four star is because if the internet is down and power cycles to eero it looses local connection. Local Network is not functional and that is a big concern as none of other routers I have used does that as the local network keeps working. This really needs to be fixed as is a major bug. Will wait to see if it gets fixed soon or will have to move back to my older router as much as would like to keep using this.

Title: I took that chance in buying this and am so glad I did
Review Comment: We live in a duplex down condo that was just not being served effectively by our Apple AirPort Extreme. I took that chance in buying this and am so glad I did. Setup was extremely simple - took me less than 15 minutes to get everything up-and-running. We've had no issues with reliability of connection or speed or loss of bandwidth. This blankets our 1800SF with no dead spots. And that's important since my Verizon cell signal won't reach far into the condo, especially downstairs in my office. This allows me to seamlessly connect to the WiFi, affording me the ability to make calls over WiFi on my cell. Absolutely recommend this amazing system!

Title: Not happy
Review Comment: Plugged it in and ruined our internet modem programming. It made the modem create faulty ip addresses and now we are totally without internet service. Not good.

Title: Jury is still out, although mostly works as advertised
Review Comment: I've had these for about a month and the jury is still out.  For my laptops and small devices, including some NEST thermostats, the eero (3 devices) works as advertised, in that I've seamlessly extended my wireless network throughout my spread-out home and well into my backyard.  I initially had some issues with my AT&T microcell and this left me guessing -- was it because of the eero (which does not explicitly support QoS for VoIP or streaming) or something else?  The eero interface (which is only available as an ios or android application) provides little to nothing by way of insight into the internals of the network.  To that end, I experimented and ended up moving the eero to bridge mode and turning my Airport Express into a DHCP server and connecting it all via network switch -- and this did not improve the performance of the microcell.  Only moving the microcell as far from the eero as possible led to improvements in microcell performance.  The other anomaly involves my Roku 3 and streaming video.  Although speed tests routinely come up at about 33 Mbps, streaming a TV show or movie usually involves one or more (as in, every ten minutes) interruption to the video stream with a diagnostic of "network error" and little else.  Unfortunately, there are no tools available to provide me with insight into exactly what's going on.  However, I am currently working with eero technical support.  Finally, it should be noted that when you setup the eero, you hand over a great deal of control to eero incorporated.  Since the product was made to be as simple to setup as possible, the result is that complexity is now managed by eero itself.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Takes the tech out of wireless.  This is wireless system for dummies!

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Didn't help with my coverage / range issues at all.  Not sure why - tried everything - moving on.

Title: Great product. Great installation support.  This changes the ballgame for home networking!
Review Comment: I moved into a new townhouse 3 years ago, and ever since then I have struggled to find a good wifi solution. For whatever reason I can't get a reasonable signal no matter where I put the router/wifi. Resorted to putting in two routers, using range extenders, power line solutions, and nothing seemed to be very effective. In total I must have spent at least $2,000 trying to find a reasonable solution. Finally, three weeks ago, I purchased the Eero system. Using its mesh network technology, I have placed three units in my house and everything works seamlessly on one network.Setup was reasonable and only took about 15 minutes. I had one issue finding one of the devices and called support and got a person right away who assisted me and I was able to fix my issue within 2 minutes.

Title: Unbox it, plug it in, and boom, ...
Review Comment: Unbox it, plug it in, and boom, instant network. Coverage throughout the house, the old dead spots are gone.

Title: Stop compromosing.
Review Comment: The end of losing value of monthly cost of high speed Internet. Seamless solution that removes technical barriers. Must have.

Title: Not a bad system. It's perhaps still under developed in my ...
Review Comment: Not a bad system. It's perhaps still under developed in my opinion. It lacks luster in features. The application doesn't provide very good analytics. I will admit that the home wifi problems I was having before installing this system quickly dissipated after eero. No more dead spots. Wireless speeds much better. Price point for what you get at this stage is way high. This system with 3 eero's would be better priced at 299.00 not 499.00. Check out eBay before you buy new.

Title: Huge improvement in coverage
Review Comment: I have a 4,400 sq ft home with the cable modem stuck in the basement.  A really tough design for coverage.  I replaced an Apple system which was good but not delivering AC 5g throughout.  What a difference.  Speedtest consistently shows 70-130 Mbps throughout the house.  My surface operates at 650-850 where in the same spot it was 144.  (I think due to lack of AC 5g strength).  This system seems to get even better over time as it figures out your house.You won't be disappointed.

Title: A Well Designed Product
Review Comment: Simply one of the greatest products to emerge in years.  The three pack Eero home WiFi system is extremely easy to setup and configure that took no time at all.  Also the coverage the each device provides is impressive as is the mobile app and the UI is well designed.

Title: Eero For Problem Houses: The Dissapointing Reality
Review Comment: I was excited to try Eero, as the product seemed like a potential solution to my family's ongoing WiFi problem. Our house is very large, and the walls are a unique build and are especially dense. So far, the only solution that has worked well has been a network of Apple AirPort Extreme towers around the house. This has produced a semi-reliable signal; but with little speed consistency. However, the main goal was to improve the WiFi signal in the family room for streaming purposes and Eero seemed like a a good shot.Before installing, I tested speeds in three rooms as scientifically as possible. We were getting 100mps download speeds in the room with the modem and 50mps in the family room (not far away, but several thick walls in between). Not great, but livable. I then unpacked Eero (beautifully designed and packaged, and very easy to install) and set up the three in the same configuration as the three AirPort Extreme towers we had been using. I then performed the speed test again. Sadly, Eero could not live up to their claim to improve WiFi in problem houses. The speeds in both rooms had slowed to a crawl, with 5mps speeds in the family room and 8mps speeds in the modem room. I tested for a while, but no change. As soon as I plugged the Apple towers back in, we were at 50mps again.In a fight between Apple AirPort Extreme and Eero for signal strength in problem houses, Eero looses badly. I would suggest the company removes mention of the product's use in houses with WiFi issues, as it is not yet powerful enough to address these. Living in a regular home with standard walls, I would absolutely buy Eero again. The product and experience is great, but stick with Apple towers if you have very thick walls in your house.

Title: 240 Mbps!...just works!
Review Comment: Just installed yesterday--15 minutes to install three units throughout the house.  Some head scratching with my sonos integration...I just had to power cycle through all of my sonos units and all 7 components were recognized.  Went from 20 Mbps to 240 Mbps on Fast.com speed check...wow!  Excellent app integration as well on iphon.  Still early, but will post an update if I run into any frustrations/issues.

Title: GREAT Product
Review Comment: Amazingly easy setup and GREAT coverage! There may be cheaper solutions but no setup as easy as this was.

Title: The best router system on the market!!+++
Review Comment: Awesome wifi system that is super simple to set up, even for a rank beginner. I have had zero down time and I am averaging 84 Mbps which allows multiple users to stream video, surf the net and check email, all at the same time. I would recommend the three pack for an average sized home. For a large multi-level home you may want 4-5 and for an apartment one should do the job. The best router that I have ever purchased!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works great!

Title: Hopefully better software in the future for eero.
Review Comment: The devices themselves are well built and have a very clean design, the setup is very easy and works. The issue for more than a casual user is, the feature set of the software, lacks even some very basic controls, for example, blocking by MAC address, and many many others. I suspect it might be a nice product once the software stack is significantly improved.

Title: This product rocks!
Review Comment: Eero is the best wifi system I have used to date!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy set up.  Completely reliable.  Eliminates dead zones.

Title: Amazing router
Review Comment: I've had a set of 3 eero routers for two months now and they are amazing.  The signal has not dropped even once, there are no dead spots in my house and the speed is incredible everywhere. It was the perfect wifi solution for me.

Title: I'm glad my friends recommended eero even though at first I ...
Review Comment: I live in San Francisco in an old 1906 home. Wifi has always been an issue in this house. I had come to accept that I would not get internet in some areas of the house which seems so weird in San Francisco.I'm glad my friends recommended eero even though at first I did not believe the hype. Once purchased, the set up of the 3 pack eero system took about 10 minutes. I placed them in three locations on three different floors of my house- ground floor, kitchen (1st floor), and the living room on the 2nd floor. Immediately (well after the system boots up) I had a stronger wifi connection in all the areas where I was previously able to connect to the internet. Additionally I now have internet in all the areas where I literally could not even open a web page before. Upload and download speeds are much faster. Love it so far!

Title: Easy to set up and works great
Review Comment: Easy to set up and works great. WiFi speeds faster than a normal WiFi router. I ended up buying two sets of 3 to cover the our whole property. For most places I am sure one sett of 3 will work fine to cover their home.

Title: Eliminates WIFI dead spots
Review Comment: Since I have installed the eero Home WIFI System, I have eliminated the WIFI dead spots that existed in my house. That was the reason why I purchased this system. My previous experience with a WIFI extender did not work well. I am extremely happy that I purchased the eero Home WIFI System Pack of 3.

Title: eero is a homerun solution
Review Comment: I installed this eero (pack of 3 unit) combo mesh system as soon as I received them via Amazon Prime. Because I was also installing Comcast 150mbps Internet service the next day and until installed , I continued to use the slower att DSL solution that day with these new units with a WiFi ssid already configured to my own desired WiFi IDs/passwords. Then using these eero units, I just power cycled then reconnected to the nice/simple Netgear cable modem(CM600-100NAS) I ordered at the same time as I ordered these eero units, just changing a the 10BaseT cable from the att gateway to new Comcast modem when Comcast lit up the service the following day at my house.With the Comcast service, I wanted better WiFi coverage than supplied by any Comcast gateway integrated router. Plus I did-not want to lease any cablemodem/routher wifi equipment from Comcast (ROI of providing myself less than a year).  It seemed like the eero was a possible clean solution, providing better wifi coverage than available using the gateways provided under lease from my ISP (Comcast).The eero packaging was very clean and well marked for "how to install" and the iPhone application to do the actual set-up was surprisingly very simple to use. After installing the initial set of eero's with full success, I decided to get fancy as I wanted to get "5 bars of coverage" everywhere in a rather large home footprint along with a separate detached storage area/building, so I ordered a 2nd set of eeros to expand my newly installed wifi mesh network.After expanding my eero mesh network, all went well again except some results with speedtest.net were more inconsistant than before my eero added expansion. To understand what was going on I rang a call into the eero support line (link to call right on the Iphone eero application(and iphone application easy to use, configure ssids/passwords, adding a guest network, etc). This support call I made is where eero really shined because:A gentleman named Dave answered the phone at the eeros support number. Dave was not just a phone agent answering and reading from a script. Rather, he was obviously a well educated/experienced IT networking professional with good customer support skills. After reviewing my home network configuration and my concerns, Dave ran a performance test between my eeros and while doing so answered my many rather detailed questions (I'm "retired from IT") with accuracy which I really appreciated. The quality of Dave's efforts working with me by phone was superb. It turns out I had two erros closer than need be, and in the end Dave's time with me over the phone assisted me in tuning this new eeros mesh network perfectly.  It's been flawless since.In addition, as a side benefit of the eero design: each remote eero in the mesh network provides a spare 10BaseT port that can be used to connect a hardwired device (TV, PC, switch, etc) if desired, or be used, if a hardwired network is available, as a "backhaul" to the erro that is plugged into the cable modem.So bottom line, eero provided me a perfect homerun solution.Doug

Title: Marketing Hype
Review Comment: Returned it, this product sucks. $500 for this junk? no thank you. There are much better and cheaper solutions such us UBIQUITI NETWORK products which i currently have, works 10 X better and stable.

Title: It works...
Review Comment: First, I am NOT a techie... When I went home for lunch on Friday, it was there waiting.. Why eat?  So, I started the install.  Amazing!  I only had one small issue so I called tech support.. Boom!  issue resolved.  Tech support patient and helpful... I elimindate 2 routers and to extenders..Now I notice how slow my Time Warner is, My decision now is live with slow or spend the $$ to upgrade.. First, find out how much, then make the decision..I am VERY impressed with Erro!  Saturday morning, got up to email telling me they upgraded the system overnight... I like that!!!

Title: Wondeful Technology!
Review Comment: Awesome! Reliable, easy to set up.  Great product.

Title: Just Buy It
Review Comment: I don't write reviews but this product solved all my home wifi issues.  I have a 4 story house that stumped all other solutions.  Eero fixed all of that in about 10 minutes of setup.  No more dead zones, slow speeds or disconnects.Had some issues setting up my Nest products but not sure if that was Eeros or issues with my 4 story house and Nests interconnect stuff.Also the product is stylish enough that you don't have to hide the unit.  Put it on a shelf and it looks like it belongs.  So much better than the spaceship looking units from other companies.Buy this product.

Title: One won't do it.
Review Comment: You need more than one. One plugs into your computer and must stay there.  Then you have to build out a network.  I wouldn't have purchased if I knew this information.

Title: but it did no better than what I already had
Review Comment: Not even close to being ready for prime time. I too hoped it would be the solution; but it did no better than what I already had. Just get the new Asus Wi-Fi router; problem solved!

Title: Everyone should have one
Review Comment: Same issues everyone has:  spotty internet in many parts of the house. Paying for highest speed available in our area, bought a booster, and still couldn't  access a clear signal. My sons video game system was always glitchy. I bought the Eero and it installed in less than 10 minutes and I have literally not had anything but high speed internet everywhere. Even extends into my backyard. I can't recommend it enough. Get this system.

Title: Wifi - SOLVED
Review Comment: This product replaced my apple time capsule.Wifi has been fixed in my home.

Title: Really wanted it to work.
Review Comment: I had heard about eero through Kevin Rose and bought it because I was always using the 2.4ghz signal since the 5ghz signal wasn't strong enough on my Asus RT-AC66R and recently had problems with it.I really wanted this to work but I just couldn't get the reliability to stick.When it did work, it worked well and fast.It may be that I have too complicated of a network, eero doesn't handle many wired connections well or to many wireless signals from neighbors interfering.If I basically do line of sight with no wired connections my wireless devices connected right away and worked well but every once in a while an eero would still go red and I couldn't figure why.The firmware did upgrade automatically and I did give it a few days like it mentioned 24 hours in the instructions. I ended up spending more than a couple hours of my time fiddling with try different positions in the house, wired vs none, etc.I ordered a used Netgear R8000 because I was getting so frustrated with eero. Read a review about it the Netgear via[...]Took me all of about 10 minutes to get it setup with "Smart Connect" turned on. Now have a strong 5ghz signal and not a signal issue.I have since returned eero. I don't believe it's ready for "prime time". Maybe firmware version 2.0 or just some additional feature to help diagnose issues. I think the technology is a good idea and maybe competitors like[...] will do better.If you have a basic network or just need a wireless connection with little setup this may be the devices for you. If you're pinching pennies, go with what [...]. Otherwise save yourself some headache and just go with one of these bad boys: [...]

Title: Absolutely Fantastic
Review Comment: Absolutely amazing. Pretty large house and we now have coverage everywhere and at incredible speeds. Set up was the most simple process and took 15 minutes max! Absolutely a great purchase.

Title: I was not very happy with the performance in that mode in my 2800 ...
Review Comment: I am cautiously optimistic.I have had significant performance problems trying to get some speed out of my 300MB TWC connection.  I recently went to a Mikrotik Wifi hotspot which allowed me full control over it, but I was never able to get any device even sitting on top of the hotspot above 30 - 50Mb/s, and Mikrotik support is by design rather limited without an expensive subscription and I was unable to get any help from the community to fix it.I initially had pre-ordered these back in March 2015 but by August the routers I bought the Mikrotiks to replace had failed and the device wasn't ready, so I always knew about them and came back in May 2016 and found them ready to ship so I ordered a three pack.Initially I wasn't aware I could plug them all into Ethernet and had them in the wireless extension mode.  I was not very happy with the performance in that mode in my 2800 square foot two story home.  The upstairs suffered as there was no line of site between the hosts.Once I figured out it was OK to plug each Eero into a wired port I re-installed those two devices connected to ethernet and now I find performance is really acceptable.  My iMac 2012 with 802.11n (no AC) is getting 150MB/s using Netflix's new fast.com speed test.  My 802.11ac MacBook is getting 280 Mbps.  The iOS devices easily hit 100Mb/s.I use a physical firewall device (pfsense 4860) as well so these devices are in bridged mode to my own router.  I prefer this as I get more control/visibility on what is going on with my network.I have roughly 30 - 35 devices of various types (Gaming Machines, Laptops, Desktops, multiple iPad / iPhones, Nest, Dish Hopper, etc) connected and have had no issues with any of them connecting up and performing.So I'm cautiously optimistic.  This is after about four days of running.

Title: Super Effective + Worth Every Penny!
Review Comment: We have Verizon FiOS, and with their dinky router (even the latest Gigabit one), the coverage was haphazard at best. As soon as we installed eero, we had phenomenal, strong coverage all over the entire house and even in the yard! Our smart TV would sit and buffer Hulu and Netflix forever before, and now it hardly ever buffers! LOVE what the eero has done for our home / home-office!! Super easy to install as well. Took about 2 minutes!

Title: Not ready for primetime
Review Comment: These simply dont work in larger homes. I brought 2 sets, that equals 6 eero's and I could never get a constant repeated signal throughout my home. In fact, there were many times rooms where I had eeros in direct sight of each other and less than 40ft apart dropped. Moreover, the network was over managed. I get 150+ download on eero never got above 50. Not ready for prime time. I will say the customer support is very good other that it took me two weeks to get it returned.

Title: Good product
Review Comment: We moved into a new house and had awful internet reception.  A media guy come out and suggested we order Eero.  Glad we did!  We get internet outside and upstairs.  Life saver

Title: Wifi That Finally Works!
Review Comment: I am really happy I purchased these. I actually have had these twice as the first time I purchased them I sent them back because I just could not justify the price, but like so many things in our lives, we really don't know what we have until it's gone.The high price is for someone like me who can't understand the way "mesh" wifi really works. Our home is a 2,700+ sqft plus a 1,200sqft basement over three levels total. Wifi in the home has always been tricky, and we have had a bevy of range extenders, but they were all of different names, wouldn't sync up etc. But with this, things finally work!

Title: Unreliable, Seems like a paid beta program
Review Comment: I had extremely high hopes for Eero. I dove in after reading all the great reviews. I originally purchased it for a small office, 10-20 users with a 300/75 fiber connection. Setup was super simple, I connected my first Eero directly to my fiber modem. After setting the eero to bridge mode, the first speed test was stellar. I proceeded adding the next two eeros, all three were hardwired. After adding the second and third I began to experience connectivity issues with our internet. Even bypassing the eeros, I still had issues that forced me to reboot my fiber modem. After reading through reviews and online forums, I found that my version might be the culprit (1.0) as other users reported similar behavior.I took the eeros home to test without disturbing others. I have a 1 gig fiber connection at home with Cat 6 wiring throughout. I tried connecting the eeros via hardware at first. They all came up for about 5 minutes and then started losing connection. There was no rhyme or reason to which eero was losing connection and it seemed to take my overall connection down...I couldn't even access internet through my Apple Airport (also in bridge mode). I reset the devices and tried again without hardwiring the second and third eeros....but I got the same results. Newer firmware is available that might solve the issue, but you are not able to force a firmware update. Instead, updates are done late at night and/or early in the morning. The idea of $500 worth of gear that can't be updated on-demand combined with the fact they were so buggy....ruined my experience. I had high hopes for the Eero system....very disappointed.

Title: The best WiFi system I've ever used - incredibly easy to ...
Review Comment: The best WiFi system I've ever used - incredibly easy to set-up, very fast internet connections, and excellent coverage (3 units) in my home.  I'll never look at a WiFi extender product again.  The price ($499) may seem high, but by the time you get a top rated WiFi Router and some range extenders (which will be difficult to set-up), you will spend as much and probably won't have the performance of the eero system.

Title: Measurably improved speeds up and downstream over Netgear R7000
Review Comment: Three pack eero replacing a home network with a Netgear R7000 router plugged directly into our FIOS modem, from there were 3 ethernet over power line connections (mixture of Netgear and D-Link) to reach problematic spots for wi-fi reception and in one case, a device that required an ethernet connection, and finally, one Netgear AC750 wireless repeater.  All in all, the stuff all worked, my devices were online, and on the whole, happy.  It wast just simply a lot of stuff to maintain, especially with the odd event like a power outage causing me to have to at times connect/re-connect things, reboot, diagnose, etc.Save for one  powerline adapter for the one device that requires a hardwire, everything above is replaced with the three eeros and I couldn't be happier......so far.  I feel I need to keep that caveat in place for the time being.  The system has been in place for several days and has worked w/o a hitch (more on that below) whereas the system it replaced has been cobbled together over years and again, mostly did the job well.Setup was super easy and guided by the app.  I did encounter a slight hiccup on the installation of the first eero as it seemingly required my phone to have an internet connection to be able to proceed w/ the installation wizard.  Problem is that I live in a remote hilltop setting and reliable 3G/4G isn't a given and as such, the wizard crapped out a couple times.  Some awkward positioning of my body with my phone near a window got the phone online and a 3rd run of the wizard breezed through in seconds.  From there, the first eero was pumping out an internet connection that made the addition of the next two devices super quick.Network speed tests bear out very noticeable improvements, both upstream and downstream for my Southern CA based FIOS service (formerly Verizon, now Frontier).Prior to this, using my Macbook Pro and Speedtest.Net, downstream speeds averaged around 85 Mb/s give or take 5 Mb/s.  With the eeros, I've been getting very consistent 100-103 Mb/s.  Upstream has been eye opening.  Previous to this, with my Netgear R7000, upstream averaged 30 Mb/s, give or take 5 Mb/s.  With the eeros in place, I have seen ranging from 107 to 118 (!!!) Mb/s.  This has been consistently tested w/ the same laptop and the same speed test from various parts of the home with no noticeable differences from tests run from any part of the home from another.Perhaps there were configuration errors on my Netgear, but other than the DNS provider and admin password, everything on the machine was left stock.  I'm a fairly technical guy and the Netgear UI (scarily amongst the better ones out there) was so crappy and daunting that I dared not mess with anything.  The eero seemingly has a ton less capability in the app, but if I were being honest with myself, I wasn't using those features on the Netgear either-- e.g. DMZs, QoS, etc.  It would be nice to see more and more advanced features rolled out in the future, but I really don't feel like I'm giving up much.  ESPECIALLY when taking into consideration the reduced footprint of networking gear I have deployed, the fact that the units themselves are far less bulky and eye catching (in a bad way).  And factoring in the improved networking speeds I'm seeing on my actual devices themselves (and not just speedtests run at the router level itself), it makes my decision to swap over a total no brainer and absolutely worth every penny.  Many are balking at the cost, but factoring the cost of all the pieces I previously deployed, I'm fairly sure they surpass the cost of this 3 pack.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: No dead spots in our home anymore; well worth the money!

Title: Simple.  Effective.  But, Maybe A Little Too Simple.
Review Comment: The Eero does exactly what it says on the box:  Strong Wifi everywhere in your house. But...Let me just say right now: If you're using smart home devices like WeMo, Wink, Echo, etc, they WILL NOT WORK WITH THE EERO.That's because most (if not all, currently) Wifi based smart home products require a 2.4Ghz signal.  The Eero automatically switches back and forth between 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz signals meaning your smart home devices will randomly stop working.  I've switched my old Asus router to pass through mode--it only exists on the network now to maintain the smart home and wired devices.Simple.The Eero is far and away one the easiest routers I've ever set up.  The only one easier, in my experience, is Google's OnHub line.  I have an Eero on each floor of my house, and I am never out of signal range--even across the street!  I put one of them behind my wall mounted TV so that I could connect the TV and my Shield Android TV box via Ethernet.Too Simple.It took me forever to figure out why my Echo wouldn't stay connected--that's because it doesn't say anywhere in the documentation that the system hops back and forth between 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz.  Also, there's only two Ethernet ports on each device so I hope you don't have a lot of Ethernet connected devices on your network.  (I have the Arlo receiver, a NAS, and my computer.)  There is very, very little you can do with the app, too.This system is for people who's gadgets all live on Wifi, for whom normal routers aren't cutting it, who aren't interested in tweaking any but the most basic router settings, and who don't have Wifi smart home devices.

Title: No DDNS support = non-starter for anything but basic wi-fi.
Review Comment: No DDNS support, which renders this very expensive home wi-fi system useless if you want to access to many home devices/cameras/servers  when outside the home."We're working on it" with no date for implementation.Back to Amazon it goes.

Title: Incredibly disappointed and frustrated with eero
Review Comment: Incredibly disappointed and frustrated with eero. To be honest, i find it impossible to believe the reviews are from actual users. Purchased a set of 3, got them home and setup. The simple setup took 3.5 hours before i could get the eeros to speak with each other. I ended up with 2 eeros in places i didn't want them in order to complete the installation (poor signal quality - i saw that message at least a dozen times). I even tried wiring the other two eeros into our ethernet but this didn't help - they still need to communicate with each other. I finally got them working on Saturday. The connection did seem stable but the speed 12 feet from the third one (setup in my office) than i got in my office with a singe Asus router 2 flights up. The next day i checked the phone app and one of the eeros showed a red exclamation mark. Bad. I attempted for 2 more hours to set that up in the location (or at least near) that it was originally in. That failed. Finally i moved that eero up to the room outside where the main eero was. Nope. No go. Poor signal quality. From 8 feet away though an open door. Finally I gave up and reboxed and am returning. Perhaps i got a bad one, perhaps one failed. Who knows. What i can say is that the online support is close to useless. That the app is dumbed down to the point of no useful feedback (example: ethernet interface tells you the mac address but does not advise whether or not traffic is flowing, can't update - mine arrived with a 3 revision old firmware that i had to wait for them to update overnight, no actual read on signal strength to aid in placement) and the the coverage they offer seems no better than one good router and the speed is worse. Make sure to consult reviews outside Amazon. That was my mistake.

Title: Amazing. Easy to install fixed problems
Review Comment: Amazing.  Easy to install fixed problems ...great

Title: EERO is the solution!
Review Comment: The system is great!

Title: Replaced Airport Extreme. Work great as hardwired access points. Devices roam seamlessly between units. Very easy to setup.
Review Comment: I just recently received a gigabit internet connection from my ISP (Suddenlink) and was looking to replace a single Airport Extreme with something that would give me good coverage throughout my single story, 1900 sq. ft. home. I initially tried to use a second Airport Extreme in a roaming setup, but my devices simply wouldn't ever connect to the stronger signal when moving around the house. After reading the reviews on the Eero, I decided to give them a shot.The devices themselves are certainly aesthetically pleasing and unobtrusive, although I could say the same for my Airports. This was critical as my wife would not be happy with anything unsightly in various rooms around the house. Setup was fairly quick and easy. Just as advertised, the mobile app gets the devices up and running. I had a small hiccup and initially thought it was the fault of the Eeros, but turned out to be a problem with my MoCA setup. Once I ironed out the issue with my wiring, the devices have worked very well. I've found with my particular setup, it's most advantageous to use the units in bridge mode and allow my ISP-provided cable modem/router to handle the routing duties.Our devices roam from unit to unit seamlessly. We're mostly an Apple household with iPhones, iPads, MacBooks, iMacs and AppleTVs, but we've also got a Nest thermostat, Xbox One, PS4, Circle, Hue and other devices on the network. So far, there have been no issues and the devices I have that have AC wireless capabilities are getting pretty close to the same speeds on speedtest.net that my gigabit ethernet devices are.I should also note that each of the three units I have are acting as hardwired access points as I have one unit plugged directly into my cable modem, another unit hardwired by CAT 6 ethernet and the third unit hardwired over MoCA 2.0/coax. I have not attempted to use these in strictly wireless mode, which I'm sure is what most people will use them in. My main concern was roaming and these work perfectly in that regard.

Title: Fantastic. I live in a 4 story house and ...
Review Comment: Fantastic.  I live in a 4 story house and was using a patchwork quilt of wireless routers, but still had dead zones everywhere, dropped signals and all sorts of problems.  I set up the eero system using 1 eero for each floor and it works perfectly.  The eeros are each plugged in to an ethernet jack.  However, I had to configure the system in a specific way that may be of interest to some of you.  The house is wired with ethernet jacks on each floor; they all emanate from the basement where the signal comes in from Time Warner Cable.  I had to get 4 eeros, and put one of them upstream of the switch that channels the signals to the different rooms.  Furthermore, I had to get a new switch since the very old linksys device I used to be using as a switch would not stop handing out its own IP addresses no matter how many times I changed its parameters telling it not to!  The eeros did not like that and got confused.  Once I bought a simple new 16-port switch, everything worked perfectly.There's another product out there called Ubiquiti Unifi wireless access points, but apparently you have to be a tech genius to set it up and the tech support is non-existent.  Avoid at all costs.

Title: Finally, WiFi that works.
Review Comment: We have an old house with concrete block interior walls and we are not able to run any new cable of any sort. I tried moving our router, adding a booster, adding a directional antenna, and could not get reliable signal in our bedroom or basement. Eero solved this problem with 50 Mbs downloads in every corner of our house and about 15 minutes of setup. Highly recommended for any setup where you need wireless range extension in a residential setting.

Title: Eero Let Me Retire!
Review Comment: Unreal! We live in an 1835 house that spent 70 years as a bank. In th middle of the 15 rooms are two massive concrete vaults stacked atop each other. I tried routers gateways boosters acces points you name it. Spent too much time and way too much money. Had systems with three passwords and zones.Then came eero. 4 eeros took 13 minutes to hook up and most of that was walking around house. Flawless setup and performance. Incredible exploitation of our highest ISP speeds.Happy kids, happy wife and the in-house IT guy (me) is retired , triumphant!MikeCamp Hill PA

Title: It's as easy to set up and amazing as advertised
Review Comment: It's as easy to set up and amazing as advertised. I've had a dead zone in my house that I couldn't resolve with any other wifi extender and it worked with the eero. Worth the price.

Title: and I liked the idea of the guest network for renters and ...
Review Comment: We bought a new double-level house as a short-term rental. It's a large two-story home and I was budgeting to run Cat6 cabling because I was doubtful that I could find a Wifi solution that would cover the house. I work from the home, and the wifi needs to support lots of visitors, or just, you know, my kids on their devices streaming or playing video games. I got a quote for several thousand to run Cat6 (it's a complex home that would be challenging to run cabling in). It was worth spending $500 to see if it would work, and I liked the idea of the guest network for renters and the kids.I plugged-in the Eero and configured it in minutes. I had great coverage in the home immediately, and the network updated and self-optimized over 24 hours. By the time it was done, I had coverage in my workshop that's 30ft away from the main building. It's completely exceeded my expectations and made wifi as easy as it should be.This is my first Amazon review after numerous purchases, and for a good reason. I only will recommend products I would buy again myself, and I plan to buy another set of Eero's for my current house because my Airport Extreme / Airport Express setup is a miserable experience in comparison to Eero.

Title: Best wifi system
Review Comment: Easiest system to set upNo hiccups in my connection, wherever I am in my apartmentBeautiful deviceInformative app

Title: Lives up to it's hype!
Review Comment: Installed in minutes, worked like a charm in a large house where my previous Wi-Fi solution struggled.  Now I'm getting 60M everywhere in the house - love it!

Title: Worth every penny
Review Comment: I was having wifi headaches. My Netflix would buffer and just sluggishness in general. My router was on the first floor of our house and we did most of our usage on the second floor. I got two eeros and set them up and have not had one problem since. They are costly, but having reliable wifi is something we use daily so worth every penny.

Title: So far so great!
Review Comment: So far so great! I updated my home network from two Apple Airport Extremes in bridge mode to three eeros, and I can easily say my network and wifi has never been more reliable. Setup only took a few minutes and I haven't had to mess with the eeros since. I wish my office would get them. Our wifi is terrible at work.

Title: I found EERO a very easy system to install
Review Comment: I found EERO a very easy system to install, also it has performed Jo and above its reviews. I would recommend this product to anyone ci

Title: Better than I had imagined
Review Comment: Better than I had hoped - full fast coverage over a 5500 sq ft home with 3 units, easy to set up and no issues encountered after a month of use. Highly recommended.

Title: 08) the performance and stability have been really good. Note that two out of my three Eero's ...
Review Comment: Initially (early March, firmware 1.01) I did have some problems, but since it hit 1.06 (or 1.08) the performance and stability have been really good. Note that two out of my three Eero's are wired. There is no discernible difference compared to my ASUS RT-AC68U.From my perspective it looks as if Eero has managed to get into quite a stable situation within a very short time, which is quite an achievement taking into account the complexity of the product and the many different environments it runs in.If you do have trouble, this reddit can be very helpful: [...]

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Eero was easy to set up and it actually works!  No more WIFI deadspots.

Title: Good product, easy to setup but average speed...
Review Comment: Piece of cake to setupSpeed is not that great and drops from 80-90 Mb to 20-30 Mb in the further areas of the house...But... I now have Internet in areas of the house where I had problems before...Several reviews state it will get better over time... We shall see...Satisfied with the product so far but it's early days...

Title: Best wifi setup I have used so far
Review Comment: I've gone through a few different Wifi routers (such as the Ubiquiti AP Unifi and the Securifi Almond), and both of them had pretty good signal for a while but they eventually started becoming unreliable.  I've only had the eero 3-pack for a couple of weeks, but so far it's been better then the Ubiquiti and Securifi ever were.  My ping rates to the cable modem are faster and more consistent then they've ever been.  I have a 3000 sqft house and like to use my laptop in the opposite corner of the house from the cable modem which always challenged the Wifi signal.

Title: The best router ever!!
Review Comment: The eero has met all our expectations!  So easy to setup and we were able to get rid of our linksys router and all wifi extenders throughout the house.

Title: Worth every penny.
Review Comment: I lived in my current house for 13 years and have tried many routers, AP, and wifi extenders to try and banish dead spots. Nothing worked or worked consistently without constant tinkering...until now. The system from eero was up and running in no time at all and has performed as advertised. I had a couple of questions and contacted tech support - to my great surprise, I got a non-form letter response from a real person in SF who answered my questions and followed up without any prompting.

Title: and I love it. Installation was a snap
Review Comment: I purchased a system of 4 eeros, and I love it. Installation was a snap, and the performance of this system is unbelievable. It replaced a system of 3 Apple routers that provided sub-par performance in my home and was down frequently. My eeros system has been in for about a month now with 100% "up" time, and lightening speed! I highly recommend this system.

Title: Solid wifi at a price.....
Review Comment: I purchased the Eero system as I was sick of my flaky wifi. I had three networks in my home. (is: network. network_ext, network_5g) My devices were always defaulting to the slowest network or just getting confused in which network to join. I also have a couple devices connected via power line networking. The main transmitter was able to determine which connection has the input from my modem and the power line network without any input from me. The setup was dead simple. It did take a bit of hunting to find the best location of the devices which the setup app walked me through. The speed does vary dependent on where I am at my home. I have a 200 mbs plan from Comcast. At the fastest locations I'm getting a solid 230mps. At the slowest about 90mbs.  Even at the slowest speeds I'm easily able to stream Netflix/HBO etc without any buffering or dropped connections. The network actually got much faster after the system downloaded the latest software update.  I also have wifi calling set up on my iPhone via T-Mobile. This has also been rock solid. The only quibbles I have with the system is that the repeaters have to be closer together than I thought. The biggest issue I have is the actual cost of the system. Thats why I'm deleting one star.

Title: hate movies that don't play)
Review Comment: I live in a 100 year old house with plaster walls though out. we've tried every sort of signal booster. Finally, I happened upon eero while browsing Amazon Launchpad.  Read every review, not kidding, before deciding to pop for a $500 maybe-solution.  It came in the mail. I had little time to open it and even less time to install.  Left it on my countertop for the weekend.  Later that evening, while I was out, I receive this text from my 18 year-old son, "Installed new wifi thing. Speed Comparison: Formula 1 vs. Prius."  I couldn't tell you actual speed difference in numbers, but, can tell you I noticed marked decrease in loading times and no burping Netflix (ugh, hate movies that don't play).  I have two teens with gadgets galore.  They are no longer complaining.Anyone want to buy a box full of wifi boosting crap that didn't work?

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: For me this was worth the money - took 10 minutes to set up and couldn't have been easier!

Title: This works!
Review Comment: Super easy to install and is the first product (after many failed attempts) I have tried that solved my wireless dead spot problem in my house.  Works fantastic!

Title: Your answer to all your wifi problems! amazing.
Review Comment: I came across this product when I was searching for a wifi dongle. We have had zero luck getting our smart tv to access wifi since the router in our home is on the other side of the house. To say that this has been frustrating is an understatement! All I want to do is stream movies/shows and use my GBox. Simple right? Not for us. I always felt like there was an invisible force field from preventing me from obtaining this simple goal. We have tried literally everything from a wifi extender to new "super" routers to no avail. So I read all the reviews for the eero and read all the data and decided it sounded super logical. I mean duh, it totally makes sense.Today was the day I installed it. It really is super simple to install. I had some issue with it registering the device and I called the support line. Quick response time. Like a minute maybe! I spoke with John and he had me close and then reopen the app. Voila! success. I was now up and running.This is a quality product. The packaging and devices are Apple quality and simple to install.The real test came when I tried to connect to wifi on my LG smart tv. Entered my password and its up and running. Netflix, Hulu, Amazon video, Crackle are all working now! I started screaming with joy and my kids did too. To say that I'm happy with this product is an understatement!!!Congrats to the smart young guys who figured out that there is a better way to wifi. Way to innovate and solve problems. I hope you are wildly successful.Thanks to you I can now kick cable to the curb!Buy it today!!!!

Title: pretty but unreliable
Review Comment: i had high hopes for this router. i liked the simplicity of the guest network access and the speed test. in the end i am returning it due to constant dropped wifi signal. it would just randomly drop all clients then pick them back up 2 mins later. i have documented this happens and contacted customer service 3 times in the week i have had it. its not user error, i have a degree in network security and i am very familiar with wifi setups.prossleeksimple setupguest network featureconscannot troubleshoot when wifi is downdrops connections/restartstoo simple feature set doesn't allow for more tech adjustmentsi had a luma on order but cancelled that due to no launch date.routers may seem like the next (nest) type device to pretty up and give a great GUI to but if it doesn't work the "pretty" doesn't cut it unlike a thermostat.

Title: it works !
Review Comment: At last some that works!  I recently moved into my very own three story 1905 Victorian dream house. Unfortunately Queen Victoria hadn't heard of the Internet. After hassling with three different routers and two ISPs I finally stumbled on eero.  Within one half hour I had excellent signal strength on my main and second floors.  I have every expectation that once my attic remodel is finished that adding other units will extend this excellent signal there as well.  This is one product that really delivers!

Title: I really like the system
Review Comment: I really like the system!  I no longer fight for finding signals in the far corners of my home!  The only regret is...I wish I had held off until I got this offer "Here’s $75 off a new eero 3-pack in time for Mother's Day*." in my email  a so I could have taken advantage of that as well!  Great product so far! - Mickey M.

Title: Mesh networking is the future... but not there yet!
Review Comment: I was very excited for Eero to launch, mesh networking is the future of Wi-Fi. I bought two Eero kits, a 3 Eero kit for my design studio, Enlisted Design. In our studio, Eero has no need to go through walls, it's a large, open space, so Eero works okay, but it's not as fast as my previous router. I also bought a 2 Eero kit for my house. When I set it up at my house (1,000sqft house), the wifi could not reach 40 feet. I moved the Eero closer, but that required it to beam through a door and it did not connect well.I really wanted Eero to work, but unfortunately, I had to go back to my previous router at work and at home. Please continue to develop this tech so that I can envelop my studio and house with seamless Wi-Fi.

Title: It works!
Review Comment: The eero increased coverage throughout our house. We now have incredibly fast connection in all parts of our 2500sf ranch house.

Title: Eero just works
Review Comment: This is such a simple and excellent device(s). I had two airport extremes supporting my network of 66 devices (IP's) with another 30 zigbee , 10 zwave and microwave , phones , baby monitors and several other devices contending for the wireless radio space. The two airports would work well for a week and then it would get slower , slower and eventually need to be rebooted and then the saga continues for a week. Now I have a 3 eero setup and a minimum 30Mbps in space I used to get 5 , and most of the house 230Mbps , the network has been stable for a month with no crashes. Eero has updated the firmware at least 6 times silently and constantly improving in the background with no interruptions to the network. This is truly something which simplifies Wifi and just works. I'm excited to see some more features for QoS and other aspects like manual ability to restart the routers , mac addressing filtering or IP filtering . I gave it 4 stars because it holds onto my network which no other router has been able to , a missing star as it does not have all the features which compares itself to other routers in that category

Title: As promised easy set up reliable connection
Review Comment: Big fan, we would need to reboot our cable router all the time and had horrible connectivity. All that has changed now just plug em in connect them following the insert and voila! We consistently have 10 devices connected and consistently show our upload and download speeds at the tippy top of what is promised by the provider. This is a big and welcome change. Before we would just use our cell signal. Three included in the set works perfectly for us but I'm considering one more to truly cover the basement too!

Title: Finally.
Review Comment: Using Comcast X1 box. The Wi-Fi from the X1 router is horrible. Drops signal/connections, etc. Hardwiring to the X1 box produces ridiculous speeds. Dissatisfied with X1 Wi-Fi along with other wireless router options, we decided to try the Eero system.One word. Fantastic.Had to play around with proper position for our single level, and long, home. Download speed per Speedtest.net is between 150MB - 220MB, depending on the device. I get service EVERYWHERE in the house, basement, and perimeter outside the home.Best system I have tried yet.

Title: Lives up to expectations
Review Comment: I bought two three packs and placed them around a 4000 sq ft house.  The through-put speeds increased in all zones.  When I upgraded my internet connection to fiber, I had to reset the entire array of Eeros, but my experience with Apple Extremes is similar. I may buy one or two more, but this has been a great experience.

Title: Fantastic product!
Review Comment: Wow! Finally, a solution for improving my wifi signal and making it usable across the whole house! Ridiculously easy to set up and suddenly your wifi works. Terrific customer service, too. Great, great product. Worth every penny.

Title: Good product
Review Comment: Worked as described

Title: Coverage is great but reliability and troubleshooting is extremely lacking
Review Comment: I've had three eero units installed in my house (roughly 2,500 square feet) for two months now. My goal was to get rid of dead spots in the back part of my house near the patio. I really did want to love this product - the idea of a "self healing" wifi network sounds great [on paper]. But in reality, it's utterly painful to deal with. First, the app requires Internet access in order to function - so you can't tell why your network is down, only that it's down. Second, you don't know how or if it's going to self heal itself - sometimes it did (but not quick - 5-10 min - and no clue what happened) and sometimes it did not (so I had to go unplug all three units and plug them back up in order). I emailed support and finally got them to admit their Internet-required app was not helpful (my words - worthless) and there literally was nothing they could do to troubleshoot the issue other than replace my eero unit (which didn't happen, it magically started working again). I compare this to the experience with my previous router ASUS Dual-Band Wireless-AC3100 Gigabit Router (RT-AC88U) that could tell you exactly what was happening (e.g. Internet is down so need to call Comcast) and only had to be power cycled in one spot (not three over the house). If it could reach just another 30 feet to the back patio, it would be a done deal - until then, I suppose I'll continue to struggle with the eero units and hope they improve over time.

Title: My poor bandwidth finally resolved with eero!!!!!
Review Comment: I just purchased the eero 3-unit WiFi system because of the poor WiFi signal in my home. I tried WiFi extenders and all they do is create another network that I have to connect to but no real signal performance. I placed my order Sunday morning and as an Amazon Prime member, I was able to get this delivered the same Sunday evening. It was a very simple setup (about 10-minutes) after downloading the setup app & plugging the units in and letting them auto-configure through the app. I pay for a 50MB connection but never been able to get a connection speed of over 20MB. My Samsung Smart TV always lost bandwidth during Netflix & Prime video streaming requiring either resetting the app or turning the TV off and back on and restarting Netflix or Prime. After installing eero, I just performed a speed test and was able to hit 50MB download speeds. My 6-devices I have connected no longer experience performance issues. If you do not want to spend the time and $ to hardwire Ethernet throughout your home, then eero is the best alternative. Great product!!! It performs as promised!!!

Title: Damn thing actually works.
Review Comment: Worked well with 5 units spread through my 5000 sq ft house. Does not project to the immediate exterior. No more complaints from my kids or wife. Simple to set up. Good speed - 169 down, 12 up - seems to be enough for us. No deterioration with 11 devices active. So much easier than the other options I've tried that didn't really work.

Title: Worked very poorly, can't return after a few week ...
Review Comment: Worked very poorly, can't return after a few week, once you evaluate.  I was hoping for improvement in speed or consistency of Wifi with FIOS.  I used both active mode and Bridge mode (with Fios router it can just serve as bridge).  Did virtually nothing.  I waited a few weeks to see if it improved, as I had read from others, and no improvement and too late to return.  Very over-priced.

Title: Very quick and easy to set up
Review Comment: Very quick and easy to set up, and works exactly like it's supposed to. The only problem I had during setup was, due to the odd configuration of my apartment, getting the units to "see" one another. But, once that was done, everything went well.For the first several days after setup, the daily speed test seemed to come up short especially on my upload speed. I was only getting about half of the speed that my Verizon FiOS connection is rated for. But one day that changed and I am now seeing full speed on the test results. I don't know if a firmware update kicked in or if it was something else. Regardless, I am very happy with eero.

Title: Over priced for an average product
Review Comment: Not as good as a standard Apple router, or Netgear. Sent them back and upgrade to Nighthawk X8

Title: Robust WiFi really exists!
Review Comment: Being probably the first German user I can confirm that it is really easy to install eero, let's say five minutes for three devices. And, that is the most important issue for me, it created a robust, stable and really fast Wifi in our house- everywhere, really everywhere 😄. The result: No longer any complaints of my sons!!!!!

Title: Once set up, consistently the fastest wifi system I've ever owned.
Review Comment: Once set up, this is the best and fastest WiFi system I've ever had, and I've had dozens.I would have given a 5-star review except for a minor setup glitch. I was able to work around that. But, for a product designed to be super-simple to setup, this knocked it back a star.Once setup, you never really have to think about the system again. It automatically downloads software updates in the background (3 updates since I installed the system in late March). I have never had a bandwidth problem since I installed. No more rebooting the router to restore bandwidth degraded over time.If you are the type that likes to login to your router and twiddle all the settings, this system may not be for you. But, if what you want is secure, fast, reliable WiFi, buy the eero. You will learn over time to pay as much attention to WiFi in your house as you do the other utilities (in other words you wan't have to pay any attention to it again).

Title: The eero system is beyond amazing! Not a single dead spot including backyard pool ...
Review Comment: I e gone through different levels of wifi systems only to still have dead spots around the house. The eero system is beyond amazing! Not a single dead spot including backyard pool area or sitting in front porch. The signal is super strong everywhere. Set up was a breeze. Just be sure you don't need additional Ethernet ports since this only has one extra. I have a home video surveillance system so I needed to purchase an additional Ethernet switch box to accommodate it but was a simple fix. But if you want a system that's super modern, sophisticated and intuitive, this is the only one to consider. A bit pricey? How much did your iPhone cost? It's worth it. You'll be done even thinking about wifi after you install this system.

Title: My decade of wifi problems is over!
Review Comment: I've had wifi problems in my house forever.  I tried everything: moving the router, changing providers, new routers, extenders, bridges, you name it.  So I bought the eero system with somewhat modified hope.  Literally 10 minutes after opening the box from Amazon, a decade worth of wifi problems were gone.  Front office: check.  Basement: check.  Back bedroom: check.  The oft-heard cry of "Daddy, the wifi's not working," has gone mysteriously silent.  This thing is a marvel, plain and simple.

Title: Fantastic!!
Review Comment: Fantastic!!! Absolutely flawless!  Worked immediately and is very reasonable price considering a sound company wanted to wire my whole house to get improved wifi. This was working in less than ten minutes over the entire 4200 sq. ft. house. The set up is fast and very simple.  I called their service line and they were extremely helpful and cordial and willing to stay on as long as it took to get things working-- turns out it's so easy I really didn't need the help but enjoyed talking to them.  A great product! Thank you eero!

Title: It just WORKS!!
Review Comment: The 3 Eero setup replaced an Apple TC, Apple AirPort Extreme (in bridge mode) & Apple AirPort Express (in extend the network mode).  I now have a consistently reliable network that completely blankets my 3,300 sq. ft. home.  I have an average of 40 connected devices online at any given moment (eg. 15 Nest Cams, 10 Nest Protects, 2 Nest Thermostats, 19 Hue Bulbs, 4 Apple TVs, 4 smart TVs, 3 Netamo home stations, 9 Wemo smart switches, Liftmaster smart garage door, 2 computers, Sony PS, 3 iPhones, 4 iPads etc.) & the network is steady as a rock.  Thank you Eero!!

Title: WiFi that really works
Review Comment: I have two houses, each with unique challenges.House 1: L shaped, with a mylar wrap on the exterior walls. The may as well be a Faraday cage. I have struggled to get a solid, seamless WiFi network throughout the house, using multiple WAP's. When I saw the Eero, i jumped on it, not realizing that i bought the first week of public release (and started with firmware 1.0.0). I had to get them in bridge mode, as i already had a dual WAN router providing redundant ISP access and Cat 5 cable run throughout the house. The first week or so was a bumpy ride, but support was amazing, especially for a brand new device. (One of the units was defective, replacement arrived in 2 business days.) Now I have seamless WiFi throughout 6,000 square feet on three levels.House 2: Basic rectangle with full basement, but no existing network wiring and the cable modem all the way at one end. Even worse, no way to run cable until i am willing to tear out the basement ceiling. After my experience with House #1, i figured lets give it a try. This system has the cable modem in bridge mode and the Eero as the router. Over a short period, the (Android) app has bloomed into a full featured configuration tool. Simple for a novice, but jump to the advanced sections and find a pretty robust set of management tools not found in many residential routers. I have a TV hardwired to the Eero furthest from the master and have streamed movies all day without issue. What more can you ask for?

Title: Rapidly became repeat buyer.
Review Comment: Solved all of my wifi problems.  Ended up buying a second pack of three for another location.

Title: Excellent product
Review Comment: We have had the eero 3-unit system for a few months and it has been amazing. Extremely easy to install and setup. We live in a 100 year-old 4-story brick house and the Wifi + extender was just not getting the job done.  I probably could add one more extender as the base is on the top floor, but it is working brilliantly. The signal strength stays very consistent and we have had minimal interruptions since installation.I will say that once there is an interruption with one of the units, you have to remove it from the network and then add it back in - at least that is the only way I could reset the unit. We have regularly 12-14 different devices connected with a maximum DSL speed of 11-12mbps. Highly recommend the eero system.

Title: Streaming movies was just annoying with buffering every 15 minutes so I added an ...
Review Comment: I recently moved to a new apartment which separated my living room from my office by another bedroom.  I previously had no problems with my internet in my last place so I figured it must be my router, so I replaced it with one from Apple. Streaming movies was just annoying with buffering every 15 minutes so I added an extender which helped but it still buffered several times a night, and my smart TV was useless.  I was pondering different ways to resolve the problem when I came across the eero on the internet.  I knew I would ultimately spend as much money troubleshooting the problem so I figured why not give it a try. So glad I did, no more buffering and the picture quality alone is worth it.  And my smart TV now responds with my amazon prime streaming.  Absolutely pleased and amazed!

Title: Best WiFi system out there!
