The system runs well with or without bluetooth capability, and I am relieved to now have wifi in places heretofore I was  unable to reach.

Title: So for $500 PLUS the cost of another router - even a cheap one - you're getting into the price range where you might as well get
Review Comment: Purchased these to install in a clients home, was positively shocked to discover they require a separate router in order to function; you cannot program a static IP & have them do it all; you must also have some sort of routing device in addition to the eeros.Some ISPs (Consolidated) literally provide you with only a Cat5 cable coming out of your wall - no other modem/router and you connect your router, and off you go.Not here.So for $500 PLUS the cost of another router - even a cheap one - you're getting into the price range where you might as well get a business-grade WAP like Ruckus, Aruba, etc.YES, many ISPs do provide you with a modem, but not all.....if you're one of the ones who don't have a modem, you're out of luck.This is ridiculous!Edit to add: We called Eero support direct & they are the ones who informed us of the need for a separate router, so no user error here.

Title: Gave it the old college try.
Review Comment: Oh, how I wished this would have worked. Set it up, and at first it seemed ok, did get some speed gains to far end of house, but less than I hoped for. But measurable (farthest bedroom went from about 4Mbps to 10). That gain, plus the promised 'it just works' idea, made me happy.Next morning I woke up, wifi is down. I monkey with it, but end up setting up my old router then head to work. Come home late, monkey with it, can't get it to work. Next day I take morning off and spend an hour 43 minutes with (very polite, very nice) tech support. They determine that one unit is bad, promise to send one out. Then determine that maybe the other unit is bad also, promise to send replacement.At this point I realize I've spent more time on my network in the last two days than I have in the last two years. Doesn't seem to 'just work'. Plus - the units are way too black box for any kind of troubleshooting. All you can do with the phone app is hit a couple buttons and receive unhelpful messages like 'your eero is offline'. I don't LIKE to monkey with routers and modems, but if I have to, I like to have some tools.Two stars because their tech support was really engaged and they were more than willing to replace the units. But at this point, I think I gained more respect for my old router and network.

Title: Newbies are welcome
Review Comment: NEWBIES ARE WELCOME. I am not mechanically or electronically inclined, but this was so easy to set up it's ridiculous. And it works. My weak and dead spots are now more than acceptable.

Title: Fantastic wifi system
Review Comment: Fantastic wifi system.  I am using four of the eero pods throughout the house, and I have excellent coverage over three floors.  I used the Speakeasy.net speed test and had 768 meg downloads and 568 meg uploads in every room in the house!!  I have recommended to several colleagues and they have had similar success.  I would like to be an investor if possible.  This is a terrific new product.

Title: Perfect!!!
Review Comment: I was extremely skeptical prior to testing these devices. Believe it or not, they worked as advertised.  I have blanketed WiFi throughout my entire house; full signal. I love it and it's FAST!!! I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I even purchased a 4th were lol

Title: It just works... Seamless, headache free extended WiFi for your home.
Review Comment: Over the past decade, I've tried various WiFi gear from most of the well known major network device manufacturers to create an extended home WiFi network. In almost every case, the setup was usually problematic requiring multiple attempts to get everything configured.  Then, once everything was set up, I was still left lacking with spotty dead zones.  Thereafter, I could pretty much count on one or more of the extended WiFi nodes to stop responding periodically, thus requiring either a reboot or worst case a reset and completely starting over with reconfiguring it.  Ugh!  What a hassle!  In the end, the best case scenario I had was 3 or 4 individual extended WiFi networks that I had to connect / disconnect between as I roamed throughout my home, each time experiencing a network bandwidth speed cut in half as result of extending the network.  Bleeh!Then about a year ago, while searching for a better solution, I heard about the upcoming release of eero, a new WiFi based on mesh technology. Since then, I have been anxiously awaiting for the product release. When I finally received it, I couldn't believe how simple the setup was. It was so brain dead easy. Within 30 minutes, I had replaced my problematic, multiple WiFi networks with a single, consolidated WiFi network. It's been  Now, I don't even think about my WiFi.  It's been running for about 6 weeks and the complaints from the rest of the family have ceased and I've stopped wasting my time playing tech support to fix the network. It's like plumbing now. It just works..

Title: Eero is my hero
Review Comment: Purchased for a city town home with three stories plus basement.  Previous router couldn't reach main living floor.  Purchased a set of three and eero has been magnificent.  No more frustration at all.  Setup was so easy.

Title: An amazing innovation. My home is long and thin
Review Comment: An amazing innovation.  My home is long and thin, and my broadband modem needs to reside at one end.  The living room is at the other end, and my WiFi was always patchy there from my Airport Extreme, with blank spots in some rooms.  I know have close to full speed throughout my home, and in particular watching streaming video in the living room is now flawless.  Highly recommended for anybody with awkward WiFi layout issues.

Title: Awesome product ever
Review Comment: This is what I was waiting for. Great product and great customer service.  No more problems no matter where I connect to the wifi.  I love the fact that all I need is my only network no more extenders plugged everywhere in the house. Now I'm able to enjoy my ECHO from Amazon.  This is the wifi of the rest of my life.  Soooo happy worth the money I paid

Title: Excellent Product
Review Comment: After buying and trying routers, amplifiers and boosters, none really worked all that well. The eero system does what it says, eliminates all the hassles and dead spots. This really works and works well.

Title: Works exactly as advertised
Review Comment: Works exactly as advertised

Title: One Star
Review Comment: After 2 weeks, mine just stop working today.  Waiting for a replacement.Update: spent 2 hours on the phone with tech support.  The slowness issue still not solve, they still investigate . My internet speed is 250 Mbps to 280 Mbps , connected to Eero I got only 7 to 20 Mbps .

Title: I swapped these for Netgear WiFi extenders and that works just fine. Do not buy this product
Review Comment: I bought a pack of 3 hoping that it would deliver strong wifi throughout the house and instead I got an extremely weak signal away from the main eero device. I swapped these for Netgear WiFi extenders and that works just fine.Do not buy this product.

Title: Would have been 5 star, but...
Review Comment: REASONS WHY I KNOCKED OFF A STARReason 1:  No custom configuration of wifi security settings.  You can't pick the type of security to use, whether or not to broadcast, etc.  My old router even had an "Allowed Devices" option that ONLY allowed devices on the Allowed Devices list to connect which added an extra layer of security.Reason 2:  The eeros require the eero company to stay in business.  If this company goes out of business, the Android/iOS apps necessary to set up the device will be useless.  Also, the eero devices themselves have to connect to eero's cloud service which will be non-existent if eero goes out of business.  (They don't even technically need to go out of business.  Someone like Google/Nest could buy the company just for the technology/patents and scrap it like they did to Revolv Hub - screwing the early adopters of Revolv Hub.)REVIEWSetup was easy.  You absolutely need an Android or iOS device in order to set up the eeros.  The setup process probably took me 20-25 minutes in total.  I was extremely patient while the eero app on my phone "found" each one of my eeros.  It seemed to take 3-5 minutes for the app to find each eero which can feel like an eternity when you're used to...say a bluetooth device connecting in seconds.  All three devices work well.  I'm in a 1500 sq ft condo so 3 eeros is probably overkill, but I have usable wifi coverage in every inch of my home.  I can't speak much to the speed because my internet is only 25 Mbps (megabits for those who care) and eero delivered 25 Mbps in every corner of my home.  None of my devices had trouble connecting to the eeros (two Android tablets, two Android phones, one iOS phone, one Microsoft Surface, one Windows laptop, an XBOX One, a Samsung TV and a Nest (3rd ed.) thermostat.Are these the best wifi "mesh" package out there?  I don't know.  Are they one of the easiest to setup?  Probably.  But with ease comes less features (which some power users might miss).Hope this helps you make your decision.

Title: I will say I am very happy with my purchase
Review Comment: I will say I am very happy with my purchase.  They do everything they are billed to do!!  I don't write many reviews, but I felt this product deserves one.  It would be 5 stars, but as of now the core router is pretty basic(but is always improving with auto updates),, but for 99% of users they will love these now!!!  I really would have given 4.5 stars but it won't let me choose a half star. Support is responsive (important with a startup). I would buy again In a heartbeat. Great product. And as a IT professional for the last 22 years.  I will say the last thing I want to do is work on my own equipment :)  So the auto update feature is a win in my book!!

Title: Eero hasn't dropped yet
Review Comment: No WiFi drops. Not a one in the last month of having the Eero network installed in my house. Living in a hard-coat stucco home means lots of concrete, wire mesh, and very little connectivity. At least that was before Eero, now I no longer trek to the basement to reboot my router when I can't get online.

Title: So far speed has been mediocre at best. With a unit 15 feet away I have ...
Review Comment: Installed in less than 15 minutes. The third one was 20 feet away but it took three tries to get it to recognize. So far speed has been mediocre at best. With a unit 15 feet away I have full bars but CW channel will not stream video and Netflix is choppy. Going to give it a full 3 month try but if it does not get faster, I'll go back to a faster router and booster system.  So 2 months in video on Netflix and YouTube is choppy and buffers. It's super easy to set up but it's slow.

Title: Easy to set up but poor coverage and constantly drops devices including phones.
Review Comment: Nothing special about these but the price. Easy to set up but not great coverage. Had 2 netgear routers and an extender and they worked better at 1/2 the price. I'll keep it but only because I don't want to another setup.Update: I hate these things. Very expensive for what you get. Constantly drops network connections. Often drops my Sonos, Provides worse range than my old routers. I hate it, but I'm going to have to switch back. Don't waste the money.2nd Update: I really hate these things. Can't wait for Orbi to come out so I can replace them. Have one in kitchen. Family room next door, no Wifi

Title: I love it when things "just work"
Review Comment: Incredible!  My home has been plagued by slow and spotty WiFi since we moved in.  Our area just received fiber and I immediately signed up for gigabit service.  Once installed, we noticed a significant increase in speed (obviously) but the gateway/router placement in the master bedroom closet still resulted in slow speeds and spotty service in many parts of our 3,000 sq. ft. house.  A friend told me about Eero and I started looking into it.  Based on all of the positive reviews and the company's commitment to continuous improvement of their product with regular firmware updates and tech support, I decided to pull the trigger.  I installed 4 units in our home and we are now awash in super-fast WiFi throughout the furthest reaches of our house and into the front and backyard.  It was super easy to set up and once it took the firmware update overnight, I was in business! I have tested the speed wirelessly and wired via ethernet and couldn't be happier. They've been up and running for about 2 weeks with no issues.  Highly recommended!

Title: TROUBLE WITH PRODUCT - The install went great. Very easy with great instructions & app
Review Comment: TROUBLE WITH PRODUCT - The install went great. Very easy with great instructions & app. The speed and coverage were great.... then trouble. Within a day all the units randomly began to cycle off and on thereby interrupting the wifi signal. It made it impossible to use my work VPN and stream video. I called eero and they confirmed the units were cycling but didn't know why and elevated the trouble report. While waiting for a response, they recommended REbooting and REsetting, Didn't help and they didn't REspond to my further requests. Then I tried REturning and REfund. That worked and now I'm much happier. In the end, I decided to go with Verizon's extender for significantly less.

Title: Three Stars
Review Comment: Didn't really work at my home.. Thank you.

Title: eero has changed everything
Review Comment: Fantastic and game changing.  I have a large old brick home that requires internet on three floors.  Here is a list of the wireless routers that I purchased in the last three years and that did not work to provide reliable wireless in our home: (1) Airport Extreme (2) Netgear N900 Wireless Router, (3) Linksys EA9200.  In a failed attempt to make these three different wireless routers work I also added a Netgear range extender and used an Securfi Almond as a wireless range extender.  None of these combinations provided reliable wireless internet throughout our home.  Sometimes everything would work and sometimes some devices would get kicked off the network and could not login without rebooting everything.  The range extenders often did nothing.  Before I purchased eero, I was unplugging and restarting my modem and router at least once a day. Even at its best, I could never reliable get devices to work that required a reliable and strong wireless connection. In particular,  I have 5 Nestcams that would rarely stay connected for a full day. They require a very strong and reliable wireless connection to work.  Also, WiFi calling on my AT&T iPhone does not work unless it has a strong 5ghz wifi connection which I never was able to achieve consistently in my home.  I have approximately 30 different devices connected to our network at any time (5 iPhones, 2 iPads, 2 apples TVs, 1 Roku, 1 iMac, 2 MacBook Air's, 8 Sonos speakers, 5 Nestcams, 1 Peleton bike, 2 printers, 2 backup hard disks etc.) and in order to get all this stuff, I had to hard wire as many of them as possible directly to ethernet because wifi was never reliable enough.eero has changed everything.  It took less than an hour to set up 3 eero units.  Everything worked on it immediately (Note: you have to restart your modem as instructed and unplug an restart any ethernet switches).  We have wifi in every corner of every floor of our house.  Every Nestcam has worked continuously without fail and I have full wifi calling on my iPhone.  The eero app (which is fantastic) lets me check the status of my network from anywhere and has shown 60mbps of download speed, 5mbps of upload speed and all three eero units online since the moment I plugged them in. My family has never been happier.ps If anyone wants any of the routers or extenders the eero system replaced, let me know and I will send them to you for free (picture attached).Update as of June 26, 2016: since the day I set eero up in April, I have never touched it. I have never had to reboot it or restart it. I have never lost internet connectivity for a minute. No other router I have had has worked like this.

Title: Delivers The Goods!
Review Comment: Wow, a technology product that is everything it claims and more. Super easy set up-just follow the (easy) step by step instructions on the app. I was up and running in 10 minutes. Most importantly, this system has changed my nearly unusable satellite system to the best wireless system I've ever experienced. Complete and consistent coverage across our 2400-square foot home, good coverage inside our adjacent in-law apartment, and good coverage from nearly 100 yards away in our back yard. Simply amazing.

Title: Delivers on its promises
Review Comment: We purchased the eero system in hopes of improving the Wi-Fi performance in our cement-floored town home.  It delivered on all it's promises of being very easy to set up and working simply and reliably.Our previous system using a fairly high end consumer Netgear cable modem-Wi-Fi router, similar spec-Netgear ranger extender, a power line Ethernet extender and a Time Capsule remained intermittent to several important-but-difficult-to-reach locations.  The eero system has substantially higher data transfer rates and is reliable in all locations around the home --- and we no longer have to manually switch between six networks (2G and 5G for each of base, downstairs, and upstairs).It is expensive, but it works.  It is beautifully packaged:  I would have preferred simpler, environmentally friendly, plain packaging regardless of any cost savings as I just feel bad throwing it away.After my initial install, I contacted tech support about it's compatibility with the power line ethernet extender, and they (the president it appears) wrote back promptly confirming that it would work.  In the end, I have not purchased a 4th unit to place on the extender, as we are actually getting a sufficient signal through our heavy cement floor to the basement that we do not need the additional unit.We are considering putting in an eero system in another home that has similar concrete problems, although with walls instead of floors:  it's that good, despite the cost.

Title: Undecided
Review Comment: After a few weeks of use, the best thing that I can say about this product is that it looks better than my old wireless routers. Note: I only have one in a small apartment, so I can't comment on the whole house coverage effect. One of my laptops has trouble staying connected (but not the newer one). iPads (2 of them) seem to connect OK. Still undecided about keeping it, as $200 is a bit much for just a pretty face and no improvement.

Title: The EERO 3 Pack Solved My Problem!
Review Comment: We have a 4500 sq ft home and EERO 3 pack solved our problem.  I tried many methods to improve WiFi and experienced poor performance in our family room which was the furthest distance from the office (source).  With the trend to move away from cable or a dish, WiFi performance becomes very important and EERO works.  Yes, it cost more but looking at the money I spent on trying to solve my WiFi problem this is a good long term solution.  I also liked the setup using my smart phone.

Title: Not my cup of tea. Difficult to setup. ...
Review Comment: Not my cup of tea. Difficult to setup. Did not work for me at all. I'll stick with my Airport.

Title: Never going back
Review Comment: Impressive performance, very easy to set up. Better yet, once I set it up, it's been problem-free. The only router I've ever owned where I didn't have to reboot it on a semi-regular basis. Even tech stuff like ip reservations and port-forwarding has been a breeze.  No dead spots anywhere in my 4000 sq ft home, where the whole basement was hit or miss with my previous AirPort Extreme. So far, two thumbs way up.

Title: Terrible. Not for gaming. Slow. Extremely short range.
Review Comment: Returned the two I bought and went back to a single R7000 Netgear. This is NOT a product for the gaming enthusiast or anyone with technical knowledge. The two Xboxes in my house could not play online games with these. Their internet speed was terrible. They had to be so close together to work that their combined range was less than my single R7000 and at a lower speed and higher latency to boot! Save yourself some money and get a high power single base station or a real solution like the Ubiquity, if you have any knowledge of networking whatsoever.

Title: Thus far I have been extremely happy with my Eero WiFi system
Review Comment: Thus far I have been extremely happy with my Eero WiFi system.  For the first time I have consistent wifi coverage over my entire house.  Other systems that included extenders would work not work consistently.  But the Eero has worked consistently everyday with no dead spots.

Title: great unless you have walls
Review Comment: I have 250mbs xfinity for a 1 bedroom apartment. Blanketed the apartment with FIVE OF THESE, this 3 pack plus two more to be safe. Guess what? I'm looking at a buffering screen right now using a laptop in the bedroom. The walls are just drywall mind you, not NFC/RFID shielded bricks...

Title: Easy wifi throughout an old big house
Review Comment: Great product. I now have wifi everywhere. Took an hour to set up six.

Title: the documentation is pretty poor, and required me to set up a ...
Review Comment: This thing does NOT work as advertised.  It REQUIRES a separate MODEM from the router, and must be inserted between the MODEM and the ROUTER.  There's no guarantee after you do that, if you can, that you'll still get the same performance into your router you had before.Additionally, the documentation is pretty poor, and required me to set up a network before I could configure the network, which is impossible.Finally, after complaining to support, I get an email asking me to provide a time and # to discuss any issues.  I replied TWICE and never hear back about a call.

Title: Finally - Strong and Reliable WiFi throughout my property.
Review Comment: Amazing product - so easy to set up and understand. Unlike an extender which basically just screws with your Sonos and doesn't actually provide an extension of usable wifi - EERO actually broadened my wifi capability. We have 3 cottages on our farm in addition to the main house and now all buildings have great wifi! Strong enough bandwidth for our family members staying over to watch Netflix and/or hold video conferences from their cottage.Love this product - I wish all my new technology worked as seamlessly and reliably. Great job!

Title: great wifi coverage
Review Comment: Amazing wifi coverage for our home.  Easy installation and fabulous coverage.

Title: Amazing product!
Review Comment: This is finally the home wifi we've always wanted. We live in a three storry townhouse, and have always had terrible reception in the upper and lower floors. This worked like a charm! Two tips:-  note that this does not include a router, only wifi. It will work with any router though, including your existing one.-  to confiigure it initially, don't strictly follow the written instructions. Specifically,  keep the slave and master together when setting the slave up, then moving the slave to the remote location.

Title: much better than paying for 2 internet providers
Review Comment: Works over 3200 Sq ft...much better than paying for 2 internet providers.

Title: I finally have Wi Fi!!!
Review Comment: It works!  There are a lot of walls and doors between the router and my office in our condo.  Even the cordless phone in my office (we have AT&T for landline and internet) didn't work well.  Since I installed Eero, I can access the internet on my computer quickly.  No more waiting and having to reboot.  In addition my cell phone and iPad work in the master bathroom!  Yes, it took 3 eeros to make our condo functional; but functional it is!!!!

Title: For the first time everyone in the house is happy. Even the wireless printer prints now
Review Comment: I have tried everything to get full coverage in my home for years. Changed providers -extenders everywhere- and I would still get spotty service on my wife's computer tucked away in her office. My Apple TV would only work half the time. Took the $500 plunge. figuring if it didn't work, I would send it back, and BINGO. This thing works. For the first time everyone in the house is happy. Even the wireless printer prints now. This may not be the solution for you - but it is a game changer for me. Easy to set up. Maybe there's a cheaper solution, but I don't care.

Title: Look more closely into how it works before buying. ...
Review Comment: Look more closely into how it works before buying. If you buy only the one unit, you're not going to have a lot of options as to where to position it. You really need more than one unit.

Title: DO NOT BUY THEM - Its a BETA product at best
Review Comment: DO not do it. This product was clearly released to soon. It worked for about 2 weeks off and on and then one day it stopped working completely. I Spent 3 days on the phone with support to try to get it replaced they said since it was bought on amazon its going to be a much more complicated process. Do not buy these they tried and failed

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: 4 thumbs up.

Title: Really Happy--Great User Experience
Review Comment: For years we struggled with wifi. Even the appliances that were in the same room as the router would have trouble. Roku would periodically lose its connection, the wireless printer would have to be rebooted regularly to reconnect to the network, and the TV in the next room was always hit or miss if you wanted to watch Hulu or Netflix. And forget about using skype in the master bedroom. So I bought the Eero three pack and set up our network last week. It took about 10 minutes to place them throughout my house, and we haven't had an issue since. For me the real test was this morning: I received an email on my iPhone with my new auto insurance cards attached as a PDF. On my old network, my HP ePrint iPhone app would certainly not work: it would never see my printer after a day or two of inactivity. But this morning I was able to send the PDF to my printer without a problem and grab my new cards as I headed out the door for work. Moreover, the easy iphone app means that everyone in my family can manage the network, and I can easily check my network when I'm away from home.I've seen snarky comments that there's nothing really new here with this technology, but what Eero has done really well is thought about user experience--from the moment you open the box it's a simple, graceful and pleasant experience. It's a great home wifi solution and I couldn't be happier with it.

Title: UPDATED: Works amazingly well. First wifi solution that worked in my four story home
Review Comment: I have struggled for years to get Wi-Fi to work in my very tall 4 story home. I bought four of these, and put one on every floor. The Wi-Fi was up and running within a few minutes. But it did take one call to customer support, who was very helpful, to get the advanced options working.I'm an advanced user with special settings for Nat, port forwarding, and DHCP reservations. But it's fairly easy to set up in the app for this device.I really can't recommend it enough, it's so nice to have Wi-Fi so strong on every floor in my house finally.UPDATE:After a few weeks, the system was working so well in my home, I installed a second network at my office, a 6000 square foot facility with lots of devices and brick walls. It works great there too. I'm so impressed with how well it works. I definitely recommend this product.Only two would be nice features:1. More than two Ethernet ports on the back. (Rectified with an additional cheap Ethernet switch)2. DDNS and NAT loopback support. Not essential, but would be nice if the router supported it in the firmware.

Title: We love Eero! We have a modern house with a ...
Review Comment: We love Eero!  We have a modern house with a lot of glass and steel.  Consequently, we have always had WiFi issues and dead spots around the house.  We have tried different boosters over the years that never worked very well.  Now with Eero, we get strong coverage everywhere.  It is fantastic and worth every penny.

Title: One Star
Review Comment: Made no difference to our wifi very disappointing particularly for the cost.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: As advertised.

Title: very pleased and would recommend highly
Review Comment: Might be the first review that I have ever written....Can't count the number of wifi solutions that I have tried in my house...was ready to give up.  Ordered eero, set the network name and PW and viola - has worked perfectly so far....very pleased and would recommend highly.

Title: It works great, I am very happy with the system
Review Comment: My house is 1200 years old and the walls 2 feet thick. It works great, I am very happy with the system.

Title: Worth every penny
Review Comment: eero is incredible. I had 2 dead zones in my condo where my linksys ac router wasn't cutting it. I decided to give eero a try and have been quite pleased with the results. Setup could not have been easier and took just minutes on my iPhone. I plugged the main unit in with a hardwire connection and played with the positioning of the other 2 units (w/o hardwire) until I got satisfactory results. I now get the same 'wired' speed wirelessly throughout my place, including the 2 dead zones. If you're having any trouble setting up a single wifi system in your place, look no further. This is really a great product and I can't stop recommending it to family and friends.

Title: They recommend 1 per 1000 sq feet
Review Comment: Game changer. They recommend 1 per 1000 sq feet, I went with 2 just to be safe. Night and day difference with Eero, our bedroom used to be spotty but now we have strong signal throughout the house.

Title: An excellent product that will only get better as it matures
Review Comment: I bought this as a plug-n-play solution to some wifi access issues I was experiencing and it works... brilliantly.  First, some quick background info.We recently moved into a new house.  I was spoiled in our old house as it had structured wiring (Cat 6 outlets in every room) so I was able to use multiple routers setup as access points but hardwired to my main router to spread wifi throughout the house.  So getting signal to every nook and cranny of my house was a non-issue.  Heck - I even felt a little guilty as I felt like I was flooding my cul-de-sac with my own little wifi monopoly.The new house doesn't have structured wiring.  And to make matters worse, my cable modem (in bridge mode) and my wireless router are upstairs in my bonus room over the garage.  The garage comes off the house in an L-Shape so much of the signal has to travel through a brick exterior to the rest of the house.  The house is 4,500 square feet and getting signal to the far corners (with a single router) is challenging.  I first tried using my existing two extra routers (Asus RT-AC66R's) in Repeater mode.  This worked OK... not great.  And the service wasn't steady.  The routers would occasionally drop signal which would wreak havoc on things.  Plus, you can't daisy chain multiple routers together in repeater mode to string signal to the far corners of your property.  And yes, I'm aware of running custom firmware for my routers to possibly achieve this... but I've got 5 kids and a demanding job and this sort of thing is more of a weekend project than a plug-n-play solution.  I also looked at Open-Mesh which is likely a very nice solution but I don't think it's any cheaper than Eero so I quit investigating it as an option.  Anyway - with this setup (using one router in repeater mode) I was getting great signal but the speed was just... ok.  See, every time you make a hop on wifi you take a hit.  So at best I was getting 55mbs which is fine.  Beautiful actually.  But it wasn't reliable as my router acting as the repeater would occasionally drop the signal.My next option was to try Power of Ethernet devices.  I did.  It worked reasonably well but it felt like a sloppy solution because I was taking a HUGE bandwidth hit.  If I'm hardwired to my router I get anywhere from 75mbs to 150mbs download speed and usually around 20-30 mbs upload.  Through the POE devices I was getting 25mbs max.  Even worse was my intranet transfer speeds where I was seeing maybe 1-2mbs.  Transferring a 3GB file was taking FOREVER.  I also tried using my existing two additional ASUS routers on the other end of these POE devices... the wifi signal coming off of this connection was abysmal.  The wired connection was OK but the wireless connection was taking the speed cut mentioned above (75-120mbs down to 25mbs) down another notch.  Best case, I was getting wireless speeds of 10mbs from the routers connected through POE.So I read about Eero and figured - what the heck.  Not the cheapest thing out there but with Amazon's fantastic customer service behind me, if it didn't work, back it goes.  OMG.  I'm floored.  This solution works and works better than I actually thought it would.  Now, in the furthest corners of my house I'm easily getting 50mbs speeds wirelessly.  So yes, with my repeater setup I was getting this as well but the difference here is that it's rock steady and this speed can extend to much further reaches of my house because the Eero system can daisy chain multiple units where I was limited to only using 2 routers with my Asus setup - The main router and ONE setup as a repeater.I had to play around with the placement of the 3 units but I eventually got it setup to where I can honestly get full bars of signal in just about every spot in the house... worst I get is 3 out of 4 bars and the speed is still ridiculously good.  I won't lie.  At first I was disappointed because the second unit I tried to setup didn't work in the location that I wanted it to - I was told by the app that the signal was too weak.  So I had to put it in an unplanned spot (my 3 year old son's room which is fairly centrally located in the house).  Once I had that unit in place I tried to set up the third unit in my office (in the furthest possible corner of the house... and the spot where my signal woes began).  Sigh... no dice.  The signal wasn't strong enough.  But then I realized that the spot I had located the second Eero in my son's room probably wasn't ideal as the signal had to go through more brick to reach my third and final Eero.  So I moved it to the other side of his room so that the signal would be passing through interior walls.  BAM!  It worked and I was able to setup the third Eero in my office.  I then hardwired my computer to this Eero and I'm getting a steady (ROCK steady) speed of 70+mbs.  Intranet transfer speeds (speed between two computers on the same network) are anywhere from 10-16mbs.  Not the crazy good intranet speeds of my wired setup in my old house (60+mbs transfer speeds) but reasonably good considering the data is making two wireless hops.Seriously, all my problems have been solved.  Nothing can replace wired connections but this is the next best thing.  I'm certain that, with enough patience, I could've followed some tutorials online and gotten a decent mesh network setup using my existing 3 routers.  And I'm sure that it would've worked equally as well as the Eero setup.  But like I said above, I've got 5 kids and a demanding job so my goal was to look for something more plug-n-play.  THIS is THE solution.  It honestly exceeded my expectations.So what's the bad news?  Not much to be honest but there are some caveats.  The single biggest issue I have is that I have to use an app on my phone (Android) to manage the network.  It would be nice to be able to use my computer to do this.  Also, if you have a particularly complex network then your options may be limited.  You can do all the basic things that most home network users need (set static IP addresses, setup port forwarding for things like remote desktop connections or VPN access) but some of the more complex features of traditional routers do not yet exist.  While you can change you IP range (subnet) you can only use a few predefined sets.  For instance, my old network was setup using 172.20.1.2 through 172.20.1.254 but this wasn't an option in the predefined IP ranges available for use.  There's also no QOS prioritization or other similar functionality.  If none of this means anything to you then it doesn't matter BUT...Keep this in mind.  This is a product that's managed in the cloud which means that it can evolve through future software updates.  It's NEW and it has a LONG way to go.  It will only get better.  I'm a beancounter, not a network technician so I don't know the technical limitations of what these devices are capable of and what future software can add/solve but I'm guessing most of the current shortcomings will be addressed through future software updates.  Meanwhile this small startup has transformed wifi for the traditional home user and you can call me a big fan.Oh... and one more little thing. These little router boxes have a HUGE WAF (wife acceptance factor) as they are typically replacing units that look similar to the Starship Enterprise with all those ugly antennas coming off of them.  The simple elegance of the Eero allows them to placed nearly anywhere.I plan to update my review as my experience has more legs to it.  I've had the 3 unit system for 3 full days at this point.  I expect my satisfaction will only increase but I'll post updates as I have them.***4/3/16 Update***I've since added a fourth Eero and actually have a 5th on the way.  This is likely overkill but let's just say that getting awesome wifi signal is a bit addictive.  I've also played around a bit with the placement of my Eero units (more on this shortly).  Long story short, it just keeps getting better.  I'm now getting steady speeds of around 90mbs on the computer in my office.  To put that in perspective, with my ethernet over power setup I was getting maybe 25-30mbs at best.  After installing the first 3 Eeros I was seeing 70ish on a steady basis.  After adding a fourth and repositioning my units a bit I'm getting 90+mbs.  To say I'm pleased is likely an understatement.A quick tip on positioning your Eeros units (and something that I hope it built into the app itself at some point).  Do yourself a favor and download a decent Wifi analyzer for one of your tablets or cell phones.  I'm using Wifi Analyzer on an Android tablet and it allows me to name each MAC address of each Eero router (there's actually 2 wireless MAC addresses per Eero - one for 2.4G and one for 5G and these can be found by clicking on each device with the Eero app and then going to details) so that I can easily see the strength of each Eero unit in different points around the house.  This has allowed me to ensure that I'm getting a very strong mesh going and has ultimately improved the speed of my signal in the far corners of my house.  This functionality really needs to be built into the Eero app.Anyway - still loving my Eero units!!***5/13/16 Update***One final follow-up.  This system has completely solved my wifi issues.  Nothing will ever replaced a wired network.  But if you can't have that, this is the next best thing.  It's mostly fire and forget.  Once you've got it setup, you never think about it again and it just works.I'd give 6 stars if they'd let me!

Title: Simple setup but it's not a great "mesh" wireless network
Review Comment: After careful placement, I found that the eero was no better than the AirPort base stations (current generation AirPort Extremes) they replaced.  Maximum distance between each device was slightly shorter than that required of the AirPorts.  The eeros didn't seem to penetrate the flooring between the floors as well either.All-in-all, these would be a good setup for a novice who has a single floor in a relatively small house and who wants a quick and easy setup.For the price ($500 for three), I would consider another mesh device (if that's what you're looking for) such as Ubiquiti or Meraki and have a pro set them up.

Title: Works great, very easy to setup and the app is fantastic
Review Comment: I live in a long, narrow apartment with my modem at one end, and my old router didn't have the power to reach to the far end of my home. This system made it a snap to cover the whole area with powerful wifi. The signal has been strong and consistent everywhere, and the units themselves are very small and stylishly subdued, with none of the crazy antennae or blinkenlights of other routers. Adding the additional units involved little more than plugging them in and pressing a button on the app.The smartphone app is excellent and very well designed. The at-a-glance information when the app first starts (network status, up/down speeds, number of connected devices) is very concise and useful, and quick access to the names and IP addresses of everything on the network has really simplified setting up other wifi enabled devices around my home.I'd highly recommend the eero to anyone looking for a wifi solution in this price range.

Title: Awesome.
Review Comment: Product works just as advertised!  Awesome.

Title: Does its job well, but I still have reservations
Review Comment: We bought the eero 3-pack to replace a Netgear router that could not provide a sufficient signal to several parts of our 5-bedroom home. The setup was very simple, with an iPhone app guiding us step-by-step through placement and configuration.However, I can't say that the setup was truly easy, since the first eero that we configured would not complete the registration process. We were able to switch it out for another of the three units, which worked fine, and the third unit set up fine as an extended. That first device, still, would not complete the configuration. We called the support number for eero and received an immediate answer. We were guided through several troubleshooting steps, but ended up having to have the unit replaced. A replacement was sent quickly and worked great. If it weren't for their phenomenal service, this review would have been much more critical, but I still am frustrated by receiving a defective unit when purchasing such a pricey product.After configuration, we have a great signal throughout our house, and plugging our Xbox directly into the ethernet port on one of the secondary nodes has improved its performance by eliminating one wireless step. Speeds have been great, especially as we watch more TV through the internet on AppleTV and Fire TV devices.Outside of my own personal experience, one of the major hesitations that still concerns me is eero's reliance on connectivity to eero's servers for setup and configuration. With such a new product, I would be devastated to see eero run into financial trouble and end up with hundreds of dollars of paperweights.

Title: Would recommend this. It really works as advertised
Review Comment: Would recommend this.  It really works as advertised.

Title: Eero Works Great for Covering Your Entire Home
Review Comment: We recently purchased a 5600 sqft home.  Unfortunately, the home was not pre-wired with Ethernet, and a single wifi base station would not cover the entire house.  I was only aware of two alternatives 1.) pay to wire the house with Ethernet and set up several wifi base stations throughout the house or 2.) utilize a single base station with several extenders throughout the house (did this in a previous home and the Internet was slow, and the extenders had to be reset regularly).I saw an advertisement for Eero, and I decided to try instead of the 2 options above.  I used the rule of thumb of 1 Eero per 1000 sqft, so I purchased 6 of them.  The setup was fast and easy.  Also, I am able to have high speed internet in every room.  The Eero system is pricey, but it was significantly cheaper than wiring the house with Ethernet cables.  I am very pleased with the purchase.

Title: A Revolution in WiFi
Review Comment: 3 weeks in, I am amazed at the ease of use and the superb coverage we get all over 3 levels of our large home. I am "tech competent" but not "tech saavy," and I found the set up to be extremely easy. I only hit one minor bump (my TV wanted to know what type of security was on the network, and I couldn't find that answer anywhere). For a wishlist, I would like to be able to do some web content control at the network level rather than have to install Norton Family or something on each device. But I don't know that anyone is doing that yet. It's expensive, yes, but my experience has been frustration-free and well worth it.

Title: The best home wifi router you can buy at the moment
Review Comment: I have had this system for about three weeks nows covering a 3000 square foot house and 800 square foot basement for a house built in 1942. The plaster and mesh construction pretty much makes every room a Faraday cage. I bought a three pack and an additional unit for a room over the garage which I almost don't need. With this setup I get 5 bars through the house and even in my front and back yard. I have slow, crummy U-Verse but this system pipes it through the house faster than anything else I've used and that include a top of the line D-Link system with multiple repeaters and wired access points. Setting up Eero is super simple if you already have a good internet connection into your home. Bridging newer U-Verse modems is somewhat tricky but that's not the fault of Eero. I wish this setup was a bit less expensive but I can't fault its performance, nothing at any price point performs this well with such simple configuration in the consumer space. I expect others will catch up in the next 6 months or so with competing offering but if you need something today I can't recommend anything else. My only reservation would be what some other views have noted. Eero is a startup and if something where to happen to them these would turn into paper weights pretty quickly.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Easy install and great performance for my two floor townhome.

Title: Our WiFi frustrations are now history
Review Comment: Works very well in our 2-story condo. It occasionally loses one of the three units but recovers easily. We've banished the previous frustrations we had and gained great Netflix streaming with zero buffering. A very superior product!

Title: One Thing I do not like about eero
Review Comment: If there is no internet connection when the main eero powers up, the eero will not broadcast its SSID or do anything of value.  The "fix" to this might be on a list of " feature request"

Title: Eero is great!
Review Comment: I have a graveyard of WiFi routers that could not function because my house was built in 1934, and its plaster walls are supported by metal meshing.  This metal apparently caused these routers to fail.  However, the Eero system works perfectly. In addition, I loved the customer service I received in setting up the system--very helpful and courteous.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Works really great, I got rid of death spots on my wifi coverage

Title: Love It!!!
Review Comment: Love it!  I live in a condo with some concrete walls. I was getting kicked off the Internet every few minutes. Since installing Eero I am staying connected. It sure makes life better. Eero was very easy to set up and install.  It is a little expensive but well worth not having the frustration I was having with my connection to the internet!  I highly recommend it.

Title: Great system, Needs.....
Review Comment: This is a great system.  VERY easy to setup.  I made the move from the 802.11ac Time capsule because we were having issues with streaming content in our living room on multiple devices.  This has been wonderful.  My only issue is the USB port on the device is only for diagnostic purposes at this point.  When they turn that on for attaching usb printers I will amend my 4 star to a 5 star review.

Title: Highly recommend for anyone from computer phobic to super geek levels
Review Comment: Full disclosure: I am a tech geek. In the past, I have spent days to months trying to tweek the ideal WiFi home setup with mixed results. Before getting the Eero system, the only way I had to get a reliable enough connection was through an Asus router, a second one acting as an Access Point (AP or bridge mode) and then two professional-grade Cisco APs. This was always plagued by devices remaining connected to an AP at the other end of the house instead of automatically connecting to the nearest one with a strong signal.The Eero fixed all my problems. For my home, I bought the 3-pack plus one additional one that connects via an ethernet connection to the room over the garage. Despite combining wired and wireless eeros, the setup was incredibly simple and flawless. I just had to plug one eero in at a time starting with the one attached to the comcast incoming modem and wait for it to show up on the Eero app on my Android phone. On day one out of the box, 4-5 bars everywhere in the house with 67Mbs down and 10 up; by day 3 with the system analyzing its own usage and balancing itself, and ever since, I have enjoyed >100Mbps down and up to 12 up...identical to the speedtests I'm getting on the hard-wired computers at home.With 34 devices all actively connected in my home, this system is amazing. I highly recommend it for anyone from the computer phobic to super geek levels.

Title: Great network extender
Review Comment: I'm very impressed by this product. Very simple Installation and works as advertised. Great network extender!

Title: Great WiFi Are you tired of hearing family members say ...
Review Comment: Finally...Great WiFiAre you tired of hearing family members say "is the Internet broken" or "have you been doing something to the Internet"?With a plethora of smartphones, tablets, notebooks, desktops, and a deluxe Smarthome set up with nearly 50 different sensors & switches & devices all depending on a solid Wifi signal, I needed something VERY GOOD.I ended up installing the three pack of eero my home and I have absolutely no regrets. Consistent & strong Wifi signal throughout every corner of my home and I couldn't be happier. This does exactly what they say it does. You won't be sorry.Thanks for a great product. You have a very satisfied customer

Title: Buy it.
Review Comment: This system is as advertised. Extremely easy to install and works great. I had issues with wifi connections. I have a 3 story house and with the 3 pack now I have great coverage. I highly recommend.

Title: No complaints, works as advertised. No more dead ...
Review Comment: No complaints , works as advertised . No more dead spots .

Title: Easy to install, and works better than advertised!
Review Comment: Sometimes a start up product comes along that is actually better than anticipated or advertised, and from my experience the eero is certainly one of those few.  I am a relatively older (therefore less techie) heavy user of the Internet and its required infrastructure, but I have to say this was one of the easiest set ups of technology I've ever experienced, and it works even better than advertised.

Title: set up for the masses
Review Comment: After years of setting up routers, each different than another and none really intuitive this is by far the easiest router to set up.  The 'mesh' is delivering a more consistent up/down mbps around my entire property.  It is even giving me full connectivity in an out building on my property that I thought I was going to have to wire.....I'm now truly wireless.  Great product and ease of use.

Title: Amazing wifi for my hone
Review Comment: The BEST system. We live in a large house and our previous system was very complicated. Internet on the first floor was 100mb but on the 3rd floor it was 14mb. With eero I now have 60-70mb on the 3rd floor. Easy to set up and AMAZING tech support. It puts to shame the other routers. USA tech support!!

Title: It just works
Review Comment: It's incredibly easy to set up. The whole process took me about fifteen minutes and that was mostly me ensuring good placement. I had previous issues getting anything like reliable wireless in the bedroom of my condo and after one too many interrupted Netflix sessions I decided to just take the plunge.The best bit is that it's great with bandwidth sharing and, at least for usual home internet speeds, the 802.11ac is good enough for me to max out my 100mbps service no matter where I am in the house.The app on iPhone was easy to use and it's kind of fun to be able to run a speed test away from home and see what devices are active on my network.The only two issues I have are that there is no IPv6 support currently, and that the app only exists for iOS and Android (no Windows 10 or MacOS). I'd love to see them both addressed and, at least for IPv6, do expect that to happen in the not-too-distant future.

Title: Works as advertised!!!!
Review Comment: I've never ever been able to achieve stable and consistent WiFi in my environment and Eero has done both with a solid package. I particularly like the fact that it checks my up and down speed every 24 hours. It helps me keep tabs on my provider's performance!

Title: Best of the Best
Review Comment: This is the system for both ease of set up and adaptability.  Install was a breeze and modification just as easy. I highly recommend it despite the price.

Title: Very, very pleased.
Review Comment: I am very computer literate but know far less about wifi except that it either works or doesn't. I ordered the Eero system because the fairly expensive router and repeaters I had been using kept dropping the wifi connection. It would, all too often, require relogging in, speeds were slow and in certain areas, particularly the laptop in my office and the wireless printers, would completely loose the connection. I bit the bullet and bought the Eero system. Installation was a snap. I remember spending hours on the phone talking to technical support in India to get the previous system set up. Nothing against India but I would rather not have to spend any time with technical support to setup any product. Download an app for IOS or Andriod (No Windows), mine would only download to my phone, not sure about iPads. At any rate just follow the simple steps to set it up. I installed the first to Eeros without a hitch. On my third Eero, the app couldn't find it so I moved it slightly closer the base unit. It was then picked up quickly and the system was ready to go. I did have to setup the wireless printer to see the network. I didn't change the network name or password to avoid having to setup the smart tvs, iPads and phones again. Plus the password was a good one. The Eero works wonderfully. I bought it at full price and received no compensation, but that would have been nice. My review would have been the same. One last thing, Eero checks your internet speed daily. You can see the speed by opening the app. I found my speeds were far lower than the cable company's claim or the speeds my other app reports which defaults to the cable company's server. In other words, you now have a really good way to verify your internet speeds.

Title: Great product
Review Comment: Disregard the techie people who say you don't need this. I have been using extenders and other products for my large home. They are all terrible.  I set this system up in under 10 minutes and it works beautifully. I can now stream video anywhere in my house.  This product is expensive but a one time cost only. Now I'm getting the high speed internet I pay for!  Getting 90mb/s in the far corners of my house. If you have wifi issues this is a great solution and is very easy to set up using their app. If you can afford to pay for high speed internet every month you certainly can afford this.

Title: I cant believe it really works.
Review Comment: I love it!  I have had WIFI issues for two years now.  I have tried new modems, Apple airport, net gear WiFi range extenders and nothing has worked.  My eero package arrived and 25 minutes later my WiFi problems are a thing of the past.  I was hesitant because of the price but now for the first time in 2 years I can get an excellent WiFi connection in my living room and kitchen.

Title: Outstanding piece of equipment!!
Review Comment: I tried everything and have hundreds of dollars in routers and extensions with all of the configurations dropping signal and our laptops and pads constantly "buffering".  I ordered this product and have to say  it is outstanding!  No more buffering and dropped signals.  This is a truly great piece of equipment and I would recommend it anyone with no reservations.

Title: Eero works great, fast and easy.
Review Comment: Purchased and installed 3 eero units last month in my home. Setup was really, really easy. No issues whatsoever. The first thing I noticed was the speed; must faster than my previous Apple AirPort Extreme and Apple Express wifi, which were the latest versions. The second thing that was striking was the wifi signal strength, again substantially better than my Apple wifi system. I have been using the eero wifi now for 1 month and it has worked flawlessly. A great product.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Outstanding system took minutes to install and it's been very stable since.

Title: Simple and fast
Review Comment: Very simple to set up and it seems faster than my router was

Title: This thing rocks!
Review Comment: If you are like most people and constantly struggle with WIFI range in your home and all the "rubber band and chewing gum" fixes out there that never quite work - this is for you.  It could not be easier and, as they say, "it just works."  If you are a computer scientist who programs routers and HTML code this might be too simplistic for you.  But for most of us - this thing rocks.  It is noticeably faster, completely stable (no drops at all), and I like how you can just shoot a guest a guest password link so they can use your wifi while they're there.  I used to have to switch routers as I walked around my house.  Now it's completely transparent.  Highly recommend.  The only negative is that it's expensive.  But personally I think it's worth every penny.

Title: Ridiculously amazing WiFi
Review Comment: My home is a very tricky environment for WiFi. Lots of walls, awkward corners, obstacles, etc.Even though the distance from my legacy router (Apple AirPort Extreme) to my home office was only 30 feet, I had zero WiFi connectivity in my home office.I purchased eero to solve my home office WiFi problem after reading about eero from Walt Mossberg's review. Game changer decision.Immediately after installing eero (which took almost no time), I had 100% WiFi connectivity in my home office! It's difficult to express the joy this brought me after suffering through crappy WiFi since I moved into my home. It's as simple and effective as eero proclaims.If I could rate eero six stars, I would.

Title: There is nothing easier and better.
Review Comment: I've never had better wifi even at work with an enterprise grade Aruba system.  Get two, I think i could have easily gotten away with just two, though three gives me 5 (full) bars no matter where I am inside or outside my house.  Kids are super happy and haven't had a single issue since plugging them in.  They couldn't be easier to install.  I mean, ANYONE can do it.

Title: but it was nice to not have to deal with any of that
Review Comment: Upgraded from a single router that performed ok, but struggled with signal strength and reliability.  I've had the Eero running a couple of weeks, and signal and reliability have been rock solid.Installation was exceptional, I understand routers and how to configure them, but it was nice to not have to deal with any of that, and just have something that sets itself up.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Hooked it up and it worked! Simple. 4000 sq ft house and it works everywhere.

Title: OMG BEST PRODUCT EVER!
Review Comment: OMG! Im shaking at how excited I am right now leaving this review. This product does exactly what it states, takes your previous home internet and basically make it ACTUALLY work...EVERYWHERE in your house. Three was enough for me and I live in a 1,800 sq ft home. I want to applaud this new company for its great product. My wifi has never been better, faster and more reliable anywhere I go in the home. I would be a spokesperson for them if I could haha! Just an amazing product. Don't scream over the price, yes its high but it's worth every penny and more! Enjoy!

Title: I was so pleased with the way the Eero system worked that I ...
Review Comment: I was so pleased with the way the Eero system worked that I installed it in my business office. Problem free so far and that is a pleasant change from my Apple Airport set up I had for years, both home and at work.

Title: Buy this product if you're looking for a fast and easy home wireless network!
Review Comment: Simple packaging, easy to understand and super easy to set up. My whole house now has awesome coverage with wireless. It took about 5 minutes to set up and get online. Well worth the money!

Title: easy and reliably as promised
Review Comment: Works exactly as easy and reliably as promised. Even it's more expensive than ordinary WiFi-routers, definitely value for money.

Title: Wifi headaches are gone
Review Comment: If it wasn't for standard Verizon FIOS headaches, the setup couldn't have been more painless. I've only connected 2 out of the 3 eero's I have in my ~1100 sq. ft. apartment, and download/upload speeds are not only 20-30 mbps faster than before, but higher than Verizon will commercially promise. My downstairs neighbor who uses my guest network is also getting better performance. Eero has totally eliminated my 2+ years of NYC apartment/wifi problems. Also, using the app instead of router's admin interface is a huge plus.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Really easy to install and it does actually work!

Title: Best solution for me in years
Review Comment: Easy setup, solves the problems in my concrete and steel high-rise condo.  Stable, solid coverage. I have two hard-wired and one wireless. After power interruption has required a power-recycle on the wireless unit - came right back.  Had used 'extenders' before with spotty, unstable results. Rock-solid now.

Title: Great product.
Review Comment: Easy to use. Out of the box and set up in ten minutes or less. Great product.

Title: Easy. Works. Worth it.
Review Comment: I love it. My home is over a 100 years old which is awesome for many reasons but it's terrible for wifi. Thick plaster walls with massive redwood beams have proved a challenge for many systems. I had an expensive router and extenders. But could coverage was spotty and the extenders had a different network name.Eero just worked. I used three for my home and bought a forth for an exterior office. The whole home is blanketed in one network.Easy.

Title: Incredibly easy set up for a not-really-tech-savvy guy
Review Comment: Absolutely loving the system.  Incredibly easy set up for a not-really-tech-savvy guy, and instantly solved by 'buffering' problem.  Went with one unit on first floor of home to start, and will see if more needed when college kids return for summer with their multiple devices.

Title: Awesome product!!
Review Comment: This was the easiest system to set up. I had issues with my current WiFi router in my home not reaching in the back bedrooms and eero solved it in minutes.  I liked the product so much I bought another 3 pack to link my guest house to the home WiFi. Awesome product!

Title: easy user friendly setup from the iphone
Review Comment: Finally found a wireless network setup that delivers. Consistently get over 50 mbps in every room  with the three unit setup (and close to full FiOS capacity of 150 Mbps in some rooms). Very well executed product: easy user friendly setup from the iphone.

Title: Eero is Awesome!
Review Comment: I waited two weeks to post this review to make sure all was good. Everything works great! Set-up was easy, and we have excellent coverage throughout our 3-story, 1920's home with thick plaster walls. I had previously tried many combinations of wireless/powerline extenders, but nothing could reach every area from the basement up to the 3rd floor. Eero does that! It's expensive, but for me the system is totally worth it.

Title: Beautiful and just works... if you pay the hefty price
Review Comment: The good:Eero does exactly what it says it does in my experience. Setup once my modem was ready to go took about 5 minutes. Access points were easy to add and the process was very simple (my grandma could do it on her own simple). The system complete covers my house in strong wifi (I even get signal across the street). My download speeds have improved by 60% since installing and I'm now receiving the speeds I'm paying for. The access points have already installed an update all on their own. I'm confident that this system will be more of a set it and forget it system unlike my previous routers.The bad:The price is SO expensive. I'm really hoping the engineering is quality and I won't be replacing pieces 2 years down the road like other routers. The single status LED cannot be turned off; keep that in mind if you're placing one in a bedroom.The ugly:Eero is a beautiful product. It's done what it said it would and for the price I agreed to. There is no ugly with eero.

Title: Solid Wi-Fi Service with no Resets
Review Comment: I used to have to reset my router almost every day and struggled with dead spots even with a range extender.  Since I deployed my eero system I have had solid service with no interruptions or issues.  Highly recommended.

Title: 10 minutes later, deadspots are gone!
Review Comment: ******Update: September 9, 2016:  I'm slowly falling out of love with the Eero.  One of my 3 (very expensive) routers slowly died -- becoming increasingly flaky, then causing the whole network to go down until I finally realized it was the flaky router to blame.  Once I removed that one, luckily I was still able to get adequate (not great, adequate) coverage for my whole house.  In the last several weeks, I have noticed devices just start getting kicked off the WiFi network.  If I disable and re-enable WiFi, they reconnect with no trouble.  This would be annoying but manageable if Eero provided any look under the dashboard at all to see if maybe there's a DHCP problem or something, but in the quest for simplicity, Eero have locked the user out of the configuration and log details you might see in any other consumer networking product.  I'm sad to say, but I'm in the market for a new WiFi solution and looking forward to seeing if the Netgear Orbi system is finally the answer to my prayers.******Update: May 16, 2016:  NOTE: This router is not compatible with the Arris Surfboard 6183.  I loved my Eero so much that I upgraded my internet speed, which meant the ISP had to provide me with a new modem (you guessed it, Arris SB6183), as a result, I can no longer run Netflix from my FireTV.  Very sad!  Eero engineering team are aware of the problem and are working on it, but it's been several months now.The Eero is very powerful and ridiculously simple to setup.  I used this to replace an Airport Express Basestation and two Airport Expresses in a 3000 sq. ft. split-level (4 levels connected by half-flights of stairs) house.  It took me literally 10 minutes to set it up.  As it turned out, I only needed 2 of the 3 included Eeros.  Every corner of every level of my house gets a strong, fast internet connection. I know it's pricey, but this was well worth the  extra cash for saving frustration in setup and daily use.I noticed they just announced a 2-pack literally the day after I ordered my 3 pack.  I don't regret the purchase, but I'm guessing a lot of people can save some money unless they have a really enormous house.  Two access points connected wirelessly covers my house nicely.

Title: It is easy to setup
Review Comment: It is easy to setup, but it's not "buffering proof" as advertised. Way too expensive for WIFI routers that doesn't solve buffering problem. Save your money.

Title: eero solved my Wi-Fi problems!
Review Comment: I love this product! This is maybe the third review I have written on Amazon, but my eero network is working so well that I wanted to let others know that eero really does solve some hard home Wi-Fi problems. Before eero I was using a high-speed AC router/Wi-Fi plus two additional access points to get coverage in my whole house. But when I walked from one end of the house to the other while using streaming services or Skype I would frequently drop the connection for a few seconds when my phone switched from one access point to another. Sometimes the phones would get hold on to a connection to a distant AP (instead of switching to a closer AP with a stronger signal), and end up using the cellular data instead of my Wi-Fi. I've been using the eero three-pack for over a month now, and have not experienced a single dropped connection throughout the entire house. And all of the phones and tablets are staying with the Wi-Fi, not switching to the cell data.This has been well worth the price!

Title: I LOVE EERO!
Review Comment: Only had this product about a week and already can see the difference. SUPER easy to set up and I can already see a difference in the level on connectivity.We recently moved into a much larger house and the wifi connectivity was shoddy at best ... can't love eero enough!

Title: This system is great right out the box
Review Comment: This system is great right out the box. I was having issuses with drop outs downstairs in my home. My modem is upstairs and I added a Eero to my modem and it took away the drop outs and freezes that I was having.

Title: Easy on the eyes and simple to set up
Review Comment: I am only a couple days in to using this device but currently my Airport Extreme is winning.  I am getting an average of 94mbps Download and 28mbps upload.  The eero out of the box produced as high as 84mbps Download and 26mbps upload.  The software updated overnight so after work today I will run the speed tests again and see if it has changed at all.

Title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Review Comment: Oh where oh where have you been all of my internet life?  ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!!!  The box came in the mail.  Just like a lot of other people it sat unopened on my sofa in my office for a week and a half.  What a waste!  Today I opened it up and got going.  Downloaded the app.  Unplugged modem.  Plugged in first eero.  Did what the app said.  Went ahead and did what else it said for the other two.  Cannot believe how fast the internet is throughout our 4500 square foot house.  No more looking at that blue wheel spinning.  Now I am looking at the content on the page.  Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU MR. EERO or whatever your real name is.  You have given me back the gift of time which as mastercard would say is PRICELESS!

Title: No problems here! EERO FTW
Review Comment: Great product! Running latest firmware 1.0.7 and coverage is great around my house. Found alot of useful information from the subreddit eero where there is an active community of people that own it, plus having an eero dev that is active on there is a plus. I see alot of people complaining about the price but if you compare it to getting multiple open-mesh access points around the house then you are actually saving money, just my .02.

Title: THE WORLD'S BEST, MOST RELIABLE, FASTEST HOME WIFI - BAR NONE!!!!
Review Comment: I have tried 3 different systems since moving into our 3 floor house last summer and NOTHING has worked.  Found eero on Amazon Launchpad, installed the whole house in 15 minutes and have never EVER had a better wifi experience!!!  This is literally the greatest wifi system I have ever experienced.  I know how it performs all the time, the coverage is outstanding, we never lose connection and the 24 devices on our home network perform at peak even in the most difficult to reach corners.  I have never been happier - if these guys don't get rich by someone huge buying them out for their genius product something is wrong!  Netgear, Asus and all the other router systems don't hold a candle to this system!!!!

Title: From a One to a Five
Review Comment: Beautifully packaged, very easy install. I installed 2, one connected to the modem, the other in the den. Tried to stream from the web and my mac to the Apple TV, but dropped out constantly. Remote unit would flash red the reconnect. Was very disappointed considering the price. It was late so I was going to sleep on it before I decided whether to pack them up and send back or make the calls to get working. Streamed some videos the next morning and to my surprise, no dropouts, worked fantastic. Speed tests results of 105mbs on mac and 50 mbs+ on iPhone. The internet was zippy on all devices. Streamed 4k video to Amazon Fire device with no problems at all. Then I received an email that overnight eero had updated and tuned the devices. All three errors now installed and no dropouts or problems after one week. Very impressed and highly recommend.

Title: Still needs work
Review Comment: I have tried a number of WiFi extenders and was excited by the potential of this product (especially the single ssid).  I needed it to help cover a three story house, so I purchased a three pack.  The main eero was on the middle floor in the center of the house.  Tried to place the second eero on the floor below the first one, but it didn't work anywhere I placed it.  Actually surprising since I have a netgear repeater that has no problem repeating a signal and is placed in a similar location.  (netgear has a strong link with good coverage & good speed)Maybe a future version............

Title: Finally, wifi that works!
Review Comment: Being one to hardly ever write reviews, I couldn't help myself on this one. I couldn't be more pleased. Nothing I've tried, extenders and such have ever worked well in my two story almost 5,000 sq ft house. Before, coverage very spotty and inconsistent with weekly reboots required. Eero was very easy to install. Speed is great everywhere with full bars in all spots. Expensive for sure but so far worth it.

Title: Wifi boosted!!
Review Comment: Great device. Setup is effortless. Configuration is super simply. Yea it's pricey but it really boosts your internet connection through out the house!!

Title: Did not have either range or speed one would have hoped
Review Comment: I had High hopes for this device.. It sort of worked but certainly did not have either the range or speed it is supposed to give.

Title: It works!  I have owned my Eero system for a few months now and remain very, very satisfied with this product.
Review Comment: So very satisfied with this product!  Set up is simple.  It does the job handily!

Title: Works great, I have used a lot of network solutions
Review Comment: Works great, I have used a lot of network solutions, Apple Airport, Wifi extenders, power line adapters and quite a few high end routers, I have never in all those experiences had a seamless setup and usage system like this.The only issue I had was Amazon sub-contracted the delivery to Ontrac Shipping and they totally screwed up the delivery, no stars to Ontrac but not hero's fault.Great product eero!

Title: Doesn't work properly, support has gone silent
Review Comment: UPDATE: Doesn't work with my modem (the common ARRIS SURFboard SB6183) -- they seem to be trying to cover this up and support has gone completely silent.  I can't recommend that anyone purchase eero until they come clean about their compatibility issues.(was: Easy to install, and now I have much more reliable WiFi throughout my entire house!  A bit weak on the router-side functionality today, but I didn't need anything special there.)

Title: Awesome! Two story home/4300 sq feet and years of ...
Review Comment: Awesome! Two story home/4300 sq feet and years of frustration with extenders and wi-fi routers. 30 minutes to install and complete coverage throughout the house. Operation has been super. So easy, even a 73 yr old guy can put it together.

Title: didn't like it much as speed tends to vary drastically
Review Comment: Average product, didn't like it much as speed tends to  vary drastically.  Also network errors happen too often, may be it my network as I have too many devices connected.  Might work if you have a simple network structure.

Title: Buyer BEWARE
Review Comment: The manufacturer demands your telephone number. In fact, they set this up so that the product will not function unless you do surrender your telephone number to them.  When I called them to challenge this, the reason provided was that they wanted a telephone number to call me back if we got disconnected. Oh really? The legality of this certainly seems dubious, but at the very least it feels very shady, so I'm trusting my instincts and asking for a refund. I will never do business with this company ever again. BEWARE!

Title: Kudos for Eero
Review Comment: I couldn’t be more pleased with this product.  I previously had a Netgear Nighthawk R-7000 router teamed with 6 Netgear powerline adapters (4 netgear pl1200 ethernet only, 2  netgear pl1000 with wifi) located throughout my 1,800 s.f. condo.  Coverage was spotty, but passable.  Even with my Apple TV plugged into the Ethernet port of the powerline adapter,  video streaming was still hit or miss with frequent buffering and speeds around 5 Mbps.  After reading a review of Eero the day it was released, I decided to give it a try.  I got 6 Eero units, placed throughout the 2 levels of my home, and the wifi has been flawless ever since.  Areas where I was previously getting speeds of 5-15 Mbps are now ranging from 50-70 Mbps.  Areas closer to the main router are pulling in speeds around 170 Mbps.  Easy to set up, attractive design, and flawless performance.......my wifi ordeals are finally over thanks to Eero.

Title: OMG
Review Comment: OMG

Title: It's Worth It Because It Works
Review Comment: For 10 years I've lived in a 1,600 sqft house built in the 1930's and for 10 years I've suffered with abysmal wifi performance.  It seems they built houses like Faraday cages back in the 1930's so that a wireless access point on one side of the house would be unreachable by a wireless device at the other side of the house and the devices in the middle wouldn't fare much better.  I've probably tried a dozen wireless access points and extenders over the years and finally spent well over $200 on a fancy dual-band WAP with a high-gain directional antenna and still kept losing connections in parts of the house.  As if to rub salt into my wounds, the signal strengths from my neighbors' networks were often much stronger than signal strength of my own network.  How rude!Being desperate, I decided to give the eero a try.  If it turned out as bad as every other option I've tried, I'd have Amazon's quick and convenient return policy to rely upon.  But, I'm happy to report that I didn't need to exercise that option.The eero was, by far, the simplest WAP I've ever set up. (Not that any WAP is all that tricky.)  The iPhone app worked like a charm and I ran into no problems setting up my 3 eero devices that hitting "Retry" couldn't solve.
