(Word of advice: Don't stand in front of your 2nd or 3rd eero devices when they're testing themselves for acceptable range.)  Although none of my eero devices are within line-of-sight of each other, I still get connection speeds almost as fast as if I was plugged into my router.  My three eero devices broadcast a total of 6 networks (3 at 2.4GHz and 3 at 5.0GHz) and those 6 networks are all in the top 10 strongest networks I can see.  The device I sit closest to is always on top of the list.  Fantastic!  My 1930's house has finally moved into the 21st century!

Title: I would have given 5 stars except for the timeouts adding the second and third device
Review Comment: This initial review is based on install and one days usage.  The initial install was fairly straight forward.  The first one plugged into my cable modem went in no problem.  The second and third one had trouble being found but after timing out on the third attempt to find the devices each time it gives you an option to add it by serial number and both were added no problem.  My wife and I both work from home primarily and we have seen a major increase in speed.  Also for the first time we have a full wifi signal is the back part of our house and into our sunroom. I will follow this up in about a week to let you know if anything has changed.

Title: Perfect as long as you have a house with nothing that blocks radio signals
Review Comment: It took me four days to get the installation working properly, but, now, it is fantastic. The hand-off as you move with your devices from room to room is completely smooth, as opposed all other systems I've tried over the years, including multiple Airports.The installation problems would have disappeared if eero were exposing to the user what is going on. Specifically, my bedroom system was working some of the time and not others whether I wired it direct via Ethernet or used the mesh radio system that's built in. Unfortunately, as far as I can tell, two critical pieces of information are currently hidden: First, whether the router is communicating via Ethernet or mesh radio. In my case, the switch failed to recognize the router until I restarted the switch so that, even though I was plugged into Ethernet, the router wasn't actually using it. Had I known that, I would have played with the connection for a bit instead of abandoning Ethernet, assuming some kind of bug in the eero software that was making it not work all the time.  Assuming that eero had a problem with Ethernet, I spent the next three days trying to get the mesh radio communication to work.Second, you can't seem to see what the signal strength levels are on the radio signals among routers, so you have to just keep guessing at where to place intermediate receivers. Since the signal was strong enough to work sometimes and not others, this turned into a major problem, with my moving the router locations six times, with the signal still remaining intermittent. Please note the actual signal problem is not the fault of the router. I know there's a signal problem between the main part of our house and the master bedroom that was added on later, probably due to foil-lined insulation in the previously-external wall. The problem was I couldn't read the signal strength. (You can read the signal being put out by each router to your devices, but not the separate signals sent among the routers themselves.)With luck, eero will address this lack of information with updates to the apps. On the other hand, eero has obviously learned much from Apple, certainly much of the good stuff like the packaging and hero's super-easy as-long-as-everything-works installation process. I can only hope they haven't learned the bad stuff Apple is doing, led by withholding vital information from users in order to generate the illusion of simplicity. I lost four days screwing around with this system because of an absence of information. Had I known that the Ethernet connection had failed, I would have recycled the equipment immediately and not spent 3 days trying to use radio in a house that's not suitable for radio.

Title: It took a couple of days to locate the units for the best coverage, but I have not experienced any dropouts ...
Review Comment: Have been using this product for almost 2 weeks and it has solved the problem I have been having with dead spots in my house. It took a couple of days to locate the units for the best coverage, but I have not experienced any dropouts since.

Title: mediocre performance and range- overhyped?
Review Comment: i guess i don't get it....i work in the tech business for a big software company.  i'm very technical and manage a large home network with enterprise grade equipment in a dedicated server rack/wiring closet.my wireless solution thus far has been two new Airport Extreme's bridged off the Cat 6 hardwired in the house, one upstairs and one down.  The one thing i absolutely don't like about the AE's was the way they interoperate with IOS devices particularly in band selection, so have them both set to show 5 gz networks rather than to auto-select, which seems to get me better performance.  you can read about this online- as many nerds with IOS devices feel that apple has deliberately tuned them to seek certain bands.anyways- i set up two eero's in the identical locations as the AEs, configured them, bridged them off the network and ran some speed tests....and....meh.  performance if anything was slower.  coverage and range was the same or worse.  i tested with android and IOS devices, and windows 10 and yosemite laptops, informally just speed testing in spots where we use things the most.in all fairness- it could be my setup is unique or weird somehow, (but it's not- i'm physically bridging both devices into a gig e network using cable)...it could be my house or wireless spectrum are weird somehow (they're not.  3400 square foot house, not in a residential neighborhood with 50 APs)....or it could be that this product was just really overhyped and if you have something decent right now, you're not going to see any improvement.

Title: Beware If You Use Arris Modems
Review Comment: Initial setup was a breeze.  No dead zones in my house and really good speeds. I am having problems accessing my network remotely to my Plex and FreeNAS servers. Called eero tech support and the said there are problems with Arris surfboard modems. So I am now running eero in bridge mode while connected to my original router. So I spent $500.00 for replacing the WiFi portion of my router.  Eeero tech support says they are working on a fix. The company's web pages states that the Android app is compatible for devices using 4.4 and up and that the device must also support BLE, yet they don't state clearly that is for phones only and that it is not supported on tablets. It is mentioned on the web page in other places.  They should just say "phone" instead of "device". It was fun trying to use my phone for tech support and eero application use.

Title: Expensive but worth it
Review Comment: After years of messing with expensive and unstable extenders, this is finally a simple, stable, powerful solution.  It's about time.  Expensive but worth it.

Title: A really excellent product. I bought an eero to attempt to ...
Review Comment: A really excellent product.  I bought an eero to attempt to replace my Netgear Nighthawk 7000 and 2 Netgear range extenders in my ca. 4000 sq. ft. 2 story house.  The Nighthawk worked well, but there were still areas in the house that had marginal wi-fi, and the existence of 3 networks was a continuing challenge to less tech-savvy users in the household :)The eero system (3 pack) was a breeze to set up and immediately gave full and complete coverage (with a single SSID) all over the house.  I did have some throughput issues; the throughput was lower in some areas than the Nighthawk (but always higher than the extenders), but I finally solved that by repositioning on of the eeros boxes.  Now I get great performance connecting to my ~180Mbps Comcast connection and near 100% signal strength everywhere in the house.  eero tech support was quite helpful in solving these issues (though the turnaround time from them was a bit slow).The only improvements I would make at this point (2 weeks after purchase) would be some more tools to help in optimizing performance (signal strength meters viewable in the apps, better network mapping representations) and also the ability to stealth all ports.  I have been seeing more portscans and network attacks than with the Nighthawk, as the Nighthawk stealths all ports, and the eero only stealths a few.Highly recommend this system.Update after several months:  This product is fantastic.  Literally set it and forget it connectivity.  I have had NO issues with eero, just solid, fast wifi all over my house.  An excellent product that lives up to its marketing slogans.Update 2: I decided to buy another single eero direct from eero.  FedEx lost the package and was a complete and utter pain to deal with.  After about 7 days, I contacted eero and told them what had happened.  Eero support was absolutely wonderful, took my info and said they'd get back to me.  4 hours later, I got a notice that my replacement eero had been shipped.  Even though the original order had 5 day shipping, they shipped the replacement overnight.  This time, FedEx actually delivered it!  10 minutes after receiving it, the new eero was up and running.  Great support is critical in a company like this, and eero delivered an A+ experience.

Title: It just works!
Review Comment: I've had this for a few weeks now and absolutely love it!  Expensive?, a little. But it just works and requires no technical knowledge to set up. Download the app, follow the step by step directions and you are done.Streaming from Netflix, Plex and Amazon Prime is perfect now. No delays or freezes. I also have a strong signal throughout the house and surrounding yard.I love that it works seamlessly  with my Verizon router/modem. This was a big concern when I started hooking things up. Not one hitch!  I have no regrets shelling out the cash for this device.

Title: Amazing product, yes it is higher priced than most ...
Review Comment: Amazing product, yes it is higher priced than most solutions but you get what you pay for.  My download speeds quadrupled and are consistently at that number.  Very easy to set up, aesthetically pleasing devices and very hassle free.  Welcome to the connected world!

Title: Very nice product and long overdue for home systems
Review Comment: I installed a 1 eero system at my office and a 2 eero system at my (small) home a week ago. Everything works well and setup was as simple as advertised. Performance is great. I like the simple setup (especially multiple-eero setup) and the small-footprint design. I only hold back the 5th start because the price/packaging feels a little high/awkward (the 3-pack seems reasonably priced per-unit, the 1-pack seems a little high-cost per-unit). The systems are managed in "the cloud" and I don't feel 100% satisfied that eero has a rock-solid network security model (simply because I haven't seen it explained).

Title: I am totally happy with my eeros
Review Comment: I am totally happy with my eeros.  We have a 4,000 sq foot home with plaster lath construction and my family has been yelling at me for years about their terrible internet connectivity on wireless.  We bought a range extender but then we had to deal with the ridiculousness of having multiple networks in the house.  We constantly had interference from neighboring wifi on adjoining frequencies.  It was awful.Setup for the eeros were a cinch.  Since we've gotten them in the house our internet speed and stability has improved profoundly, we only have one SSID, and nobody's complaining anymore.  I had a slight problem with my wireless HP printer not connecting properly to the new network -- I contacted customer service about this.  They were a little slow in getting back to me, admittedly, but they suggested that I reset the printer to flush the prior network settings and this worked like a charm.I have no complaints - great product for me.

Title: Very easy to install and work GREAT
Review Comment: I'll sum it up by telling you my network name. "Eeros_is_the_best".  Very easy to install and work GREAT!

Title: Thank God For eero!
Review Comment: I've had iffy wifi for YEARS, including dead spots and dropped connections. I even hard-wired a second computer in my home that I needed for business. Then I heard about eero. $500?! That's a lot of money, but it'd be worth it if it really did the job. I watched all the YouTube videos and figured that Amazon would take it back if it didn't work. I got the box in the mail and opened it up. No manual, just a start here note. Installation was virtually plug and play. A snap. Took less than 10 minutes. I logged into my new network, with a new easy password (!) and it's been great ever since. I can now even get Netflix on a tv in my bedroom. If you've got the $500 buy this!!

Title: thinking that they sounded like exactly what I'd always been looking for
Review Comment: I've tried nearly every type of wi-fi extender over the years, both in my former residence and my new one, and while they were okay, they never gave me the performance that I was looking for.  Even the dual band routers/extenders with 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz bands always left some part of my house  with less-than-adequate connectivity and performance. Wireline extenders are OK, but even they lack some of the crispness of signal that we all have come to expect for our online experience with our wireless devices.  After reading the review of Eero in the Wall Street Journal a few weeks ago, I immediately ordered the three-pack, thinking that they sounded like exactly what I'd always been looking for. They were delivered promptly, only took about 20 minutes to install, and I couldn't possibly be more pleased with the results.  We are about to put an addition on our house, and when it's done, I will buy at least two more Eero's to cover that space as well.  I am particularly appreciative of the fact that these are going to be automatically upgraded by the company as new software improvements are developed.  On a scale of one to ten, these are definitely an eleven.  They do exactly what they are advertised to do, are very user-friendly to set up, and are unquestionably worth the price.

Title: It was easy (and fun) to install
Review Comment: One of the few pieces of tech that worked EXACTLY as advertised.  It was easy (and fun) to install, blanketed my relatively large rancher with wifi coverage and the speeds have exceeded my expectations.  Having issues with your wifi?  Get eero and they will be solved!

Title: Eero "just works" for my thick-walled apt
Review Comment: I've tried multiple solutions in my 2000+ sq ft very old NYC apt, where the walls are made of some impenetrable material. Was ready to spend a boatload on a custom mesh network rig. Eero released just as I was about to pull the trigger on that; it has performed something close to a miracle. Everyone in my apt is now wifi-happy.

Title: Not just for extending wifi, but also 100% stability!
Review Comment: Eero totally saved my home network!  Over the years I've spent many hundreds of dollars replacing routers that I thought were faulty and buying all sort of WiFi extenders.  But nothing would ever solve the problem of my devices constantly dropping their internet connections. Almost every day, I had to renew my DCHP lease on my i-devices, DirecTv and Apple TV.  Frustrating beyond compare. But after reading the reviews about Eero I gave it try. I started out with a single eero and immediately saw the benefits. My wifi was rock solid now. But my NetGear wifi extender was still dropping it's connection, so I ordered a second eero to replace it. That was about two weeks ago and I haven't had to renew my DCHP leases once!  Set up is a no brainer.  I wish I could give eero SIX stars!

Title: Works great, and as advertized.
Review Comment: Works great, and as advertized.  I'm getting blazing speeds and far better coverage than previously.  Setup was a breeze.  I'm contemplating buying a 4th and maybe even 5th unit to get the higher speeds in a couple of other rooms in the house (4500sqft, lots of old plaster walls that deaden signals).

Title: both floors and every room has the best WiFi I've ever had
Review Comment: Quick setup and solved a coverage and speed problem in a two story house. I have been struggling for years with different equipment, repeaters, etc. 15 minutes after I opened the box, both floors and every room has the best WiFi I've ever had.

Title: Works exactly as advertised
Review Comment: The three-unit mesh network works as advertised, although there is a speed drop off when the signal has several walls to penetrate. Still it is much MUCH better than any network I've had before. The built in speed test on the phone app is very handy, too.

Title: The Real Deal
Review Comment: Not sure where to start. I have an older, longer house with lots of walls. I've tried WiFi extenders, Powerline adapters, and pretty much everything has sucked. Until eero, that is. I had three eeros setp up and covering my entire house (plus pretty much everywhere outside of it) within about 10 minutes. Unbelievably, stupidly easy and the coverage is absolutely as advertised. I went from something like 6-8 Mbps in the worst spots to over 40 Mbps. Since setting up my eeros I have not had another thought about WiFi in my house. Worth every penny.

Title: Finally a product that lives up to the hype!
Review Comment: What a nice surprise, a product that installs and functions as advertised!  It was extremely simple to install and I have had no problems at all after two weeks of usage. Blistering fast upload and download everywhere in my large home using Verizon FIOS.  Highly recommend this product.

Title: My hero!
Review Comment: Awesome. I no longer have be the IT guy in our family. The kids can play video games, I can use my laptop and well, there are more ands than you can shake a stick at. The interface is simple and the tech support from eero is friendly and helpful. I now check out our wifi speed just for the heck of it. 3 eeros replaced a trio of Apple Airport Expresses which never solved getting a robust signal past our kitchen. The eeros deliver whatever the signal is consistently throughout the house. The only drawback is: our cable broadband provider is revealed as the culprit. Wish me luck fixing that.

Title: AWESOME product!
Review Comment: Download speed prior to EERO 13.52 Mbps (12:50 pm on Feb 29th)Download speed after EERO 89.07 Mbps (12:53 pm on Feb 29th)

Title: Great product. Delivers
Review Comment: Great product. It really kills all the wi-fi lag. It has sped up my network to the point where being connected over wi-fi or directly thru cable delivers the same performance. Solved my problem.

Title: Very happy, worked as advertised
Review Comment: I wasn't looking for anything technically advanced. I just wanted better wi-fi signal strength and speed throughout my house without having to spend time on complicated configurations. Yesterday I got the Eero three pack. Including opening the box, downloading the app and installing all three units it took me less than 25 minutes. I had no problems.Signal strength is excellent throughput my 2400 sq ft house, much better on the rooms on the opposite side of the house from where my xfinity modem is. Over night the system updated itself and today performance is even better. Speed on the far side of the house went up from 14 to 55 Mbps down and from 5 to 11 upload. In the same room as the xfinity modem it went from 67/3 to 177/11. Performance was almost the same on iPads and a work laptop (Windows 7).Not cheap, but it was as easy and as good as it promised. I'd highly recommend it.

Title: Hi Jared, it worked. It's running solid - ...
Review Comment: Hi Jared, it worked. It's running solid - my apartment is an old one - 50 years old, bricks and mortar, several rooms of difficult coverage. 3 eeros did the job, strong signal all over the house.I live in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, in an old apartment , bricks and mortar, very complicated lay out. More than10 years struggling with several wireless systems, 3 eeros nailed it. Strong signal and smooth coverage in the whole house, have dumped all router and wireless systems I have (Apple, Lynksis you name it).But if you want to sell worldwide you must accept international cell phone numbers to setup the system.RenanRenan

Title: Don't purchase, does not work as advertised. Devices have not been Quality tested, and they overheat to dangerous levels!
Review Comment: Horrible product.  I purchased this for the very purpose that the creators envisioned it for, setting it up for someone else so there would be far fewer issues.  This product simply does not work as it is advertised to.  I purchased this for my parents to replace a Ubiquiti UniFi system that I had set up for them that was working great with the gigabit Time Warner Cable service, but required maintenance from time to time if the power went out for an extended amount of time.  This forced me to look for a solution that was self healing or a simple troubleshooting application that my parents could handle without having to use a terminal connection to the router to reset.I was willing to pay nearly any price for a seamless solution that could cover a large home from one side to the other with speeds that could deliver Video-on-demand to simultaneous televisions, handle about 4 - 5 Macs, a couple printers, as well as handle the variety of Nest Thermostats, and Nest Protects installed around the home.  This seemed like a task that should be attainable from a $500 solution, then I came across the eero and I thought that with the resoundingly good reviews on Amazon this product would be a surefire way to solve the problem.  How wrong I was.  This system is complete garbage, I have a good feeling that the positive reviews are being stuffed by the eero team, as their customer service line is unanswered, not what I would expect from a product that is going for a premium price.I suppose that they are handling quite the volume of angry telephone calls in regards to people in situations like I was in while at the same time creating Amazon accounts and reviewing their own product.  I returned the system to Amazon (they are great about taking back horribly designed products) but could not pin down the issue I was having until more real reviews started appearing with similar issues that I was experiencing. The common thread between all of the negative (real) reviews was the brand of modem being used (Arris / Motorola brands). This is quite the surprise since it is also the most commonly used modem brand in the country.I have a very high speed connection and these devices cannot handle the switching needed for more than perhaps 10 wireless devices without overheating.  When connecting the devices that the average home has connected over wifi, it simply crashed these APs and the eeros were extremely hot to the touch.  For example these devices would randomly stop responding and shut down requiring one to pull the power to the device and the modem to get a reset.  I expected that a system that went for such a high price would be tested and reliable, especially for the most common modems used in the country, however this set of devices is worse than many routers that you can get for less than $50.  Perhaps it could work for someone seeking to only connect a couple computers to the network, but if you add a Roku or Apple TV to the network, the bandwidth requirements of transferring the videos it will crash the system I am assuming due to the processor of the eero reaching nearly 250 degrees fahrenheit.  Purchase at your own peril, if you dare to try it be sure to stress test it right away to make sure you will be able to return them in the return window.

Title: I was skeptical, but now a believer. But it!!
Review Comment: I was very sceptical of the eero home wifi system...but went ahead and pulled the trigger. I was using an Apple Airport Extreme previously, and before that on a few different Cisco Linksys units. I was always struggling to get good signal throighout my home - and always struggled to maintain solid internet connection. This was always apparent when streaming multiple Netflix streams.So, along came eero, and the promise looks to good to be true. Yes, it's very expensive - but if it could do what it says it could it would be worth it. And...it did! Eero delivered on every promise.The good:Amazing internet speed. I am seeing over 100mbps, and before I would at best get 30.Outstanding coverage.Great app experienceSuper simpleThe bad:ExpensiveSetup did not auto detect my devices. I had to manually enter the serial number. But then it worked.Overall: A near 5 star rating. It works amazing.

Title: Life changing
Review Comment: Best wifi system I've ever used. Highly recommend!

Title: Keeping mine but would not buy again - might work better for you
Review Comment: Not a bit of improvement for streaming tv & movies. Drops the signal just as often as before I wasted $500!!! Generously gave the product 2 stars because it is easy to setup. Also, as an optimist, I hope the product gets better over time ( updates & etc ).(new comment)moved from 2 stars to 3 stars with this addition - nothing got better but giving eero benefit of the doubt it will improve with time.I called the support line and they confirmed I was on the most recent update and placement in my home was appropriate.So no improvement by calling support.I know being on TWC does not help - I know their internet is terrible but it is the only thing available in my area without sticking an ugly dish on my roof. We just became a Google city so hopefully my neighborhood will get that option.I guess my expectations were higher than the product can deliver. I was expecting to see some improvement based on the pre-release marketing.To be fair to eero, my review should be taken with a grain of salt. I was disappointed before I received my eeros. It took several months past the initial promised date to receive my order - which was frustrating. By then I was looking around for other options and Luma was offering their product for half the price (but had to wait another 3 to 6 months to receive). I was going to cancel my eero order but checked on it and it had shipped - company must be psychic or something. So I kept the eeros.  They work but just not to the level I was expecting - not a game changer as I had hoped (and glad I am not a gamer, just streaming Netflix can be a challenge on certain days)

Title: FINALLY!!!
Review Comment: Finally! After years of WiFi misery, finally a product that does what I needed it to, what I wanted it to do, and what it said it would do.We live in a 1600 square-foot townhome with two stories. The Internet modem is in the office. The master bedroom is down the hall from that past one wall and one door. The living room and kitchen are downstairs past one wall.We've had two or three different wireless modems before this and none of them have ever worked well. Dropped connections and long pauses during streaming for years.I installed this in the office, in the bedroom, and in the family room; finally we have perfect coverage throughout the entire house. Five bars everywhere. Superfast download speeds in all rooms.The only tricky bit was that I had to reset the modem before it would connect to it. But after that it worked perfectly.I highly recommend this product.

Title: Very happy! Speed in previous blind spot is up by 2.5 times!
Review Comment: Does totally meet my expectations. We have a 300Mbit connection which is obviously blazing fast with an ethernet connection. But with my previous router plus a repeater, the most I got in the back bedroom was around 50Mbit. I have had this Eero system for two days and now the LOWEST speed anywhere in the house has increased to 127Mbit which is totally amazing. The set-up was a matter of minutes. Obviously, $500 is a lot of money and I was totally prepared to send it back in case it had not met my expectations. But instead I am a very satisfied customer!

Title: Like but don't Love
Review Comment: I Love how easy the eero is to set up, simple. I only bought 1 eero and my entire house has a signal. The tp-link AC1750 I had was fast but it would drop the signal upstairs and it would disconnect my mac from time to time, so frustrating because I don't know enough to troubleshoot wifi problems. I tested the speed of my tp-link AC1750 before I installed my erro and the eero is slower but with only 1 eero I get a signal everywhere in my house. I do like that I was able to get a fully operational network in minutes but I'm not satisfied with the slower speed.

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: They may cost a lot but they work.... Well worth it.

Title: A little pricey, but worth every penny.
Review Comment: I've had trouble with wifi coverage in my house for years (particularly on the 2nd floor and deck). Tried various range extenders with limited success.With eero, I no longer have dead spots anywhere in my home and I'm getting the speeds I pay for from Verizon FiOS over wifi. Even on my deck!It's a piece of cake to set up and I've had no issues so far in roughly 2 weeks of usage. I've turned off the wifi radios on my FiOS router, Airport Extreme and unplugged the range extenders.They still have some work to do (mostly for those who have very complex setups), but I'm very impressed with what they have accomplished.The highest praise I can give it, is that it just works.

Title: Greatly improved my wifi experience!  Very small customer support issue preventing a 5 star
Review Comment: Has greatly improved my wifi experience!  I was dubious about this product when I first heard about it. I read five or six reviews and saw their tests and still thought....yeah, I will be wasting money.  The review that changed my mind was someone that had Comcast, and lived in an older building with the type of walls I do. Reviewer mentioned how this improved the service and does not blame Xfinity for the problems as much as he used to. That intrigued me enough to spend a decent amount of money.Got the box and had a small issue with setup. While setting up the first unit by the router, there was a failure message after I named the location for it. Stated it could not locate it any more. I tried a few times to figure out how to reset it, before I realized that it was back online and working well.  Not blaming the system for this - minor issue that I easily resolved. Had the whole setup done in 20 mins...and most people would have it done a lot quicker than that.Here is the con - and the reason for 4 stars. I did email Tech support.  I mentioned in the email that the eero speed test on the computer site was a bad link. (I could test it on my phone, but I really wanted to test it on my laptop in different parts of the apartment.  I also asked if there is a detriment of putting the units too close together.  Some parts of eero stated they should be 40 feet away, but when one of mine wasn't being located that far away, it recommended putting it closer and said 30 feet away. So, I was curious on since I was only using two of the three units, what would be the negatives of having them closer together and using three.  I think it was three or four days later I got a reply that my network speeds are great and they recommend not changing the setup.  That is good info to have, but it didn't answer the two issues.  1) speed test link on their site is not working  2) what is the negative of putting them closer together.  This may seem trivial  and if I could give 4.5 stars, I would...but if I email with questions, I kinda want the answers - especially if the app and site gave two different distances, and the site provides a link that does not work.Back to positive stuff:  My internet since moving to this apartment and switching to the demon spawn known as Comcast has been horrible. I couldn't watch Netflix at certain times of the day, and even had buffering issues on Youtube. Sometimes basic loading of sites were annoyingly long.  Set up this unit, and have had no buffering issues at all. I am getting the download speeds for the actual internet package I bought.  Very easy set up.  For someone that lives online, and gets most of their entertainment from online, this is a blessing. Even my PS4 has no trouble staying online (with gameplay or even just downloading updates).The price seems a bit high, but for the situation I am in, and for how much I am online, I am 100% fine with the price of this product.

Title: ... usually write reviews but this product is really very good. I have been using now for 2 weeks ...
Review Comment: I don't usually write reviews but this product is really very good. I have been using now for 2 weeks and have not had any problems with streaming movies on acorn.tv. Before I installed the eero home WiFi system I was having problems with the movies stopping and reloading several times during an hour and a half movie. I have not had one movie stopped since I installed eero. IT really gives me complete WiFi coverage to my home.

Title: Finally - WiFi Throughout the House
Review Comment: I rarely review a product, but after seeing the results of the eero, I feel like I need to do just that. For years I have used a variety of routers and extenders (Apple, Linksys, Nighthawk, etc.) in an attempt to get a reasonable and consistent level of WiFi throughout my house (a large, two story house), but that has never happened - the signal would go in and out, and it was all but impossible to get a signal in my kitchen. With the eero 3 pack, I solved all of that and have strong, consistent WiFi signal throughout my house, including that troublesome kitchen. Installation was easy, and my family is thrilled to have WiFi everywhere.

Title: #hellnoeero
Review Comment: I was forced to give this 1 star in order to leave a review. Personally I would give it no-stars if it was possible. I had high hopes for this product, what can I say it's marketing strategy was great. I've also been looking to upgrade my old wireless network. So let's break down my experience so far;got the product on Friday and it was very easy to setup. I ran into some issue with speed so I then switched it to bridge-mode. Still had the same results. Now the first thing I noticed was than my laptop felt slower since I was opening and closing files form my file-server. So I decided to check and see what speed I was actually connected to the eero. My late 2011 MBPro reported that I was connected to a solid 300Mbps. This threw me off for a bit, since on my older network I was always connected to 450Mbps. So then I'm like hmmmmm this is weird, I have both eero's hardwired. One on each end of the house on separate floors. Then I'm like well I'm about 4-5 feet away from the nearest eero. Shouldn't my speed be quicker, so I power off wireless and power it back on again. Just in case I was connected to the eero downstairs and I was getting a weaker signal, right makes sense. So now I have a solid connection, thinking I'm on the closest eero and that my speeds would be faster. #Hellnoeero, I'm still locked in at 300Mbps. So I decided to check my other devices, my ATV4, Roku 4, Sonos are all moving and responding slower than they were before. So I'm like okay let me power cycle my devices, just incase something else is going on. Keep in mind that all of my devices have static addressed via my Server.app, but I'm like hey it's worth a shot. Same thing nothing has changed expect that the devices are moving/responding slower than better. So art this point I decide to call support. I get the typical recording that their call volume is higher than expected and that call will be picked up in "35 minutes". So I decide to ride it out, an hour and 45 minutes later I get to someone. Now I'm finally happy to speak to someone, I'm hoping that they can help me. I describe the issue and they ask to put me hold while they research it. Sure no worries I would like a hard concrete answer. So they person comes back and I'm told that it appears that the devices are connecting to N speeds. So then I let them know that I was getting these speeds with my old wireless setup. That I was using 6th Gen AEBS, which then I was told that maybe Apple is doing something different when the decides connect to their AEBS. So at this point I'm like what?!, are you saying that "there is some Apple Magic happening here?". To which I get the answer of yes, it appears so. Now four days later, today actually I get this email from support:"We support both 802.11n which theoretical max is 300 mbps and 802.11 ac which theoretical max is much higher. Perhaps the device you are seeing speeds of 300 mbps is using the 802.11n standard."So they don't appear to state what's the theoretical max for AC, hmmmmmm.So I email them on Saturday since I got an email to let me know that firmware was updated. So I launch the App and I see that I'm still running 1.0.4. The email was sent by Nick the CEO, so I reply back to him. Asking him what exactly has happened, since I noticed that the firmware was the same. I get a reply notifying me that I got the message by mistake or late, since I already had the most current firmware. Signed by the CEO of Eero, so I take this opportunity to ask him more question and vent my disappointment and frustration. I mentioned that I understand that's a new product, that they are overwhelmed with calls and emails but they should really communicate with customers better to help reduce the stress and frustrations. I get no reply, so I head over to twitter and post my issues as well (within the 150 character limit of course). No replies either. So we went with the weekend of using the product. My wife notices the speed difference and she mentioned wasn't this supposed to make it faster? All of a sudden one of my NestCam constantly is dropping out. The Nestcam is directly above the the room where the main eero is connected. Not to mentioned that this is the NestCam that is in the nursery and of course it disconnects  when we need to use to check on our kid. Now my wife is not happy at all, so I send out another email about this issue. Come Monday, I get home from work and the wireless network is completely worthless. Nothing is working as expected. I remove the eero's form the App so that they reset to factory defaults. I re-connet my 3 year old, now extremely reliable AEBS. I used the same cables, add the MAC address to Server.app and get my same iP's that the hero's were using. Guess what, everything went back to "normal" speeds were better, devices responded faster. Our laptops backed up faster via wireless and the NestCam has not dropped not even once since Monday evening and it Wednesday evening today. During the weekend with the eero's, the NestCam disconnected every 3-4 hours. So I get a reply from eero support today as well."If your Nestcam's are dropping offline I would power cycle them so they get a new DHCP lease. If this does not resolve the issue you may want to contact Nest as we have not had any other reports of the eero devices losing connectivity to Nestcam's."About 96 hours with my AEBS and my network has not had one hiccup yet. However with the eeros during the same time period, my experience was horrible. How do I measure success, simple. No devices are dropping of the network, and the main factor. My wife notices the differences and let me know that things were faster.All of this has lead me to create the hashtag #hellnoeero. Please think twice about the product and I would call sales/support first. If you can get to them that is and get a clear expectation from them on what the product can do and what it can not do. Bottom line, don't set false expectations about your product.

Title: Sets up well but be aware
Review Comment: The eero sets up quickly and easily as advertised but be aware of a couple of things:1. If you like to hide your SSID like I do for added security, you can't with the eero.  When I contacted them ask about it, they said they don't offer that option.  And didn't indicate they would or planned to do so in the future.  Make sure you beef up your passwords.2.  It looks like the system can go anywhere and you are covered.  But during setup, the instructions are the units shouldn't be more 40 ft apart and they work best if they are in line of sight.  I couldn't do that and it seems to be working.  But if you have an older house with plaster walls and metal, you might have a problem.Overall I am happy with performance to date.  I wish they would allow SSID broadcast to be modified, but maybe in the future.

Title: Nailed it.
Review Comment: I've been waiting for a week to see how things panned out.  TLDR; Yes, this is an excellent product.  I took 5 speed check measurements at various points around my small house in Seattle.  After installation, I did the same. My spreadsheet tells me that I went from 1.19 Mbps to 66.68 Mbps in my basement, 5.98 Mbps to 42.23 Mbps in the bedroom, 42.95 Mbps to 80.00 Mbps in the dining room, 7.16 Mbps to 95.71 Mbps (!) in the living room, 7.35 Mbps to 45.15 Mbps in my office, 34.54 Mbps to 51.54 Mbps in my other half's office.  Setup was very easy; I did need to reset my modem but that was Comcast's fault, not Eero's. The Android app does everything that I need it to.  I'm completely delighted; this was a rare instance when a piece of new tech absolutely delivered what it promised.

Title: Eero Totally Worked for Me!!
Review Comment: Purchased 4 of these to cover 4 k sq ft home and guest house. The house has lots of concrete walls which made getting signal everywhere challenging. Prior to Eero I used a router, access point and two range extenders. All together counting, 2.4G and 5G, I had 5 different networks on the property. In the past I have also used repeaters. None of these solutions were satisfactory. Besides the multiple networks there were still dead zones, network drop outs, and most annoying the need to keep changing the network name for the laptop/phone depending where you were on the property. Installation of this product was flawless. I had all 4 routers up an running in less than 30 minutes. The connection is strong now throughout the property. Speed is slower for the most distant boxes but still 2-3X what I was getting from my prior setup and very acceptable at 20+Meg. Handoff between the boxes is mostly perfect but on rare occasions I need to turn wifi off on the client device and back on. I have not had any problems with boxes disconnecting or the red light coming on. Yes it is an expensive solution but when I consider the frustration I have had dealing with the coverage problem, the cost of buying the hottest next generation router, hoping that would fix the problem, the inconvenience of continually changing the network name as moved about, and the occasional cost of hiring a network expert to try to solve the problem (unsuccessfully) I consider it one of my better investments.

Title: Love it. With an apple time capsule
Review Comment: Love it. With an apple time capsule, airport extreme, and airport express I was getting 85-20mbs download speeds via wireless when I was paying for 200mbs. With eero I'm getting 165-200mbps in every single room. A little pricey, but worth every penny.

Title: I really wanted this to be great, but it wasn't
Review Comment: Man, I really wanted this to be great, but it wasn't.  Doesn't work nearly as well as advertised, at least if you only order one.  Maybe if I ordered 3 (for $500!!!!) it would've done something.  BIG disappointment.

Title: Great experience so far
Review Comment: Downloaded app and set up router in less than 10 minutes. Immediately noticed an improvement in speed over my old router and videos now stream much more smoothly than before. Contacted support team about a feature and heard back within less than a day. Great experience so far!

Title: Outstanding, innovative wifi at long last!!
Review Comment: For years I have looked for a solution to a very weak wifi signal in our bedroom at opposite side of house and a floor up from Verizon router. I tried upgrading the router each time Verizon upgraded from "g" to "n" to "ac". While I got minor improvements, not even an extender really helped. Then came Eero. Wow, what a difference-- a bit pricey but worth every dollar. And the setup with the notoriously difficult Verizon FIOS system was a piece of cake. Heartily recommend for those who have weak signal problems in far reaches of their homes.

Title: Not Stable
Review Comment: Fell far short of the promise.  The most important issue is that the EERO network is NOT STABLE.  We were unable to use streaming services, with video dropping after 10-20 minutes.  For that reason alone, I am returning the device (I bought the 3-pack).  In addition, set up took much longer than advertised.  And trying to move a device once set up is far more painful than I would have thought.  I wanted to love the device, but I will be going back to the old router, which had some weak spots in the house but never gave us the problems the EERO gave us.

Title: One word: Amazing!
Review Comment: In a word; amazing. We rely HEAVILY on WiFi in our corporate offices. We need to support private and guest nets and we need to support both 2.4 and 5.0 devices. The Guest segment must be isolated from the private side as well as each other. To accomplish this, we previously had a complex router configuration and FOUR WAPs running. The biggest problem (aside from the tedious maintenance and delicate config) was the varying signal strength (and speed/reliability) in different parts pf the office. Sure, Cisco and others will happily sell us $3000+ in gizmos to handle this.  I was VERY skeptical about a $499 "homeowner" product doing the job. But, it was up and running (in Bridge mode) in < 60 minutes. Everything works as expected and hoped. We left the old stuff running for more than a week as a safety rollback but never needed it. Back to my one word; Amazing. One small black mark irritation... the two mobile apps are not created equal - IOS allows more capabilities - such as check-boxing Bridge Mode - not cool in this marketplace. Hey eero folks, stay up late the next few night and get them on equal footing!

Title: Product needs work, company is very poor at communicating.
Review Comment: The product currently works as a very expensive range extender. Yes my entire apartment now gets solid wifi signal everywhere. But...* Be prepared to use your old router because the software on the Eero is way too immature right now and use the Eero in bridge mode. UPnP doesn't work properly which means most media and gaming consoles don't work properly.* Firmware updates happen sporadically on your devices and it doesn't always happen overnight.* When things go wrong... you don't have any mechanism to troubleshoot. Just un-plug, re-plug and hope for the best.* While your device has strong signal to nearest unit, your actual connection speed will be much lower (I average 30mbps in the worst spots) so you may still not be able to stream video in all areas of your home.* Android support right now is basically not there.But the biggest problem is the simplest for them to fix which is why I give them 1 star: They don't communicate.* They don't blog.* They don't acknowledge their issues publicly.* They don't post change-logs of firmware.* They don't properly triage support tickets or give you an ETA on a response. Your best bet is to call them which is annoying.* They are incredibly slow to respond to email and unless you call or tweet at them do they pay attention. I get that their overwhelmed but they are working harder, not smarter.I'm worried for the future of the company because mis-managed launches like this usually spell the death of a small company like this.

Title: Unless I can figure this out in 48 hours I ...
Review Comment: Unless I can figure this out in 48 hours I will be returning this. I went from an Apple Time Capsule network which was getting slow network speeds compared to the eero. Eero created faster internet by about 25%. But all the printers and backup went offline. I cannot figure out how to make this work. Their "Help" is not helpful and I don't want to invest any more time. I will wait until this upgrade is available on another device.

Title: Outstanding Product
Review Comment: I have had two Apple Airport routers over the years and in my current house, I struggled with consistent signal throughout my house. I added an Airport Express access point, which had minimal improvement. I was researching the Eero router for a few weeks, but was hesitant to spend the money, given the price point. Finally took the plunge and hooked it up today and I am happy to say that I have fast speeds in every room in my house, including the basement. HD streaming is consistent and no buffering. Eero is a fantastic product- no more frustrating dead spots.  Very satisfied.

Title: Perfect!
Review Comment: Buy this now! After years of poor wifi coverage in my house, my prayers have been answered. Seamless fast wifi everywhere! 10 minute install. And, when I had a technical question with regards to my network, the CEO of the company responded to my email.

Title: Very Disappointed
Review Comment: I was really excited when to order my 3 Eero system after reading the great reviews despite the ridiculous price. I have ATT internet that I'm paying for "up to 45Mbps" in an old ranch house with plaster walls. During certain times I only get 5-15Mbps and a few spots in the house never get more than 5Mbps so I was hoping eero could improve all of this. I set it up to my existing ATT system and my ATT network is running at 40Mbps and my Eero is not even registering half of those speeds. I am hoping it improves over the next day or two or I will be sending back.Pro's: Easy setup, nice aesthetics.Cons: Way to expensive, poor performance, fails to meet expectations.

Title: Great solution for large home with multiple floors and dead zones
Review Comment: We have a 3 story home with a basement and had horrible speeds and connectivity with AT&T so we switched to Comcast Internet  (chicago), but had the same issues. We tried really researched and expensive extenders, but nothing worked...especially in our basement. We researched EERO and decided to give it a try. First of all the packaging is beautiful and well designed, secondly the android app offered ridiculously simple step by step instructions and offered suggestions and lastly...it worked!The initial unit was a breeze to set up. The second unit was one floor below and directly underneath the main unit, so 15 ft away max. The unit was easily found but the signal wasn't great. The directions suggest placing every unit within 40ft. of each other, unobstructed, so they can see each other...this is close to impossible in any home...but be patient!! I moved unit #2 even further away instead of closer, just to test it and after two cycles it was perfect. I then placed unit #3 in the concrete dead zone basement and let it cycle. On try #1 it alerted me that the signal was low, but as before, I cycled it again with same results. I decided to unplug and try again. This time the app couldn't find it but asked for the serial number. Once entered it was found and had a strong signal.While this may do understand lengthy, it was actually perfect in less than 20 minutes and fixed a long time issue. Our download speeds tripled. We are airbnb hosts as well, so we usually have multiple devices being used at one time. The EERO app showed 7 devices in use today and everyone was happy with speeds.The units have even extended our outdoor reach which will be great in the Summer.The app is super informative, easy to use, runs speed test on demand, has access to support, ability to add extra units and each can be identified.It's like Internet success for dummies! We love it and don't mind the initial sticker price anymore either. $499 buys a lot of power, reliability and consumer happiness.

Title: Great router.
Review Comment: Very pleased that I purchased the Eero my other router(Belkin) was always buffering, to retrieve a web page,my old IPad was slow,I thought that I needed to update the the pad. After installing the eero the problem was resolved. One eero covers my home. The IPad is working better than ever.This covers my entire home and patio.nowmy wife can see the difference in her I phone.

Title: Great idea, well packaged but failed immediately.  Very disappointed.
Review Comment: Product failed out of box.  Even the download from the App Store was a problem.  This product looks great but just doesn't work.  Even using serial numbers vs. auto find feature for secondary terminals failed despite many rooms, many plugs, etc.  I had very high hopes for this product.  I was installing with an Optimum connection/modem and an Apple Airport router.  Never got as far as adding in my Amazon Echo because the new wifi failed first.  Beautifully packaged but.....

Title: Extremely disappointed - wasted time and money
Review Comment: I have a 3200 sq ft two-story house. I pre-ordered the three pack and two single eero units. After waiting for nearly a year for the 5 devices to ship, I got nervous about coverage and ordered three more from Amazon. Installation was a breeze and I was able to place these units in optimum open spaces. However, since installing the eero network, and (trying) to use it for a week, I have had nothing but grief. The connection is never, ever consistent. And seems dramatically slower than the four Airport Extremes I replaced. I am extremely tech savvy and have tried everything to include the dramatic step of having the cable company to come out and make I had the strongest signal coming out of the cable modem. I did try to email and call eero tech support, but surprise!!!! they communicate as well as they did during the pre-order phase - which is to say non-existent. Anecdotally, t seems that if you have a small house and can install the eeros with direct line of sight, you seem to have some success. I went for excessive coverage and still the performance is less than the system I had in place. And as far as video steaming goes? Please don't even try. It seems that the signal travels in waves from these units and regularly drops the network. Netflix has gone from flawless to aggravatingly unusable. For a wireless device so expensive, you would think that the wireless in these devices are so powerful that software issues would be tolerable. Not so. So the eeros are going back and the old, much more reliable Airport Extremes are going back into service. I have an extra 5 pack of eeros if anyone wants a great deal - as I can't return the pre-orders. Not ready for prime time. Might consider 2nd or 3rd generation if the reviews are honestly good.

Title: Would not recommend for serious internet usage...for now.
Review Comment: SO far........ eh.For very general web usage (Web Browsing, streaming music, etc.) this system works great. My speeds have increased about 3X my previous setup and the general installation was a breeze.I've run into issues though with gaming on PS4 and Video Conferencing on my PC. So for most of the time the gaming and conferencing work fine, how ever, at random intervals my connection just drops. To the point on PC gaming where I get kicked back to the main menu and in video conferencing I have to go in and reconnect to the meeting. The strange thing is that it happens at random intervals. Some gaming session for example, I may get one drop in an hour, in other sessions I'll get about 4-5 in an hour. Because of this I simply cannot recommend this right now for anything outside of general web browsing. I have hope that they'll have some software updates that we alleviate this problem, and if so, it can't come soon enough! I would have been more lenient with the stars but so far trying to contact support has not worked, I got one reply back, I then gave them my setup, and then they've gone dark, it's been 2 days.

Title: But this thing is bomb diggyty awesome..
Review Comment: I rarely write reviews... But this thing is bomb diggyty awesome.... I have 3 AC routers before and this system works much better in my home, videos load instantly

Title: Best home wireless I've purchased
Review Comment: I've used MU-MIMO 802.11ac wave 2 routers and other 802.11ac mesh solutions, but this one is by far the simplest and most reliable I've purchased. To me, noting is more frustrating than to have to troubleshoot crappy wireless solutions at the 11th hour when you're tired and just feel like relaxing and streaming a movie.To hat end, I've used this 3 AP mesh network since release for online gaming and streaming across multiple devices concurrently and have had nothing but perfect experiences on all my devices. Setup was especially easy, and fast. The only thing I do wish eero would do is provide an application for this as a business-grade solution, as what currently exists is not robust enough to be used outside a simple home setup.

Title: Very Impressed. MUCH better than an AirPort Extreme.
Review Comment: Wow...what a difference.  I bit the bullet and bought the 3 pack. I still think it is quite expensive. BUT, it really does work much better than the Apple AirPort Extreme I bought almost 2 years ago.  Over the past 2 years my wifi would buffer and freeze. At first I thought it was the cable modem, but in order to solve it I had to unplug the AirPort Extreme (which is an "a/c" device so it should be fast) and restart it.  That would be the only way to solve the problem.  Apple (who usually is really good) said that "at times" you need to restart the AirPort Extreme by unplugging it and restarting it.  You shouldn't have to do that for a $200 device.  Since we installed the eeros, we saw a noticeable increase in speed and stability.  Our home has 14 internet connected devices and it's amazing how fast things are.  I feel like we have been missing out over the past 2 years.  I would highly recommend these devices and it was a breeze to set up.  Sorry Apple.....you loose on this one.

Title: Not ready for prime time...firmware needs more time in the oven!
Review Comment: Disappointing so far! It is easy to setup (certainly easier than the vast majority of WDS systems of repeaters). Major points for the Eero app design in getting set up. I was able to set up 3 Eeros in a mesh network, 2 of them wired to ethernet as well (I use FiOS as my provider, with the FiOS router WiFi disabled) as a single unit unwired. This was very easy. However, my Wink Hub and Chamberlain MyQ garage door opener had major problems connecting until I redid the setup. I am NOT factoring these problems into my review since it is unlikely the Eero was at fault here. But this did necessitate multiple hours of getting the Wink Hub and garage door openers online and talking to each other, so I mention it more for other users who may struggle a bit. I did get these working eventually (with exceptions, see below), but be aware that you should budget extra time if you have picky smart home products.My discontent is actually aimed at the reliability of these units. They do seem to provide very good coverage (they are being used in a single-story, 2700 sq. ft. home, mostly open plan) and decent speed. However, my devices constantly lose connection to them (iPhone 6 Plus, iPad Air 2, MacBook Pro, MacBook Air - sorry, don't have any Windows machines w/ wifi, only ethernet, so can't say anything about that). When this happens, I notice that the Eero's LED is blinking white, meaning that it is "starting up and connecting to the internet". It has happened 3x in the course of writing this review! Make that 4 times.This was going to replace a system made up of 2x Apple Airport Express's, that have been completely bulletproof and were also easy to setup (but not as elegant as the Eero app for sure!). In fact, the ease of use of the Eero app makes the unreliability of the Eero network twice as frustrating. They should have spent as much time and attention making these stay up reliably as they spent in designing the app.

Title: More Hype than Substance
Review Comment: The write up on this product was certainly appealing, however practical application was nowhere near what was published in the product definition. When you receive the product, it will tell you that it works best if the additional units are within 40 feet of the router connected unit. It also says that it works best if it can see the other unit - If the units can see one another, then I'm guessing if the devices attempting to access the first one could see it, you wouldn't be looking to extend the signal to start with.  That said, my router is installed in my front office and would require considerable wiring work to even think about moving it. I had the second unit within 15 feet of the first one and it would not recognize and sycn with the first unit. I couldn't position them so they could see each other due to the design of the house. Basically, my current wi-fi extenders work solidly, albeit that they do have different names that the devices must switch to. I would certainly not recommend this product based on my experience with it.  I would however give Amazon huge accolades with respect to their extremely timely handling of the return and credit to my account.

Title: Incredibly easy to setup (my house previously used range extenders on ...
Review Comment: Incredibly easy to setup (my house previously used range extenders on multiple bands that were a nightmare to set up).  It literally self installs. The mesh network operates flawlessly as one unified network throughout the house with zero dead spots.  The speed is at least double that of my previous installation.  For most end users this is the ultimate wi-fi solution.  I literally could not be happier with my purchase.

Title: I'd be happy for upgraded firmware to make it even better
Review Comment: I'm not one for long winded reviews, I can chime in that after working for wifi in a challenging apartment for 5 years, I have finally gotten it to work.  It works both well and consistently.I'd be happy for upgraded firmware to make it even better, but it doesn't need it now.

Title: Easy to set up
Review Comment: eero lives up to the promotion.  Easy to set up, very easy and delivers the speed demanded of a wifi network these days.  I have an Apple extreme network and I was very happy with it until eero came along and upped the stakes.  So the extremes handle my ethernet and the eero my wifi on a NAT/NAT configuration.  Everything is talking and I am a very happy camper.

Title: Awesome product, solid company
Review Comment: Awesome product, solid company, friendly, professional and proficient support.3 pack purchased, finally able to use all of bandwidth purchased from ISP on wireless connections.  No more dead spots, 3 Eeros cover 3 floors and backyard at 95% of subscribed bandwidth (upload and download)Devices needed 10-12 hours 'burn in' before connections became rock steady.  No dropped connections since turning them on a week ago.4 phones, 1 stereo media receiver, 2 Apple tvs, 1 Roku, a Plex media server, 3 smart tvs, 2 desktops and 2 notebooks, Eero hasn't even blinked.Thank you Eero!!!

Title: FINALLY WiFi that works!
Review Comment: I have been fighting internet issues for quite a few years. During those years I have purchased newer and better routers/modems and added two different (dLink and Linksys) extenders, all of which still had trouble in my house (my house, is very tight and doesn't allow the wireless internet to get all over my house). Because of all of those problems I was forced to add another router in my house, which is called a roommate router, because you are only allowed one router in each house, go figure. Anyway, it costs an additional $50 a month. Good news, it has helped. Anyway, as a last resort, I have purchased a new internet booster system called Eero. Very easy to install. So far, so good. I have a system of three, one of which is connected to the router, and two others placed around the house. By far, these extenders have worked further from the router than any other kind of router I have purchased before!!!! I am going to use everything for a month, or so, then turn off my roommate router to see how everything works. Maybe I will be able to eliminate the roommate router and still have internet throughout my house. I will keep you posted. btw the reason I think this system works better is because it connects directly into your router which then boosts the signal throughout the house.

Title: It just works. Totally new WiFi experience in my home.
Review Comment: Wow. I just installed eero today, so it's early times yet. But talk about a great first impression. The product packaging looks like something from Apple (highest praise), and the setup is a breeze.For years I have been suffering with WiFi in my home and home office. My 100Mbps connection worked within a small radius of my powerful Asus router, but dwindled to 5-10 Mbps, if that, in my home office about 20 paces from the router. I played with several brands/kinds of routers and network extenders (will have those for sale in eBay soon), 2G and 5G, with terrible results. Even in a small apartment, my connectivity was lousy.I don't quite understand how eero does it, but I now have 80Mbps in my home office, even at 6PM which is when everyone else connects in my apartment building and my internet used to slow down to a crawl. I used to blame my cable provider, but now realize it was WiFi noise infecting all channels. I can also connect my AirPlay music devices with zero dropouts.Yes, $500 for three eero modules is a LOT of money. And yes, I expect this technology will become prevalent, with prices dropping a lot in the near future and maybe congestion growing in their "channels" or whatever (did I mention I don't understand...?). But yes, for me it is totally worth it. Thank you, eero!

Title: Finally solved my wifi issues!!!
Review Comment: I almost never take the time to write a product review. That said wi-fi in my house has been the bane of my existence since moving in a year and a half ago. We live in an older home with twists and turns and hard to penetrate walls. While not a techs, I have tried multiple high routers/extenders etc. to no avail. I even had a commercial grade service guy come and propose a solution similar to that in an office building. Fortunately we didn't pull the trigger on that monstrous expense.I saw the eero and figured I would give it a try in my never ending quest. It is the first solution that actually works throughout the house (I have 3 eero's). As a non-techy, set up was a breeze and the app even let me prove to my teenage son that his x-box in the basement was getting a great signal. WELL DONE EERO!!!!!!

Title: Five Stars
Review Comment: Must buy for any home with dead spots.  Really impressed.

Title: Finally! After years I have wi-fi! - with update a few weeks later
Review Comment: I have an unusual situation that I had to solve. I'm trying to add wifi to a house that is 9000 square feet. The house is not heated and cooled at 9k sq. feet, it's built around a 4500 square foot masonry area so the house is a big hollow square. All sides of the house have one interior/exterior wall that is masonry with rebar reinforcement. This mean signal is a bear to get across the house. I had an awesome IT guy on staff and I've had him out here installing, tweaking, testing, etc. wifi over the years. No matter what I did I had decent to terrible signal. We've pulled hard lines across the house to have multiple wired access points, we've switched to the same enterprise system we used at work, we've done it all. The end result is my signal was crappy. Plugged into the router, I get 18-23 Mbps (max provided by AT&T). As I get into living areas, it drops as low as 1-2 Mbps. It varies by day, and with that level of signal drop, it sometimes just dies all together. Just recently I finally ripped out the existing access points we had and installed new Apple airport extremes. The signal was pretty much unusable meaning the frustrating enterprise access points were actually doing the best job possible.Since my IT guy doesn't work for me anymore, I can't have him come out and fix my issues any longer so I asked him if he had any ideas of what I could do. He shot me a link to Eero. Hmm, never heard of it. Amazon had it so with trust in Amazon's return policy I thought I'd give it a try. I pulled out the Airport and plugged in the Eero unit #1. (after installing the Eero app). In about 10 minutes I had it running (power issue on my end). Once it popped up live, I checked to see if it was working correctly and the internet popped. Very quick. I went into the room where I had 1-2 Mbps with the airport extreme and I had about 14 Mbps! This was a room where I couldn't pull cable so my thought was I could use the Eero to get some kind of decent signal. I had 64% of my total available speed before I even installed the second Eero. I quickly installed the second Eero in this room which basically meant plugging it in and selecting next a couple of times on the app. Once it came alive I rechecked. 23 Mbps! Absolutely full speed that was rock solid. Finally I went to the other side of the house to install another wired Eero to give signal over there. Another minute to get things installed and boom! 23 Mbps. They are installing fiber on our road and I frankly didn't care. My wifi was so bad I'd never be able to use fiber's speed. Now I'll be chasing the installers around asking them when I can get on the list! We still get some variance in speed as 23 Mbps is our rock solid top speed on our service but now that variance is with AT&T, not my wifi.I use OpenDNS to block content on our internet. Eero has a simple screen to enter custom DNS. 30 seconds and I had it working. No double NAT, no extra access points. Nothing. Dead simple.I used a wireless scanner to check the signal in the entire house. I've only covered two sides of the four sided square. According to the scanner, I've got plenty of signal in the whole house now. No problem. However I have more areas to cover besides the house.Because I didn't finish covering my property (I have an outbuilding where we work that needs it's own internet) I'm here ordering another pack of 3 to finish blanketing our property with rock solid wifi. That's $1000 worth of wifi, which is stupid. But if you've tried to work with crap wifi for years, you'd gladly pay for something that actually works. Eero actually works. It's also already automatically upgraded it's own software and emailed me to let me know it's done rather than the funky firmware upgrades I had to do on my old access points. It may all blow up later and I'll regret this. I know some other companies are coming to market with a cheaper alternative. But at this point they aren't to market yet so I'm sticking with Eero. It's actually a pleasure to use the internet again and I'm seven years into dealing with bad internet. Hopefully never again.Update 3-11-16After having the units installed about four days, I came home to find them dead. Two of the units had a red light rather than the normal white and one had a white light. I really fumbled trying to get them back online as the app was having trouble connecting, the internet was barely able to be used, etc. Eventually I deleted the entire network from the app but the devices didn't reset but my app did so I couldn't log in again. I finally contacted support and about a day later received a response with some things to try and that that person was escalating my case to another person who also contacted me shortly thereafter. The helpful tip, which I'd requested in my initial request was how to do a factory reset on the devices. It's a paperclip and hold the button down (tiny hole in the back of the unit) for 15 seconds. Once I reset all the units, I did the quick and easy reinstall which took about 10 minutes this time. Everything came back up and has been rock solid since. No idea what caused the issue but support worked, the units reset, and I've ordered another pack of three units which set up beautifully in my out building. Now if my internet is slow, I got to the AT&T router and reset it and it comes back to full speed. Wireless is NOT my problem anymore. This has solved so many problems I was having I cannot begin to explain how wonderful it is.

Title: Super easy to set up and works better than I ...
Review Comment: Super easy to set up and works better than I expected.  Allows full bars now even in the farthest part of the house, up and down the stairs.  5 stars all around.  Amazing product

Title: Effortless set up and whole house coverage - excellent. highly recommended
Review Comment: At last a wifi system that covers the whole house that is easy to set up. Very simple set up instructions. Followed them and had everything up and running within five to ten minutes. I have replaced a top of the line linksys router and extender with eero. The linksys router was very good, but the compatible extender caused many issue and had to be reset on a regular basis. My home is 5,000 sg ft plus and the three units are providing coverage throughout. if you are not comfortable with setting up a wifi network in your home, then i strongly recommend this system. works out of the box as advertised.

Title: Incredible!
Review Comment: I purchased 2 3-packs for full price and I am so glad I did! My former setup was a mixture of D-Link AC 3200's and Apple Airport Time Capsules. Over the years I have tried every new configuration and I could never get the right coverage or speeds. Extenders never offered the right speeds or coverage area, so I wired multiple routers but with that one would drop off or other complicated issues. A week prior to getting the Eero I purchased an Amazon Fire Stick. It was located less than 20 feet from my D-Link AC3200 and the picture would just stutter. I forgot to return the Fire Stick, so when the Eero arrived I tried it, and the picture was absolutely perfect. Installation was very easy and now my entire property is fully covered with most areas seeing full wired speeds. I would recommend providing the system 24 hours to update the software and pinpoint the devices to optimize coverage. I have over 75 devices on my network including many home automation devices. I have seen zero drops and speeds have been consistently high. When I programmed the network name and password, everything connected without any need to reprogram the devices or find the network. If you have any hesitation, my recommendation would be to give it a shot. I was leery my hopes would be too high based on the positive reviews, but I too was blown away.

Title: The Best
Review Comment: This is the only product that has worked to provide wi-fi to all areas of our house.  It was very easy to set up.  Love it.

Title: Great easy system we never take the time to leave ...
Review Comment: Just buy it.. we have spent a lot of time and money trying to fix the problem..... Great easy system we never take the time to leave reviews... this system works....Thank You

Title: ... my Airport Extreme network and installed these puppies - awesome performance. The only downside is the power supply ...
Review Comment: Kicked out my Airport Extreme network and installed these puppies - awesome performance. The only downside is the power supply blocks two outlets from its square design.

Title: Sadly - Did not measure up to the hype at least when you already have a good wireless system with Apple airport
Review Comment: So that was a bust.. I really, truly wanted to like this. I hate to admit it, but I even know some people that work at Eero.. Thats why I was willing to put my Apple wireless router which was not cheap by any means. The promise of faster internet and being a techy.. I was excited and looking forward to faster home internet.Yesterday, the unit arrived and in the evening, I tried to set this thing up..  Spend over an hour attempting to first, download the app, and I kept getting errors on both my iPhones..  after it was finally downloaded and the app and unit connected, I got stuck in the registration.I gave up and re connected my Airport Extreme network.Day 2, another attempt, same issues trying to register unit. When I finally managed to register the box, it worked but the performance was not better than my airport extreme network.Most notable issue was reach of wireless network. I purchased one Eero because I have one Apple Airport unit with coverage on the entire top floorI tested this thing trying to stream a movie in the kitchen (25 feet from unit in living room) and not only did it not work, but the Speedtest results were as bad as they could get (I could not even pull up an email page.I don't know if I have a bad unit but its definitely going back tomorrow.. not sure what those great reviews are for?  Cant imagine they had Apple Airports and or wonder if they are even real.  One Eero should be strong enough to cover one floor in the home, and if its not, then its far to expensive given competitors products / pricing.Oh, and holding the laptop next to Eero did result in one excellent speediest result. But again, distance is a real problem. Maybe future releases will fix this issue..  or you can sell me 3+ units for the price of one. Other than that, I will stick with what I have. To date the best network my money can buy thru Apple

Title: Great product... So happy these devices are available...
Review Comment: So far so good.  I can't believe how easy it was to set up.  I hate dealing with the routers in my house, and currently have 4 set up to try to blanket my house.  I set these 3 up in less than 10 minutes.  One in the second floor of my office, one in our family room and the third in our bedroom.  Great download and upload speeds.  Our security cameras that had a hard time staying connected have not shut down yet.  I'm tickled so far.  Will purchase more to extend further.

Title: could not be more pleased! i have an old house with plaster walls ...
Review Comment: could not be more pleased!  i have an old house with plaster walls which limited the range of my existing wi-fi.  with the eero, i now have wi-fi upstairs and have enough signal strength to enable netflix access in another section of the house.  i am technology challenged, but found the system very user friendly and the set-up was a breeze.  pricey, yes, but i think it will pay for itself quickly; no more using our cell phone data plan to access the internet upstairs alone will be a big cost savings for my family.

Title: Eliminated Deadzones
Review Comment: Greatly improved signal throughout the house and devices seamlessly switch for continuous coverage.  Such an improvement over previous router and extender combination.  Well worth the price.  Three pods worked for large brick house with plaster walls throughout even for streaming to tvs.

Title: Eero...it's the real deal!!!
Review Comment: while it is not inexpensive it does provide the best wifi experience possible.  eero does exactly what it says it does.
