I got rid of my router and wifi extenders and purchased the set of 3.  It was the easiest thing to set up and my coverage in my home is unbelievable.  NO dead spots!  I also now have excellent coverage outside as well.  you will not be sorry you invested in this!

Title: It works!!
Review Comment: I'm a believer. It took just a few minutes to set up and yes, there was a little bit of frustration (user error), but all-in-all it was super-easy to set up and I'm already getting great speeds from what were formerly dead spots in my house. The network is supposed to optimize itself over the next day or so, but even at the speeds I'm getting now it's still a huge improvement over the old router + booster setup I was using.It is a bit pricey, but if you've struggled with your home Wi-Fi like I have, I think it's well worth the price.

Title: Excellent product and amazing set-up app
Review Comment: I'm a skeptic when it comes to new WiFi systems and their ease of set-up, but the 3 Eeros I bought, and their amazing set-up app, have changed my mind.  Previously I used to mess about in a complex IP-based set-up site, which looks like it was created back when DOS reigned supreme. I have 18 devices in my home network, from printers, streaming videos to WiFi thermostats and "smart" sprinkler controllers. With the Eero iPhone app I had all three devices set up in less than 30 mins.I ran SpeedTest before and after install, and the results seems too good to be true (see screenshot). With the old system, even with it's range extenders, I was getting at best 29 gps download, but now I'm getting around  89 gbs. The upload speed remains at about 6gbs.I'd certainly recommend this product.

Title: I've been an wirecutter's wifi router pick fanatic, and ...
Review Comment: I've been an wirecutter's wifi router pick fanatic, and then an airport extreme user, but have always been frustrated with the connection in my 1100 sqft 3 story townhome. I've tried extenders but they have *never* lived up to their promise, creating problems for airplay, etc. Eero provides me wifi that covers my entire house consistently with high speeds. Get 3, and never look back

Title: Outstanding product and service.
Review Comment: I am revising my original review.  I was contacted by Eero who offered to work with me to try and set up the network.  I had limited time and did not want to reorder and again have to return the Eero so they very graciously offered to send me a unit to test for free and arranged for a tech support call on a Sunday morning, which was most convenient for me.  They called as promised, actually ten minutes early and we went through the complete set up.  The Eero worked perfectly and I then installed two more of the routers seamlessly.  I find this company to be incredibly responsive, knowledgeable, and most patient.  Furthermore, unlike any other company I have dealt with, they trusted me and sent me a three unit version of Eero without my giving them my credit card or any other financial information.  I cannot recommend this product or this company too highly.  And I will gladly pay them for the Eero system, and in fact will order another two routers.  It is important for the reader of this review to know that I am paying them and will not accept it for free, so that my review has more credibility than other product reviews where it is provided for free in return for a good review.

Title: Not as good as they'd like you to believe.
Review Comment: Don't believe the hype and reviews. It does great for just extending wifi - but even then, it completely disabled my TWC Roku app and a few other Roku apps from streaming any content. There is no web interface to log-in through the gateway so typing in the router's IP address will get you nowhere - and what passes for a gateway is an overly simplistic app, which provides for next to no way to actually fix any problem. A lack of parental controls, blocking for filtering, and shut off switch for SSID broadcasting doesn't help either. The units themselves get extremely warm over long use. It's overnight updates will have the tendency to knock out known-good setups and have you start over the next day. Its definitely a 1.0 and for the price it should be starred that way. I'll give it 3 because it does do well at extending wifi - but for $600, it's not worth it. I need my equipment to just work, not create more problems. Clearly the engineers forgot to do any field testing. I will be returning this soon.

Title: Seemingly amazing miracle product - Doesnt live up to the hype.
Review Comment: I was stoked when I heard about this mesh wifi. I have a 3 story townhouse and I was hoping this would be a good solution for me instead of using APs throughout the house.Everything was fine after I installed. Super easy to setup and get going. I used the same SSID as my previous router so all of my devices automatically detected the new network. Wifi was super fast after I 1st installed it. I went around the house on my iPad and I was getting 200mb down when I was getting 120 previously. I was amazed at how these units optimized my speeds. My glee turned quickly into frustration when I started to realize how many limitations this system has for unknown reasons.1. Netflix will not connect on my XBOX One, PS4 or Apple TV. These are my primary ways to watch Netflix. This is the main reason I am returning it. This is quite funny because on their site Netflix is named in their product description. I have seen other reviews with issues with netflix as well. How could this be an oversight on there part?2. I use an FTP regularly for my profession to get assets to and from clients. FTP transfers were half as fast on this as compared to my previous router somehow. Also I get random disconnects on the FTP a few mins into any downloads. Dealbreaker.3. My Logi Circle camera will not work on this wifi. Not sure why.4. My PS4 just will not download anything. It says im not connected to the internet although I am on the wifi.Only reason I gave it two stars is because of the ease of setup and the packaging.

Title: Tech issues
Review Comment: Unable to download app.  Tried 3 different devices; Android phone, Android tablet, and IPad. Spent hour on phone w tech support, unable to sort out problem. Elevated to engineers; no response in 24 hours. Tried to send message to support; system will not accept submittal. Beware tech issues until company has worked out kinks.

Title: Oh Baby, where have you been all my life ...
Review Comment: Oh Baby, where have you been all my life. Set up was simple, speeds are outrageous, no dead zones. Well worth it!

Title: Amazing!
Review Comment: wow. Amazing!

Title: My hopes dashed but now saved!
Review Comment: Great product - had a little problem at installation - probably my fault.  Company back up was great, beyond great, and installation following instructions on my Iphone was very smooth.  Now getting strong reception throughout my home.

Title: If you have pain, it will fix you pain
Review Comment: I did same day Sunday delivery because I couldn't wait. This is my first day review, I will amend if anything changes. Setup was a breeze just like everyone says. I placed my 3 units and it let me know that my 3rd unit needed a better position.I had an expensive Asus 68U that I purchased six months ago. It was OK, but the speeds never matched the speeds directly coming out of the modem. There was always a hesitation and dropouts. I had to restart it every day without fail.The eero works like a champ. The house is bathed in strong signal and top top top (did I say top?) speeds. It is so fast and so smooth, I am delighted.The only place where the Asus beat the eero is outside the house. I'm at 65-70 Mbps in the house and out in the garage inside the car and out in the driveway, I get around 17-10 Mbps. I'll take it.If you are a new router purchaser, this costs a ton of money. Maybe try something cheaper and you might get lucky. But if you are like me on your 6th router still in pain, still chasing something easy and reliable you can't go wrong with the eero, it will ease your pain. For me the pain wasn't coverage, it was reliable consistent service and I can already see it is much better than my Asus.

Title: Overheats and shuts off
Review Comment: It worked great for about 30 minutes, then basically stopped working. I felt the main unit and it felt really hot so I'm assuming that's the problem. Going to return.

Title: WPA2-Enterprises is NOT supported.
Review Comment: Unfortunately I'm returning this unit because it does not support WPA2-Enterprises. You can get a $40 wireless router that supports it. Paying $200 for this unit that doesn't support Enterprise is absolutely ridiculous.I really didn't feel comfortable giving my number to them while setting this unit up. Hopefully they don't get a security breach that exposes our email addresses and phone numbers.

Title: Wifi Problems Solved!
Review Comment: Works seamlessly; set up a 3-pack in our 6000 square foot house; no more dead zones!!!!  Had previously been using Apple Airport Extreme with Airport Express in bridge mode; really didn't work very well.  Eero has solved our problems.  Setup was a breeze.  Worth the wait and the cost.

Title: Does what it says it does! Can't wait for improvements over time.
Review Comment: Huh. It actually worked! I purchased this in a last-ditch attempt to avoid rewiring my home at great expense with new cat-6 cables. It's expensive, but I can conclusively say it's completely worth it. Across a large, 3-story home with 3 Eeros, i'm seeing consistent 200-300mbps speeds. Not as fast as gig ethernet, but you know what, it's good enough. It took about 24 hours to get up to that speed -- at first, i was seeing as little as 20-30mbps in far corners of the house, but something changed overnight.It's not perfect. I wish I had much more advanced controls; I *definitely* wish I didn't have to use a mobile phone app / there was a web interface; I still have to keep an old router around to drive PPPoE since that's not supported; only two ethernet ports are limiting, and mean I have to use hubs in two locations. But basically, Eero does exactly what it says it does and makes mesh wireless work and work well.It's expensive as all getup, but if they release a future rev that can do 3x3 or otherwise get closer to gigabit speeds, I'll be there.

Title: Not possible to set up unless....
Review Comment: Be warned! Unless you have a US or Canada phone number it is impossible to set up!

Title: Unlike every other Wifi Router or Wifi networking system I ...
Review Comment: Unlike every other Wifi Router or Wifi networking system I have ever bought, this one refused to work with my TWC Arris Cable Modem. Called support and they tried everything. Tried resetting my cable box and moving it into Bridge mode and then the unit worked but the distance is ridiculously short. If you go beyond 40 feet with the pucks they don't connect. It's not acceptable. A normal home Router has about 250 feet of signal. This product is not viable for people in homes. they don't disclose the working distance and the pucks need to be line of sight... FAIL.

Title: eero has nailed it! This is one phenomenal router.
Review Comment: I'm not one to gush, but after investing in high-powered routers plus multiple brands of extenders, eero has nailed it! I bought many of those routers and extenders off Amazon but never wrote a review because they all failed to perform despite multiple efforts at configuring them. My home is a very connected home and right now eero tells me I've got 18 devices wirelessly connected!. The eero network speeds are registering over 100mbps and upload speeds of close to 15mbps. Speedtest tells me I'm maxing out my Comcast Business internet speeds at >50mbps downloads and 10mbps uploads! We had three HD videos streaming in three separate rooms last night and no buffering, no stuttering, just smooth. We've never had that before eero. Congratulations to eero for a product that works. One caveat, it's only been two days so I'll update if things fail. But eero says my network speeds will actually get better as my eeros figure things out over the next few days! I cannot endorse eero more strongly!
